title: Fantastic hotel for a solo trip to NYC
text:
Stayed alone in a Studio Mini and it was small but so well done with a fantastic view and a huge lovely bathroom. I could lie in the bath while looking out the window at the skyline. My room was right by the elevator but I was never disturbed. The Lower East Side is a wonderful neighborhood but I made a point to get back to my room and enjoy it as much as I could for my 3 night stay. When I had a Zoom meeting in my room, I ordered breakfast through room service and had a very delicious bowl of oatmeal. Since my stay at this hotel, I have stayed at two other high-end well reviewed hotels in nice cities, and neither served oatmeal anywhere near as good as The Ludlow. 

The minibar provided some really nice choices including an Emergen C packet, which I used!

My only tiny complaint was that I had to meet someone at 7 am, and the hotel did not provide a coffee maker in my room, and they did not begin serving coffee in the lobby until 7 am and the coffee shop next door didn't open until 7 am, so I was a little strapped for caffeine before 7 am. But everything else about the hotel was so great, including the service. I hope to get the opportunity to return.

title: Cool location, cool hotel!
text:
We were staying in New York for 9 nights, and having done the tourist thing in the past we wanted to stay somewhere different …. After lots of research we decided on the Lower East Side and this hotel seemed ideal … we were not disappointed.
I was initially worried we would be a bit remote but you are very handy for several subway lines and can be in all areas of the city very easily - but you are far enough from the centre to get a much different (and in my opinion better experience of New York).
Check in was quick and friendly, and having spotted a lovely open fire and bar on our way to our room we were sitting having a beautiful glass of wine 10 mins after checking in!
I was also concerned before arriving about the room size, and yes it’s cosy but it is gorgeous…. Absolutely beautiful.  So bright and clean and had everything we could want, including an incredible view of the Empire Stare building and Freedom Tower, I would stay here again in a second.
We didn’t eat in Dirty French because there were just too many other options around, but all the food we saw looked lovely and the restaurant always had a great atmosphere.
We did however enjoy relaxing in the bar, staff were so friendly and drinks were great.  We would really suggest asking the staff where they recommend locally, as we got directly ( and overheard) some great suggestions, most of which we tried and loved.
Much of the experience for us was the local area and I want to share some of our favourite places ….. just next door Ludlow Street Coffee for morning drinks and pastries, Russ and Daughters cafe (go early and out your name in the list!), Subject cocktail bar (don’t have too many) and enjoy classic movies (book in advance just in case),  Heavenly Hot Bagels (just great breakfast!), Death & Company for cocktails (you can’t book, so we turned up just after opening), Restaurant Claud (a new place which I found before we travelled, you need to book in advance but it is just brilliant food/wine/service) and finally for a cosy excellent Italian meal, book a table across the street in Taverna di Bacco, you will love it!
In summary, a perfect, clean and cosy hotel in a brilliant area of New York - do not hesitate…… book it!!
Thank-you Ludlow and Lower East Side, we will be back!!!

title: Fantastic hotel, incredible location - 100% will be back
text:
Absolutely incredible, I will 100% be returning! I booked a Studio Mini as I was travelling solo, and it was honestly perfect. 

Check in was easy with incredibly friendly staff. I had requested tea/coffee facilities in my room (as the Studio Mini doesn't include this according to the website) and they had been arranged for my arrival. I had also requested a room with the shower / bathtub combo, which booking so last minute, I was hopeful for but didn't expect it - but they had accommodated the request, so I was delighted! I had emailed the hotel a few times before booking too, I always got prompt replies and they were very helpful. The pre-check in link is great too, if it's a special occasion you can pre-order items for your arrival, which was a nice touch. 

The room was perfect, so well thought out and whoever did the design clearly thought about all of the small details that are often forgotten about. There were numerous hooks throughout the room to hang bags, coats, towels etc. which in small NYC hotel rooms, is always appreciated. I felt very safe and secure the whole trip too, which is always important as a solo female traveler.  

It was very clean and housekeeping turned it over beautifully each day (often when I'd only popped out for an hour, at different times, I'd come back and they'd turned it over already - I never saw housekeeping, so not sure how they know you're out - but it was a nice touch! It's always a pain returning after breakfast to brush your teeth and feeling in the way - but this didn't happen once, I don't know how they did it!). 

The bathroom is just incredible, I'm obsessed with the design and again - so well thought out! The robes are comfy, the sheets are soft and there's some good black out curtains too. You can also open windows in the room / bathroom, which I always appreciate and not something you often get in NYC hotels. Good quality amenities too - I didn't get bath salts / bubble bath in my room, however a friend who had a Studio Mini on a different floor got given lots, so they gave me some - I think it was just a slip up that I didn't get it, but I'm sure if I asked, it would have been provided. They were such great quality too! Hair dryers in hotels are never great, and whilst it wasn't my Dyson, it was better than most hotel hair dryers I've used. 

Not that I used anything from the mini bar, but looking at it, they once again have thought about the small details. The snacks were high-quality and there were items such as worldwide travel adapters in case you forgot yours. There were also items such as bottle / corkscrews in the room, an iron / mini ironing board and the items you could request from room service were well thought out (e.g. sanitary products etc.) They really have thought about everything you might need / forget on a trip. 

I ordered room service the first night as I'd just landed and was too tired to go out, it came quickly and it was delicious. I had a few drinks in the bar downstairs most days and the cocktails were great, and the decor is amazing.

The location is perfect, a few minutes walk to iconic spots like Katz, Russ & Daughters and Clinton Street Bakery. I also walked most places I visited from the hotel, it is very well situated. Check out was friendly, helpful and I left my bags whilst waiting to head to the airport, which was no issue.

After my last visit to NYC in October, with a very different experience in another East Village hotel, which was well below par to say the least, I had left thinking this is what I should expect in the area and that my expectations were too high. I had assumed that the poor quality, dirty rooms and lack of service were the New York experience. However, this was a totally different experience, in a beautiful hotel, with amazing staff and exactly what you'd hope for. It's a real credit to the whole team there. 

I have a few more trips planned in the next year and I will be booking The Ludlow again every single time. I've already recommended it to some friends travelling in a few weeks who are changing their travel plans to stay.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER!!
text: We loved our stay at the Ludlow Hotel so much and can't recommend it enough. The hotel, the room, the staff, the service and location were absolutely perfect. We are a family of four with two teenagers that stayed in the Ludlow Double. The layout and size of the room were a perfect fit for our family. The location was amazing for all ages and gave the kids the ability to have some independence. We loved it so much that we added another night at the hotel. If you are lucky enough to be traveling to New York with your family (and teenagers), I definitely recommend checking out this hotel as it made our vacation even more special.

title: We loved The Ludlow ❤️
text: The Ludlow is a great hotel in a trendy location on the Lower East Side. My sister and I had a fabulous stay and highly recommend it. Not only was the decor to our taste with its stylish industrial touch, the room was stunning, the bed and pillows dreamy and the bathroom very modern. The staff were so helpful, friendly and accommodating! Hats off to the housekeeping team who ensured the room was spotless! We loved the comfortable bar area with its great food and drinks menu. We will definitely be back! Thank you for such an amazing stay!

title: Hotel charm in the heart of Manhattan
text: Super charming and comfortable hotel, the reception team was super attentive, I felt very welcome, we were celebrating our wedding, we were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and a beautiful welcome card, we will definitely be back

title: Best Stay and Birthday!
text: I live in the city but do staycations often as means of self-care, and this time was for my birthday as well. My stay here is by far one of the best in the city. From the friendly staff, to my beautiful room and delicious food at the restaurant, Dirty French (cannot stop thinking of that bread!), I couldn’t have asked for anything more. Thank you Ludlow Hotel for such an amazing experience and a birthday to remember! Will definitely book again!

title: Excellent Stay
text:
My wife & I stayed here for our anniversary. Having stayed in Times Square on other visits, We wanted something away from the noise. The Ludlow was amazing! From check in to check out, the staff was friendly & so helpful.
The bar & lounge were a great place
To relax after a day in the city. It had  a fully stocked bar with top shelf bourbons  & a good wine selection also. Plenty of specialty cocktails & good pours! The bartenders & wait staff were awesome!
The rooms are smaller but very cozy, however it’s plenty of room for 2 adults, but there was a nice, big bathroom in our room.  
We will certainly stay again when we return to NYC!

title: Love the Ludlow!
text: Comfortable, chic, deluxe vibe. Loved my room with a little balcony. Loved being on the Lower East Side. Walking distance to the Tenement Museum, wonderful restaurants,  and lots of funky shops. The Dirty French served great breakfast (eggs, avocado, potatoes) and dinner-- great steak frites!

title: 10/10 Best Bachelorette Suite
text: The best way to relax in luxury in the Lower East Side. The skybox loft was a gorgeous room and the most beautiful sunrise and sunset views. The bed was the perfect amount of soft and hard, I slept like a baby. The bathroom was the real cream de la cream, you felt like you were bathing in Versailles! We visited for my bachelorette weekend and it was the best choice we could have made with superior room service, the Dirty French restaurant or lounge bar.

title: A Gem of a Hotel
text: We had a great time at the Ludlow:  amazing location, super friendly staff, and cozy, clean and comfortable rooms.  Great luxury at an approachable price for NYC.  A really cozy bustling lounge. Highly recommend and will definitely consider again for my next stay in NYC.

title: Amazing experience at the Ludlow
text: LOVED the Ludlow - the staff are excellent (I asked for a room change and they were incredible), and the location cannot be beat. Room was super clean and large for NYC, bathroom was gorgeous. It was also totally safe for a solo female traveller. The food options within walking distance are great (inc Double Chicken Please, Katz, Russ & Daughters just to name a few). There are also multiple subway line access within walking distance. I would stay at the Ludlow again any time I am back in NYC.

title: The only place you’ll ever want to stay in NYC
text:
This is my go to spot in NYC, full stop. The vibe, the charm, the food, the rooms, the location, it has it all. 

PLUS, the staff. All are friendly and dedicated to making your stay a great one. Shout out to Jonathan at the front desk who was an incredible host. He did everything he could to help me, made it his mission to ensure I was taken care of. Felt like family. You won’t be disappointed!

title: Cool decor/good location- customer service needs serious improvement
text: Cool decor and good location. Didn’t think much of the restaurant menus, but we didn’t eat there either so can’t comment on food quality. However, the staff need some serious training for even just basic customer interaction, which I’ve seen others commenting about. Check-in felt chaotic and unwelcoming.Throughout the duration of our stay, we were pretty much unacknowledged. Check-out was equally as unfriendly, didn’t ask whether we enjoyed the stay, a thank-you or even good-bye.

title: A lot to like
text:
The Ludlow has a great vibe, solid service, and nice details. The rooms are small but well furnished although the low ceiling and too much furniture in ours made it feel really claustrophobic. We loved the shower, the towels, and the sheets.

We barely spoke to a staff member during our 2-night stay which was actually alright with us because they seemed to value our privacy and left us alone, but others might now appreciate it. Also the LES feels kind of frat-party these days but if you don't mind that, the location is convenient to Soho, the East Village, and a bunch of subway lines to get you where you need to go. The coffee place next door is great.

This wasn't my best stay but I will certainly come back again because there's a lot to like at the Ludlow.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: I came to NY to visit my daughter and picked the Ludlow based on its proximity to her apartment-- it turned out to be a great choice! This is a wonderful hotel-- the staff from the front desk to housekeeping are all friendly and helpful. My room was really spacious for a New York City hotel (room 1902) and had a great view. The bar/lounge area is a welcoming and comfortable place to hang out, especially if waiting for your twenty-something year old child to wake up! And the food was great. We had a delicious dinner at Dirty French. Honestly, I've traveled a bunch recently and this is the best experience I've had at a hotel in a while.

title: Stunning views and exceptional service
text: Everything about our stay at The Ludlow was 5*.  The views from our room (Skyloft) were stunning. The room itself was exactly as we had hoped and the bed was extremely comfortable, with a memory foam pillow that we pre-requested. We had breakfast and dinner once in Dirty French, both were excellent. The service levels throughout the hotel were exceptional - in the bar, the housekeeping and in particular the front desk team who were so friendly, accessible and knowledgeable. We appreciated hugely Jonathan and Anthony who exceeded our expectations by far, taking time to make sure they gave us recommendations which were exactly what we were looking for. Thank you… we’ll hopefully be back soon!

title: Yet another outstanding stay at the Ludlow
text:
My partner and I have been coming to the Ludlow regularly for years.  We love all aspects of the place…the reception staff is welcoming and friendly, the charming fireplace in the lounge is warm and welcoming, and the rooms are unique and feel like home. We come from way upstate in Saratoga and the UWS, and we both absolutely adore the Ludlow making it our getaway “tradition”, even though it isn’t far from home. It’s both hip and also grownup.  The lobby is an excellent place to grab a cocktail or a cup of coffee and relax.
 
We stayed at the Ludlow and everything about it didn’t disappoint.  What made this time special was that we had a difficult holiday season and the entire staff made it feel like Christmas this time.  I can't really share how much it meant to us.   

We did something a bit "touristy" this time.  Instead of eating at the Dirty French (which is quite good), we ordered takeout from Katz' deli across the street.  We were surprised at how good it really was.

If you can’t tell, I really love the Ludlow, wish I could stay here much more often, and wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone.

title: Charm and Local Flavour in the Heart of the East Village
text: Can't say enough good things about my recent stay at the Ludlow hotel! The rooms are small but extremely cozy and filled with cool local touches. The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel was in fact so wholly charming, that I couldn't wait to get back there for a drink at the beautiful bar each night before bed. What really makes the place special though is the staff, who are friendly, helpful, and never without a kind word. I'm already mentally planning my next stay. Thank you Ludlow team for such a wonderful mini break!

title: Great location!
text:
There was a very comfy bed, great shower, lots of room in the bathroom considering it’s NY. The staff was helpful and kind.  They helped me celebrate my birthday!

Theres so much to do in the area. Bars, coffee restaurants. The subway stops are a 7 or 8 minute walk away. 

The gym on the top floor had a great view and actually made me want to work out!

title: Views for Days
text: The views from this hotel are unlike anything else in New York City, it’s truly spectacular. The room I stayed in featured an immaculate sunrise that most people in NY never get to see and on a clear day I was able to see as far as LGA.  The Front Desk & Housekeeping staff were all very friendly and accommodating to my requests. Hotel is near lots of great shops and restaurants. 10/10

title: THE ultimate home-away-from-home
text: The Ludlow has a distinct artistic flair, which makes it a unique and inviting place to stay. Further enriching the experience are the amazing views, outstanding room amenities, stellar dining and bar services, cozy lounge area (replete with expansive fireplace) and a very courteous and attentive staff. Last but not least, there is the outdoor garden area, which, thanks to the dappled beams of natural light, exudes a decidedly European charm.

title: A great hotel
text:
A really nice hotel, good location, very friendly and very helpful staff.  My room was small and suitable only for one person but very comfortable and had a decent bed (something you come to appreciate the older you get!).
Good views over to the financial district from the room terrace.
Close to some restaurants - a good Italian straight across the street and Russ and Daughters around the corner for breakfast bagels.

title: Stay at The Ludlow!
text:
Great place to stay!  We spent our weekend in the East Village.  What a wonderful location.  The hotel is current & on point.
Loved the decor….
But where they shine is in their staff!  The hospitality was 5 ⭐️!!!  We will book here again.  The East Village is a culinary cornucopia!

title: Chic boutique hotel with trendy finishings in LES
text: Couldn’t have asked for a better stay at the Ludlow. Check in was very warm. The customer care and attention to detail especially from Omar was unlike anything we have ever experienced. The room was cozy, well decorated and clean. Soaking tub was great after walking the city all day. Amenities including bath salts, bubble bath and robes were a nice touch. Rooftop patio offered great views of the skyline. The location is great- a short walk to the station and most attractions were just a few stops away. Food at the Dirty French and drinks in the lounge were fabulous! Stay here-you won’t be sorry.

title: Sherman’s take the city!
text: Loved the boutique feel and the service. The courtyard area is cozy, and relaxing to enjoy my morning coffee or the amazing espresso martini. One of my favorite spots in the city!!! The drinks were just right. The rooms were the right size for our family of 3. I loved having the balcony to prop the door open for the cool air! Thank you for the amazing hospitality, Ludlow team!

title: Fabulous stay
text: Travelled to New York to treat my Mum for her 60th and chose The Ludlow. Could not have stayed in a better place! We stayed in a king studio which had plenty of space for us both. The king is actually an superking which was a treat. Great powerful shower and a bath you can almost swim in. Ideally located for all the great foodie spots we wanted to visit. The staff were warm and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. The public areas were cosy and comfortable, great cocktail menu and food options (we had room service rather than eating in the restaurant, but it was always packed). I would 100% book here again for my next NY trip and I’d recommend to anyone.

title: Great experience traveling with toddler
text:
What an incredible trip to NYC thanks to The Ludlow! This was our first time traveling to New York with our toddler and they went above and beyond for us and him. Highly recommend the Ludlow Loft style when traveling with a baby as the set-up includes a nice sitting area which is helpful for separating yourself from the baby when sleeping. The Ludlow graciously set up the pack-n-play for us prior to our check-in so everything was ready to go when we got there and they even included a blanket, Ludlow stuffed animal. organic soaps and lotions, and toddler robe — it was so precious. Not only did they provide those sweet arrangements for us, they also went out of their way on a busy Friday to set up a mobile hotspot for us so that we could set-up our travel Nanit which required a special Wifi outside of the hotel network. We were wowed by the whole experience and so grateful for their hospitality. Looking forward to coming back! 
P.S. for any parent reading this review wondering about the Loft set-up it is a nice sitting area when you walk in, then a little hallway with the bathroom and continue down the hallway to the bedroom where there is room for a pack-n-play and also a little sitting area

title: Best Hotel Experience & Love the location!
text: saw them on Instagram and flagged it as a dream stay in NYC and finally made it happen in early November and WAS beyond blown away!!  And the staff there know why!!!  They made our anniversary EXTRA special - far beyond expectations!  Even if they had not done this, this stay would have been amazing.  The feel of the hotel once you  step inside their lobby is just what you would want in a cozy boutique hotel.  And the full breakfast at the French restaurant was absolutely delicious!  We are never one to eat at our hotel as we want to explore, but this was beyond hard to pass up, so we ate in house!  The drinks at night in the lobby and the balcony on our room, the linens, the tub, the entire feel of the hotel and its super helpful staff.  We had a fabulous time and will stay again when in the area!  I loved being in this area, out of Manhattan and the walk through all the neighborhoods all the way to the highline was so doable with a coffee in hand and good conversation!  We didn't plan to hit Katz right across the street, we aren't LINE people, but went at 4 in the afternoon for a late lunch and walked right in and sat down!  Definitely the way to do it and the Reuben was DELICIOUS!  Anyway  -the hotel and their staff were exactly how they should be in this industry and it was a treat b/c you certainly don't get that anymore at most places.  Thank you Ludlow for your special special treatment!  We are not ones to stay in a hotel room when on vacation, as we are there to explore, but your accommodations were so amazing, we stayed in with the bottle of champagne (thank YOU!) and fridge full of IPA"s and snacks all afternoon on our first day!  Only left for a bowl of ramen and a late night slice!! the room was spectatcular and so appreciated beyond words!  We will sing your hotel's praises and posted on IG as well.  I got some gorgeous pictures!

title: Best staff, best bathtub!
text: I booked the Ludlow because I knew they had amazing bathtubs and views of the city from Instagram. I was totally blow away with the kindness of their reservations and front-desk staff - they went above and beyond to make my stay really special. The rooms and bathtub are even better in person! I can't wait to book another trip so I can stay again!

title: Great downtown hotel
text:
Always an amazing place. Great high-ceiling rooms with good attention to detail. Stylish interiors and common areas. I would highly recommend it. 
Scene around hotel gets a bit busy and young on weekends.

title: Best hotel experience
text:
I been planning my bf bday for two months from the time I called the hotel to book and spoke with Jonathan he was so helpful when it came to picking out the perfect room to surprise my bf for his bday. Even up until the day I checked in he made sure everything was perfect and went above and beyond the whole front staff was amazing and my bf bday surprise was one he would never forget thank you all. Only
Complaint I have was the dirty French they took their time to serve me and was not very welcoming like if I was a bother to them to be there and the breakfast was not great at all I give that one star

title: stay at the Ludlow
text: Just stayed this Autumn at the Ludlow. Fantastic hotel, great view,  lovley room, spacious,  Really looked after us and couldn't do more.  special thank you to Miguel.  Excellent staff. would recommend!

title: A surprising gem for families 💎
text:
We stayed at the Ludlow for the last six days of our family trip. We have a baby and a toddler, and having stayed at the Ludlow before, we weren’t sure what to expect now being a family. 

Firstly, the staff were excellent. They were so friendly to our children and so welcoming. Nothing was too much and they recalled us every time we passed through the lobby. 

Our room was incredible. Great views, a lovely balcony and a real New York feel. Great decor, fantastic amenities and they were all prepped for us arriving with a cot and baby amenities in the room. They even had a baby lamb teddy and little robes - it was very cute!

The location is great. Really close to the subway, walking distance to Soho, Little Italy, and downtown. Easy to get cabs and close to the subway. There was even an enormous playground right behind the hotel.

We had room service on our first evening which was lovely, but we also had food delivered which was no bother. We had Nobu and Beauty and Essex with a skyline view while our little ones slept, and the hotel were great loaning us plates and cutlery. 

Our kids love to swim, so we were initially put off with it having no pool. One of our New Yorker friends told us how it’s a couple of blocks from a 1920s public pool which is beautiful and clean (Hamilton Fish Pond). It was a lovely way to cool off in the late summer and as we went on a week day, it was really quiet (just take a lock). It’s literally steps away.

We were sad to leave, and when we did, front desk gave us a later check out. We also forgot a phone in the room and the hotel shipped it to us (thank you, Joe). 

We can’t wait to return and recommend to families considering the Ludlow to do it. You won’t be disappointed.

title: Stylish and confortable NY hotel, in a superb location
text: Beautiful hotel in a great, central and fun location. The room was small, but well appointed with a super comfortable bed, great pillows and excellent amenties. The bathroom was large and had a huge bathtub, with lovely products. Service was excellent, helpful and responsive. Great bar area downstairs, and rooftop area. Would definitely stay again.

title: highly recommend, book a room with a tub!
text: A beautiful, smooth stay! We were (to our surprise) able to check in quite early, and enjoyed many of the amenities available. Bathtub and related view was so stunning. Excited for future/additional visits, and grateful for such kind and responsive staff!

title: Perfect hotel in the heart of the lower east side
text: Easily one of the best LES hotel. Very cool, very welcoming.  The lobby bar was a great place to stop and plan the afternoon. Plus having a balcony for tour room in NYC ! Customer service was quick and convenient. They were able to bring kettles and teabags to the room in addition to anything we needed.

title: Didn’t meet expectations
text:
The Ludlow is in a good location, just south of Houston on the same block as Katz’s deli. The hotel staff was pleasant and accommodating. Public spaces are nice. 
  Two issues with the room. It was so tiny that there wasn’t room for one suitcase, let alone two. And the bed was so squeaky that it was hard to get a decent night’s sleep. The staff sent up an engineer to “tighten” the bed frame, but that didn’t help. 
  The restaurant food was okay, but the service was slow and indifferent. 
  For the price I think we can find a better hotel next time.

title: Exclente
text: Excelente!!! Adorei tudo, desde o quarto à comida. Funcionários muito atenciosos, sempre ao dispor. Vistas panorâmicas lindíssimas. A comida era muito bem confecionada, com produtos de qualidade. Tudo muito limpo. As roupas de cama eram de boa qualidade. Recomendo

title: Must Stay!
text:
I loved everything about the Ludlowhotel.  The hotel was super helpful in everything that I needed, from pillows to a new key card, to where I could park.  I also provide customer service for a living, and they exceeded all of my expectations. 
The hotel was in a very walkable and friendly neighborhood.  
I can't wait to stay here again.

title: All around great hotel
text: The staff is friendly and accommodating. Our room was quaint and extremely clean.  We had dinner and  brunch at the hotel restaurant Dirty French. Both melas were fantastic. My new favorite New York Hotel.

title: Thanks to Kin & Rachel
text: Shoutout to Kin & Rachel - they were able to help me with booking changes I had to make for personal reasons and did so in a really human way. Most places lead with bureaucracy and red tape but Ludlow was old school human and understanding.   Love staying here and will be back.

title: Five star sevice
text:
Great location and wonderful staff.  Everything from the lobby bar to the bathtub with amenities makes for a wonderful stay.  I love this place and try to stay whenever I visit my daughter in the lower east side.

Staff is so kind!  Especially the front desk folks!

title: A must go!
text: We had the most incredible experience. Better than we could have expected at The Ludlow Hotel. Ken at the front desk went over and above for us, he was kind, patient and truly made our stay very memorable. We will always rave about our time with you and recommend anyone who is looking for a hotel in NYC to The Ludlow. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful. We were celebrating my dads birthday and he was extremely pleased with the service, experience and hotel! The hotel is chic, stylish, historic, has a great gym and perfect sunroof to watch the sunrise or set. Thank you again!!

title: Fabulous short stay in the city
text: We came to New York for my birthday, and we’re surprised by our daughters from Kansas City and Hutto(Austin) Texas. The Ludlow was the perfect venue. Our middle daughter orchestrated the whole surprise, and the hotel stepped up and made the event special. The room was perfect, and the bar area was a great out of hectic lower east side for evening after dinner cocktails.

title: One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had!
text: We recently stayed at The Ludlow to celebrate our 10th anniversary, and it was without a doubt one of the greatest hotel experiences we've ever had. The Ludlow team went above and beyond at every turn to make it a special, memorable trip. We're already looking forward to future trips to NYC, and will always aim to stay here!

title: Luxe staycation
text: Gorgeous rooms, although very tight. Rented a queen room with a soaking tub with a huge window overlooking the city. Really fun place to have a staycation, and the location in lower east side and overall vibe is really hip. Also not super expensive for a posh NYC hotel room, but the size of the rooms reflected that.

title: Beware Deceptive Booking Practices
text:
I reserved a Loft King room and got Room 1602 with no balcony, no corner windows, no windowed rain shower.  Then management argued with me the whole time that I got the room I reserved! And guess what ?!?!  I did because their booking receipt clearly says the room preference is subject to availability. I thought I reserved a premium room as described on their website. Instead I got 1602 with none of these
amenities directly next to the elevator with a small sitting area.

title: Ludlow is the hotel to go to for your best NYC experience
text:
We stayed in a Queen Studio with Terrace on the 7th floor. Small but beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and a fantastic outside space. 
The Ludlow has a really cool vibe, amazing friendly and helpful staff, especially on the front desk. The hotel is in a great position in the LES close to some fantastic bars, cafes and restaurants. There was a bit of a heatwave the week we were there and coming back to the Ludlow to sit in the Lounge and have some drinks was a great end to our daily tours. A nice cool hug … and relax. It has a really chilled atmosphere which is ideal after the hustle of NYC. 
You can take your own drinks up to the rooftop which  provides some fantastic panoramic views.
It was our anniversary and we received a complimentary bottle of fizz when we arrived which was a really nice touch. 
Highly recommended for your NYC stays and we will definitely be back.

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE
text: The Hotel is amazing but the customer service is just SUPERB!!! Omar did a very good job in explaining the different rooms available and made sure that my stay was an enjoyable one. He was very accommodating and also advised of the local restaurants and transportation. Great stay and even greater customer service!!

title: Ludlow 2.0
text:
It was our second time in New York and in The Ludlow Hotel. 
The hotel is amazing. The staff was very kind and helped us a lot with every question we had. During the Stay we felt really home. It was an amazing experience and we will come back to The Ludlow Hotel as soon as possible.  For 100 %.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
A very nice and hip hotel. Very friendly staff. 
Very good breakfast. 
Nice and very clean rooms with all the necessary amenities. 
It is located almosy halfway between 5th avenue and Wall Street
We enjoyed our stau very much and would certainly recommend the hotel for your stay in NYC

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday weekend, it was our second stay here, and I can honestly say The Ludlow never disappoints!!! The staff makes every effort to make you feel at home and caters to your every need. The front guest staff and manager, Omar, were incredibly friendly, welcoming and helpful, especially when it came to suggestions for a perfect night out on the town. The bar/lounge manager, Emily, was also amazing and took such good care of us. When we called the front desk to see if someone can check out the AC unit in our room because we felt it wasn’t getting cold enough, they had someone from engineering (I wish I took his name :() come within minutes and fix it right away. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It’s rare that you come across a gem with great food, atmosphere, amenities, and service. 10/10.

title: LOVE the Ludlow
text: Incredible location - great service - awesome cocktails at Dirty French - our room had incredible city views. The hotel's decor is spot on and every detail is thought out. I will recommend The Ludlow to anyone coming to NYC for the location, value, and style. The lobby area is a great spot to spread out, people watch and get some work done.

title: Ludlow is the place to be
text:
This hotel was amazing right in the heart of LeS. 
Centrally located everything is a few steps away. 
The staff was amazing specifically jonathan he went out of his way to make our stay out of this world. It was my bday there was a custom greeting with a bottle of champagne which was excellent and came in clutch after a long night of fun in the city. 

The skybox loft had 180 degrees of jaw dropping views which made this stay memorable for years to come. 

Jonathan was so efficient in making us feel like we had a personal concierge with his knowledgeability of the local spots and whatever we needed. He was so on point I had forgotten an outfit and he reached out to us right after checkout to return to pick it up. 

Great views, Great place, GREAT PPL 

CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!

title: Great Hotel in the Lower East Side
text: Stayed here for 4 days, 3 nights. Front desk people were very helpful. Unfortunately room wasn't ready at check in time, so I ordered a salad and a drink in the lounge area. Once we got into room was pleasantly surprised at the size (got a double room). I had the King size bed and my daughter stayed in other room that had a queen size bed. Room was quiet and spacious, and the A/C worked great as it was 101 degrees on day I landed. Walking distance to little boutiques and lots of dining options in the area. Whenever I called the front desk to ask for more water or hangers and such, they would have someone to my room within minutes. I would stay here again.

title: Shoutout Jonathan and the crew!
text: Absolutely loved my stay at the Ludlow for business! Jonathan, Anthony, Chris, and Chloe were wonderful. Beautiful building, great food, useful amenities and service was on 10. I will be returning and recommend people book their stay here as well.

title: Ludlow NYC is the BEST.
text: The Ludlow Hotel is my first call anytime I go to New York, whether for work, or now for my daughter, who is starting her first year at NYU.  We love the service, the beds, the decor, the chic lobby, the rooftop (we watched the sunrise)...the neighborhood.  I lived in NYC in the '90s, so it quenches that old NY vibe that I crave whenever I go back.  xoxoxoxox

title: Ein absoluter Glückstreffer, sehr empfehlenswert
text: Von A-Z äusserst angenehme Atmosphäre, diese beginnt bereits bei der Buchung via Email. Vom Check in, während des Aufenthalts bis zum Check out alles top. Wir reisten mit zwei Teenagern, welche den Aufenthalt ebenfalls sehr genossen haben.

title: Very disappointing- no care of their clients at all!
text:
Hi
Quirky & in a typically local part of New York. 
This should have been an unforgettable experience & not an unfortunate one!
Our view from our loft room was exciting & fabulous. The room was tired but with the view you overlooked that.
What can you do better? Your client servicing was lacking completely. We were travelling for over 10 weeks in various parts of the world with fabulous care & service. From the minute we waited for our car to be transferred to the Ludlow I knew it was not going to be as I hoped. The driver would not get out of the Car that you had organized to help us across the busy New York street on pick up . She was totally unsuitable for the job - no help with the cases . Other kind unrelated to us Drivers helped - with a leg injury I was on a crutch. Arrival at the Ludlow was not warm or welcoming - this continued. Three across the desk but no help ever - always had to be pushed!
No concierge : no suggestions & as for trying to help locate a cab. Impossible.
You always on your phones .
I spoke about a later checkout  after our nearly week stay & was told 3PM was fine. Normal for what we had experienced elsewere. We were down for checkout at 2.30PM  & you charged us a half day rate!
I was told I should have  come down at 1PM . 
I objected & was told the Manager would come & speak to us . He didn’t arrive : we were ignored by the rest of the reception staff & we departed .Absolutely embarrassing &! appalling. 
I will not stay here again or recommend you to friends family or business colleagues.
I have been in the Industry for many years & my business specializes in client servicing.
I am not without experience.
So very disappointing.
Lyne

title: Relax, enjoy, and experience NYC
text: Excellent stop in NYC.   Large rooms with super comfy beds and complete soundproofing. No street noise, no adjacent room noise, no hall noise.  The staff is very professional and the service is first rate throughout.  The lobby area is fun, hip, and funky, excellent cocktails, food, and service.  Relax on roof deck, enjoy the sunrise/sunset.  Not posh/pretentious, you will not find gold fixtures here, but you will find wonderful comfort, excellent service, and some delightful people watching.

title: A very happy weekend in New York - thanks The Ludlow
text:
Fabulous hotel, great area too
Lovely room, well appointed
Reception staff in particular were friendly and so very helpful
Breakfast was nice but dinner was fantastic
Would return and would highly recommend

title: Gem in NYC!
text: This was the third time staying at The Ludlow Hotel. We have enjoyed staying here each and every time. The rooms are charming and the entire staff is wonderful. They couldn't be more helpful. This is a true gem in NYC! Thank you to the entire staff for making our stay relaxing and enjoyable.

title: My go-to spot in New York
text:
The staff go above and beyond at this hotel to ensure you enjoy your stay. The facilities are great and the rooms are clean and comfortable. 

The hotel has a perfect spot on the lower east side as it is quiet at night and only a 10 minute walk to Noho or Soho.

title: Ludlow - the best in the Lower East Side
text: We stay at the Ludlow every time we visit our family in the Lower East Side and every stay has been excellent!  The staff, especially Omar and Anthony most recently on our last visit, go above and beyond and make you feel like you're part of the family.  The accommodations are top notch - beds are comfortable, suite is clean and trendy, and the staff always aims to please to meet your request.  We also like making our reservations directly with the hotel, as they are so friendly and accommodating.  Last time we booked with Katie and she was fabulous.  We definitely recommend the Ludlow and will stay again!

title: Flawless experience
text:
The Ludlow is such a refreshing departure from the usual New York hotel experience. We came in early to drop off our bags and they immediately offered to check our room to see if it might already be available. It happened to have been cleaned already, so we were able to go unpack and get comfortable right away for no extra charge. The room was spotless, the beds were comfortable, the view of the city was amazing, and everyone on staff was so kind and accommodating. It totally felt like a home away from home. 

Be sure to check out Dirty French off the lobby or order some room service. Some of the best food & cocktails we had on our trip. No complaints! Will definitely be back.

title: Great room with a hot tub by the window.
text: Staff was very friendly and check in was easy. The Queen Loft room was great, nicely appointed and had a nice selection in the mini bar. The bathroom was awesome, very stylish and the bath tub was the highlight. Will definitely be back again, I’ve been to the restaurant before which is also awesome, and we had great room service this time as well.

title: Great stay at the Ludlow, excited to go back
text:
Amazing stay at the Ludlow! Super friendly staff at the desk, delicious food, comfy beds. Was perfect for my business trip and excited to head back. 

The bathroom was a great size and it had a lovely shower. Luckily I got a room with a terrace which was an added bonus and was a great space. 

Thanks to the team for a great stay!

title: The Ludlow is the cool NYC home away from home of my dreams
text: The Ludlow is now my go-to NYC hotel — this was my third stay. Whether I’m in the city for work or pleasure, I am finding The Ludlow my home away from home, mostly due to the efficiency of the check in process, the helpfulness of the staff (not too pushy, but there and informative if you have a question or need a rec), the comfort of the rooms (not to mention the amazing water pressure!), and the location (walk to the Village, Soho, terrific people-watching, cool Lower East Side vibe.)

title: Inspiring by day, buzzing by night
text: The standard of the hotel was overall great. I stayed on the 15th floor with a lovely view of Downtown Manhattan, loved the gym at the top floor, it's on the smaller side but it has everything you need. The Lounge area was nice and inspiring to sit and work by day, and buzzing by night. Location is also perfect. Will be back!

title: Great Stay in the LES
text:
Stayed in a Loft Double - a king room with a sitting area and a queen room connected by a long hallway with a good sized bathroom. We were a couple + 1 and really appreciated the sitting area as a space to gather and also work. Each room has some shelves and a small closet for hanging clothes, and there’s a desk in the king room with a few additional small drawers. 

Do note that you enter and exit the suite through the queen room and must walk through it to access the bath and king room, so that may not work for all travelers.  No windows in the queen  although there is large one in the king.

Pros: great space for an NYC room; also ample lounge space downstairs to gather; friendly, helpful staff; location close to the subway and buses and walkable to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy.

The Loft Doubles are only on floors 3-6. We were on 3 and there is some street noise. Except for sirens going down the street one night though, it was never loud enough or persistent enough to be a bother, and we enjoyed the people watching from the large window. 

Only minor annoyances were the dim lighting in the rooms (not as bad in the king which had lots of natural light) and the slow elevators

title: Worth repeat visits!
text: Our third visit to the Ludlow was just as good as the first two. The rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed, comfy beds, chairs, mini-bars and lovely bathrooms.  We love the lobby as a great place to hang out, meet friends, have a drink.  The staff is helpful and well-informed. The location is great for all the fun things to do and great places to eat in the East Village and to catch the subway uptown.

title: Warm atmosphere and hospitality!
text: Had a wonderful stay at The Ludlow with my husband. We chose it because of the neighborhood, but were so pleasantly surprised with the beautiful, warm spaces. Not your sterile futuristic modern hotel—there are plants and color and candlelight, friendly faces and great vibes. Hospitality was wonderful from everyone. The room was larger than your average city hotel room, and the soaking tub was deep and spacious. Our room (506) was clean and quiet. I appreciate the door to the bathroom—not sure why so many nyc hotels have glass walls to the bathroom and I appreciate the privacy. I ended up leaving some belongings behind, and they were prompt and amazing in getting in touch and sending them back to me. Hospitality isn’t dead! Would totally stay again.

title: Top Reco - esp with Kids
text: First time taking our little girls (ages 4 & 7) to NYC and the Ludlow made it so easy and fun for us. Every single person we encountered was very accommodating and welcoming - always greeted us and very intentional on greeting the kids. Special shout out to Omar, who was so playful and engaged directly with the girls. And even made my life easier when we had deliveries to the hotel. He was always insistent on sending someone up with the delivery. Will definitely be recommending this hotel to other families. It was SO clean, spacious rooms (for New York!) and great atmosphere. Not to mention, great location to all things. Easy to jump on the subway, could easily walk to SoHo and the Village. Made our kids first trip to NY a memorable one, and we can't wait to bring them back.

title: Un luogo segreto che quasi dispiace consigliare...
text: Stupendo, in tutto, sapore, accoglienza, pulizia, posizione, il rooftop, non economico ma veramente perfetto. Poi al suo interno un ottimo bar, ristorante, nel Lower East, zona vivace piena di locali e ristoranti. Perfetto. La camera non illuminatissima... ma è un dettaglio.

title: Love the Ludlow
text: Loved the Ludlow. Loved the room which had great views over Manhattan, an opportunity to get fresh air and  the most comfy bed. The staff were very friendly, responsive and helpful. Great location on the Lower East Side close to a great variety of coffee shops, restaurants and bars (including those on the premises). I’ll be staying there again.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel on the lower east side
text: Fantastic boutique hotel with beautiful bar/lounge area on the ground floor.  Great location, great rooms and decor.  Rooms a bit tight but not atypical for NYC.  LOVE the Ludlow and will continue to go there whenever I can.

title: Amazing stay
text: One of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed was n. The service was amazing. My room was perfectly and the views were out of this world. I had the pleasure of staying on the 18th floor with a bathtub view of New York.

title: Bring your own elevator
text: Overall, I liked the hotel very much.  Friendly staff, good food and ambience.  But you will wait forever for an elevator.  There doesn't appear to be a service or staff elevator, so housekeeping, room service and others also need to use the two elevators that are insufficient for the traffic.

title: BEST customer service!
text: Apart from the stunning decor, the most memorable part was the boys at the front desk. They accommodated me every step of the way with whatever I needed. They did it though as if they were just waiting for me to show up! And we had fun and they are awesome and I will be back!

title: Super Hotel in great neighbourhood.
text:
Stayed in The Ludlow for 2 nights last week. We were delighted with the hotel, the staff
especiall on the front desk were extremely friendly & helpful. They recommeded a really
nice local Italian restaurant for the first night. The room was lovely, great view (we were
on the 8th floor). The bed was super comfy and although the bathroom was small it
was very well stocked and great shower. The neighbourhood is buzzy with lots of restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Incredible- highly recommend!
text: Incredible hotel! The rooms were beautifully decorated, with stunning bathrooms, and super comfy beds. The rooms were very small, with no where to put cases. This was the only problem we encountered. Our room was beautifully cleaned everyday. The bar area and outdoor drinks area was gorgeous.  Also has a rooftop area where you can bring your own alcohol and food and watch the sunset. All staff were great, and very helpful. Would highly recommend. In a great area, with subway close by, and shops within walking distance. Great coffee shop next door! Would also highly recommend eating in their restaurant Dirty French. Food was delicious! Very expensive, but brilliant service and atmosphere!

title: The staff are a major asset in this hotel. Very small rooms with very limited luggage space.
text: This is located in a somewhat dilapidated area of NY but the hotel itself is restored to a very high standard. The staff are excellent and check-in was hassle free and efficient. The bedroom was very small albeit with a very comfortable bed: with a poorly designed door handle on a very heavy door on to a small balcony; the air con in the bedroom is excellent as is the WIFI. The lounge/bar is quaint but comfort is sacrificed for the sake of design on most of the seating in this  area. The Dirty French restaurant is very buzzy and the food is very good but chef does tend to over-spice. Overall. a very good experience and worth selecting for a night or 2.

title: 10/10 Would Recommend
text: This hotel is amazing. All of the hotel team is so helpful and everyone goes above and beyond to ensure you have an amazing stay. I stayed at the hotel for over a week on business and had shipped some packages to the hotel before my arrival. Everything was well organized and coordinated so I didn’t have to worry. Special shoutout to Jonathan and Omar at the front desk who were helpful from even before my arrival and every step of the way during through to the very end. Both of them always greeted me and my team with a smile and it made all the difference. Thank you, both!

title: Hidden gem.
text: The Ludlow is what I think of when I think of a hip NYC hotel.  Great hospitality.  Which, in my mind is better than great service. We very much liked the rooftop sanctuary.  BYOB. It was a fun place with views of the city to relax and  share a glass of wine after a fun filled day. So close Katz deli, Russ and Daughters for bagels, Clinton Street bakery for awesomeness for breakfast and the F LINE subway station was a few min walk.

title: Buono solo se non userete aria condizionata/riscaldamento
text:
L'aria condizionata/riscaldamento sono RUMOROSISSIMI (al punto di impedire il sonno), e questo è un difetto grave.

Il clima ci ha permesso di spegnere l'impianto, e per il resto Ludlow Hotel ha davvero tanti punti di forza, e una splendida atmosfera.

Ma se fa freddo o fa caldo, scordatevi di dormire.

title: A trip to remember
text: From the start the hotel reception staff could not do enough for us.  The rooms were Immaculately clean and the lounge bar has a relaxed ambiance with subdued lighting.  There are plenty of eateries around and subways nearby.  A friend recommended the Ludlow and I would definitely recommend it as well.  Thank you to all  the staff, especially the very helpful night manager.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Where do I start?! Probably the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Stylish rooms, comfy bed, helpful staff and a nice rooftop terrace. They also take into account personal wishes (bath tub, floor, view etc.). I absolutely recommend staying here.

title: Best Location + Best Deep Soaking Tub + Friendly Staff
text: Incredible hotel! Staff was extremely friendly and fast. The best deep soaking bathtub in NYC with outstanding views. Also, the hotel is in a very trendy area with so much to do. I loved my stay here and cannot wait to come back.

title: Erfrischend anders, super nett und in Top Lage für Leute, die gerne mittendrin sind.
text: Wer ein frisches, lebendiges Hotel mit tollem Service und sehr gutem Essen sucht, der ist beim The Ludlow genau richtig. Dieses Hotel ist erfrischend unkompliziert, liegt perfekt für Leute, die gerne mittendrin sind und nicht in den cleanen Vierteln von uptown übernachten wollen. Die Zimmer sind gut, sehr sauber und für New Yorker Verhältnisse großzügig. Auffällig ist das unglaublich freundliche, hilfsbereite Personal, daß stets gut gelaunt und ohne Allüren auf die Wünsche der Gäste eingeht. Das Restaurant ist absolut zu empfehlen. Aber Vorsicht: Große Portionen! ;-) ....und unbedingt die Bar ausprobieren. Die Cocktails, die man auch auf die Rooftop Bar im 20.OG mitnehmen kann, sind richtig gut. Insbesondere der Espresso Martini ist eine Offenbarung! Darüberhinaus liegt das Haus direkt an Katz´s (Harry und Sally Szene), an China Town und Little Italy dran. Wir kommen definitiv wieder!

title: Fav NYC stay
text:
Very comfortable for family in the double room.
Very accomodating to our needs of party of 9.
It felt like our 2nd home while we were in NYC.
Breakfast and dinner at Dirty French was great.
Would come back at any opportunity.

title: No one wanted to leave the Ludlow
text: Superlative hotel experience: elegant, clean room (we stayed in the Ludlow loft) which was light and well proportioned and ditto the bathroom;  very attentive - but never obsequious service-; great location. Will definitely be back again with my family  and in the week since returning to London, have already recommended to friends and colleagues.

title: Just book it.
text: This was our (mom and teen) second time staying at The Ludlow and we can't imagine staying anywhere else. Everyone is genuinely kind and helpful. We arrived before check-in, coming off of a red eye, and our room was ready! We were so thankful to have a place to be. The room is cozy with a comfortable bed, pillows, and linens. I was able to spend some time in the lobby this time and enjoyed a cocktail. Service was great and felt comfortable spending some much needed downtime in the bustling lobby. Also, do not miss out on going to the rooftop for some amazing views. We are forever ruined by The Ludlow and will not stay anywhere else when visiting New York.

title: A gem of a hotel, combining good taste and value.
text: As a frequent traveler to New York, I want to praise The Ludlow Hotel for being both wonderful and much better than comparable properties.  It is not inexpensive, but I have paid as much elsewhere and received much less.  The Ludlow is not just clean, reasonably appointed, and competently managed -- it is beautiful, elegantly appointed, and superbly managed.  There is an attention to thoughtful detail and a pride in professional high standards that is rare even in much more expensive hotels.  Daily room cleaning?  Still their standard.  Excellent room design?  Above and beyond.  Warm personal service?  You bet, and genuine in feel.  Good restaurant?  Yes, for all meals.  You cannot do better-- not only in the East Village, but anywhere in the city.  I will definitely return.

title: Definitely recommend The Ludlow NYC
text: Staff is very welcoming. Lounge area is super comfortable - great place to hang out and do some work or have a drink with friends.  Nice to have a good restaurant on the  premises (Dirty French). Great location and great price point.

title: Looking forward for my next stay !
text: Haven’t slept so good in  while! Most comfortable bed, gorgeous bathtub with breathtaking city view, very well trained and friendly staff. Can’t wait to come back!!! Great restaurants with a walking distance. We had brunch at Rus&Daughters and dinner at the Dirty French whisky loathed at the Livy of the hotel. Make reservations ahead of the time of your visit.

title: Best downtown hotel
text: Amazing hotel - everything is perfect - the location, the staff, the views. Shout out to Chloe at the front desk who made sure I had everything I needed - also to housekeeping who magically cleaned my room in the 10 mins I stepped out for coffee!

title: Great place for a staycation!
text:
I got the best sleep I’ve had in awhile… we reserved the loft room and opened the windows to let a breeze in. It was surprisingly quiet for the 11th floor in Manhattan; that paired with the sunlight from the sunset is a great recipe for cat naps.

The hotel is located in a great area to just walk around and see super interesting things. And some great restaurants and bars in the area as well.

The staff are super helpful and always greet  you with a smile. Everyone seems super happy to be there. Shout-out to Chloe for walking up three stories and back just to get me a wine bottle opener. You’re awesome!!

title: Amazing Must-Stay Boutique New York Hotel
text:
The Ludlow is an amazing boutique hotel locate just off Houston, so it’s an easy walk to SoHo Little Italy, Chinatown and the East Village. It’s also only a block from the 2nd Avenue Metro station so there’s great access to the entire city. 

The vibe is very cool but low key. Leave a little extra time for drinks in the lobby lounge 

We didn’t try the restaurant but it looks great and our son who lives nearby says it’s very good. 

We had an amazing room with a separate second bedroom which was great as we were traveling with our aunt. 

The Ludlow is our new favorite New York hotel, and we can’t wait to stay there again on our next trip.

title: Incredible hotel!
text: One of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in! The nicest staff, the best amenities, awesome room service, and a super clean and comfy room. It’s in an excellent location and the byob rooftop is to die for. Amazing!

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC!!!!!
text: Just have to say, I will not stay at any other hotel in NYC other than the Ludlow.  First time here and this place far exceeded my expectations.  The area is amazing with many unique shops and restaurants.  The famous Katz Deli is literally a stones throw away.  The breakfast at the restaurant downstairs(The Dirty French) was fabulous.  The best part of this hotel is the staff.  Trust me, you will not find any hotel staff better than them.  Helpful and friendly beyond words.  Thank you guys for a memorable stay.  Can't wait to book again!!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Another great stay at The Ludlow Hotel. Third time here and will be back again.  Love the neighborhood and options around for exploring and dining. Stayed in loft room which allowed 2 teen daughters to share bed and front room I had as a single bed.  Beds very comfortable and space Worked perfect. Lots of space to enjoy the room. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Love sitting in the lobby lounge. Only suggestion is to expand on the lounge menu for more menu options. Oysters and deviled eggs not high on my list for a snack with a glass of wine. Other than that no complaints at all.

title: Cool location, young crowd and great ambience,
text: Nice ambience and cool location at the outskirts of Soho. Young crowd. Nice and clean rooms. The studio queen room we originally booked was however way too small with no space to store the clothes and not enough floor space to open up the suitcase. We upgraded to a King studio that was a much better room with decent size. Helpful and nice staff.

title: Perfect spot!
text: We loved our stay at The Ludlow! The room was beautiful, spacious, and provided a peaceful respite from the city. The staff were exceptionally attentive, friendly, and professional. The location was perfect- we had easy access to Brooklyn and the rest of Manhattan, and we loved exploring the neighborhood. We would 100% stay here again.

title: Gritty City + Trendy Sophistication
text: Just perfect. Omar was especially kind and attentive during a stay. We arrived early and he held our bags while we ate lunch before the room was ready. They texted us to let us know when it was ready and had already placed our bags in the room, along with some flowers I’d had delivered for my spouse. The room was lovely with nice decorative touches and spectacular views of the LES. You might see Spider-Man jumping across the rooftops below. You’ll get amazing photos from the rooftop patio and the fitness center has really nice equipment and was never crowded. The lobby bar is trendy and cozy (you won’t be sorry if you order the Espresso Martini) and the staff was great. Room service from Dirty French was outstanding. Get the pomme frites. The roasted half chicken and the chick club were also great. Storage space in the room is limited, but the hotel will gladly store any bulky items in their bell room, and suitcases fit easily under the bed with room to spare. There are also lots of coat hooks and deep window sills. It’s perfect for a long weekend in the city. The neighborhood was fun. It’s a gritty city feel, yet we felt perfectly safe walking about during the day and even in the evenings. Use common sense. It’s a big city and dark side streets are probably best  left alone in the middle of the night. The bars and restaurants are easy to get to without going down sketchy alleys. Go. Have fun. You won’t regret it.

title: Excellent everything
text: My wife and I have made the Ludlow hotel our permanent staycation destination. All thanks to Johnathan and Omar for the excellent customer service and hospitality. Beyond amazing in every way. Can’t wait to book again.

title: Location, room, and staff all get five stars!
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow for the first time in January and was blown away. The location is within walking distance of great nightlife and also close to several trains if you need to travel elsewhere in the city (getting to Brooklyn is especially easy). The room itself (studio queen) was perfect for me as a solo traveler—it felt luxurious and had all the amenities I needed. Unlike many hotels I've stayed at in NYC, there was no train/street noise and I slept extremely well. The bathroom was also especially nice and housekeeping did a great job during my stay. Finally, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, even letting me stow my bags with them for a few hours after my check-out. 

Highly recommend staying here during your next NYC visit!

title: A1 customer service and stay at the Ludlow!
text: Where do I start? First and foremost the personnel! Shout out to Jonathan and Miguel for making my wife and I’s stay at the Ludlow not only one we’ll never forget but also a hotel we’ll look forward to staying at whenever we want a night in the city. Jonathan went above and beyond when our room wasn’t ready when we checked in. Not only did he go above and beyond but his communication to ensure he was on top of business was top notch. I have never received such cordial and authentic hospitality. Sure you can have kind and helpful personnel but not the level of  authenticity and above and beyond the way the team at the Ludlow operates. The room and hotel were awesome as well from the aesthetic and presentation to how how clean everything was. The pictures don’t do the rooms and hotel justice. But again the whole experience was great thanks thanks to the team at the Ludlow - We’ll be coming back for sure thank you Jonathan, Miguel, and Omar!

title: Perfect Staycation
text: First time at the Ludlow Hotel for a February staycation.  Though still in denial that this is the same block of Ludlow where I used to frequent Max Fish and Luna Lounge, we had a wonderful stay.  Every interaction with the staff was courteous and kind and the service impeccable.  Stayed in a Loft Queen.  Tastefully decorated and warmly lit.  The bathtub is  almost worth the stay on its own.  It's enormous with beautiful fixtures and a the second best respite for a cold February afternoon...the first of course being a hot toddy by the fireplace in the lounge.

Love The Ludlow Hotel 

( 3rd visit ) 

Location perfect in coolest part of town 
(Even an oldie like me can party once in while )

Staff always helpful and welcoming 

Great restaurant 

Rooms with outstanding views and especially the baths with a view as that’s unusual in NY.

Good / great value for what you get in an expensive City which New York currently is 

Hope to see you later in the year again 

Regards

CG

title: Best Value Hotel in Manhattan
text:
The Ludlow is the BEST value hotel in Manhattan.
Unbelievably friendly, helpful, accommodating staff.
The lounge is so comfortable and perfect place for that nightcap after a busy day in the city. Designed for small groups to sit, chat, drink and nibble.
Great drinks and food.
The beds are so very comfortable, the pillows actual fluffy pillows versus the flat uncomfortable ones in so many hotels these days.
Our family stays at the Ludlow about every 3 months to gather our EAst Coast and West Coast family - we wouldn't stay anywhere else !

title: Chic and fun!
text: From the moment we entered the lobby, the staff made us feel special. I must mention in particular Omar with whom I spoke to before I even got there, and who made this a special event for us. The room has terrific views of the city out of the tall floor to ceiling windows, and the bathroom is downright elegant. Dinner at Dirty French was delicious and fun. Everyone we came in contact with was engaging and personable and the place was spotless. Can't wait to come back!

title: A great hotel with great views
text:
We had an excellent one night stay at The Ludlow and will be sure to return back on our next trip to NY. 

The Staff; it goes without saying that every employee we encountered, from those at the front desk to the housekeepers to the bartender, were all kind, friendly and willing to help us when need be. They accommodated our late check out request immediately and were happy to do so. 

The hotel: The lobby/lounge area, with its roaring fireplace and comfy couches is a perfect place to sit and enjoy your morning coffee and bagel or your pre dinner drinks from the Dirty French bar. I do wish the bar was opened a bit later, it would be great to come back to the hotel and have a late nightcap! The rooftop is a must see as well, awesome views of the surrounding city, with some tables and chairs to hang out at with a cold beverage. Our room (Loft Queen) was well appointed and comfortable. We were on the sixth floor and got a good amount of natural light through both the bedroom and bathroom windows. The bathroom itself was one of the best parts of the room, with a the large shower and tub (which is right next to a window with a view) . The bed was comfy and the shades will darken the room plenty if sleeping in is your thing.

Overall, this is a comfy hotel with great views, a very friendly staff, and an overall relaxed and chilled vibe. I think we may have found our favorite hotel in NY!

title: Great service!!
text: Room was clean and spacious…I’ve been staying in NY hotels 5-6 times a  year over the past three years. And this was one of the friendliest and most helpful staffs I’ve dealt with. I would like to extend a special thank you to Jonathan for the amazing service. Jonathan handled my request quickly and with a smile. I’ve been looking for a place to call “home”, and I think I’ve found it. Thanks again to Jonathan and all of the staff!!

title: My favourite
text: These days I always stay at the Ludlow. The team are exceptional, always so helpful and friendly. The bar is a firm favourite, and even the smallest rooms are designed so well, you still feel you're getting a premium stay. Dirty French is a terrific restaurant – a little on the pricey side, but the food is great and the service, again, is spot-on. Absolutely love this hotel, and will absolutely be back again.

title: Home away from home!
text: The Ludlow is the coziest, warmest place to stay in the city! It's always welcoming and has the best King rooms! I've stayed here for years and plan to keep coming back for many more. The staff is always friendly, the area has great food and I love that the Ludlow Coffee Supply is right next door! 10/10 every time.

title: Beautiful and dreamy comfort
text: The decor is beyond and ultimate comfort.  All of the staff is so friendly and right there for you.  If you are staying on the lower east side this is the cream of the crop - no regrets and worth every cent.

title: Best Hotel in NYC - unparalleled  views and service!
text: Everything was phenomenal! Front desk staff, Omar and Jonathan, were attentive to every detail that would make our stay memorable, down to delicious meal and drink recommendations at the hotel's restaurant. Restaurant staff and service was also amazing and made our getaway feel incredibly special. Will be recommending this place to friends and family and I definitely plan to stay at The Ludlow the next time I'm in town.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Beautiful hotel and terrific service! It’s also located near some wonderful delis. The rooms were clean and well sized for New York. It was easy to catch an Uber or a cab and easy to walk to places like Greenwich Village & Chelsea.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: This hotel was excellent from the time we arrived. The location is perfect and the views are great. The place has a very homely feel when you walk inside. The food was great in the restaurant, and the staff was very friendly from the front desk crew to the cleaning staff. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to feel that real NYC energy and not be stuck in a tourist trap.

title: Great three night stay at the Ludlow
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Ludlow. The room was perfect for a three night solo stay;  great views, cozy in the January gloom. Eclectic decor, very comfortable. Great light fixtures throughout the hotel, in the room and common areas. Loved having cocktails by the fireplace in the bar - good atmosphere with groups playing cards. Delicious light bites at Dirty French where the hosts and servers were delightful to a person. Front desk staff welcoming and helpful. I will definitely stay again. Thank you!

title: 2 Thumbs Up
text: From the moment we entered until the moment we left the staff at the Ludlow were amazing. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful and efficient in getting us checked in. The rooms here are beautifully decorated with lots of little details to enjoy. The shower and tub were excellent and the bed and pillows were super comfortable. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a room in LES - you cant beat rolling out of bed and being a half black from Russ and Daughters....

title: Love The Ludlow!
text: My husband has stayed at the Ludlow before and this time I got to join him! Our stay was perfect - from check-in to check-out the staff was super friendly and accommodated all our needs.  The room was clean and spacious.  We will be back!

title: Love the vibe
text:
The staff is so accommodating and helpful! The hotel vibe is very cool! The lobby and bar were so fun. Rooms were spacious and quiet! Love this boutique hotel! Will definitely be back!!
Notable names-Alan was amazing!!

title: Hidden Gem:  A must see
text: This place was more than I expected and perfect for our mid-week getaway post Christmas with our two teenagers. The hotel was in a great location (bonus that Katz deli was across the street), tons of cools shops and bars in walking distance and in a safe neighborhood.  Hotel itself was staffed with very kind and amazingly helpful people--from the bartender who made me a custom drink from something I described--to room service who placed a complimentary bottle of Rose wine in our room for my Husbands birthday. The room was comfortable, the lobby inviting and warm with the woodburning fireplace, just a great spot for a late evening cocktail (while our kids decompressed on their phones in the room), super luxurious and low key at the same time. Comfortable and casual, and elegant. My son and daughter both had room to stretch out at night while we had a nite cap on property...it was a hidden gem and we would absolutely go back!!!

title: New Favorite Hotel!
text: Love this hotel! It was my first time staying here and I cant wait to come back. It is the perfect location in the Lower East Side - walking distance from soho or the east village. The rooms exceeded my expectation. I walked into the room and was blown away at how big it was for a New York hotel. It felt like an apartment. Loved the vibe of the whole hotel and can't wait to book again.

title: So good we had to come back for more...
text: We stayed at The Ludlow when we eloped in January 2022 and returned to mark our first anniversary. The staff was wonderful and welcomed us warmly after a long day of travel delays. Our Skybox Loft was every bit as good as we remembered it...and that soaking tub!  The hotel is in a great location and the ambience is fantastic. The Ludlow will remain on our must visit list.

title: Great stay!
text: Clean and beautiful rooms! Highly recommend the skybox loft suite with soaking tub and city views! Staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is gorgeous with sitting area/fireplace and cozy bar area! Would stay again.

title: Great weekend stay
text: Had a great weekend birthday stay at the Ludlow.  Great ambiance in the lobby with fireplace and bar.  Rooms are tastefully decorated and have an old-world feel.  Service was attentive. Will come again!

title: Cozy Weekend In The City
text: This past weekend I had a great experience at the Ludlow, where the restaurant and room service staff was prompt, professional and personable. I’d like to shine a light on one of the hotel managers, Omar, who fosters a great atmosphere for both staff and guests. I highly recommend you take advantage of the complementary amenities, specifically hot tea and a bubble bath. Additionally, the hotel is conveniently close to Dirty French, Katz Delicatessen, Van Leeuwen Ice Cream, and more. From my clean room with a beautiful view to the delicious food with swift service my stay was fantastic!

title: WHAT A TREAT
text: The Ludlow is without a doubt my favorite hotel in NYC. I have always stayed in a mini suite and despite the small size, it is comfortable and seems to have everything that I need. The bathtub is decadently delicious, large and beautifully appointed with a view of the Lower East Side. Moroccan Rose toiletries from Red Flower are provided, a scent that even Red Flower no longer offers. My favorite and I always feel pampered. This is a hotel that actually listens to guests. Every single request I had was honored---Nespresso coffee maker in the room-check, tea kettle-check, empty mini bar-thank you, more bottled water-check, bubble bath-of course. And no resort charge. With a warm and inviting staff in the best neighborhood that the city has to offer, thank you Ludlow for being such a  consistently delightful experience.

title: My favorite NY hotel!
text: The Ludlow arranged for a bottle of champagne for my parent's as we were in town to celebrate their wedding anniversary. The staff were all so pleasant throughout our stay and went over an above to ensure we were well taken care of.

title: The Ludlow - How to get it right
text: Great hotel - Great staff. Everyone who works in the Ludlow, was polite helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The Ludlow is a busy hotel with a good bar and restaurant area. Conveniently located on the LES. Rooms are a little small with little room for suitcases. Typically NYC.

title: A Merry Christmas Journey
text: Good service, clean room, friendly front desk staff.  The room is complete with daily necessities.  You can check in with the package.  There is a quiet restaurant for breakfast in the morning and a lively bar for joy in the evening.

title: Amazing NYC hotel with the greatest vibe and staff
text:
What an outstanding hotel! We have visited NYC many times, but never really found "our place" before now - but the Ludlow is IT! 

We felt so welcome from the moment we entered the lobby. Fantastic and hospitable staff gave a great general vibe, and everybody we met were so welcoming and nice. The room was stunning, and so well maintained by the housekeeping staff. We loved the food, and enjoyed the cozy lobby with always attentive waiters. We just felt genuinely welcome and loved our stay. We will definitely come back!

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
text: Our family of 6 spent 6 nights at this hotel. It is a stunning hotel with chic decor. Everything is super high quality and we found the staff to all be friendly and helpful. Our rooms were very comfortable, each comprising of 2 bedrooms and a bathroom - so plenty of space and privacy if people were coming and going. Importantly in NY the rooms were well insulated from noise, both from the street and other rooms, so very quiet. Restaurant and bar are high quality and well staffed. There is also a decent gym. The hotel is in a great location, with easy access to the subway or to walk around  the area or to nearby districts including Little Italy, Chinatown or over to Chelsea / Meatmarkets (30 mins). We loved our stay at the Ludlow Hotel.

title: Swanky Cool BEST stay every time!!!
