text: BEST Swanky Cool Vibe through the whole hotel....AMAZING Clean rooms in all the details...BEST attentive caring staff...COMFIEST bed...BEST bath experience....AMAZING food...GREAT location....BEST roof top views and hand out...My favorite place to stay in NYC because all of the above and nothing missing!

title: New York in Style !!
text:
Absolutely amazing !! There is no better hotel in New York for service and style. Will be back as soon as we can be … our top tips ..
make sure you visit the roof terrace for the best night time view and have dinner at Dirty French with plenty of cocktails!

title: Lower East Side Vibe
text: The Ludlow is a super boutique hotel in the Lower East Side.  First, the location is out of the way of the main tourist crowds but also central enough to get to Lower Manhattan, SoHo, East and West Village, Brooklyn, Union Square, etc.  There are amazing restaurants nearby, shops, art galleries, etc.  Really the best of NYC.  The hotel is well managed and clean with exciting communal spaces including the lounge, greenhouse and restaurant.  I usually upgrade to the “loft” size rooms which are a little bit larger, but really every room is comfortable and beautifully designed.  The food at the restaurant is superb, though there are also so many choices near by.  I highly recommend Ludlow Coffee next door and of course no visit to NYC is complete without a stop at Katz’s Deli or Russ & Daughters.

title: I would definitely stay again.
text:
Extremely comfortable room, wonderfully comfortable bed. Everything we needed for our 5 day stay. 
Very amiable, very helpful staff the whole time.
We had 2 breakfasts, a lunch and a snack in the bar / restaurant, all very nice.
We ate and some fab restaurants around the hotel and found it really easy to catch the metro to wherever we wanted to go.

title: Poor, tiny rooms, no storage, unable to unpack anything f
text:
This hotel has a lot of style - but has one fundamental flaw

The rooms are tiny - even by NYC standards, but the prices aren’t.

There is ZERO room for luggage and guests in the rooms, we ended up with bags on beds!

The wardrobes are cupboards and can at hest accommodate 2-3 shirts 

We really didn’t enjoy this place as a hotel, fine as a bar, but hotels need a nice room (these are tiny and cluttered), a comfortable quiet bed (neither comfortable nor quiet - between the aircon and the incessant car alarms from the parking garage behind it.

2 lifts servicing entire building meant long queues 

Frankly this is my second stay here - had forgotten my first from some years back - both were below par, by some way

3/10

title: Wonderful experience
text: Great experience. Beautiful room, lively bathroom and large outdoor patio. Great location. The lobby has a huge cozy fireplace where you can relax and have a drink, coffee or snack. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant was excellent. Love this place:

title: Love it
text: My husband and I + our two young boys (5 & 9) stayed in a 2 bedroom for a few nights, and we all really enjoyed out stay. We found all of the staff to be extremely welcoming and accommodating, and the room to be extremely well appointed and clean. The hotel has kind of a cozy, hip vibe which we found very comfortable. We also dined at Dirty French a couple times and thought the food and service were fantastic. The pancakes are to die for. We would highly recommend and would absolutely stay here again!

title: Lower East Side gem
text: The Ludow’s comfortable and cozy rooms were perfect for my family. The staff was welcoming and gave us great recommendations for meals and things to do with the little ones. I loved seeing the smokeless crowds in the lounge, although we didn’t join in.

title: LES with the BEST location, cool room types and FAB service
text: There are so many hotel choices in NYC, on the LES and even on Ludlow Street but The Ludlow is always THE BEST choice. I stayed there four times in the last few weeks - all for business mixed with some fun. The staff continues to be the most gracious and welcoming. The rooms are so cool and have the best lighting (for that social) and views. It’s been so much fun to explore the unique rooms on every floor, too. LOVE THIS PLACE and the TEAM.

title: NY without the stress
text: Really great location for all things local from Katz to Russ and Daughters bagel shop. Rooms were great and lobby bar was inviting and very friendly. Room was quiet and comfortable without the fuzz. Staff were helpful when we were looking for a local place for breakfast within walking distance. -

title: Fantastic hotel with brilliant service
text: The Ludlow, NYC, has officially become our favourite hotel in the States.  From the moment we arrived and were met by Omar and Miguel at the front desk they couldn't do enough to make sure we had everything we needed.   Our room was stunning with huge double windows overlooking NYC.  When we rang down for something to be brought to our room it arrived within minutes even though we were on the 16th floor!  Lev, the barman, was just brilliant at making the most wonderful cocktails, even making up exceptional non-alcoholic ones when needed.  All in all a wonderful stay in a fantastic hotel with a real heart for service and making you feel at home.  We will be back!

title: A truly unique stay with views that are absolutely unparalleled!
text:
Every staff member we encountered was VERY welcoming and helpful. Austin went above and beyond to make sure our room was perfect for our trip.
The property itself is first class and VERY UNIQUE!
Absolutely the most incredible view from our 18th story skybox!
Can’t wait to go back!
We highly recommend The Ludlow!

title: First Rate Experience
text:
My wife and I live in New York City and booked The Ludlow as a weekend stay for her birthday to spend some time in other neighborhoods.

Best parts of our stay:
- Bright, beautiful room
- Crisp, comfortable bed
- City windows (for quiet sleeping)
- Amazing shower pressure
- Helpful, professional staff
- Solid restaurant (Dirty French)
- Welcome gifts (wine/waters)

Only issue:
- Slow/crowded elevators

We knew within an hour that The Ludlow was going to be a great stay. We’d stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Fine hotel but small guest room and dark decor in public spaces
text: The hotel staff was terrific, the location fine, the hotel was hip yet chill.  However our room was quite small. We had to take turns getting around the bed to the closet! (Room 704 - queen room with terrace).  The public areas were comfortable and interesting, but the overall decor was dark and a few times we couldn’t find any open seats in the lobby-lounge, as some people parked themselves for the long haul with laptops and meals, and seating was limited.  We may stay here again, but would book a larger room. We didn’t try the restaurant.

title: Weekend stay in the LES
text: The Ludlow is a beautiful, stylish and comfortable hotel in the lower east side. It is conveniently located near great restaurants , culture, and shopping. The rooms are small but very clean, stocked, and the beds are very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the coffee even better. The Garden room is very nice and light filled

title: great hotel!
text: The Ludlow was the most beautiful hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying. The room was spotless; the staff was friendly, helpful, and kind. The lobby, dining room, and room aesthetics were the perfect combination of masculine and comfortable. Everyone from the doorkeepers, front desk, and Restaurant Manager Nelson were top-notch, ensuring we were taken care of at every turn. We will surely be back and have peace of mind knowing that we will have a great stay.

title: Great hotel
text: Wonderful and hip hotel in a great location in LES.  Service is great.  Room was very nice.   Loved the restaurant and downstairs bar.  As a bonus Katz is steps away! Will definitely be staying again at the Ludlow!

title: Fabulous stay in a cool hotel in a cool part of town
text:
I loved every minute of my stay at the Ludlow. It’s a safe haven at the end of a long day exploring the sights. Walking through the doors to the friendliest of reception staff into a comfy lounge area with a roaring fire is just what you need after a day of sightseeing. The rooms and beds are cool and contemporary but also cosy and comfortable with huge beds and the bathtub of dreams. The cocktail bar and restaurant are fabulous and you only
have to walk out the door to find even more incredible
bars, restaurants and shops on your doorstep. I would recommend the chicken shop next door for the best fried chicken sandwich I have ever had, Rosie’s for authentic Mexican with amazing frozen margaritas and Beauty and Essex for a glam dinner out.

title: We love The Ludlow
text:
The Ludlow is our favorite hotel in the city. Great location. Best rooms, and defiantly THE BEST bathrooms in the city!
Dirty French is a fantastic spot for dinner (we missed their new Jazz brunch) and the garden bar is perfect for a cocktail.. afternoon, evening, or after dinner! The staff is welcoming and professional.

title: We'll be back!
text: Exceptional stay.  Every employee (even the cleaning staff we bumped into on the elevator) was friendly, helpful and accommodating.  Short cab ride to everything you could want in NYC.  Doesn't hurt to have Katz's across the street!

title: Cannot fault this hotel
text: Stayed in the skybox loft room on a delayed trip from 2020. I was so pleased with the hotel choice - views from the room were unbelievable. Very clean and unusually for NYC, space to move. Helpful reception staff and some great restaurants nearby. Recommend Pause cafe for breakfast. Loved our stay and would recommend for anyone visiting New York 😍

title: Home away from home in NYC.
text: Honestly this is one of the most wonderful hotels i've ever stayed at!  Super friendly, lovely decor, great folks at the front desk and front door, awesome cleaners, comfy bed and pillows and lovely linens!  We were in NYC from Vancouver, Canada for a wedding and a number of the guests stayed here.  The lounge area/restaurant with the fireplace made for a lovely place to gather and chat and meet up spontaneously.  When you stay in a hotel there is often no where to get together with friends staying in the hotel so this is a real bonus. Plus I met a few new people in this area as it is such a friendly hotel with great vibes!  I'll be back to the Ludlow the next time I am in NYC!  Thank you!

title: Fabulous Hotel and team
text: The stay was perfect from start to finish. The room was luxuriously appointed, comfortable, tastefully designed and a sanctuary to drop into when needed. Slept like a baby in the very comfortable bed. Housekeeping was impeccably clean. Staff were friendly and approachable - helpful when needed. The design and look of the common spaces was stunning! And did I mention location? Perfect. I would not hesitate to recommend The Ludlow Hotel, nor to return every time I visit.

title: L O V E this hotel
text:
We booked a king room on a higher level. They made it possible to check in early 1:00 PM and we were surprised with our corner room with the best views of lower Manhattan. We loved it! 
The bed was great and we had more than enough space in the room for 2 big suite cases. The shower was amazing, says someone who does not really care for rain showers. 
The members of the staff were all very helpful and approachable and we are especially grateful for Cristians help the day we had to leave for the airport again.
The only thing was that the mini fridge was removed from our room, maybe it needed fixing? But we did not miss it and we did not even mention it. 
Would highly recommend and will definitely come back our next time in Manhattan.

title: Siempre será mi lugar en NYC
text: El buen gusto en todo, el ambiente, el restaurante BELLÍSIMO donde puedes desde desayunar (el croissant más delicioso que he probado) hasta cenar. Ese cuarto de baño! Nuestras vistas no eran la mejores pero aún así teníamos un amanecer impresionante cada mañana desde la cama. Tampoco era ningún drama porque podías subir al roof top, solo para huéspedes y siempre tranquilo, y ahí si tienes una de las vistas más espectaculares de la ciudad, donde ver atardeceres que te dejan sin palabras. Me dió rabia descubrirlo el último día, lo habría aprovechado más. Si nos lo dijeron haciendo el check in sinceramente no lo entendí. Pero no tiene mayor importancia, pudimos disfrutar de las vistas tomando una copa nuestra última noche allí. La zona y el barrio son de mis favoritos de Manhattan, al sur de la isla es donde está toda la vida de verdad, y bien comunicado. volvería siempre a este genial y discreto hotel, con el mejor de los servicios.

title: Bliss
text: Stunning space, lovely staff, cozy room with tasteful decor - wish I could take the bathtub home! I worked from the main lobby which was peaceful and pleasant. I didn't stay for dinner/drinks but I suggest a drink at the fireplace during the winter months!

title: A great NYC Vacation
text: I have been staying at the Ludlow on a very regular basis since 2015. The hotel has a great atmosphere and the team working there are very friendly and eager to please. When I stay in NYC it feels like home. Between 2015 and 2020 I stayed there on average once per month for at least 10 days.  I have returned post covid for holiday trips and I haven't been disappointed. The hotel's standards of high cleanliness still remain and the team despite changing a great deal remains very friendly. It was great to see some of the longer serving employees still working the hotel! The speed of service in Dirty French has improved. The hotel's location is great even for the business traveler. You can be up in midtown or downtown in less than 20 mins.

title: Fantastic Hotel in the Lower East Side with some of the best views in NY
text: We had a stunning two nights at the Ludlow. The service, vibe, restaurant and rooms were fantastic. Highly recommended. The staff were extremely friendly and guided us for everything we needed. Great for exploring both Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Perfect Getaway!
text: The perfect hotel for a romantic getaway or a solo retreat. It's perfectly located for access to amazing restaurants, shopping and fun times. We'll always return! Great service and thoughtful details. I love getting work done or just having a drink in the lobby, the balcony rooms are so cute and the decor makes it feel so special. I love the bathrooms!

title: New Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: I am a long time visitor of New York and this was my first time staying at The Ludlow.  This has become my New Favorite Place.  When you first arrive, they actually greeted me at the curb and helped with my bags.  The Staff is so incredibly friendly, courteous and go out of their way to ensure you are comfortable.  The Lobby Area is perfect for catching up on work when you don't want to sit in your room.  Plenty of space, comfortable and cozy and the Fireplace!  The rooms are very spacious and surprisingly quiet- which can be a rarity in NY - with incredible views and the beds are very comfortable.  This was a Birthday trip and the Hotel Manager, Eric, added special touches to help with the Celebrations.  Wine, chocolates (how did he know) and balloons!  The Hotel Restaurant - The Dirty French - is amazing and is a must!  It was the prefect place to spend my Birthday! Thank you and I Will Be Back!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Ludlow has incredibly kind staff, clean room, great service. Highly recommend! The amenities are fantastic and the view from the roof is stunning! The rooms are also very quiet and the bathrooms are gorgeous.

title: Wedding overnight stay
text:
What an incredible space and even more incredible hospitality. Jolyn Is outstanding! She gave us an early checkin and then we were able to receive a late checkout. Everyone was so warm and welcoming no matter how early or late, how busy or slow. The staff held our bags after we checked out so we could explore the neighborhood without having to lug our bags everywhere. 
Beautiful night sleep, it was surprisingly quiet ❤️
Thank you so much! We will be back some day!

title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff - will return!
text: Stayed in a studio king bed room for three nights - beautiful, clean hotel.  The room was very well appointed and it was quiet ( for New York!) at night.  Front desk staff are very helpful.  We also enjoyed drinks in front of the fireplace and room service.  Highly recommend!!

title: Fantastic hotel and service. Clean, atmospheric and friendly.
text: We had a great stay in the ludlow, hotel it  was spotless, staff were very helpful and friendly. Great atmosphere in the lounge bar and restaurant. Food was excellent for breakfast, we had one dinner in Dirty French, again excellent, not cheap, but comparable with local quality eateries.  The room (on 10th) wasn’t large, but big enough, very quiet, stylishly decorated in great condition and clean, air con spot on, bathroom lovely, spacious enough  with good shower, great mirror, hot water temp and pressure spot on. I’ll say again the staff were really helpful and the area was great too, it’s a heady cultural mix and what we hoped NYC would be with great food options of every kind, high end modern shops mixed with real streets and people, a real community feel. Subway easy to get to on foot, safe and easy to get to midtown, downtown or Brooklyn. Area is very lively at night but we never felt unsafe with family (2 girls) on the streets. it was ok to grab a takeout coffee from the great coffee shop next door which was nice. For the Brits, if you want a kettle and tea in your room just ask and it’s complimentary, the Nespresso machine is the std. We didn’t ask so I grabbed tea from the coffee shop before we hit any breakfast.  Overall I would definitely return and recommend. If you like Shoredich/Soho you’ll like the LES but either way we felt it was a great base for NYC.

title: Top notch hotel in lower east side
text: My daughter and I stayed in a two bedroom loft here while in town for the US Open.  Lovely room, very helpful staff, tremendous value for the money here as this is a top level hotel. Great food, close to great coffee shops and other restaurants.

title: I will always stay here
text: Any time we come back to New York, I hope that we will be able to stay at The Ludlow again. Everyone we encountered (from the front door, lobby, and elevators) was incredibly kind. The room was surprisingly quiet given the activity downstairs. We asked for a last minute switch that was graciously accommodated by Jason and Anderson. The location is close to transit and great coffee shops and grocery. I can't wait to come back to The Ludlow!

title: The best place to stay in NYC!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at The Ludlow! WIth so many hotels downtown, it's hard to pick one. But Ludlow is an amazing location (close to CVS, juice shops, Whole Foods, etc. if you need it during your stay) and the service is impeccable! Will definitely stay again soon!!!!

title: Amazing staff and location!
text:
We had to move from one hotel to another at short notice due to a booking error which we were not thrilled about, but turned out to be a blessing in disguise!
Of all the assets the Ludlow has (great location, great decor, great services etc) the best by far are the team of personnel!
As soon as we walked in we were greeted and made to feel welcome,  and although our room wasn't ready (we were early)  the Manager, Jolyn, took extra care to ensure she had our luggage taken care of - even some items that needed to be refrigerated - and explained all our room options and preferences to ensure we got the best room available.  It's personal attention above and beyond that made the hassles of the day seem like nothing at and before we knew it our room was prepared and it was great. 
Great furnishings and style, room service was both fast and delicious, and the hotel's location (lower East Side) offers the best of NYC at your fingertips.
We really appreciate your work, Jolyn and team, and will be sure to visit again next time in the City!

title: Great neighbourhood, room far too small
text:
I love the LES, so this hotel is perfectly located. The hotel itself is OK. A bit too sparsely lit for my taste, but the rest of the interior is tastefully done. 
My room however, was way too small. For me as a solo traveller (and I am not tall or big) with a medium suitcase, it already felt too cramped. I had a room directly next to the elevator. I believe these are smaller than other rooms. Unfortunately, the reception, when I mentioned my issues, could not move me. The only thing they could do was let maintenance remove a coffeetable so I had room to open my suitcase on the floor (no luggage racks here). I stayed for six nights and can’t say I enjoyed staying in my room. Ofcourse, when you’re in NYC, you’re not in your room a lot. But for me, $3000  for six nights is a lot of money. Being able to move comfortably in your room, is not too much to ask for, right? Even for European standards (I regularly stay in Paris and Rome) the room was just too small. So I won’t be returning. I don’t want to run the risk getting stuck in a tiny room again. Can’t comment on the breakfast or restaurants on site, but people seemed to enjoy themselves. O yeah, and I really loved the rooftop (worth checking out during day and nighttime).

title: Chic et posh, à faire si cela ne vous gêne pas
text:
Très bel hôtel au cœur du Lower East Side, the Ludlow jouit d’une situation désirable dans le New York branché. 
Lobby et espaces communs chics et élégants et terrasse rooftop folle combleront les plus blasés.
La chambre (une studio queen au 16eme étage) était elle aussi chic et élégante! Les serviettes étaient moelleuses et en nombre suffisant.
Mais que manque-t-il alors me direz-vous? 
Tout d’abord, le matelas manquait de confort, trop mou, pas digne du standing voulu par l’hôtel. 
Ensuite, tout était payant et, soyons honnêtes, hors de prix, compte tenu là encore du standing de l’hôtel, je ne suis pas sûr que mettre de l’eau à disposition des hôtes ait un impact fort sur la rentabilité, alors pourquoi la faire payer (2 petites bouteilles sont offertes pour la 1ere nuit).
Fuyez le petit déjeuner du Dirty French, cher, au choix limité, le tout servi (en tout cas ce matin là) par une équipe trop blasée pour être sympa.
Bref, un hôtel de standing où séjourner si vous vous fichez de vous sentir chez vous, à défaut d’être conquis vous serez peut être séduit !

title: Made my visit
text: An incredibly cozy hotel with fantastisk staff. We were well taken care of.Clean and tidy, cozy gutniskes rooms.Me and my family had an unforgetable trip.I will definitely go here again and can really recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: The Ludlow is a beautiful hotel on the lower East side.  It is surrounded by famous restaurants and has a great restaurant and bar.  The 20th-floor gym and outdoor patio are a great place and worth checking out too

title: Excellent experience!
text:
Loved staying at the Ludlow. The design is beautiful - exciting to look at, but also very calm and soothing. Everyone working there was overtly friendly and approachable, which made me realize that I kinda expected the staff to be a little too cool for school, but that wasn't the case at all. The beds are super comfortable, and the rooms were really quiet. My room was next to the elevator, and obviously, NYC is noisy and the LES is lively all night long. I literally heard nothing from either the hallway or the neighborhood when I was in my room. 

They were great at accommodating my requests for a room with a good view and a tub. The tub and shower were both fantastic - the tub filled very fast and the shower water pressure was perfection. I had the smallest room, which was snug, even for one person. There wasn't a luggage rack in the room - I found out later I could have requested one, but there really wasn't anywhere to put it, so even if I had known they were available, I probably wouldn't have asked for one. But the snugness was cozy, and more than comfortable for one person for a couple of nights.

title: Hotel with character
text: The hotel has great character, from the moment you enter you get into a special atmosphere. Great friendly people to help you. Rooms are very nice with all that you need. The resto has good food and also there very good service.

title: Tucked away gem
text: We chose this location because it was close to where our daughter was moving in. We were pleasantly surprised at the"intimacy" of the hotel but the proximity to where we wanted to be. The rooms were comfortable and attractive. The staff were really friendly. Right opposite an amazing deli (pastrami like nothing I have ever seen). We are new to New York but we will not hesitate to return to The Ludlow.

title: Lower East Gem
text: The Ludlow is the epitome of a boutique hotel.  It provides personalized service and a very comfortable atmosphere. The rooms are a little small but have some of the best views of New York City. The breakfast (best pancakes ever) at Dirty French was amazing, the staff were very accommodating and friendly, and the exercise room on the top floor will get you to do your cardio regularly. The neighborhood that the Ludlow is located in is vibrant and there are numerous restaurants within a block or two. We had a great stay and didn’t mind waiting for the elevator.  The rooms were clean and well appointed. There were a couple of minor service related issues that did not affect our stay.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: I want to come back!!
text:
Great staff, super pleasant room, a few water bottles when I checked it!
My favorite part was the gorgeous bathroom (great shower pressure) with lots of counter space and solid bath products. 
My second favorite part was the covered lounge in the lobby - a great spot for working between my meetings in the city.

title: Great hotel, I didn’t want to leave.
text:
We really enjoyed our visit to a the Ludlow and would certainly stay again. We were in the Ludlow double loft which was perfect for 3. There is no separate hallway to exit the room so you do have to walk through a bedroom to get out. This was no problem to us but might be for others. It was great to have a small seating area and immaculately clean. The rooms are very quiet and cool. As a Brit I missed an in room kettle for my morning tea and wish I’d brought a travel one with me (🫖 is life!)

Staff were friendly and helpful. We didn’t eat in the restaurant in the evening as we tended to go out but if you want to make sure to reserve a table as it gets busy with non hotel guests. There is a fantastic Italian restaurant across the street I’d recommend, Taverna Di Bacco. 

I liked that the lounge and outside terrace were hotel guests only. Great views from the small roof terrace and good subway line to uptown and Brooklyn. Easy to walk to Soho too. 
All in all I didn’t want to leave!!

title: Great stay at the ludlow
text: We just stayed at the ludlow and it was absolutely perfect. From the greeting at arrival, to the friendliness of the entire staff, everyone that works here seems to be generally happy. At least that’s what it feels like. Even the maintenance people were friendly and would say hello. The lobby bar was a great place to meet up for drinks before we went out and also when we got back from dinner. Plenty of seating and very comfortable. The vibe was cool. The rooms were clean and the we had no issues. Location is good if you like east village. Literally next door to Katz’s Deli. It also has a nice rooftop area to hang out and the gym is also on the roof. We would definitely recommend staying at the ludlow. I didn’t take pictures inside the hotel but did take one from the roof. Nice views from up there.

title: Wonderful
text: We loved our stay at the Ludlow hotel, it’s a charming place with a great atmosphere and the staff was absolutely perfect. I haven’t had such great customer service in a long time. Great location with lots of choices for restaurants.

title: Lovely hotel, lovely staff!
text: I had amazing 3 night stay at the Ludlow Hotel for my 40th Birthday! The staff were all welcoming and genuinely friendly and helpful. We stayed in a Loft Queen and the room was stylish and very comfortable - best part was likely the amazing bathtub with city views! We also enjoyed having a drink on the beautiful garden patio which had AC!! A very welcome thing in mid-July :) The location was great - very walkable and lots of amazing restaurants nearby.  I look forward to coming back sometime!

title: Wonderful!
text: Loved the style of the hotel and the room decor.  The beds were great; had a balcony that offered great views of the city too!  The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially Chloe and Kin at the Front Desk.  Can’t wait to come back and visit!

title: My new favorite hotel
text: I cannot say amazing things about the Ludlow Hotel and the staff that works there! Everyone was so kind, patient, and willing to help. Our room and the common areas were always so clean. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Perfect place to stay
text: I stayed in June of 2022.  It was a wonderful experience, great rooms, great location and fantastic caring, diligent staff. Would highly recommend and would defo be my go to hotel for New York and can't wait to stay again.

title: What a great Hotel
text: We have been in New York since 1975 fifty times and visit t the Ludlow the 3th time.A great hotel, very personal, cozy, and vibrant. Perfect service, cozy rooms with every comfort. And the area just keeps getting better, lower east side, Elisabeth Str., La Fayette and and and.This is the place to be.

title: King Suite
text: The Ludlow is beautiful, quiet and comfortable. It feels upscale without the snobbery. The room is good size, well appointed. The restaurant Dirty French was really great - particularly the service from the sommelier and the extensive wine list. We can't wait to return.

title: Every detail was perfect and super cool!
text: We recently stayed at the Ludlow hotel in NYC and we cannot say enough good things about this place! The vibe was ridiculously cool. Every detail from when you enter to every corner of our skybox room was unique and well thought out. The staff inviting and genuinely happy to see us. We received excellent recommendations and our every need was met to 100% satisfaction. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC and we cannot wait to go back! Thank you for a top notch experience!

title: My favorite hotel in the city
text: The Ludlow is my favorite hotel in NYC. Every time I'm there I feel like I'm returning home! The staff is so friendly, the building and rooms are beautiful and the views from the rooftop are unbeatable!

title: Loft King with Terrace was worth it!
text: We had a lovely stay at The Ludlow in the Loft King Terrace view. The room was a bit of a splurge for us but completely worth it. The views of the city were incredible. The room itself had lovely furnishings, a nice sitting area for four, comfortable bed, stylish bathroom and great shower! Room service had great food and was prompt. The service and staff were all around great! The frozen aperol spritzes at the hotel bar was the cherry on top. My only negative feedback is that there are two elevators that service the building so the wait to get to and from your room was a little longer than we are used to but there’s not much the hotel can do about that. We were visiting family on the lower east side and the location worked well for us. Highly recommend if you are looking to stay in the area!

title: Stylish Excellence
text: The Ludlow hits the perfect balance of city chic without leaving anyone behind. Comfortable beds and pillows, great bathroom with very good water pressure, lighting could be brighter for the older set but they did include a magnifying mirror in the bathroom and services from housekeeping, restaurant and colourful lobby bar all made high marks with me. Location and street put you right in the center of the action of this inspiring city. Thanks for a great week!

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text: We visit New York often and always stay at the Ludlow.  The hotel is lovely. The location is wonderful. But most of all, the staff is fantastic. They are always gracious, helpful and accommodating. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent Hotel for a Girls Weekend: Great Service, Ambience & Location
text: Ludlow Hotel is the destination of choice for my girls' weekend getaways. We've stayed here at least four times and each time it gets better. Our most recent trip is no exception: every interaction we had with the staff was friendly, courteous and upbeat: from the doorman to the cleaning woman we met in the elevator to the helpful front desk team to the bartender.  Guest rooms are comfortable, with quality and thoughtful detail throughout.  The lounge area and indoor patio are wonderful places to have drinks, as is Dirty French.  I can't say enough good things about this hotel and the location can't be beat.  You will not be disappointed!

title: Perfect location to tour NYC
text:
Great service and a perfect location!
We love sitting in the atrium and the food was excellent.
It feels like you’re a member of a family and it is not antiseptic like a big chain hotel. 
Front desk personnel were especially helpful and friendly.

title: Great weekend in NYC!
text: Great room with wonderful staff! Loved the lobby with a very nice bar and common area. Food and drinks were fantastic.  The view from the room could not be beat. Workout facility was perfect too. Thank you to the staff who all made our stay so accommodating!

title: Fabulous LES Hotel
text: The Ludlow is a beautiful hotel and in a great location if you're looking to experience a much more "neighbourhoody" vibe in NYC.  The interior of the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are really well appointed and with a surprisingly spacious bathroom for an NYC hotel!! We had both breakfast and dinner in Dirty French and it was delicious! Breakfast was a particular treat as it was a lot less sweet than typical breakfasts I've had in the US which is much more my taste. The Duck special for dinner was BEAUTIFUL. There are a lot of really nice bars and restaurants close by and of course, you HAVE to get a sandwich from Katz Deli if you get a chance. If you're going to be spending a lot of time up close to Times Square etc., I'd get comfortable on the Subway as relying on Ubers is super expensive or the Open Top Bus tours take a long time to get from here back up as they go through the Financial District and can take forever!

title: Perfect in every way for me
text:
I loved my studio room. It was small but had everything I needed. The bed was very comfortable, the ambiance was old New York and the bathtub was deep and cozy. I slept well. While the room was near the elevators I never heard a thing, not even the cleaning personnel in the mornings. 
The staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone from the servers in the lounge, to the front desk employees to the room service server. An important perk when you travel alone. The front desk even helped my put on my necklace when my nails got in the way. I felt at home. 
I had room service every morning. It was fast, good and reasonably priced for New York city. The back lounge was only for hotel guests and a wonderful repose before or after a long day in the city.  I will return for all my NY stays.

title: Balthazar restaurant
text: Balthazar Restaurant is a perfect reminder of a French restaurant from years ago. The service is wonderful, the food is delicious, and the ambience cannot be improved upon. Every time we make a trip to Manhattan we always visit this restaurant.

title: Another Amazing Ludlow Experience
text: We stayed another 5 nights at our go to hotel in the LES. The entire Ludlow staff went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional. We would especially like to call out and thank Karen at the front desk for taking care of us and managing to get us the right room every night of our stay despite the hotel being fully booked. We cannot wait to come back again next week for another amazing getaway at the Ludlow. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at!
text:
Me and my now wife stayed at the Ludlow Hotel in June as we were getting married in Central Park. We chose the Skybox Loft and we were certainly not disappointed. 

The room was amazing with stunning views of Lower Manhattan, the bathroom was out of this world. I can not think of any hotel in the world with a view from the bath tub like this. 

The bed was large and very comfortable. 

The staff made our wedding day so special giving us numerous bottles of champagne during our stay. 

The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the 2nd Ave Subway with a CVS round the corner plus you are on the same street as Katz. 

We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will be returning next year.

title: Loved The Ludlow
text: This was a really great hotel experience all around. Staff was professional and friendly from check in to wait staff to room attendants. Ou room was exactly as described. We had lunch on the back atrium, food was delicious. We also had drinks at their bar/restaurant Dirty French which was great too. It was my birthday the day we checked in and a bottle of wine was sent to our room to wish me a hbd. Nice, thoughtful touch. I would stay here every weekend if I could!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I have stayed at the Ludlow a few times now and it never disappoints me:). The staff is so welcoming and accommodating, rooms are lovely and we explored the roof top this time and it is Incredible!  Great hotel, great location and great service.

title: Lower East Side Home
text: A true beauty. Helpful and easy going staff. Treat yourself to a Skybox Suite. Fantastic area close to interesting restaurants and activities. Feels like you are actually living in NYC and not just visiting.  Amazing lobby to drink coffee or a cocktail and snacks later in the night.

title: Couldn't have asked for more
text:
We stayed in a Queen Loft room in May / June for 1 week.  The room was beautiful and full of natural light which isn't common in hotels, it had a amazing view over to Brooklyn. We were on floor 19 so it was also relatively quite for central NYC. 

The room had everything we needed, my only comment would be the storage space was a little light for 2 people for a week, but it wasn't a problem and we made it work.

Shower and bath were incredible, fabulous light filled bathroom.

The public spaces were a highlight.  We'd often grad a bagel for breakfast and eat it in the courtyard with a coffee from the restaurant.  It was also a great space to end the night with drinks with friends before going to bed.

The gym was also fantastic, on the small side, but very well equipped with amazing 180 views.  There was always enough space, even if you had to go out on the roof terrance with a mat and weights.

Service was always fantastic and friendly.

The location is great, in the heart of the LES, a short walk to Katz so you can get in early and avoid the lines.  There are SO many great restaurants and street food places in the immediate area we were really spoiled for choice. It's super vibrant in the evenings too which is fun.

I would 100% return and recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great hotel, fantastic staff.
text:
I’ve stayed at The Ludlow a few times and it’s consistently a great place when in NYC. Fantastic location and the teams there are exceptional. I love the views and room design and always have great cocktails in the lobby. 

No complaints other than having to leave. Can’t wait to return soon!

title: Beautiful Hotel in Lower East Side!
text: We had a great stay at The Ludlow! The property is beautiful and stylish.  The staff was welcoming and incredibly helpful.  And the location was perfect.  It was my first trip to NYC and didn't want to leave the neighborhood, filled with great shops, restaurants, bars, and bakeries.  I would highly recommend for anyone visiting NYC! Can't wait to come back!

title: Wonderful stay.
text:
Nicely curated boutique hotel that deserves 5 stars simply because of the wonderful staff that works there (thank you Austin for making us feel at home).
Loved the restaurant, bar and amenities (specially the gym which is nicely equipped and has a GREAT view from the 20th floor).
It was a wonderful stay overall, will definitely be back.
- Gerardo Echeverria

title: Loud Music and Partying across the street at the Indigo made sleeping impossible!
text:
The Ludlow is a beautiful hotel.  Service was excellent.  Quality of food and cocktails was great.  We stayed in room 1502 from 5/26-5/31.  It is a loft/king bed with a terrace that faces west.  

Unfortunately the Indigo Hotel directly across the street faces east and it has a "party" room with inside/outside spaces.  Friday, Saturday, and Sunday night starting around 7pm to after 2am parties with the loudest music, screaming guests, etc.. never stopped.  We were unable to sit out on the terrace and watch the sunset because the base was so deep our chests were pounding; the music was so loud we could not hear each other across our table.  Also; sleeping was impossible as the noise (music and screaming) did not stop until well after 2am.  For an $891.50 per night room this was unacceptable.  The front desk could do nothing, and I went across the street asking for the manager of the Indigo to have the music turned down to no avail.  I took an otherwise 5 star experience to average or less.  I would never recommend this Hotel, much less stay here again.  Very disappointing.

title: Can't Wait to Go Back!  Best Location!
text: This was my first time staying at the Ludlow, and it is now my go-to NYC hotel!  I cannot imagine a cooler, more beautiful hotel in a better location.  I walked everywhere while I was there, and the customer service was truly spectacular.  I lived in New York ages ago, and this hotel made me feel like I was back experiencing the city as a local.  If you are able to, splurge on a room with a tub - it was amazing!  Such nice people as well!  Thank you to the Ludlow for such a fantastic and memorable stay!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Every aspect of this beautiful little hotel is a complete success. The staff are delightful, friendly and helpful. The rooms are small (it's New York!) but highly designed to maximise space with a large shower, enough closet  space to hang clothing for a week stay and plenty of coat hooks in the entrance hall for coats and scarves etc. The beds are deliciously comfortable with high quality linen. My room had a lovely view of the city too. And most importantly, the rooms are spotlessly clean. I spent my afternoons (when I needed to work) down in the gorgeous lobby lounge by the fire in the really warm and lively atmosphere, drinking coffee and working on my laptop, or drinking cocktails with friends, . The location is excellent being walking distance to everywhere I wanted to go...or an easy cab ride. We loved our Ludlow experience !! Highly recommended!!!

title: The Ludlow Experience
text:
Every detail from the minute you walked in door caught your eye.The design,accents and soft lighting.
Friendly staff to greet you,assist with your luggage and getting you settled in your room.
The lounge and bar areas  were abuzz with a lively atmosphere,a lit cozy fireplace nook and good servers who were attentive.
We also had dinner at the Dirty French restaurant in the hotel.
Once again, great service and a delicious dinner!
You must try the beignets with warm caramel dipping sauce and espresso to finish!!
Be sure and checkout the rooftop with a cocktail in hand and behold a spectacular panoramic view of NYC.
Amazing‼️
Loved our whole experience at the Ludlow.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: This was my first time at the Ludlow and I had the best stay. The staff goes above and beyond and is so king and helpful. The rooms are beautiful - best shower I've ever been in and great location. Will only stay here for future stays in NYC!

title: Sky loft with incredible views
text: We had the best time at the Ludlow Hotel. The sky loft is on the sixth floor and has great views of the city and is quiet. The staff are wonderful, the hotel is very clean, the tub is glorious, and the restaurant is delicious. We’ve already booked our next stay.

title: We was so glad to stay again after this 2 years and stay and feel joy and safe again
text: It’s an incredible experience, the excellent service and ubicación in lower east side one of the most diverse and inclusive, inspiring places in NY, we enjoy iconic places to eat and have fun again, they offer and excellent place to work, have fun and be in touch again with are love ones

title: Excellent customer service, beautiful hotel
text: We previously stayed in this hotel while visiting my son at NYU and I loved it. For his graduation, we returned with my daughter. Our flight from Atlanta was delayed four times then cancelled - we had no choice but to drive due to multiple circumstances. This meant we missed our first night at the hotel. We had called several times to stay in touch with the hotel, and they were so helpful each time. When I returned home, they did not even charge us for the first night when we weren't there. As a business owner myself, I never expected them to do this for us, nor did we ask. I called the manager Kin today and he was so kind and generous. As a side note, our room was set up as we asked (needed the daybed option) and was the perfect space for us as parents and our young adult daughter - we all had separate space. I *love* the Ludlow. Will definitely be back!

title: Over priced for what it is
text:
Stayed here last week in a terrace view room.
Staff were great and rooms ok albeit a bit small.
Paid for a terrace room but terrace overgrown and covered in old cigarette butts. Dont know if they had'nt been cleaned up from previous guest or whether they had been dropped out of one of the rooms above us.
Front desk also put a hold for over $2000 on my card at check in and then charged me again at checkout for our actual spend. 8 days later im still trying to get the first $2k released back to my account. 
Would we stay here again? Its a nice hotel in a good location but overpriced for the terrace room so probably not and issue with hold on my card left bitter taste.

title: Great hotel on Lower East Side
text: This was our second visit to the Ludlow, and it was terrific again. Nice room, on the small side but what we expect in a city hotel. Bathroom was very clean and nice toiletries. Great lounge area and friendly staff. Lots of fun restaurants nearby.

title: In love with The Ludlow.
text: I stay here whenever I travel to NYC. This is such a perfect New York hotel. Feels boutique, but has all the needed amenities. Staff is considerate, helpful and they have the right amount of presence. They were always providing little extra touches: Putting a package in my room when I was out at a conference; sending candies up to welcome me to the hotel; and placing extra toiletries in the bath when housekeeping serviced the room. The Ludlow is well located so you can walk to all kinds of perfect spots. Lively neighborhood, but rooms are soundproofed. Very small gym, but it's on the roof so it's light and bright--a great way to work out at the beginning of the day. I cannot say enough about this special spot. Love, love, love.

title: The Best of NYC!
text: The Ludlow is truly the best hotel I've stayed in during trips to NYC. It's in a great neighborhood with easy access to the subway, airports, and countless bars & restaurants. The staff is kind and accommodating. The rooms are so incredibly spacious for NYC and have endless thoughtful touches. Comfortable beds, beautiful linens, and great room service. Truly cannot recommend The Ludlow enough!

title: The BEST hotel service team  in NYC
text:
I have been staying at this hotel since I moved away from NYC a few years ago.  There are so many reasons to love this property not the least of which are the service and hospitality. From the front door and front desk team to the restaurant staff and housekeepers - everyone goes above and beyond to take care of everything that I need.  

I typically stay for a combination of business and pleasure and the couches by the fireplace are perfect for both types of meetings. The food at Dirty French is always delicious. And those rooms with the outdoor terraces OMG. Incredible.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: This charming hotel, was very clean, staff was excelant always happy to help. Rooms, linens where soft and bed super comfty. could of used a few more pillows...but didnt ask for them. Everyonewas very friendly and willing to help.

title: Springtime in NY
text: Loved my stay at the Ludlow.  Comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom fixtures, cool vibe in the lobby, close to cool shops and the Essex Market.  The perfect pastrami sandwich across the street at Katz's deli.  What more could you ask for?

title: Ludlow! One of my all time Favorite Hotels!!
text: From the lobby and wonderful reception to the welcoming living room with a warm fireplace and beautiful bar-to the beautiful quiet room with beautiful linens and a most comfortable bed, The Ludlow far surpassed my expectations! The deep soaking bath tub and beautiful bathroom were spa like! I love the Ludlow, great location, amazing staff , a perfect stay!! Thank you!!!!

title: Wonderful staycation in plush setting
text: From the moment we arrived, I knew I'd made the right choice for our anniversary staycation. The desk staff was friendly and greeted us warmly. We splurged on the skyloft box suite and were delighted to find it as picturesque as we anticipated. The sunlight and fresh breeze, both from the windows which actually opened and the lovely balcony, brought a bit of the lovely spring day into the suite. And the soaking tub! I may not be exaggerating when I say we spent hours enjoying it. There was also a very well-stocked minibar area (reasonably priced even) which came in handy when we'd the late night munchies. Add to this the excellent customer service (buckets of ice and extra coffee were promptly delivered with a smile and a small mix-up with room service remedied with apology) and we would definitely highly recommend! I'll note that the lounge area downstairs looked inviting, too, and Dirty French (the connected restaurant) is always fun and delish. All around 5 stars.

title: Perfect getaway
text: Thanks to Karen she provided an exceptional service with a beautiful room with an awesome view, my girlfriend and I got to enjoy our trip thanks to Karen!!! Looking to book again! On our next get away!

title: The Ludlow Hotel, NYC
text:
I have stayed at The Ludlow Hotel many times. Without exception, each stay was a wonderful experience. 

The Ludlow staff are gracious and helpful, the rooms and amenities are splendid, the in-hotel restaurant—Dirty French—provides some of the best food and service I've ever had, and the overall atmosphere is nothing short of rejuvenating.

title: Another Lovely Stay at My Favorite NYC Hotel
text: I just completed yet another extended stay at The Ludlow, hands down my favorite NYC hotel. As always, my stay was enhanced by the extraordinary competence and kindness of the members of the front of the house staff. And my room was again spotlessly maintained.

title: Nice stay on the Lower East Side
text: Nice boutique hotel. Only stayed one night, but would stay here again.  The room size is typical for NYC, but has all you need (some storage, nice shower, decent AC, not too noisy, etc.).  Staff were friendly and helpful.  For someone who wears their mask often, there wasn't a lot of mask wearing by staff.  The hotel lobby and common areas were not overly crowded, so I didn't feel too uncomfortable.  Outside the hotel, you have all you need (shops, restaurants, etc.).   By the way, room service make a killer breakfast.

title: Best place to stay in NYC!
text: Not only is the hotel beautiful, the rooms cozy, amazing decoration, bathrooms, guest areas, but the staff! The staff made my stay worth every penny, I felt welcome since I walked in until I walked out. They were extremely kind and attentive, I felt very comfortable and at home. Will definitely try staying here every visit to the city!

title: A perfect stay!
text: Honestly, our stay was perfect. We spent 4 nights in a Queen Loft room, and it was a dream. Comfy bed, immaculately clean, very quiet, gorgeous bathroom (the tub is to die for). The neighborhood is amazing - very walkable. Also easy to get a cab on Houston as well. I'm a native New Yorker who now lives in LA and the Ludlow will be my new NYC home base from here on in. Make sure to grab dinner at Dirty French too - delish and fantastic service. Thanks, Ludlow Hotel - see you soon!

title: Cozy, Chic and Went the Extra Mile
text: Coming from Brooklyn to celebrate a buddy's birthday in style. Staff went the extra mile for us helping to facilitate surprise amenities and set up gifts upon arrival. We will be back many, many more times. Special shout out to Jack and Cynthia at the front desk for being so accommodating.

title: Lower East Side Gem
text:
Loved staying at The Ludlow. Great neighbourhood, great people, great vibe!
Everyone was super friendly and helpful! The bar downstairs is a great spot to unwind after a busy day in New York!
P.S.: Be sure to ask for a room with a tub!

title: Top as always!
text: We love Ludlow hotel: great location (try the next door pastrami!), friendly and helpful team, comfortable rooms, amazing breakfast, reasonable price level. Not our first stay and definitely not the last.

title: Very nice hotel
text: We stayed at The Ludlow for 3 nights with our teenage daughter. We had the king/queen combo room and it was perfect for our group. Very friendly staff and great food at the restaurant Dirty French. Location is also great, very lively and subway not far away.

title: Exceptional Hospitality
text: I stood here to celebrate my engagement with my fiance. I figured it would be nice for a staycation and The Ludlow did not disappoint! Omar and Jolyn were amazing every step of the way. They helped me with everything that would make our experience unforgettable including reservations at the Dirty French, and near by bar recommendations. When we arrived, we received a complimentary upgrade because of the occasion. The room had champagne, cupcakes, and flowers which all brought my fiance to tears of joy. We also received excellent customer service from Johnny, who helped us with our luggage and saved our night outfits by finding us lint rollers haha. We can't wait to come back here!

title: The Best Hotel in NYC
text: My first stay at the Ludlow was in a Studio Queen with a Terrace. Small room, but gorgeous outside terrace that isn't available unless you are in a very expensive mid or uptown hotel. Over the years I've stayed in the Skybox Loft (amazing), and the Studio King (unexpectedly roomy). I just can't recommend it enough. So pretty and cozy.

title: Absolutely EXCEPTIONAL👌🏼
text:
I don’t think I would rather to stay anywhere else but the Ludlow hotel NYC. I planned on only staying for 2 nights then 3 then kept extending till I absolutely had to.. total a week stay! Service here is phenomenal!
Omar-his charismatic attitude really went above and beyond to make me feel like a vip guest. 
Austin and Karen and Joe!!! at the front… just made me feel so welcome and can’t say enough about my stay here. And lastly but not least Christian the concierge I can not express enough about his welcoming friendly vibe and his attention to detail with his recommendations was spot on every single time! Exceeded my expectations. I absolutely love the 24 hour gym clean with an impeccable view!! I did not want to leave my Queen tub room with a view!
Everything I needed was a few blocks away: Wholefoods, Marshall’s, superare, laundry service, 24 hour bodega, cvs, amazing food, pop up vintage shops..
I will be back sooner than later!! 
Highly RECOMMENDED!!  🙌🏼

title: Excellent
text:
I have stayed at the Ludlow for two weeks for work. Excellent stay, Nancy at the front desk has been amazing and super helpful throughout my stay. Everything was up and running (not many hotels in nyc are lively after the pandemic).
Room was very clean, quiet and with a stunning view. 

I will definitely stay again when in nyc.

title: BEST LUXURY STAY EVER!
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Ludlow! I came to celebrate my friend's birthday and to relax too because I am a tired student midwife and nurse. I stayed in a studio mini on the 13th floor, and the view was great! I woke up to the most beautiful sunrise. The entire room was beautiful, the bed was sooo comfortable and the bathroom was GORGEOUS. I got the rain shower and tub combo (highly recommend you request this when booking!) and omg....I had the most relaxing bath! I ordered room service for breakfast from Dirty French, and the pancakes were absolutely DELICIOUS. I had dinner there and it was great too! Service was amazing and my food and mocktail were so good. Check in and check out were also SEAMLESS. There is also a Marshall's and CVS about a minute walk from the hotel in case you need to grab quick needs for your stay! 

What made my stay even more amazing was that Karen C. and Omar from concierge helped me surprise my friend for her birthday, who was also staying there in another room. They were AMAZING. They made a plan and called her to come to the lobby so I could decorate her room, and they surprised her with champagne FOR THE SECOND TIME since she arrived! When I was done decorating her room, I called them to send her back up and she was so surprised! It was so fun and pleasant to work with them and they went above and beyond; it felt like they were friends with my friend and trying to surprise her too lol! I am so grateful for them and couldn't thank them enough. They also roped in other staff members to help as well and it was just the absolute best. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

I highly, HIGHLY recommend The Ludlow for a staycation, birthday, anything! Treat yourself to a luxury stay here and you won't regret it!

title: If you’re trying to decide, BOOK WITH THE LUDLOW!!
text:
From the location, to the restaurant, the rooms, and the attentive staff, AMAZING and UNMATCHED. 

ABOUT ME
I’m a healthcare worker and student and I usually travel
to a Caribbean island for my birthday. This year due to COVID, staffing shortages, and school I couldn’t take much time off. But I’m exhausted and very much needed time to myself. I live in Connecticut and I chose to celebrate my 31st birthday in NYC at the Ludlow due to the beautiful soaking tubs, rain shower, and amazing views. 

RESERVATIONS 
The amazing experience began when I placed my reservation over the phone. The staff member provided great details about each room, square footage, and dining options. She also asked if I was celebrating anything and I said “my birthday”. She said she’d make a note of it in the system, ensure I get a room with a tub and rain shower, and ensure I’m on a high floor with a spectacular city view.  

CHECK-IN
Two weeks later when I arrive, the front desk associate greets me and after verifying my ID she says “Happy Birthday!” She then provides me with a complimentary breakfast voucher for my birthday and gives me to key to room 1701. The room on the 17th floor has a beautiful view of the city and the bathroom is incredibly luxurious and better in person. I’m so happy when I arrived and could not wait to bathe and rest. 15 minutes later when I’m settling in I get a knock on the door and it’s a delivery of a complimentary bottle of champagne. The associate tells me happy birthday and he hopes I enjoy my stay. I call the concierge to thank them for the gift. 

STAFF
 During my stay I 100% felt like I was at a resort due to the attentiveness of the staff. Every time I would pass the front desk they would say happy birthday, ask how my day is going, and ask if there’s anything I need. I asked for ice and it was delivered within 5 minutes. I also forgot to pack a few items, the staff member walked with me outside and pointed me into the direction of a CVS and Marshall’s - both which are only 2 minutes away from the hotel. Omar and Caren are absolutely an asset to the Ludlow and made my experience unforgettable. They helped my friends surprise me with balloons, a cake display, and more champagne for my birthday. They went above and beyond and asked me to come downstairs for a complimentary surprise which was a Ludlow mug, candle, boxes of water, another bottle of champagne, and champagne flutes. This was a diversion while my friends brought the balloons, cake, and decorations in my room. I return to my room surprised.  Amazing!! Unforgettable experience. 10 minutes after the surprise Omar delivers an edible arrangements package to my door as it was delivered to the hotel from my sister. Amazing service!!!

DIRTY FRENCH
I also ate the the restaurant, Dirty French, for dinner one night and the food was incredibly savory! The host greeted us warmly and promptly seated us and Jan was our waitress. She was funny, attentive, and provided great recommendations for drinks and food selections after asking our preferences.  

If you’re thinking of staying at the Ludlow. Book it! My stay was all that I imagined it would be and more! The rooms are so cozy and luxurious. The staff is attentive. The restaurant is delicious. The hotel is so well located - I headed to soho for some shopping and it was a 10 minute Uber ride and I went to Fandi Mata in Brooklyn for my birthday dinner and it was a 15 minute Uber ride. Do your mind, body, and soul a favor and rest and reset at the Ludlow Hotel!

title: A special kind of place!
text:
From the beginning to the end of our stay, the staff was attentive, kind, and extremely helpful. We arrived with 7 pieces of luggage (for ourndaughter’s move across the country) and quickly realized the room we booked wouldn’t accommodate us. It was 1:00am. Jacky was AMAZING! He quickly got us settled into an appropriate sized room for our 7 day stay. 
We are booked for our March stay with the Ludlow and now consider this our home away from home.

title: Most Aesthetic and BEST Service!
text: Oh boy, the list of wonderful things to say about The Ludlow goes on and ON! I took the red eye from the west coast and waltzed in at 6:30AM and Jason & the night crew got me a room to check into and unwind. After so many trips into the city, this was the very first time this was even offered and it was just the precursor of such exceptional service to come. I had wanted a room on a top floor for a view, and Jason helped me check in and find one a couple nights into my stay - arranging a midnight move at 2am to the most gorgeous sweeping views of the city. Comfortable bed, amazing ambience, warm atmosphere, and four baths in the soaking tub of my dreams later - I cannot suggest this spot more.  Thank you for the most amazing stay, I can't wait to come back and book a skybox!

title: The perfect romantic getaway
text: Absolutely stunning hotel. The staff was amazing, especially the front desk and the doormen, and even the room service . Everyone greeted us upon arrival. Check in was seamless and everyone was willing to help. Our bellhop Ray went above and beyond. He was so informative gave us great suggestions on where to go for the evening, he was so approachable and made us feel like family. We were there to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and even received champagne upon arrival!! Our room was perfect. It was clean and had an amazing view. Even though we were only there for one night, we will always remember how amazing it was. We will definitely be coming back the next time we get some free time and hope that we are able to stay longer.

title: Incredible Hospitality for Birthday Staycation
text: We booked The Ludlow for a weekend "staycation" to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, and it was the most perfect, special, romantic stay we could have hoped for! The Loft Queen Deluxe we stayed in was gorgeous, with an incredible view of Lower Manhattan and a balcony to stare at it from. The bathrooms are immaculately clean and so well designed (especially the clawfoot tub), and the bed felt more comfortable than my own mattress at home. Special shout out and thank you to Nickeesa, who I coordinated with to surprise my boyfriend with a bottle of champagne upon arrival, and who took care of all of our needs during our stay.  The hospitality from all the staff at the Ludlow was really warm and welcoming, and it made for a really special weekend. Thank you!

title: Elopement Knockout
text: My (now) husband and I stayed at the Ludlow for our elopement in mid January. The staff were kind & helpful, the skybox loft was perfection, and the lobby bar was a great spot to enjoy coffee or and old fashioned. The Ludlow Hotel was an wonderful complement to a big milestone for us and we look forward to celebrating anniversaries there for years to come.

title: Amazing experience
text: My partner and I came across The Ludlow Hotel on a “best of” list and after the trip advisor reviews we were sold! We loved our stay, the service was absolutely top shelf. Comfortable beds, stunning views, and a gorgeous atmosphere. We stayed in a king suite and had a friend staying in the two bedroom. In the king suite we woke up to city views including the Brooklyn bridge every morning. I found it to be more than enough space for the city. I highly recommended to anyone looking in this price range on the Lower East Side. The quality and service were absolutely worth the money! We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be back!

title: Cool vibes, outstanding service
text: I recently stayed at The Ludlow Hotel for a quick birthday trip. A friend recommended the hotel and it exceeded my expectations in every way possible. The room was perfect, with luxurious linens and tasteful decor. The bathtub was indulgent. The location is so cool. But the service was the cherry on the sundae! I hope you’re lucky enough to have Omar working while you’re there. He epitomized wonderful service. When I was headed to meet friends and realized I had forgotten a face mask, he insisted on finding me one that matched my outfit (I was in all black). As he said, “it’s a vibe.” Thanks Omar!

title: Stylish and cozy perch
text: Great location, sweet views. My room's terrace gave me some fresh air, but it wasn't private from other rooms. My room was small, but the bed was big and comfortable Loved the bathroom, especially the rainwater shower head and tile work. Plush towels and robe, upscale toiletries.  A stylish perch for a few days while in the city for work.

title: Chic hotel
text: it is a beautiful  hotel with very clean, chic and inviting  rooms, & cozy lobby bar. the staff was very friendly. it is waking distance to Chinatown ,Tenement Museum and little Italy.   I had great time there

title: beautifully decorated hotel
text: one of the most beautifully decorated hotels I've ever been to. Really unique classic hotel vibe (reminds me of The Grand Budapest Hotel movie). Rooms were clean and well kept. All the staff I encountered were friendly and attentive. Highly recommend.

title: Inte värt pengarna
text: Otrevlig personal när vi kom. Fick ingen beskrivning av hotellets faciliteter. Extremt små rum som inte stämde överens med beskrivningen. Fanns ingen plats att förvara resväskor eller packa upp kläder på. Dålig standard i badrum, kalla golv, trasiga lampor och ingen handdukstork.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
From check in onwards this hotel ticked all the boxes - as a single elderly lady who frequents NY regularly to visit my son I found this hotel exceptional- the staff at all levels were so friendly and helpful- the bedroom was a good size with plenty of drawer space etc - the bathroom was a good size and very well lit - the main lounge was very comfortable- coffee and pastries r available early morning as restaurant was closed for breakfast but I think u can order room service - it take about 15minutes to walk
To shops at Broadway 
Will certainly recommend and will stay again

title: Beautiful room, great location, mixed bag with customer service but the bell people are great!
text: The Skybox Loft is stunning. Upon check in, the other guest next to me (that arrived right after I did) had a much lovelier and welcoming greeting - she was asked if she had ever been to the hotel before, welcomed, I was just given the key and asked for ID (she was white, I am not - definitely unintentional bias, I’m used to that but doesn’t make it o), the front desk staff is helpful but don’t go above and beyond. The bellmen there are fantastic though! I wish they had a system for tipping them with no cash, Venmo chart maybe? There was no room service the last night I stayed, I was told I could order delivery 😒. The hotel was festive and the room is lovely, the only reason I rate it a 3 instead of a 4 is cost, given the price point ($1K+ for 2 nights) you would expect a certain level of service. Asking for assistance on something or a question sometimes felt like you were asking the hotel for a favor or bothering them. Some at the front desk are definitely more accommodating and friendlier than others. I think they assumed I was a tourist, I don’t live in NYC anymore (as of last year) but I did for a decade. It was a pleasant enough stay, and I know it’s NYC so you have to temper expectations, it just didn’t feel particularly welcoming.

title: My Girlfriend’s Birthday Ruined
text:
I booked the Skybox Loft for my Creative Blogger girlfriend for her Birthday - Sunday, Dec 122021. I had several intentions when booking this room…the first…it was romantic. Second, it would provide great content for her social media platform and, finally, it was a hell of a view for her to wake up to on her birthday. 

The reality of that experience was taken away from us as soon as we walked into the Ludlow Hotel. We arrived at the hotel at approx 4pm, having checked in online about 1 hour before arriving. As soon as we walk to the counter, we’re told the room isn’t ready, but will be in a few moments. The manager at the desk hastily runs off as if he’s going to take care of the situation. 

Mistakes happen, we understand…so we say we’re willing to wait. However, I did ask myself, how could your #1 premier room not be ready 4 hours after checkout and when I also checked in online prior to arrival. 

While waiting, we’re offered a room on the 10th flr. I reject it, and say I booked the Skybox Loft and expect that room. 

About 25 minutes goes by as we wait. The manager goes back and forth from the front desk and then says “I have a few boxes to remove from the room and we’ll escort you up to your room” momentarily. We say ok. Then 2 minutes later the desk clerk comes to say “your room on the 10th flr is ready”. We’re in total shock. He then proceeds to say that the room I booked “isn't technically guaranteed”. 

Instead of making a scene and engaging in the glaring mediocrity, I immediately asked for a refund. Management/ Staff didn’t seem really apologetic that we were leaving.

While I’m upset for my girlfriend and I, imagine flying in to NY for vacation, and being told the room you booked isn’t “technically guaranteed” so you have to take something of lesser value with no concessions. If you fly in and on vacation, you don’t have much of a choice. I’m glad I did. 

As Black people, we understand that racism and classism exists in many forms so I’m sure if we were of a different race or different class, my experience would be completely different. 

Thankful that the Ink48, our usual hotel, had rooms available for the night. And my girlfriend’s birthday wasn’t ruined.

title: I didn't want to leave
text: Nice charming hotel in excellent location. My room was small but I was lucky enough to have a terrace and although it was a bit chilly I did enjoy it. The lobby sitting area is cozy and fun with a nice fireplace where you can have coffee or a bite. And bite you should I had a delicious dinner  at the bar in the adjoining Dirty French Restaurant, excellent. Every staff member I encountered was curteous and down to earth.  I didn't want to leave.

title: The Ludlow is a home away from home
text:
The property and location are fabulous, and the rooms and amenities are wonderful. But it's the staff that makes it feel like a home away from home. 

While you expect a high level of service from a property of this type, during our most recent stay, the bellmen on duty at 6am managed to organize our airport transport (during a fierce rainstorm and with an unexpected knee injury) and get us to the airport - mostly dry - and in time to make our flight. 

While it was the location and design aesthetic that originally brought the Ludlow to our attention, it's been the attention to detail and quality of personal service that brings us back year after year. It's unimaginable to think of staying anywhere else in NYC. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough!

title: Cute hotel in great location
text: I travel to NYC often but had not stayed here before.  It is so charming in a great location.  I had a room with a terrace and enjoyed sitting out there to take in the views.  The staff is so lovely and the drinks in the bar were great!  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Downtown NYC Gem! NY is back!!
text: I stayed here for work and it was a great and pleasant  stay! East quick check in and my room was roomier than most NYC hotel rooms. Loved waking up to pick up my pastry box in the morning.  Enjoyed my evening baths while relaxing and the products are luxurious and great! So much attention to details on everything  from the Margiela towels to luxurious comfortable bedding and amenities.  The private rooftop was truly incredible and such a great perk. Highly recommend.  This area is very fun and young and there’s So much to do! Highly recommend for those wanting to be in prime Downtown.

title: Great place
text: I went to NYC about a month ago to visit my brother.  I looked online and decided on Ludlow.  It turned out to be a great decision.  the staff was fantastic and the location was perfect.  I really look forward to going back.  There was a very small hiccup with my room key and they virtually tripped over themselves fixing it.  Be sure to check out the restaurant and the roof!  I will be back

title: Great views
text: Spent our 25th anniversary at The Ludlow. Very fun atmosphere, great location on the Lower East Side, wonderful views from the balcony.  Katz Deli is on the corner. There is a parking garage across the street which is very convenient. Loved this hotel!

title: Perfect hotel for a christmas break
text: We went on a couples break at xmas Dec 18 to New York, our friends stayed up near 40th while we went for the Lower East as we're into a more alternative lifestyle. The hotel is great, as it was xmas/winter it had a real homely feel in the reception and main hotel area, log fires burning, nice cocktails. Location is perfect if you want to be out in the more dive bar areas, we found some amazing bars, tip stay off Ludlow and move onto other streets where the drinks are cheaper. We walked from the hotel down through Little Italy, down to Battery park then back up through China town to the hotel one day. Another day upto Union park, over to Chelsea, Soho, Greenwich. Loved it

title: Almost lives up to the hype!
text: I've wanted to stay at The Ludlow for a very long time and I was very happy with my two nights there. I stayed in the Studio Mini, which was perfect. The room is extremely cozy and I loved the decor. The bathroom is huge and the bathtub is amazing. Views from the bedroom and bathroom are wonderful. There were a few things that were a bit annoying though.  The rainshower was much too strong, to the point where it was uncomfortable and all of the water flooded the floor next to the tub. I asked the front desk to check it out, but nothing was changed when I returned later on. There were also a couple of noise issues during my stay, most of which were resolved and understandable as it is a hotel with people coming and going and moving around above you. Almost everyone at the front desk was friendly and helpful. I'd love to stay again.

title: Great location - Stunning views from the roof.
text: Perfectly located for a short stay in NYC. Good sized room for NYC with great views. Lots of good food and drink options within a short walk. Felt safe and clean in these covid times. Overall very happy with The Ludlow abs have already recommended to friends.

title: Overall great visit
text: My wife and I visited NYC for a week to visit our daughter who just moved to the east side of Manhattan. She recommended we stay in the lower east side, and voila, we chose the Ludlow. And we loved it. We had a terrace king with a great city view. We loved our room, with a wonderful bed, fancy bathroom, and plenty of workspace. The staff is very attentive and it’s hard to find a better front desk. On the weekend the bar is quite the happening spot, but the bartenders are still some of the best around. One night we hosted cocktails and hors d’ouvres from the bar on the roof, which is a fantastic spot to have fun. The neighborhood can be a noisy at night and weekends, but that comes with the territory in an area populated with young people and cool bars and restaurants. Thanks Ludlow!

title: Warm, Quirky, and Unpretentious
text:
The Lower East Side isn't for everybody but whether you're looking to party with Gen Z (oof) or seeking a respite from that scene, The Ludlow is an excellent pick for all. The interior decor is warm and quirky with a vintage charm, and the rooms (at least our Studio King) are efficiently laid out with ample seating space and plenty of personality. 

Service was excellent from the get-go, and we felt that they were taking every precaution necessary amid the pandemic.

Our only gripe was the lack of a view from our room. I recommend splurging for a higher floor and requesting a view!

title: Trendy and Clean!
text:
Staff was extremely nice, lobby was so inviting with great interior design, and the room was super clean. Would definitely recommend upgrading to a slightly bigger room as even the Loft King room was a little small (it is NYC). 
We stayed in the Loft King Room (Room 1211) and it was decorated so well, and also had a window in the shower as well as a small Juliette type balcony. Very cool views of LES and Soho.  
Only downside is mildly inconvenient proximity to the subway, about a 7 minute walk to the F and a 12 minute walk to the 6. Also the streets are a little noisy on a Friday night, even on a high floor.

title: Love the area
text: Great hotel. Multiple stays here and we never get tired of the area. People are nice. Rooms are great.  Bathrooms very clean and the shower is like standing under Niagara Falls. Great views of the city. Easy walk to cross the Williamsburg Bridge into Brooklyn.  Across the street from Katz’s Deli and down the block from Russ and Daughters. Need I say more.

title: Chic stay in a great location
