text: Romantic, stylish, cozy hotel in the middle of all of the fun. You can't beat the location if you value energy, creativity, wine and food and of course, shopping. We stayed in the Queen Terrace room and it was spectacular. The room (as mentioned in many reviews) is quite small. But the terrace makes up for it. We spent a lot of time out on the terrace, sipping coffee in the morning before hitting the streets or in the evening - taking in the stars. We will stay here again, most definitely but will probably upgrade to a King Terrace room. We found we were bumping into each other quite a bit (not always a bad thing.) Bathrooms are gorgeous - the brass faucets, rain shower and marble floors, divine. Great amenities too. No remote for the tv, but who watches tv in NYC? Hotel staff were so friendly and relaxed.

title: VIew overrated, but nice hotel.  High cost
text: i got a suite at the last floor because it was showing pics wit a  320 degrees view on Manhattan. Actually the view isn't that great. Hotel is clean, and employees are quick, diligents and priofessionals. Despit of this, the cost is very high (like 400 USD per night) and it's ridiclous considering this is an average hotel.

title: Welcome to Gatsby house
text: I immediately felt in love with this hotel. It has a style and a character. Perfect amenities and excellent service. Romantic and cozy place. It has boutique vibe. I have enjoyed the good size of the room and comfortable bed. Towels were fluffy and like new. I am the big fun of this area but the hotel made our staycaution perfect

title: Rustic Cozy Room with beautiful panoramic view
text:
Room we stayed in: LOFT(Skybox)1 Queen Bed

Front desk staff was very friendly. Check in was quick. On the way to the room we smelled a light fresh smell in the hallway. Over all the hotel is neat and clean. The room was nice and clean as expected, but unfortunately the windows were not!!! Considering the fact that appeal of this room is it’s panoramic windows with city view, my boyfriend and I were a bit disappointed that the windows were dirty. When it comes to room service this hotel did not disappoint. Every request was satisfied and was done in timely manner. Please see the photos attached. 

P.S: The Roses, champagne and strawberry set up in the tub was not provide by hotel!!! If you are interested in this please make sure to call them directly and see if they provide this service. Otherwise there’s a liquor store and whole foods within walking distance from hotel. 

I would also advise calling ahead of time to request the room on the highest floor possible for better view.

title: Great hotel in a great NYC neighborhood
text: We loved it. Family of four, got a Ludlow Double room, and had a great visit. HUGE room by NYC standards. Superb front desk service, wonderful bar / small plate venue,  top notch attention to design and detail. Definitely would visit again!

title: Just fabulous!!
text: Stayed here for 5 nights with my son and daughter in October 2019. It’s wonderful ambience hits you from the moment you step inside it’s doors. The staff are friendly and attentive making this a relaxing and comfortable stay, nothing is too much trouble. We booked the Ludlow double with its 2 rooms. The beds were really comfy, my daughter and I shared the king size which was so big it felt like you had the bed to yourself! Having the second room meant my son had his own space so it was just perfect. The space itself was very stylish with a luxurious bathroom and small sitting area. Our room overlooked the street at the front of the property giving us a view of the iconic Katz’s deli! There is a rooftop which has spectacular views of the city. Inside, the lobby bar and lounge provide a variety of cosy seating areas, whilst the trellis covered garden has a lovely light and airy feel to it. The location is great I’ve only stayed in midtown before but have to say the Lower East side has so much to offer. We found the subway the easiest way to get around. I could probably go on forever about this amazing Hotel I really can’t recommend it enough. The best thing you can do is to check it out for yourself you won’t be disappointed!

title: Better than soho house
text: Exactly the vibe that the lower east side needed.  Once you enter the doors you escape the madness and chaos of 23 year olds flirting with death as they flail wastedly through the streets.  Ludlow is a VIBE, the type of place you can post up all day that doesn't feel obnoxious/try too hard, the was soho does.

title: NY trip - The Ludlow Hotel, LES
text:
We stayed at The Ludlow for 5 nights with our teenage daughter in a Ludlow Double room. The room was amazing, 2 bedrooms with a fabulous bathroom in between both rooms.  The room amenities could not be faulted, it was very clean and we had everything we needed.  The furnishings and decorations all fitted in with the style of the building, we were wowed from the minute we walked through the door. The beds were comfortable, pillows a bit soft but we requested firmer ones which were immediately sent to our room. The staff were helpful and friendly. The location is perfect, lots of bars, restaurants for all tastes.  This is our third visit to NYC in 3 years and this is by far the nicest hotel we have stayed in and our favourite location. I would recommend this to all! 
I had read a few reviews saying there was not enough storage/cupboard/hanging space. We had no issues, all 3 of us brought far more clothes and shoes than we needed but we had room to unpack all our belongings with our cases fitting under the beds. 
We would definitely stay here again with no hesitation.

title: OK - but really that's about it...
text:
Native NY'er taking a staycation down on the LES - thought the Ludlow would be the place to be, and it was super cool, great neighborhood, friendly staff, etc, but overall - just an OK experience.  Room very nice and clean (and not a bad size), beautiful bathroom and shower and bath and a view to Ludlow St. out of our windows.  The bed was not the best - just not that comfortable.  We're in NYC - so expect things to be expensive (parking $55 for 24 hours, $20 cocktails in the bar) - but still - that has to be taken into consideration.  

Ate dinner @ Dirty French - was underwhelmed - service eh (tho the peeps were super nice) - very expensive (no surprise) - but the food was just OK.  4 of us spent $600 with tip - ok we drank and ate alot - but none of us would go back. 

Great time, excellent neighborhood - a lot of fun - but I'd try a different hotel next time. 

T'Man '20

title: Love the LES
text: I have stayed in 3-4 different hotels in the LES and, without a doubt, the Ludlow is the finest. I'm not big on the crowds in the lobby around happy hour and evenings, but early in the morning when you can get close to the fireplace with a cup of coffee, it's an intimate cozy space. I stayed in January once again, the most affordable and quietest time of the year. I love the mini studios with the big tubs, just right for one person or two in love. I had to wait a little bit to check into a room on a high floor, but it was well worth the wait. The customer service is flawless and friendly and the location perfect. Wish I could rent a room here year round.

title: Overly impressed, once again.
text:
I've lost count of the times I've stayed at The Ludlow. This trip was the first time I'd brought my Husband with me, and I wanted him to stay at my favourite hotels, to get an understanding of why I find my time in New York just so lovely. And The Ludlow didn't disappoint. 
I wasn't sure if he would be a fan of the overly detailed styling (being that he's a minimalist at heart) but he was obsessed with it. He was so impressed and loved everything about it.
I don't think I've ever had a bad word to say about any of my stays at The Ludlow. (I've got past reviews on here too). 
It's the most wonderful space to come back to at night. 
I particularly enjoy staying here in Winter when the fire is lit in the front bar and the hotel has a beautiful cozy feel to it.
Ludlow Coffee Supply right next door has awesome coffee too!

title: Beautiful Hotel With A Few Drawbacks
text:
I had business in the LES, and decided to give The Ludlow a try.  I had noticed the hotel a few months ago while dining at their terrific restaurant, Dirty French. This hotel is in a great location, surrounded by restaurants and bars. The hotel is really beautiful - as long as you like historic buildings. The lobby is lovely, and I especially liked the lobby bar, with big comfy couches and excellent atmosphere.  I had a small suite - with small being the key word. It had a tiny living room that was not really big enough to use, but a good place to store my luggage. The bed was quite comfy, but the bedroom was tight to move around. It is an old building, and has old building issues, including weird electrical that is hard to use, and a lot of street noise. I ended up plugging in my devices all over the room, because there is not a good central charging place. At one point the bathroom door wedged shut, and it took a lot of effort to get it open.

It has an well-done old fashioned bathroom, and there was plenty of hot water, and good toiletries. There is a mini-bar and Nespresso maker in the room. Service was very good.

I stayed two nights, and enjoyed my visit. If you like older hotels, and are willing to deal with the normal issues they present, this is a great choice. The Ludlow also has a very sexy vibe - and if lack of space is not an issue - would be a good choice for couples.

title: Love It!!
text:
Have stayed here several times and have never been disappointed.  The place is beautiful.  ALL of the staff go out of their way to be helpful and accomodating.
I stayed in 3 different rooms on this trip.  Even with its tiny size, the Mini is my favorite.  The decor is as comfortable as it is attractive.  Mid way through stay my husband arrived and we moved to a larger room.  It too was perfect. The bathroom is spacious.  Excellent panoramic views.  Room service was prompt.
The Ludlow is one of my favorite hotels anywhere.  Wish I could move in!

title: When can we go back...!?
text:
Such a great place to stay in the East Side, and we would certainly go back given the chance!

Superb service from start to finish, yes you pay for it but hey that’s life.

We were fortunate to have a terrace room which was certainly worth the extra, although the room was small it was well laid out and really did not need to be bigger.

The staff were helpful and offered some great dining recommendations close by.

title: Beautiful hotel, rather small rooms
text: It's been my second stay at the Ludlow hotel as I absolutely prefer the Lower East Side over midtown or uptown. My stay was good, however, the room was extremely small. I had a terrace, but almost no space to store my suitcase which was a bit of a tricky tetris game every time I had to get stuff I had no place to store in my tiny closet. Breakfast has really improved since my last visit, the avocado toast was excellent!

title: Great hotel in fabulous area of NYC
text:
We spent 4 nights at the Ludlow, one of which was my birthday. The hotel is extremely comfortable with great rooms, beds and bathrooms. We also had a balcony with superb views. The lobby area and bar with fireplace is a great spot to relax with a drink.
The staff are friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. I was delighted to find some fizz and a birthday card in the room on our arrival.
The lower east side is fascinating, full of restaurants, cafes and fabulous boutiques. 
We were able to walk into the financial district and many other areas only needing to use a cab occasionally. 
Only one small criticism, we found the lighting in the room although very atmospheric was a little dark.
Highly recommended hotel, I would love to return one day.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Great hotel with decent size rooms (especially for NYC) and bathrooms, beautiful decorations, and excellent location for food and subway. I wasn’t sure if we would be able to hear the traffic outside but things were perfectly quiet in our room. We also had a wonderful view of the WTC as well as the Empire State Building from our room which was a welcome surprise. 

Staff here are gracious and helpful. I’ve previously have come in for drinks a few times and have always felt the customer service was stellar. Strongly recommend travelers stay at this hotel if looking for an excellent stay and in the best part of the city!

title: Over hyped and not worth the money
text:
If you are expecting lucxury and service do not come to the Ludlow. The rooms are cramped. We payed for the Skybox loft that turned out to be the size of a shoebox with a closet the size of a thimble. There’s nowhere to put your bags or clothes and you can barley maneuver around the bed. 

If you are expecting breakfast in the morning make sure you are up early because they stop serving at 11. 

Put simply this hotel is overhyped and not worth the money. Stay at the Dominick.

title: This time back with two kids :)
text: Last time I stayed at the Ludlow, it was just my husband and I. We decided to bring our two kids this time around. There were bath robes for our boys in the room. The baby shampoo amenity smelled delicious and it made bath time so much fun for me... I thought it was so cute. The staff was so accommodating and extremely engaging with my 4 year old when we ran into them. The breakfast at Dirty French was a hit... my 7 month old couldn't get enough of the breakfast potatoes. Eggs Benedict are probably the best you will ever have.  We had friends come and visit and the Courtayrd was perfect area to host them. Especially after the kids went to bed... my husband and I took turns and enjoyed drinks with our friends without having to go out.  They served food there as well. Our mini vacation back in the city was wonderful and the Ludlow staff contributed a great deal by making this stay extra comfortable for us.

title: Very cool Hotel
text:
Stayed for one night on business in the city. When I first arrived, staff welcomed me to the property, very cool decor and a warm inviting layout with sofas and tables, fireplace, bar areas. The place had a cozy, unprentious feel.

My room was a little small but was nicely laid out and clean. Had a few drinks in the bar and the bartender was very friendly and made a mean bourbon old fashion!

I would definintely stay there again.

title: c'est parfait
text: l'emplacement en face de chez katz, le petit déjeuner, la brasserie dirty french, les chambres, difficile de trouver plus sympa. les "encore plus":  la douche est une cataracte bien faisante et le personnel est vraiment dans le ton juste. à noter, la skyroom pour une grande nuit d'amour...c'est cher mais c'est new york, alors on ne compte pas...

title: Beautiful space, excellent service and delicious food. Recommended by a New Yorker
text: I live in the city and stayed two nights as a weekend staycation, so pretty particular about a New York Hotel and I really made the right choice. The details of the interior and lighting design really feel both comfortable and authentic. The service/ staff was really lovely, considerate and just chill. As far as food, I had heard mixed reviews about Dirty French. All I can tell you is that all the food I had was very delicious. Their menu was priced very reasonable by room service standards. Do yourself a favor and order the pancake for breakfast, it's truly life changing.

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
I can not say enough good things about this hotel. Already in the weeks before my arrival the staff went out of their way to accommodate my requests over email. I had asked for a high floor and was lucky to get a mini studio on the 16th floor with fantastic views over the city. 
From the moment you walk in the lobby you’re hit with a vibe and a feel-good-atmosphere that’s unlike any other NY hotel I have tried. Staff is extremely helpful, beds are comfortable and the bathrooms out of this world stylish! This is your place to stay in NY.

title: Very cozy and comfortable stay.
text: This hotel has such a wonderful ambiance, very cozy and nice. The room was a little too small but the terrace made up for it. We had a great time here and the breakfast was extremely delicious and well made. I had the smoothest, most perfect omelet I have ever had.

title: A perfect stay!
text:
We loved it and exactly what New York is about.
They got the decoration perfect, quirky attention to details and the lighting magic. the suite was big enough for us, great beds, great linen and great amenities.
The front desk was 100% going ALWAYS above and beyond expectation.
French Bistro was also of high quality (And prices to match).
We will stay there again thats for sure.
David

title: Great bar and hotel
text:
Really enjoyed my stay at The Ludlow for 50th Birthday celebrations, the bar is lovely and the location in LES is really buzzing. Katz on the corner is great for getting over that hangover!!
Rooms are quite small but have all you need and have lovely bathrooms.

title: A real taste of NYC
text:
Stayed here in September 2019 for 4 nights 

Chose this hotel as we wanted a taste of what living in New York was all about and it didnt disappoint.

The decor is old skool NYC, beautifully and tastefully finished. It is a renovation rather than a new build but that adds to the character. However, this does mean they’ve had to work with what they had so our room (skybox loft) was smaller than I’d expected and, ideally, would have liked. But the views from the loft....wow

Bathrooms are also worth a mention. Very spacious(!), fitted out beautifully and who wouldn’t want a view of 1 World Trade Centre from their bathtub?

We didn’t eat here, although all of the reviews we read of Dirty French were very good, just because there are so many other great places in LES

Location is superb and handy for both 2nd Ave and Delancey subway stations, walkable into Chinatown, Little Italy and SoHo

Only real gripe was that, due to it being an old building, air con in the room was noisy so did interrupt sleep during the night. But that is the ONLY gripe in an otherwise brilliant hotel

Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC

title: Boutique in the LES
text:
We had a great time staying at The Ludlow.  The room was a good size and well appointed, and the location is perfect to explore downtown Manhattan on foot. The immediate area surrounding the hotel is full of bars, restaurants and cafes of every type. 

The gym is a bit on the small side, but I never experienced it to be crowded, and along with the roof terrace has absolutely stunning views.  Only negatives would be having to wait for our room to be ready upon check in, patchy/slow service in the bar, and always having to wait for the elevator.

title: おしゃれ
text:
お洒落ですが、ホテルの質の割には値段が高い気がしますり
連泊するにはコストパフォーマンスが良くないと思います。

title: Just short of sublime
text:
We stayed here for a night and had a room on the 18th floor. The sunset view genuinely bought a tear to my eye! There was ample space, a very comfortable bed and a huge bathroom with beautiful mosaic floors. The view from the bath was fantastic.
However, it lacked a couple of things below.
- No comp water (had to use the 9 USD one in the fridge!)
- No tea bags in the room (granted, I am from the UK but surely most people like tea in the AM?)
- The roof terrace could have been made so much more wonderful - a bar/comfortable seating area even, heaters for the winter? It was quite sparse and unused, which was a shame.

Otherwise - WONDERFUL!!!

title: Nice place just missing the odd brush stroke.
text:
Stayed for 4 nights. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very good. I liked the robes and the towels were soft and fluffy. The room was small, but this is New York so it was to be expected.
Had breakfast a couple of times. The food was good, but the service a bit slow. Just watching, it appeared to be one person down. One additional person would have made a huge difference
The bar/lounge area was nice if a little over air conditioned but that is just me being a bit picky. 
Overall very nice and would return in the future.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: One of our "Go-To" hotels while in NYC.  The rooms are great size, the service is top notch and the location is hard to beat.  Very cool hotel that's also makes you feel welcome at all times.  Would recommend getting a room size up when booking as it makes a big difference when you need a little more room to relax before hitting the city.

title: Top week gehad
text:
De wijk waar dit hotel, lower east side, is erg in opkomst. Het hotel zelf is een  heerlijk authentiek adres om in NYC te verblijven. Ik en mijn tienerzoon hebben echt genoten, de kamers zijn zeer comfortabel en mooi stijlvol ingericht. 
Uit de keuken komen ook zeer lekkere gerechten, alles met een originele vertaling of twist. 
Mijn tip voor het management zou zijn om  iets aan de verlichting te doen, vond het op sommige plekken  in het hotel wat slecht verlicht.

title: Mysigt hotell
text:
Mysigt hotell i bra läge med bra standard. Supertrevlig personal och god mat
Nära till trevliga barer och restauranger.
Bara några kvarter från trevliga Soho och Spring Street som blev en favorit. Tunnelbana nära och bra läge att besöka Downtown Manhattan, finanskvareteren, Batteri Park och Brooklyn bridge

title: Unschlagbares Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis in NYC
text:
Ich war schon des Öfteren in NYC in Hotels mit ähnlichem Preisniveau, "The Ludlow" ist für mich aber ein kleiner Lichtblick in Manhatten. Das Hotel ist ideal gelegen (jeder New Yorker hat uns ob unserer Hotelwahl gratuliert), um in alle Richtungen auszuschwirren, ist es vermutlich die beste Wahl. Wenn man von der Hotel Lobby auf die Straße geht, weiß man, dass man sich in einer Großstadt befindet ohne dass man von Menschenmassen überrannt wird. Es gibt tolle Lokale und Bars in der Umgebung, in der man sich nicht wie ein Tourist, sondern mehr wie ein waschechter New Yorker fühlt. 
Die Zimmer sind vergleichsweise zu anderen Hotels in New York wirklich GROSSzügig, sauber und gemütlich. Als Minuspunkt wäre vielleicht zu erwähnen, dass die Beleuchtung im Wohnraum "grenzwertig" ist, aber in einer Stadt, die niemals schläft, kommt Licht bekanntlich auch von außen herein ;). 
Auch die Rezeptionisten sind "waschechte New Yorker" und begrüßen einen tagtäglich mit einem gelangweilten und desinteressierten Gesicht, aber da ich mit ihnen wenig bis gar nichts zu tun hatte (Check-In/Check-Out), war es mir auch egal, wenn sie mich beim "Vorbeihuschen" im Eingangsbereich keines Blickes würdigten. 
Das fließt jedoch nicht in meine Bewertung mit ein, denn bei einem City Trip sind mir ganz andere Dinge wichtig, und all diese hat das Hotel bestens erfüllt.

title: Honeymoon stay
text:
The staff at this hotel definitely are the best part. Everyone we met was super friendly, especially Christian and the guy with the cool glasses (sorry didn’t catch your name!) on the front desk. They arranged for a bottle of fizz in our room to celebrate our honeymoon which was such a nice touch and everyone was so helpful throughout our 5 night stay. 

The hotel is definitely going for the vintage look which was as expected but we felt it could be improved if it was modernised in areas whilst keeping this vintage look....the air conditioning in the room was super loud. Admittedly we didn’t report this but it was an old unit so don’t suspect there wouldn’t have been anything they could have done during our stay. Also the elevators did feel like they could break at any moment. Definite haunted vibes in this hotel. 

Overall the hotel is great if you want to stay in the LES and be able to walk around downtown Manhattan.

title: Cadre sympa
text:
Un bel hôtel dans un quartier qui bouge. Bien insonorisé du coup nous avons bien dormi.
Nous avions pris une chambre avec une terrasse très agréable, nous y avons dîné tous les soirs ( nous avons pris des plats à emporter dans les restos du quartier)
 La chambre est jolie mais il manque des rangements. La literie est excellente.

title: 18th Birthday Celebrations
text:
Our second stay at the Ludlow but this time with our soon to be 18year old son.  Love this hotel. Rooms are fantastic and the location is great. We had 2 bedroom suite which was perfect. Also had breakfast each morning in restaurant which was really good (recommend the duck hash!).
Great area with loads of great places to eat, easy access to anywhere worth going.
If you can get a room looking over the back or in high floors it’s worth doing - this is the city that never sleeps and that includes the road outside!

title: Great boutique
text: Nice hotel with a definite hipster vibe. Lots of food options nearby. We had a room with a bathroom that had both a separate tub and shower which was super nice.  Hotel does not have its own parking lot, but has a share option with a lot across the street.

title: Overall great hotel, with a few issues
text: The lobby, lounge/garden area, and rooms were all beautiful, and the price for a room with two separate bedrooms (even if a little small) was pretty incredible. One star taken off for a couple of small issues- service at the bar and lounge area was very slow even when not busy and sitting at the bar alone with the bartender, getting an elevator always took awhile, rooms were a little dark, and the water in the shower never quite got hot. But overall a wonderful hotel option in NYC!

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text:
We stayed at the Ludlow for 6 nights in June, this hotel is gorgeous! The decor and fit out it beautiful. From the moment we walked in it was a wow! The room are small bit have also a lovely fit out. The view was nice i would mot say it was anything fabulous but it was view. The bathroom was small with a great large shower head, only bigger enough for one person to be in there at a time and you had  to close the door to use toilet and shower. We found out the day before we left you could get a clothes rack to hang you clothes which would have been great to know on day one- as the wardrobe is tiny.

The girl and front desk was lovely, she was friendly and gave a run down on places to eat in the area. Nothing seemed to much trouble. The other staff - they said good morning/ good evening but other than that were quite unapproachable. 

There is a gorgeous lounge and under cover court yard that is lovely to fit at and have a very over priced drink at. We did that once or twice but paying $60 aussie for two drink was a little over the top. The restaurant at the hotel Dirty French had a great feel- even though you couldn’t read the menu it was so dark, we order steak frits and asparagus side and it was amazing!   
Great first night meal in NYC.

The location of this hotel in the Lower East Side across the road from Katz deli was a funky area with a cool young crowd we love the location- except getting around on the subway system was difficult from here - especially if you not back by 8.30pm - the train line would be closed on weekends and you has to take two different lines to get where you want to be. We spent lot of wasted time travel to the site in Manhattan. This hotel was any cheaper than the ones in Manhattan - overall as much as i loved this hotel and thought it was stunning for convenience it would be better to stay uptown while site seeing and then head to the Ludlow once you are done.

title: Hype !
text: Le ludlow est un bel hôtel (boutique hôtel, plutôt....) avec un magnifique lobby, une très belle terrasse (climatisée), une petite salle de sport avec une vue extra au dernier étage. Nous avions un 'studio", qui en réalité est une chambre de taille moyenne (voire petite), affublée d'une jolie salle d'eau. La literie est plutôt bonne, et les nuits sont calmes (11 ème étage), ce qui est assez rare à NY. Le petit déjeuner n'a pas retenu notre attention, et nous sommes allés voir ailleurs chaque matin (au café Medhi, quelques rues plus loin). Une fois qu'on a fait ces quelques compliments.... et bien on a tout dit. Et c'est bien cela le souci. Le quartier n'est pas particulièrement intéressant, et s'avère assez sale. Alors évidement à 23 h (et +) , bien alcoolisé on ne s'en rend sans doute pas compte. Mais à 7 h du matin...la rue Ludlow ressemble plus à une poubelle qu'autre chose. Idem pour toutes les rues alentour et notamment Orchard street. Quant aux resto et aux bars.....c'est sans doute Amazing quand on a 20 ans. A 50, c'est autre chose. Nous avons fini par aller nous balader de l'autre coté de Houston Street, (c'est à dire dans East Village), pour découvrir de super petits restos. Le lower east side ne nous a pas vraiment plu..... Bref, un hotel bien sympathique mais qui mériterait un autre environnement. De ce fait, le rapport qualité prix en souffre.

title: Certified
text: Great little hotel with a great view from the rooftop. Queen room was quaint with a wicked bathroom. Extremely trendy spot that had me questioning whether we were cool enough to maintain the hotel aesthetic with our presence.

title: Quand « branche » rime avec un zéro pointé en service et accueil.
text:
Hôtel bien situé dans le Lower East Side, très pratique pour visiter NY. 
Métro à deux pas, Soho et Greenwich Village a 15 minutes à pieds.
Que dire de l’hotel, belle chambre (1580) avec une vue spectaculaire... la propreté de la chambre n’est pas exceptionnelle notamment la literie (oreiller qui sentent la transpiration).
En revanche énorme bémol sur le personnel et le service dans cet établissement. 
Nous avons assez rarement été aussi mal accueilli ... c’est très branche et surtout trop branche car le fait d’etre désagréable semble être une règle de conduite.

Personne ne dit bonjour, ni merci .... c’est normal c’est branche... à 450 € la nuit ..,.

C’est vraiment dommage les seules personnes sympathiques sont les femmes et hommes qui font le ménage.

Malgré la belle situation de l’hôtel et la vue de notre chambre, je pense que nous ne retournerons pas en ce lieu.

title: Bon hôtel dans un lieu branché
text: Le lieu est branché et la vie nocturne du quartier est intense les soirs de week-end. Aucun problème pour trouver un bar à café ou un restaurant dans le quartier. Il y en a plein, de tout type et pour toutes les bourses! Si vous chercher un quartier vivant, c'est ici qu'il faut être. En ce qui concerne l'hôtel lui-même, rien à redire. Ce n'est pas le grand luxe mais c'est tout à fait impeccable et confortable. Pratique également avec les chambres à deux lits pour les familles. Je recommande.

title: The Ludlow, an excellent hotel
text: The atmosphere is relaxed but everything runs efficiently and the staff are friendly and helpful. The staff on Reception were unfailingly obliging. The decor, fixtures and fittings are of a very good quality. The neighbourhood is vibrant. I was unprepared for the stunning views of Lower Manhattan from the roof terrace.

title: Always excellent service
text: Charming hotel in lower East side.  Very friendly staff.  Only draw back it the rooms are too small . If you are happy be in a small space this is the place. Excellent breakfast and cool bar . Try to book loft box rooms.

title: Fun and hip to stay in, Skyloft a little small but cozy
text: Feels very trendy to stay here. good neighbourhood right in the middle of the action in lower east side and the skybox offered great views over the city. The bed was quite small and also the room, but it was still very cozy. You should stay on higher floors, otherwise I can imagine this to be quite noisy.

title: will stay again
text: This hotel is in a great location near colleges and in East Village. Our double room was surprisingly large and with good view. The staff was friendly. The shower got the whole bathroom wet, but that seems to be a chronic problems. The restaurant seemed a bit douchey with some kind of hotpot-in-a-tent situation going on in the garden, but there's a million other places to eat. Will repeat.

title: Made Our Trip
text:
Booked a King Loft for a 5 night stay with my husband for our anniversary.  Amazing hotel, SO COOL. They even left us a bottle of fizz and anniversary message which was a nice touch. 
Service when checking in was great and then throughout the stay. Everyone was so lovely and helpful. 
The room we were given had unbelievable views, it was very clean and cool with great air con - v important in the 30 degrees summer heat.  Massive comfy bed, shower water pressure was AMAZING, it was an excellent wake up call.  Hotel surroundings are quite loud but the once all windows/doors closed it was pretty quiet.
We didn't try the restaurant but had cocktails in the bar which were very nice. 
Great location, close to subway and loads of bars and restaurants.  Probably one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had, would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Booked for 4 day visit to NYC, good east village location with bars, restaurants and music within a block.

Also 2 blocks from the subway do easy access to most places.

Restaurant is French themed and is excellent, albeit slightly expensive (for what it is). Was surprised that a glass of wine was charged at 19 USD!

There a 4 or 5 rooms with a nice sun terrace on floor 7, we took one of these and it was excellent .... you can see the top of the Empire State Building. 

The rooms are clean and spacious, the bathroom is also roomy and well equipped.

Really can’t fault it, highly recommended.

I recommend a roof terrace room on floor 7.

Oh, and it’s opposite Katz’s the restaurant from the Scene in when Harry met Sally.

Other photo’s are of view from roof terrace on floor 7 and some meals from the restaurant.

title: Trendy boutique hotel in the Lower East Side
text: Cute hotel. Very “insta” worthy. Small dark rooms with not so good lighting but quaint and cozy. Easy check in/out. Friendly staff. Would return if on business but def not a family friendly place if traveling with kiddos. Walkable neighborhood.

title: Fantastic Lower East Side hotel
text:
I've stayed in NY many times, and my recent experience at the Ludlow was the best yet! By far the best service I've received in a NY hotel. We felt really looked after, All the staff we encountered were great. The bar was really buzzing and the restaurant looked fun - although we didn't eat in it.
The area is brilliant too - I literally can't recommend this hotel enough!

title: My Favourite Hotel in NYC
text: Yet again had a great time here as l always do but dude on the the door with the bleached hair needs to learn some manners to much attitude for such a lovey hotel, But he won’t stop me returning as the rest of the staff were amazing.

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: I loved my experience here. I stayed here for almost 2 weeks and was immediately upgraded to a top floor suite with a beautiful view of the Brooklyn Bridge. It felt like home away from home. I loved hanging out in the lobby too.

title: Stylish and Cool
text:
Beautiful bathrooms and overall stylish and chic vibe. We splurged for a Queen Box room. The view was great in the living room. Totally worth it. 
Small balcony and view from bathtub. Our check in was easy and the reception was SUPER welcoming. 
I never order room service but I broke my rule and ordered breakfast here. The food was delicious best avocado toast I EVER had. Worth every penny. 
My only negative was the “queen” size bed felt more like a full size. Small. It may have been my misunderstanding or misinterpretation. I know NYC rooms are small but if I were staying longer I would forgo some of the cute living room and choose a king size room/bed to be safe. Restaurant Dirty French was delicious and convenient

title: Licht und leider etwas zu viel Schatten
text:
Sehr gute coole Lage, viele Restaurants in der Nähe. Mehrere U-Bahn-Linien.Vieles in Laufweite, nach Midtown in 10min mit der U-Bahn.Einrichtung geschmackvoll, eher dunkleres"Ambiente.Gute Bar,das Restaurant soll gut sein.Schöne Dachterasse mit Ausblick zum Financial district, Gym klein aber fein mit guten Laufbändern.
Das Ludlow double (2DZ mit Flur) war zur Hälfte eine Katastrophe. Was in keiner Beschreibungsteht: das Zimmer mit dem kleineren Bett  ist ein Durchgangszimmer und hat KEIN Fenster! Laute Klimaanlage.Die Bilder des kleineren Zimmers auf der Internetseite haben nichts mit der Realität zu tun.Auch für New York zu teuer, man bucht zum Preis von 2 DZ ein "normales" Zimmer und eine Abstellkammer! An der Rezeption hatte ich die Kommunikationslücke nach der 1. Nacht zur Sprache gebracht, da war wenig Verständnis, kein Angebot zum Zimmerwechsel oder ähnliches, man wollte mit mir noch diskutieren.Ein professionelles Beschwerdemanagement sieht anders aus.Erst eine Beschwerde über Booking.com zeigte im Nachhinein etwas Wirkung (geringer Preisnachlass). 
Abzocke beim Frühstück,Service unterirdisch:Beilagenwechsel mit Aufpresi-2 Spiegleier mit 2 Scheiben Bacon + ein halber Toast (mit O-Saft, Kaffee, Obst für stolze 20$). Ein nachbestellter Toast für 3$.  Kaffee und O-Saft waren eigentlich inkludiert, trotzdem berechnet, Rechnung erst nach Reklamation korrekt, Refill kostete.Ansonsten wie gesagt cooles Hotel, aber Augen auf bei der Zimmerwahl und Frühstück lieber woanders....

title: Boho show down
text: Wow wow wow, we had a fantastic stay here, chic, edgy, opposite Katz Deli! Our room was amazing with a bath tub over looking the city. A W E S O M E. Staff were super, it was clean and nothing was too much trouble. Only complaint was we could hear the elevator going up and down late at night from our bed. But it wouldn’t stop us staying here again 😘

title: Very good Hotel for a Lower East Side stay!
text: We had an enjoyable 4 night stay in a King Studio room at the boutique Ludlow with a great view of the New York skyline.  The room was certainly comfortable, clean and spacious enough but the room lighting is a bit dim which may be annoying for some. The bathroom is excellent and well appointed. It is certainly a hip, contemporary hotel with a lively lounge bar and interesting layout and open fire. Most of the staff were helpful when assistance was needed. I have to agree with a previous review that in the evening the lounge bar is packed with non residents who come for cocktails or to eat in in the restaurant . Staff did not acknowledge us as guests, and were not particularly helpful or welcoming on a couple of occasions when we tried to sit down for a late night cocktail drink before heading up to our room. The hotel is in a great location to explore the LES - Katz Deli is nearby along with great places to eat and experience a fantastic neighbourhood of New York City. Wifi was good.

title: Perfunctory service, tiny rooms, world's slowest lifts, great location
text:
We reserved 2 rooms here for 5 nights over Easter.  I'm afraid I don't get the hype for this hotel at all. It is hip and decorative downstairs for sure,  but the first bedroom we were given had the world's smallest wardrobe, not a single drawer,and the bedside table doubled as the minibar so had bottles and snacks over it.  OK we could have paid for a fancier room, but I guess I'd hoped $350 a night would get us a functional space.  Our eventual room was OK, but small even by NYC standards.
There are 2 small lifts for the whole building, doubling up as service lifts. This means long waits and a sort of roulette as to whether you'll be going up when you pressed down and/or be sharing with the room service trolley.
Service is very average, both from the front desk and in the lounge. 
I stay in a lot of hotels, for work and pleasure, and this was a very underwhelming experience.
On the positive side, it's in a fantastic location!

title: Skyloft
text:
We loved our stay at Thw Ludlow
We stayed in a Skybox for three nights in September.
The rooms are a delight. Very quirky and stylish with amazing views.
We utilised the space under the bed for storage as we were travelling for two weeks!
The Ludlow is a beautiful place to hang out. We enjoyed drinks by a roaring fire in the lounge which is comfortable and atmospheric.
Service was great, friendly and accommodating.
After checkout we spent the rest of Sunday morning having brunch in Dirty French before catching our flight home.
We enjoyed exploring LES and it was a great base for our trip
We'd be back in a heartbeat.......or a New York minute

title: Quintessential Boutique
text:
Having previously lived in NY and a lot of friends with spare rooms I had never stayed in a hotel in NYC so expectation and excitement was high.

After a slightly disappointing start with the size of the room, or actually the size of the bed in relation to the room we were moved and everything was great. 

The location is very cool, especially for exploring the independent shops on the Lower East Side and East Village.

The bar and garden room are lovely during the day but extremely busy at night and it's difficult to get anywhere to sit.

title: Sehr legeres Hotel
text: Großartiges Hippster Hotel, alles ist sehr legere und die Leute sind schon sehr cool. Tolle Bar und schöner Restaurant Bereich. Vom Rooftop hat man, wie auch mit den Zimmern mit Balkon einen großartigen Blick in die Stadt. Gerne wieder.

title: Who knew.... (well... me now)
text: I love this place....  i love the small boutique feel... the folks at the front desk... the room.. and THE TERRACE!!!!!  I did not care that i could see my breath and it was 40 degrees outside... i sat out there for an hour... just being.   I am sure the other rooms are nice...  but the terrace makes it all worth while.   I had an odd request for 4 more pillow (on top of the awesome pillows that were already there...) no one batted an eye... and sent them out... (i suppose that is better than asking for hookers and blow... but it is 2019 and not 1986) so..  this request was very reasonable in that respect.    Really...  it is on the lower east side... and getting down there is a bit of a pain in the ass.... but i am already checking to see if this room is available when i am back in ny in April!

title: SO happy with this choice..
text: With a long weekend in December free, we decided to make a long overdue trip to NYC. After doing some research, the lower east side seemed like a good neighbourhood for us - walkable to lots of cool areas (we saw some great comedy in Greenwich Village, drank at some amazing bars, and had some incredible meals), transit options for getting to Broadway where we had tickets to a show, and less hectic and cooler-looking than midtown. The Ludlow was a PERFECT choice for us. It had beautiful furnishings, lovely amenities, nespresso coffee in room, a very comfortable bed with beautiful linens, a luxe and hip vibe with friendly, helpful, staff. The rooftop view was stunning (though it was too cold for us to linger), and the cocktails in the lounge were impeccable, with a fun, buzzy atmosphere. We would go back in a heartbeat. It was an absolutely amazing getaway! 🥰

title: Top NYC stay
text:
After extensive research chose the Ludlow and it was totally the right choice.Great location for exploring LES. Vibrant and lovely common areas and had a great room
layout for giving MOM some privacy and having a living space as well.
The Ludlow double was perfect and a great value.
Great pleasant staff in all areas!
Minor tweaks for room lighting (although their bathroom lighting is excellent)and location of art vs. mirror in sitting area for function would put them over the top!

title: Stylish hotel
text: Stayed here for the week for my husbands 40 th birthday . We stayed in a larger double room but it was still quite small , though  had everything we needed . Great shower . The bar and lounge areas are very comfortable and were lively at the weekend . Great breakfast in Dirty martinis which is the bar in the hotel . Location in Lower East Side was perfect for exploring New York , we walked everywhere.

title: Valentines Day Gem! Great Staff!
text: I stayed at The Ludlow this past Valentine’s Day, as a special surprise staycation treat for my girlfriend. Prior to arriving, I contacted the hotel and the manager Ken was readily and available to assist with all my tedious request and set me up for such a wonderful and special stay. He even reached out to me after my stay to make sure everything went as planned. Before even arriving that afternoon, I received a text that my room was ready. I hadn’t even registered as yet, and was being told my room was ready. Eric! I arrived later that afternoon and Lawrence, the lobby ambassador, with a great smile and personality greeted me at curbside and accommodated me with a space right in front of the hotel to unload and leave my car while I settled in. I checked in and my journey with Lawrence continued, he took me up to the beautiful Loft Queen Deluxe, which was to die for and showed me around!! I set up my room to complete the last leg of my big surprise and asked Lawrence to assist me, which he happily did, by recognizing my girlfriend, after briefly showing him a photo, and having him hand off a card key to her when she arrived. IT WAS PERFECT! I later went to the lobby bar and met the beautiful host, Deandra, who got us our cocktails and even sat with us and had a nice conversation with us while we enjoyed the space. It just felt like home. If I could afford to be there each week, I would. I've already recommended the property to so many of my friends and colleagues and I can't wait to be back to this Gem!

title: 분위기 깡패
text:
뉴욕의 마지막날을 러들로에서 보내서 너무 좋았다
직원들은 매우 친절하였고 호텔 분위기 자체가 아늑하고 아주 좋았음
우선 룸이 너무 예쁨 주변에 고급 슈퍼마켓이 있어 음식 사다먹기 좋았다
바로 옆에 영화에 나온 유명한 샌드위치가게가 있는데 계속 줄이 길어 방문하진 못함

title: Moody and Fabulous
text:
This is the 4th time I've stayed at this hotel, and I just love coming back.
It's just fabulous every where you look.
It's dark and moody, dramatic and sexy.
The rooms vary in sizes greatly, so try and go for a larger suite if you can.
But either way, you'll love coming home to this gorgeous space.
The hallways are like something out of a story book, and the lobby bar is perfect for evening drinks.
There's always a real buzz in the downstairs area, it's so lively and the restaurant, 'Dirty French' is almost always a full house.
The bathrooms are so gorgeous, I've used them multiple times for shoots for my brand. Try and get one with a tub and a window if you can.
I love staying here and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxurious stay in NYC.
And the door staff are always so friendly with a smile and a helping hand.

title: SuperCool Place in E Village/Chinatown
text:
We loved the Ludlow. If you want to be in this part of town it’s a great destination. The rooms are nice and clean,  and the place is pretty happening. The bar, lounge, restaurant and sitting areas are all very nice. As with most NYC hotels, the rooms are a bit cozy, so we stayed in a small suite, which was great. I’d also recommend not staying on a higher floor as I heard people who did complain about the elevator wait. 
A really nice break from, and completely different vibe from, our usual midtown experience. Well recommended.

title: Great Hotel in the LES
text: I spent three nights here in January in a sky box loft on the 18th floor. View was pretty good looking further downtown & west. The room had a small lounge area which definitely made the room feel spacious and had a couple of small closets to hang clothes etc. I found the room to be a little too dark, even with all the lights on and on the 18th floor - I get the look they are going for but personally would like options. The bathroom was awesome, very light and bright with a large walk in shower, big bath and plenty of space on the vanity to spread toiletries out on. I loved the big window in there, but might not be for everyone. there was a curtain to close if you want more privacy. Check in was quick and easy, but in general I found the staff to be a little blasé. I didn't eat at the restaurant but did have drinks in the bar area and enjoyed the open fire. Top spot if you want to be downtown with loads of great restaurants, bars and coffee close by.

title: Stylish decor - underwhelming customer service
text: We stayed for a few nights just before Christmas. The decor is very cool both bar/lounge and (small) bedrooms/bathrooms. We really liked the area - trendy and authentic neighbourhood which is well placed for covering a lot of Manhattan on foot. But extremely noisy at night - definitely ‘the city that never sleeps’. We had breakfast in Dirty French (in the hotel) one  morning which was over priced and extremely average, and after that ate out for the rest of our stay. Great coffee shop next door. The bar/lounge area is comfortable during the day, but in the evening is PACKED with non residents who come for cocktails or to eat in Dirty French. Front desk staff never acknowledged us as guests, and weren’t particularly welcoming. Worst of all, when we settled our account, they took £1500 payment on a debit card,  but didn’t release the £1500 deposit on our credit card, despite many emails from us, for over a month. Go for a cocktail - but don’t bother staying.

title: A NYC Favorite
text: We love this hotel.   Everything is well appointed.  The lobby and restaurant areas are chic without making one feel inadequate.  The room are nice.  This last visit we stayed in a Ludlow double which had a king and a queen sized beds and loved it.   The neighborhood is awesome.  Must try.

title: お風呂が素敵な居心地の良いホテル
text:
2018年末に5泊しました。
クイーンロフトルームという部屋で、バスタブの前に大きな窓がある部屋でした。
ちゃんと深さもあるバスタブはお湯の出も良く（びっくりするくらい、すぐたまります）、シャワーブースは別であるので、お風呂にしっかり浸かりたい人にはとってもおすすめです。
写真で見たとおりのタイル張りのおしゃれなバスルームに気分が上がりました。

ベッドも寝心地が良く、部屋の広さも十分あり、スーツケースを広げるのも問題なしです。
冷蔵庫はミニバーを兼ねていますが、2リットルの水のボトルやちょっとした果物やデリなどを入れておくスペースは空いていたので問題無かったです。

2人以上で宿泊すると少しクローゼットが狭く感じると思います。

スタッフもカジュアルな感じで親切な対応をしてくれるので印象良しです。アジア系のスタッフが割と多くいました。
宿泊者で日本人らしい人には会わずでした。

ホテルすぐのところに、有名なカッツデリカテッセンや、ラスアンドドウターズがあり、レストランやカフェの多いエリアなので夜でも気軽に食事も楽しめました。

スーパーはホールフーズとユニオンマーケットが近くにあり便利です。

全体的に満足したので、次にニューヨークに来るときも泊まりたいホテルになりました。

title: Just ok
text:
Love Manhattan, so unless the hotel is a complete disaster it's never going to be a bad trip. My wife and I spent 4 nights here with our 15 year old daughter in a 2 bedroom space. It was disappointing to find that 1 room (our daughter's) had no natural light - it was like an anteroom to the front, where we stayed.That's a little primitive for this day and age. It was certainly clean enough, a little small for my preference, a bit boxy - and overall lacked any real character. Bathroom was very nice but in terms of atmosphere and decor the rooms were non-descript. The reception staff were helpful when asked for info or recommendations, charm itself in fact, but on arrival, there was no offer to help us with bags or anyone to show us the room. We were given the keys and left to get on with it. That is clearly hotel policy and not what you'd call getting off on the best foot.
              The bar and lounge area was, by contrast, very comfortable and stylish although in the evening the atmosphere changed from family hotel into something else entirely. It made for interesting people watching. We had some drinks and bar snacks which were pretty good but paralysingly expensive. But hey, it's New York, right? We went down to breakfast one morning and it was good with customary polite, attentive service.
                    So, a bit underwhelming, odd and slightly inadequate. We spoiled ourselves a few years back by staying at the Crosby Street Hotel and it was one of the best we've ever experienced. In comparison to this, it cost an arm and a leg although New York is eye wateringly expensive compared even to life in London. If you are fortunate enough to be able to make the choice I'd recommend spending the extra.
              ps if you go to the coffee shop next door with all the vinyl records, by all means have the coffee, it's very good. But don't buy the fresh OJ if you suffer from a heart condition; the price may push you over the edge.

title: Comfortable, easy, beautiful bathrooms!
text: We stayed at The Ludlow for five nights in December. We paid the extra money for a Skybox Loft but wish we'd asked for one higher up the building as we ended up with the lowest 'box' on the 8th floor. It was still lovely but I imagine that the view was better as you went further up the building. Small room (obviously, we were in Manhattan) but with a gorgeous bathroom and a comfortable seating area where we sat and read with a bottle of wine a few times. The bar / lounge area was lovely with the fire in deepest December, service was brilliant.

title: All time favorite hotel, stay there and love it!
text:
The Ludlow makes you feel at home from the moment you walk in the door. The staff is attentive to your every need, starting at the front desk. They greet you like a friend and are happy to help in any way they can. It is a great location, close to the subway and the area is filled with fabulous shops and restaurants. They have a wonderful lobby and bar, plus a great restaurant. The rooms vary, but well appointed and comfortable. Treat yourself to a great place and enjoy to
He comfort of The Ludlow!

title: Little haven on lower east side with the best view
text:
In November i was traveling by myself and stayed two nights at the ludlow in nyc. The hotel is in a great very hip neighborhood, the famous Katz’deli is just across the street. The hotel has a very welcoming lobby with friendly people at the reception. My room was lovely, very cost but with all the amenities you need and a great view. You can see the downtown skyline from the bed! 
I had a drink in the very nice and comfortable bar with again very friendly staff. The lower east side is a cool area too, lots of coffee places, shops and restaurants. 
Overall The Ludlow was a wonderful place to stay!

title: Gorgeous hotel Great location
text: We stayed at this lovely hotel for ten days. The room was small but very comfortable and the view was spectacular. My only criticism is that there is little to no storage. We had minimal clothing with us and had to live out of our suit cases. Thankfully one suitcase fit neatly under the bed. Aside from this, I'd still recommend this hotel for short stays.

title: Lovely hotel, nice views
text: We loved the hotel, we especially recommend upgrading your room to the one with a bathtub next to widow. Awesome, peaceful place, great service. They allowed us to check-in earlier as well. I will totally come back!

title: Quick NYC visit
text: This is my second stay here in past 3 months. Both have been great stays. Great location. Within walking distance of Nolita and SoHo. Across street from famous Katz’s Deli and around corner from Russ & Daughters. Lots of great restaurants on the street and around including the hotel’s own Dirty French. Feels cozy and like a comfortable place to be. Room this stay worked great for daughter and I. Not big but this is NYC but enough. Great friendly service from all the staff. Enjoyed hanging in the lounge area for a drink.

title: Superbe hôtel en plein coeur de Lower East Side
text:
Superbe hôtel dans mon quartier préféré de Manhattan, le Ludlow est un lieu tendance à la décoration travaillée, le personnel est attentif, aux petits soins et très agréable. Les chambres offrent une belle vue sur la pointe Sud de Manhattan (ou le pont de Williamsburg selon l'orientation) ainsi qu'un rooftop où vous pouvez prendre de belles photos et y apporter votre petit pique-nique.
Mention spéciale à la machine Nespresso dans chaque chambre ! Un gros plus !

title: Hotel with great personality
text:
Una joya de NY, buena ubicación, las habitaciones preciosas y su diseño reflejan el carácter newyorker
El bar y rest espectaculares 
Es ideal para vivir la cuidad 
El personal con un estilo jovial, relajado; muy en la línea

title: Style over comfort
text: The Ludlow is high on style but skimpy on some basic creature comforts. The vibe is great and the rooms are very well appointed in linens and furnishings. The staff is welcoming and helpful, the lounge bar is nice, and the location is great for doing the East Village and LES on foot. There are also lots of late night services and action nearby, and yet the back room where we stayed was quiet despite the hubbub outside. All that said, a few very simple investments would make a world of difference: luggage stands (a standard room is so small the only place to put your suitcases is under the bed!), at least a minimum of counter space in the bathroom for toiletries (even simple narrow side shelves!).

title: Christmas in Soho
text: We choose the hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Greeted by young man at door and showed to the desk to check in. Small boutique hotel with a personality. We had planned to walk around in Soho then cab to midtown for lunch. If you like NYC deli’s the famous Katz’s deli is across the street and no line if you go early in the AM. Russ and Daughter’s down the street L O N G lines. Took subway a few stops to 14th street to shop. Stayed 2 nights and 3 days for Christmas shopping

title: Comfortable, stylish hotel
text:
I highly recommend The Ludlow over any chain hotel in NYC. The location is fantastic for exploring a vibrant part of the city, and subway access is easy to get to tourist or business destinations. The lobby bar is packed at night but feels like a comfortable living room during the day.

I stayed in a Skybox Loft room and enjoyed the fantastic views. The queen bed was very comfortable, and water pressure was excellent. Despite this being a higher category room it still felt small, not uncommon for NYC. The living room looked bigger in pictures.

My 2 complaints about the rooms:
- Lighting: great during the day with the curtains open but horrible at night. With all the lights on it was about as bright as a romantic bar, and reading in the living room was impossible.
- Storage: there is only 1 small closet, and no drawers/dressers (even the "night tables" are just small flat surfaces). I like to completely unpack on longer vacations, and this required some creative thinking. I had the same issue in a Studio Mini room last summer.

I didn't rely on the staff for much assistance except for delivering the Sunday paper to my room after I'd left for the day, which was appreciated.

I'd stay here again without hesitation, knowing the limitations of the rooms.

title: Charmantes Hotel ideal gelegen in Manhattan
text: Stilvoll eingerichtetes Hotel, ideal im Süden von Manhattan gelegen. Geschmackvoll eingerichtete Zimmer mit tollem Ausblick über die Skyline, sehr ansprechendes Ambiente im Bar- und Restaurantbereich, sehr hilfsbereites Team. Wir würden es wieder buchen.

title: The highlight of our NYC visit!
text: When we got home from 5 days in New York, I asked the partner what he thought was the highlight of our trip. He said what I was also thinking - the Ludlow and our room there. For having selected this hotel only from ratings and reviews on this site we managed to choose the perfect place for us - it says much about the value of honest reviews. The hotel is nicely located by shops and restaurants in the LES/Soho area - far more intimate and user friendly than other areas in the city. But the hotel itself was the star. Hip, warm, intimate, friendly. Our renovated 15th floor corner room with ceiling height windows and terrace was beautiful and spacious for 2 with a comfortable sitting area and awesome views. The lounge with large central fireplace and cool decor and furnishings was perfect for our chilly stay. The staff was very friendly and Dirty French is a great attached restaurant. The service in the restaurant and lounge however is material for another review. Most highly recommend this hotel for someone looking for a charming, personable boutique hotel.

title: Litet topphotell
text:
Supermysigt! Trevligt
 litet hotell med perfekt läge! Nära bra shopping, grymma restauranger och små trevliga fik. Små men mysiga rum och en härlig bar i lobbyn med öppen spis och gott om loungemöbler.

title: Cozy, comfortable and hip
text: My 89 yr.old mother, my brother and his wife, and their 20 yr. old daughter all stayed here and loved it. The rest of us joined for breakfast and hanging out in front of the fire for afternoon tea. (with our dogs! So nice of them to accomodate!) The staff was really friendly and helpful, the rooms were inviting, and the lobby so warm and clubby. The location can't be beat.

title: My new favourite hotel in NYC!
text: This has to be one of the most pleasant experiences I have had. The staff were absolutely wonderful, the hotel was beautiful as were the rooms with great views and comfort. I love the location and if you need/want to stay downtown, I can't recommend this hotel more!

title: ファッション好きにはたまらないホテル
text:
なんとバスローブとバスマットがマルタンマルジェラです。
僕は自分の誕生日に泊まったので、自分へのご褒美に買いました。
フロントで言えば新品を出してくれます。

title: Wonderful hotel and staff!
text: We stayed 4 nights this week. I researched hotels and when I found The Ludlow I knew it was perfect! We were greeted as soon as we walked in. The front desk was friendly and personable. I think Tristin checked us in. He gave us a few restaurant recommendations, which was so helpful. We booked a Skybox loft. The room was comfortable. Great view of the city! I would highly recommend booking a Skybox. We were close to so many cool shops and restaurants. The room and bathroom were spotless. I look at EVERYTHING and it was super clean! The hotel was booked but we never heard any neighbors. I'm giving this hotel five stars but I did have one issue. We could see our neighbors using the restroom and taking showers. That means they could see us too. When I told the front desk (two young girls) they kind of laughed it off and said well you have to close the curtain at the window. Yea, I'm not an idiot. Of course we closed the curtain. There is a space above the curtain rod and the ceiling with a space big enough to see right through. I was pretty embarrassed when we realized this. We shoved a bathrobe in the space and went on with our business. Again, we still enjoyed our stay. It was wonderful. They just need to fix this one issue.

title: Trendy, warm and cosy stay
text: Me and my wife had a few very nice days in NYC. I can really recommend Hotel Ludlow located in East Village. It's a very relaxed atmosphere, high service and standard with the little extra in the details. The sourondings is also really cool with lots of cafe's, bars and restaurants worth visting

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
This past weekend my boyfriend and I traveled to New York from California for a weekend getaway and to celebrate my birthday. We stayed at the Ludlow for part of the weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is so trendy and attentive to details- we loved the decor and how friendly the staff was at all times! We stayed in the Queen Loft and had a wonderful view as well as a spacious and comfortable room. There are many restaurants, bars, and coffee shops surrounding the hotel and the subway is a quick 5 min walk away.
What made my stay especially memorable was the birthday surprise waiting in the room, which my boyfriend coordinated with the staff. We would like to thank Ming & Jenna for helping him plan this surprise and for going above and beyond to make it look so lovely. We will definitely be back!

title: Amazing Ludlow weekend
text: Simply an amazing stay at the Ludlow!  Ming was super helpful at check-in and went out of his way to welcome us and find the perfect room for us.  This is my favorite hotel in NYC.  Wonderful and warm lounge ; great rooms and customer service .

title: Amazing staff, room and experience
text: Jason L and the Ludlow staff were amazing in helping us with a room location issue we experienced upon arrival. Jason’s creativity and thoughtfulness led to an amazing night in one of the most beautiful rooms we’ve ever seen in NYC. Great hotel, great staff, perfect experience. A+++ all around.

title: Nice place with a few major faults
text: Fun location, young vibe, nicely decorated but not large rooms.  But very noisy from street and HVAC noise is astounding.  Biggest drag is that two elevators and no service elevator is very insufficient for a 20-storey hotel with the result that a lot of time is spent waiting. Overall, one expects a more professional management and service at rates being charged.

title: best customer service !!
text: I've been staying at The Ludlow for some years now, loving it every time, even through a major blizzard in March 2017. I was planning a trip in October. Something was mixed up in my reservation (100% my mistake) and I was billed for a now-show. I explained my circumstances and concern by email to the reservation department and was offered a full refund on what had been charged on my credit card. And I insist, it was my mistake, totally. They just thanked me for my loyalty. Loyalty it will be, for sure! Thank you and I can wait to book my favorite Studio Mini as soon as possible. Thank you Ludlow !

title: Great but deposit problem
text:
Overall the hotel is super cool - I booked a room with a balcony, which was a great addition to an already cool room. Spacious and views of the city. I took a cocktail in the bar and brought it up to my balcony to enjoy :)

The bathroom and additions feel super luxurious. The bathrobe was Margiela - you can purchase them too if you want to take it. The room wasn't small or big, just right for NYC.

Rooftop is also very cool, I don't remember there being a bar there, but no reason you couldn't take a drink up there from the bar. The views are spectacular.

Location is awesome. Great fried chicken restaurant next door and the iconic Katz deli down the road which you have to try once.

They double charged my deposit which I didn't get back for a couple of weeks. I had to tell them about it, so that was rubbish. And took a decent amount of my spending money for my trip. They were also a bit laissez faire about the whole situation, which I thought was rude. So taking a star off an otherwise five star review.

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: Had to write this review as soon as I returned home from four luxurious nights in a Queen Loft room at The Ludlow. Every detail was sublime - from the bathroom soaking tub and the rain-shower, to the super comfortable bed and linens. It felt cozy and warm - everything you want in a room in the bustling city of NYC. At first I thought the lobby was too hip/cool, but after the first night it felt warm and inviting like an oversized living room - one that just happens to smell like Moroccan roses. We only had breakfast at Dirty French, but the oatmeal and pancakes were yum. Many thanks to the Ludlow for making our visit to the city so perfect!

title: Nice hotel in an interesting location
text:
This was our first trip to NYC. The hotel is well presented and trendy, although it is very dark inside the lobby and the rooms.

The roof (king sized loft with balcony) was good. Whilst we struggled with space for our 2 large suitcases I think this would be the case with any hotel in NYC. The bed was large and comfortable, the balcony had impressive views of the city, and putting the large tv on a pull-out arm on the wall was a nice touch.

The bathroom had a powerful walk-in shower (a pleasant change from a lot of hotels) but barely any space for toiletries.

Location-wise, there were 2 metro stops within a 5-7 min walk, and lots of independent shops and restaurants, although it feels more of an ‘up and coming’ neighbourhood than most of Manhattan.

Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but it felt on the pricey side.

title: This is what a hotel should be like
text:
absolutely loved this hotel! The atmosphere is so cosy and you feel at home immediately. 
I had a room with view of the NY skyline and it was amazing! I could even see it from my bed. 

The bed slept wonderful.

Location is nice in a very lively area of the Lower East Side. Lots of great options for bars and restaurants and Soho is like a 10 tot 15 minute walk.

title: Excellent Hotel for Discovering Lower Manhattan
text: Excellent hotel, superbly located for discovering lower Manhattan. Beautifully decorated interior, attentive, helpful and friendly staff. Perfect night's sleep every night. Extensive choice of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance with the added benefit of Katz's Deli on the other side of the street! Superbly located for attractions such as The Brooklyn Bridge, DUMBO, Battery Park. 9/11 Memorial and Freedom Tower. Cool bar with comfortable sofas! The only thing I didn't try was their restaurant, Dirty French, which I'm sure would have been excellent too!

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Excellent choice in LES for a romantic weekend stay.  Staff was friendly and attentive, the room (with small balcony) was clean and charming.  Loved the bathroom.
The location cannot be beat with a quick walk to great restaurants and nightlife.  Our reservation included a bottle of wine and a bottle of champagne.

title: BRILLIANT !!!!
text:
What a great place..

If you are looking for really nice accommodation then pick the Ludlow. 

We had a skyloft or skybox whatever it was called it was great, huge views of the city. Rooms aren’t cheap but you do get what you pay for for sure. Bathtub is ace , I’ve never seen one fill up so fast before lol. 

We were in 1312 , next time I will try to get a higher floor as basically the higher up the better the view . Having said that our view was brilliant. Bed comfy and considering your in the city it was quiet through the night (maybe that was the wine .....)

I will not stay anywhere else when I want to be in the lower east side

Oh and that staff were lovely 😊

title: Stunning hotel, terrible service & amenities
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Ludlow NY this September in a skybox loft for 2 nights and then the loft king for another 2 nights. Both room were absolutely stunningly gorgeous especially the skybox loft and the rest of the hotel including lobby/restaurant where so lovely design wise. Shame there is no pool or spa though.  

This is a gorgeous hotel but when you are paying $600 USD per night tea and coffee should be complimentary.

Our stay was unfortunately tainted by the hotel charging us for ridiculously overpriced tea bags. I have stayed in many luxury hotels and tea and coffee has always been complimentary as it should be. When we realised there was no tea bags in the rooms mini bar we ordered 4 tea bags and milk from the front desk so that we could enjoy a cup of tea that evening and again for the morning. These 4 tea bags plus small jug of milk was $28 USD that is a joke when you are paying $600 USD per night. My partner called the front desk to enquire about why the tea is so expensive he was passed onto the manager whom simply said that is the price. We then asked to return the order (as we would buy some ourselves from the local deli) we were informed that it was impossible to return as the goods we already signed for.

Poor service and inflexible on what should be a small matter.

title: A very happy evening!
text:
Would love to stay at The Ludlow sometime but on this occasion I visited the hotel restaurant, Dirty French.  Having walked out of Beauty & Essex in a huff after being treated really badly by the hosts my friends and I just turned up and were lucky enough to get a table.
The experience couldn’t have been more of a contrast.  Very classy staff, wonderful food - quite pricey but worth it in my opinion and great decor.  Perfect end to my New York break.

title: THERE IS NO LOW at THE LUDLOW
text:
THERE IS NO LOW AT THE LUDLOW  

Where do I begin... my Husband and I have huge withdrawals we had a skybox loft on 12th floor 
The VIEWS blew us away, who needs a TV when you have this LIVE skyline view changing every second, or to stand on the balcony with your Nespresso coffee in the Ludlow beaker listening to the city coming alive 

The room ...just ticked all the boxes
Fabulous seating area to chill read look at the skyline views 
The bed was super super comfy + quality logo bed linen ( you should sell the logo sheet ) 
Fresh  bouncy towels daily 
The Bathroom OMG I think the most instagrammed bathrooms in NYC for style and views from your huge bath tub 
We now have inspiration for our New bathroom design
Everything about the interior is just so thought out and eye candy for the interior lover 

The chill lounge was so relaxed a great crowd of folk, no pretentious wannabes here ;-) which was refreshing 
The food was fantastic from the bar menu 

The staff are so lovely so friendly efficient and helpful,
Lovely smiley door staff who make you feel so Welcome, like a family member returning HOME
We will be back ASAP 
A good idea ...  it would be super if you put tea bags & some fresh milk in the fridge as the Nespresso machine has hot water ( especially for us Brits and our teas ) wink :-)

title: nice little hotel
text: Lovely little hotel. Very nice lobby, bar and restaurant downstairs and helpful, pleasant staff. Felt very at home. But yes, the room was so small we had to ask them to remove a chair so we could fit our luggage in and the only bedside table space was cluttered with their merchandise (mini bar). We removed that to the top of the wardrobe. No space in the bathroom either so our toiletry bags went under the bed with the rest of our luggage. Least it was a high bed! Cosy! But, the room was quiet, the view great, the bed soft, the room clean and the hotel well located. Overall, we were happy to stay here - but perhaps one of the larger rooms would have been a better choice for a week long stay. (we had the queen studio). An overnight with no luggage would be perfect.

title: Tiny rooms, unresponsive management
text: Stayed at the Ludlow two nights ago and while our stay was generally good a couple of things to note. Smallest room I’ve ever stayed in, including throughout Europe. So small there was no place to put luggage other than on top of bed. Terrace off room was a nice feature and if the weather had been better it might’ve lessened the smallness of the room. Ordered room service breakfast for the next morning when we arrived in the afternoon. Next morning no breakfast came and person who answered room service phone number said they did not have an order from us. So instead of comfortably relaxing in room we went downstairs for breakfast, which was good. After eating, decided to see manager to mention the screwup. Spoke with Yvette who’s comments were (1) who did you speak with in room service, (2) the restaurant is funny that way because of shift changes (3) she’ll make sure we’re not charged for the undelivered room service. That’s it. Not even an apology. I could rant from here but let’s leave it at we’ll not be returning.

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text: This hotel is in the trendy lower east side neighbourhood.  Close to subway and walking distance to Little Italy & Chinatown.  Staff were friendly, helpful, and informative.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  We had the two room apartment, which was really well designed with the little space available.  Bathroom in the middle so rooms were separated.  Highly recommend a stay here.

title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in
text: I don’t know where to start, it took me months to finally choose a hotel in New York it was so important I picked the right one as it was my first time visiting and a dream of mine. My partner visits NYC all the tine for work. So he’s stayed all over NYC. We booked the sky box room as I really wanted a room with a view. When we arrived we were early so our room wasn’t quite ready but they let us leave our luggage while we went for a bite to eat. When we opened the door to our room we were gobsmacked. The room was beautiful, it looked exactly like the hotel pics but the quality of the furniture and the bathroom was so much better than the pics do it justice. The view from our room was amazing. So much so we never closed the curtains not even to sleep. Our room was cleaned exceptionally well every day with fresh towels every day. The bed was also super comfortable. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. To make the whole experience even better it’s situated in a great area alongside some fantastic restaurants, bars and coffee shops. I’m so sad to have to check out at the end of my stay. I will recommend to anyone and suggest of you can afford to spend that bit extra for the skybox room i promise it will make your stay so much more special. My partner who works all over the world and is always in NYC said it’s the best hotel he’s ever stayed in also.

title: A great hotel
text: A really good hotel in a great part of New York. Couldn't fault this hotel tbh. Good service, gorgeous little room. And walk right out into the East Village. I'm definitely staying here again when I go back.

title: Great hotel in a good location.
text: This is a fantastic hotel, staff were always friendly and accommodating. It's in a great location close to some fabulous restaurants and the right across the road from the famous 'Katz' delicatessen. It's also close to the subway so it was easy to get around. We had 4 people in 2 bedroom room and loved the bathroom size, it was a little bit squishy in one the bedrooms only because we had a fair bit of luggage and the beds are so big, they take up a bit of room, but they are very comfy after a long day of walking. The only negative thing I can say is the lifts take forever and I did hear a lot of other guests comment on that also, but maybe we are just impatient! :)

title: One of the best! 🏆
text: This is a really cool hotel in a great neighbourhood. From the arrival to departure the service was excellent. The room was comfortable and the bed was awesome. My only gripe was the bathroom- shutting the door whilst inside requires some tricky yoga like moves and is simply awkward, but a small problem in context of everything else I loved.

title: Tiny rooms
text:
The hotel is great I suppose, but when it is almost impossible to fit into the room, let alone store a suitcase you have chosen to much and/or to bulky furniture! I was a single occupant, dont want to Think about double occupants!
The bathroom on the other hand was spacious and really nice! But it was also very lightly furnished. 
The staff was great, the location amazing and the hotel as such was worth every dollar! But please choose different furniture!

title: Unique-unico
text:
Cari lettori
Vengo spesso a NYC per lavoro e finalmente ho trovato una sistemazione comoda, pulita e rilassante
Hotel bellissimo e super originale - c’è un ambiente super - e mai caotico come nella maggior parte degli hotel
Frequentato da ottime persone
Salotto con camino molto accogliente 
Bar e bar tender sempre simpatici e di compagnia
Ottimo il ristorante Dirty French
Posizione comoda e rilassante, lontano dal caos ma anche comodo a tutto
Bravi, grazie e a presto
D

title: Très bien
text:
Pratique pour une famille avec deux ados car on rentre dans la chambre par une première alcove avec lit pour les enfants puis couloir puis chambre parents avec fenêtre.
Cela correspond à presque  2 chambres avec un prix élevé qui reste correct pour cette prestation.
En revanche, les commentaires sur la vue superbe c'est si vous prenez des chambres en hauteur qui coûtent beaucoup plus chers.
Le personnel est très professionnel. 
La situation est très bien si vous voulez être plus au calme et éviter des quartiers comme Time Square.
