title: Great Location and Staff
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights in early July.  The staff were friendly and helpful and the room clean and comfortable.
The hotel is in a great location surrounded by good restaurant and bars, and you are a stone's throw from Katz Deli!  
The area is busy and the nightlife seemed good, although to be honest we were on up early every morning so didn't really see much of it!  We weren't disturbed by it either, having a room on the 15th floor with a balcony and fab views.

title: 3 jours à New York
text: Hôtel très bien placé, à proximité de beaucoup de quartier, le cadre de l’hôtel est très sympa! Accueil très limite, le bar de l’hôtel et la véranda sont certainement les atouts de l’hôtel, pour la chambre très petite, lit correct, gros gros soucis rien pour poser ses valises, et placards minuscules pour ranger ses affaires, salle de douche bien super deco mais petite toilette dans la salle de douche pas de pommeau de douche.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed with my wife and two teenagers for 4 days. Hotel is in a great area of the lower east side ( if you don't like quirky/bars/restaurants then this aint for you).  Received an email just prior to our stay advising that the wifi was not working, however we received a discount and breakfast vouchers, really felt like the management went above and beyond, Had a great stay and would recommend the hotel, large double room has two separate sleeping areas which is great.

title: Lovely rooms and decor
text: I really liked this hotel.  The decor is warm and inviting and I felt like I staying with friends rather than a sterile hotel.  The location is fab...wish the gym they gave me access too was more in keeping with the up market nature of the hotel.  But, the bed was uber comfortable and I had some great night sleeps here.

title: 5 nights in NYC
text:
We stayed at the Ludlow in April, 
Its a great location on the lower Eastside. The Hotel has a really cool vibe. The Room was fairly compact but adequate, super clean with nice bedding. The bathroom also compact but adequate and well equipped. The bar and restaurant were lovely very hip NYC. The price for NYC was fair and we totally had a great time exploring the neighbourhood and beyond with the subway a short walk.

title: Small room, loud air condition, creaky bed, unpleasant manager
text: While the Ludlow hotel is located in a wonderful neighborhood - the rooms are tiny and it appears to be losing its edge. The room and lobby were becoming shabby, the bed was creaky, the air conditioning noisy. The room was so smalll that there was actually no place to open a suitcase. The only place to put the suitcase was blocking the door to the room. And the room was super expensive to add insult to injury.

title: Great vibe, location, staff, restaurant
text: My daughter and I took a short getaway trip to NYC and The Ludlow was recommended by an acquaintance.  It was just fantastic in every way.  The service from our arrival was spot on...not too over-the-top, but just perfect.  Our room faced Ludlow Street.  It was clean and  we loved the decor.  We ate at Dirty French (the hotel's restaurant) and had fresh, delicious fish.  The craft drinks were refreshing.  We loved the service and felt really comfortable there.  It is in such a great neighborhood - LES.  So, convenient to get to Brooklyn etc.  Can't say enough.  You will be so glad you chose The Ludlow.

title: One of our all time favourites
text:
The vibe of this place is so cool - edgy, friendly and forward thinking. The choice of beverage is great (we didn't eat), and our room, whilst typically small (which is how it goes in NYC), was beautiful - offering panoramic views on the 13th floor. 

I only raise one slight caution for the hotel to consider, because if it sorted a couple of minor details - I don't think I could say I stayed anywhere better.

1) the hairdryer was incredibly tatty - for the sake of a few dollars please upgrade - everything about this hotel is designed to make you feel special, and getting yourself ready should be part of that

2) teaspoons!! How can you stir the coconut milk without m having to use your finger??!

I will definitely be back - along with the slight burnt top of my index finger 😂

title: Awsome experience
text: On business trip came to say at the Ludlow amazing experience and comfortable beds great services and amenities  !!!! thank goodness I picked the place to stay . Easy access to and from city will be back here for my  next trip  !!

title: Perfect stay!
text:
Just spent a week at The Ludlow and am devastated to be checking out! Stayed in Room 707 which had a spacious, wonderful patio overlooking Ludlow Street. Everything in the room was beautifully considered & perfect for a comfortable stay in the bustling LES. From the moment I first checked in and met Sophia at the front desk, the entire staff at The Ludlow impressed me with their friendly attentiveness.

Seriously, if you’re looking for a hotel in NYC that offers a warm and welcoming ambiance, stay here! It’s hip without being showy and succeeds in feeling like a home away from home. 

Also, grab a cocktail at the bar and head up to the rooftop on the 20th floor - the view is amazing.

Thanks again Ludlow - will definitely be back!

title: Top Notch!
text: Intimate, fun, comfortable and clean!  Near great shopping and across the street from the famous "Katz's deli. Close to subway stations also!  Beautiful lounge/bar areas and a great little restaurant right on site!

title: Sublime hotel
text: What a find. Such a beautiful hotel AND amazing cocktails too. We didn't eat here but the rooms are fab and the view from the roof is well worth a visit. Great hotel in a great location and the staff were very helpful too.

title: Wonderful Night in NYC
text: Great location on the border of the East Village and the LES.  For the most part the hotel is beautiful.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating.  We had a skybox loft and the views of the city were spectacular.  The room itself was not large but was more than spacious enough for the two of us, especially since we spent most of our time out enjoying the city.  We were there the weekend after July 4th so it was less busy than normal but we did not have any trouble sleeping well in the room.  The couch in our room could stand to be refurbished but would be nitpicking and did not detract in any way from our stay.  I would absolutely stay at the Ludlow again and recommend it to everyone I know.

title: Love...low!
text: After an unsuccessful stay at a hotel further up the road (no names) we moved here for our final 3 nights and within minutes of arrival we knew we'd made the right move. Proper hotel with everything you need. Decent bar, lovely restaurant attached, superb location, great rooms........all underpinned by a real sense of customer service.... Thanks to you all at the Ludlow.

title: Great for NYC getaway
text: My husband and I stayed in a studio queen for two nights and overall enjoyed our stay.  The was small, but it worked for us.  Didn't hear much street noise and never heard anything from the rooms beside us or above us.  I will say the doors are a bit thin, because I could hear everything out in the hallways.  The staff was great and check in was quick and very pleasant.  The location is great!  So many great places to eat within walking distance.  We did not eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on how it was.  The whole hotel is kept pretty dark/dim, with the exception of the lovely room in the back on the lobby level.  I am torn on if I would suggest this as a place to bring a family.  You definitely could, but it doesn't have the family vibe.  I would 100% suggest staying here though in general and we will be back for our next couples getaway. *even got to see a movie being filmed while we were there*

title: Hip and cosy
text: This hotel is very conveniently located and the rooms are spacious and cozy. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Very good service indeed. The bed is so comfortable and the bathroom is modern and very nice! I will come back anytime! Love it!

title: Absolutely Love the Ludlow Hotel!!!
text: I’ve stayed in boutique hotels all over the world but the Ludlow has me hooked! Everytime I think of staying somewhere else the siren song of the chill lounge vibes, stylish rooms, and impeccable staff pulls me back in. Staying at the Ludlow feels like a home away from home. Great neighborhood full of tasty restaurants and tons of shopping!!! Has similar vibes to the Bowery but the Ludlow has a bit more heart.

title: I wish I liked it more
text: The little sister to The Bowery Hotel just doesn't live up. The lobby is crowded and overwhelmed. The room is average and black soap? Really? Room service from the restaurant verged on awful. I just don't get it.

title: Mostly loved The Ludlow
text:
I stayed in a Loft and had a corner room with great views from every angle. The bed was huge and super comfortable, the room was quiet and I loved the decor. It’s a cool neighbourhood with good restaurants and bars on the doorstep. 
The hotel houses Dirty French and this is where you take breakfast. The staff are friendly and very hip, trouble is after 5 days the inconsistent service started to irk. Three words - Write it down !

title: Location,location,location -and amazing feel to boot!!
text: Amazing rustic chic feel!! Great staff. Cozy room,great location & city view from 20th flr roof deck!  location near multiple great restaurants made it hard to choose  - also walked all around lower east side, alphabet city and east village -- live music nearby and great residential community feel to all those neighborhoods - felt safe late at nite as well.

title: Great Space, One of my Favorites!
text: The Ludlow Hotel is probably one of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in. The decor is so fun and vintage, we absolutely loved it. The staff was great, location was excellent, wonderful staff and the room service was awesome. I just can't say enough how wonderful the hotel was. I'd love to stay there again. Thank you Ludlow!

title: Beautiful rooms in a fantastic part of New York
text:
The rooms are beautifully designed with a great view (French windows) of the Lower Eastside. Great restaurants nearby and an easy pickup point for Uber drivers. 

Well equipped gym on the rooftop with a wonderful view of the city.

title: Excelente hotel y buena ubicación con gran personal y muy cómodo
text:
Estuvimos una semana en este gran hotel. Su ubicación es perfecta, al menos para quienes buscamos un NY menos lleno y menos ruidoso. Estación de metro Houston está a solo pasos y caminando se llega a Chinatown, Little Italy e incluso el greenwich village.
La habitación tiene un tamaño adecuado, no es grande pero tampoco tan pequeña como la media de NY. El baño es hermoso, las vistas desde la terraza del último piso son espectaculares.
El gimnasio, que es importante para mi, es algo pequeño, tiene solo cuatro máquinas de cardio, solo una bicicleta y dos elípticas, pero está bien si tienes suerte y no hay mucha demanda.
El restaurante Dirty French merece mención aparte, una delicia, hay que reservar idealmente tanto para brunch como para cena. Vale la pena.
En fin, me ha gustado mucho el hotel y lo recomiendo absolutamente. Es probable que vuelva a hospedarme acá.

title: Good (but over-rated) Location To Explore The Lower East Side
text:
We stayed at the Ludlow for our 30th wedding anniversary. Skybox Loft room was excellent: large bathroom & separate sitting room were standout feautures. 

Breakfast at 'Dirty French' was massively disappointing (boring menu, mediocre quality & over 30-minute wait.) Would not recommend eating at the Ludlow as there are plenty of far better options within a short walk (Russ & Daughters for breakfast, example.)

The other bizarre feature of the Ludlow is the anonymity of it's staff. It's difficult to recognise who actually works there & even more difficult to discern who's in charge. This was apparent to a number of guests we chatted with while staying at the Ludlow. You'd see people wandering around with suitcases but have no clue whether they were guests or staff. It was the same in the restaurant, barely organized chaos. We watched one fellow guest give up waiting for his breakfast to arrive & simply walk out.

In short, great rooms & location in the Lower East Side, but the rest of the 'package' at The Ludlow falls far short of what you would expect for the prices they charge.

title: Oasis after Nightmare Travel
text:
This hotel is so welcoming, front desk staff so friendly when I arrived erased memories of  the 1.5 cab ride from LGA from my mind.  The upgrade to a terrace...heaven.  Thank you.

This is a very comfortable room, always nice, clean, stylish and without complications.  Yes they are small but a one night stay perfect.

The restaurant in the building has really good breakfasts and service is always attentive and fast.

Thanks for the great one night stay.

title: Friendly comfortable hotel
text: Loved the public areas of this hotel, comfortable lounge/bar, great restaurant with wonderful service. Room lovely, but must have been designed by a man as no room for storing clothes, suitcases or wash bags! The only bedside table taken up with drink and bar snacks to buy! What is that about!!

title: Confort & Raffinement
text: Je viens de passer 9 nuits dans cet hôtel absolument parfait. En étage élevé, on a une vue superbe. Confort, raffinement et personnel extrêmement professionnel dans un quartier en pleine évolution et mouvement. Je viendrai de nouveau dans cet hôtel lors de mon prochain passage à New York.

title: Hip boutique hotel
text: When I am looking for hotels, I spend hours searching the web looking for just the right place...well I struck gold with the Ludlow!  The Ludlow is in the vibrant lower east district and it is just perfect.  The reviews are not lying.  The hotel is trendy and boutiquey-perfect for a romantic break away.  The setting is in a vibrant street but the noise is really not bad for being a city location.  The staff are friendly and helpful, maybe a tad too pretentious but working in London I get used to this!  The room we had was small but I knew that on booking, I preferred to compromise on size but get a cool room with a great view.  Pay a little extra and ask for a room with view.  The only issue we had was that the bed was noisy!  We did ask for it to be fixed and they tried but didn’t work. But we decided to stay in the room as the bed was very comfortable just noisy when you moved!  Make sure you spend time on the rooftop as you get a great view.  Overall, we were in NY for a romantic getaway and the Ludlow really had a part to play-thank you.

title: Chic, friendly hotel in great location.
text:
I went for a long weekend to visit my daughter, who lives on Brooklyn.  Since she doesn't have much room at her place, she stayed with me at the Ludlow. We had a King suite on the 4th floor on the street side.  Loved this place for the location, the chic and trendy vibe and the friendly staff.
I wasn't in NYC as a tourist, so wanted to be off the beaten path a bit (If that's even possible?) but still in range of fun things to do, shopping, restaurants, etc.  Perfect location for all of these things!  Added bonus was the fantastic lounge and sunroom areas off the lobby!  Lovely place to drink coffee in the morning, and a hopping place for a cocktail at night.
Highly recommended!

title: Impeccable hospitality
text:
I never write reviews, but I had to for the Ludlow. I was fortunate enough to stay for one night last week, and it MADE my trip (which made my birthday!). Chris and the women at front desk were fantastic, food was amazing, room was gorgeous. If you can afford it, you will not be wasting a single penny; one of the few things in NYC I can say that about!!!
Thank you!

title: Very Trendy Spot
text: This hotel is very different from anywhere else in NYC that I’ve been to. I love the vibe it gives out!! Check in was very easy & staff was very friendly especially Ivette & her beautiful smile. Had a couple issues with maintenance but the engineer (I believe his name was Chris) was very knowledgeable & took care of all our needs. Will definitely return. 👍🏽👍🏽

title: My 2nd choice of hotel in my city
text: Aye yall, i want yall to know that this is my second choice of hotel and if it's worth investing my money in? I see that is is clean, nice, beautiful, and this is pretty expensive i haven't had time to come and visit your hotel yet but i will get to it just be prepared for my appearance i love yall out in NY! stay cool Stay Clean ~6ix9ine

title: Great hotel
text: Came in for work and was worried I might get stuck because of the storm. The front desk team told me not to worry, they would take care of me if I did. Felt much better. The rooms were amazing - well decorated and while the rooms felt small it felt homie. The bathtub was awesome - mini bar presentation was spot on! That rose cider is a MUST!

title: Spring break
text: I travel all the time, I’ve been all around the world and this is my very first trip adviser review. My wife daughter and I spent three wonderful days at the Ludlow. Everyone upfront, day and evening staff, including Ming and Sophia  couldn’t have been more accommodating.  The smaller rooms are small, but typical for New York,  ad long as you are aware of that going in.  The front desk team was able to upgrade  our room when they had another cancellation which was above and beyond. They Recommended amazing local restaurants,  activities and offered to assist with Last minute theatre tickets. Unfortunately, the one thing they could not control was the New York weather. The lobby bar/lounge is a fantastic spot for a late afternoon or late evening cocktail. The restaurant in the hotel, Dirty  French is outstanding. Amazing location in the LES. Despite the cold and rain, we were able to walk virtually everywhere, Soho, East Village, little Italy, Chinatown and even trekked to TriBeCa. Our experience was fantastic and could not say more about the staff and management. I look forward to returning soon.

title: Skybox is an awesome room
text:
Checkin: Easy like most hotels. 

Room: Large Room with a living room that has 360 views of the city. Tuna tartare was amazing. Took some chicks back. It was really good night. Total cost of room was only 350 USD. 

Service: They were pretty on point. 

Cons: That elevator was dreadfully slow. It hits every floor. It's a nightmare hungover.

title: Bästa hotellet i NYC!
text: Superhärligt hotell med en skön mysig känsla. Direkt när man kommer in känns det som en lugn oas i loungen. All personal supertrevliga o laidback på ett bra vis. Rummet var fantastiskt, rent och kändes stort. vi bodde på 18e våningen så utsikten var härlig! Badrummet var en dröm, badkaret så härligt. Väldigt lugnt o mysigt hotell med närhet till att härligt på lower eastside. Kommer definitivt boka här nästa gång jag åker till New York. Tack Ludlow!

title: Fancy aber nett und hilfsbereit
text:
Das Hotel und die Zimmer sind sehr schön gestaltet und eingerichtet. Alles ist an ein eher jüngeres Publikum gerichtet. 

Das Zimmer an sich - wir hatten ein Skybox Loft - ist relativ klein. Man bringt die Koffer kaum rein. Aber super schön ist es. Ein Marmorbad im Zimmer mit Badewanne und Sicht auf die Stadt, ein Queensize Bett (was zu  klein ist) das sehr bequem ist und eine Sitzecke. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt im Zimmer und es wurde auch sehr gut geputzt. Viel Auswahl ist auch in der Minibar und an Snacks vorhanden. 

Der Service ist sehr nett, freundlich und hilfsbereit. Kann man an keinem Punkt motzen. Unten in der Lobby ist eigentlich immer viel los. Entweder sitzen viele Leute in der Lounge oder das Restaurant ist voll. Gestört hat es uns jedoch nie. 

Die Lage war für uns eigentlich auch perfekt. Wir wollten nicht am Time Square oder sonst bei den Sightseeing Orten sein. Dennoch hatten wir viele gute Bars und Restaurant herum. Wir konnten auch gut überall hinlaufen. In den 5 Tagen haben wir so gut wie nie ein Taxi oder Uber gebucht. Wir sind zur Brooklyn Bridge gelaufen und auch zum World Trade Center und nach Mid-Town. Einfach überall. 

Es hat uns sehr gut gefallen und wir können es nur weiterempfehlen! Auch wenn es einen stolzen Preis hat.....

title: Great stat at The Ludlow
text:
My family and I just wrapped up a week in NYC at the Ludlow Hotel. We booked a double room that worked out just perfect for the kids.  The kids had their own bed and the king bed for the adults and living room worked out just perfect for the whole family.  We love the neighborhood and the food spots are some best NYC has to offer just steps from the hotel.  The front desk was helpful accommodating our every need and even gave us some gift cards for treats around the neighborhood!  

I’ve stayed at the Ludlow for business as well and it proved to be perfect for the family too.  We will be back!

title: Worst Front Desk in New York City
text: This hotel should be great, as it has almost all the makings of a great boutique hotel. Good location in the action of the LES, nice lobby area and bar. But, then you talk to the front desk and everything goes down hill. Honestly, the worst front desk I have ever experienced in all my time traveling. Long story short, they messed up our room bookings, told me it wasn't their problem and then lied and acted as if I booked something else. The literally did nothing to rectify the situation. They couldn't care less and that's unacceptable because you ultimately return to a hotel based on how you're treated. Do not stay here, plenty of options in the city where they won't treat you like dirt.

title: A Good Find
text: This is definetly a very interesting NY neighborhood and a jewel of a place to stay.  The Ludlow is a relatively new structure tucked into this bustling area.  The staff is very congenial taking the extra step not often experienced in “the city”.  The Lulow’s lobby is quite large yet inviting to spend time people watching or for a tet e te with friends.  A very homey atmosphere.  Our room was small due to a last minute booking next time (and there will be a next time) we will plan ahead.  The restaurant is excellent with an interesting fare.  We tried lunch (don’t miss the broiled oysters) and breakfast...great Eggs Benedict.  We enjoyed our stay in this “neighborhood”.

title: New York Gem
text:
Shhh.....  this must be New York's best kept secret!!
From the moment we arrived everything was picture perfect. Very efficient & friendly staff. Quick & easy check-in. Cosy fire in the large fireplace warming the entire room. 
And then.... the amazing sky loft!!
Small but beautiful, well laid out, clever use of space ensures you do not want for anything. Indescribable New York views... even from the bath tub.
Vibey, safe area...  I would come back to NY for The Ludlow alone!

title: Fab boutique style hotel in trendy area
text:
Writing this before I leave first thing tomorrow (wish I could stay longer!)

There are so many plus points about this hotel:
Great location - lower East Side near Soho
Friendly, helpful staff
Room has all I need (staying in queen studio) super comfy bed, amazing shower products, bathrobe & slippers
Nespresso coffee maker - have learned to love black espresso (not brave enough to try the coconut oil ‘leaner creamer’)
Quiet (8th floor room)

Food in restaurant is plentiful - ordered an omelette for brunch & was provided with cakes to ‘keep me going’ whilst I was waiting for my order. I had to pass unfortunately!

Negatives:
None that I could find.

title: Cozy in the East Village
text:
This was my first stay at The Ludlow. I was on a quick weekend trip with my college age daughter who was beginning her Spring break.   It is a hidden gem just off of Houston.  The excellent, welcoming staff greet you with smiles and a quick check in.  It was a cold weekend so the large burning fireplace was a welcome site.  Lots of wood and comfy furniture make this one of the more cozy lobbies in the city.  Room was small (expected in NYC)  but well appointed.  Small closet, shelves, hooks, mini bar, flat screen tv, rain shower and a deep tub.  I heard no noise from the hallway or adjacent room. The restaurant, Dirty French, looked inviting but we opted to hit the city and grab a quick bite rather than dine.  

Big Thank You - My daughter left her glasses on her night stand.  She contacted the Ludlow the next day.  They had them and sent them within days.

Pro Tips - The Ludlow is just off Houston on a very narrow street.  Walk up to the corner to flag a cab or meet your car. Other than the famed Katz's Deli which is across the street it is not near a lot.  You need to walk several blocks to get to the heart of SOHO, car/taxi to mid town for theater will run $15-20 before tip.  The pillows are VERY soft.  There were 4 on the king bed in our room but would have preferred about 4 for each person because of the softness.  I'm sure they'd have brought more had I asked.  Bring ear plugs (I always do on trips to NYC) just in case your room fronts the street like ours did.

title: Unique hotel in a great location.  Not your typical modern minimalist hotel room.
text:
We loved the Ludlow, even though we (mid-50s) were definitely on the higher end of the age range from what we saw of other guests.  The King Studio was roomy and had a huge bathtub/shower combo.  Hubby enjoyed a soak in the tub one night and the rain shower was easy to use and not wimpy.  One note, I'm on the short side ~5'1" and it's a high leg up into the tub, so it wouldn't be good for someone with balance issues since there was no grab bar.  The room has a nice sitting area and since we were on the end of the hall, it was very quiet most of the time.

There is a fabulous restaurant in a garden-y type room off the lobby with very helpful wait staff.  We weren't really too hungry, but didn't feel like going out, so we ate there and ooh la la!  Very tasty French cuisine with a twist.  Portion size was just right (not too big), so we finished our meals.  The bar/restaurant/lounge area seems to be a local hot spot and was crowded and some of the noise trickled up to our room because we (3rd floor) overlooked that area on the first floor, but it was happy noise, so all good.

It was a married-couple getaway without kids for us, so we spent a little more for a romantic, unique hotel near shopping that we like in East Village - easy walking distance.  24 hour parking is right across the street and subway stops are a few blocks away.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: la mia scelta n.1 a nyc
text:
Quando torno a New York ormai il Ludlow è la mua scelta obbligata. 
Lo sappiamo li spazio nelle camere degli hotel di NYC non può accontentare tutti.
Al Ludliow però, soprattutto se la scelta cade suglu skybox, il comfirt é assicuraro. Bellussimi i bagni. Fantastica la lounge e il ristorante. 
Vista mozzafiato su Lower Manhattan.

title: Artsy hotel
text: The rooms are small, but that was to be expected. The issue is there was no room to put anything other than a few hooks for coats and maybe pajamas. There is a very small half closest to hang clothes but there are no drawers and only one little space at the bottom of the closet. There wasn’t much space to leave a suitcase open. The night stand was a “log”, so there was no place to put my glasses when going to bed. The room as 77 degrees when we checked in while it was in the 30’s outside. We had to use the AC, which turned out to be incredibly loud every time it came on. In addition to the AC noise we could hear the street traffic below, late into the night. We were on the 15th floor. The pillow were flat and not comfortable at all. There is a Nespresso machine on one of the night stands with pods in the closet. Not the easiest set up. The bar is trendy and expensive. Four drinks were $80 before tip.  When we left our room to check out, there was the distinct aroma of the floor of somebody having gotten sick on the carpet. It made waiting for the elevator a bit challenging. Yes, this was mentioned to the front desk when we got down there. While waiting for our friends in the lobby we attempted to have a cup of coffee, but it was cold. The location is nice and there are a number of surrounding places to eat and shop, but the size of the room and the trendy bar are not going to bring us back.

title: Skybox Loft
text: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay at The Ludlow.  Staff were friendly and the neighbourhood is filled with galleries, restaurants and bars.  We stayed in a skybox loft because we wanted a great view and a tub! The furnishings are starting to get a little worn ... not badly, just worn and scuffed here and there. The only things I would have preferred is a king size bed and a place for our suitcase. Everything is compact, but very tastefully done! We didn’t eat at the restaurant but it was always busy, along with the lounge, so I’m assuming this is still the place to be.  Trendy and a lovely old school NYC vibe.

title: Work Trip
text:
This hotel is super cool. Right in the centre of cool lower east side. The rooms are on the small side, but hey this is New York! Small yes but luxurious. And it had the bathroom of dreams... and the view? Could never tire of it.
Downstairs for the bar or breakfast, the ambiance is New York understatement. Have stayed twice now, looking forward to my 3rd visit. Only thing, some of the Front of House staff could be friendlier.

title: Charming retro hotel but a bit bit too far in the lower east side
text:
The room was charming, well decorated.. but very small. the bathroom however is rather large for NYC. As always air conditionning is very noisy.
Disapointement with breakfast : muffin came cold,  I had to wait at least 15 minutes to be served, granola thick as a brick in my stomach..
So why not but I will not be back

title: Truly amazing!
text: Words can not describe how amazing my stay at The Ludlow was. The staff was amazing, room service promptly corrected an issue. The customer service was like no other. The rooms are cozy the views of the city breath taking (stayed in the skybox 18th fl) you got to stay here at lease once. I will return!

title: Favourite hotel in Manhattan
text: I love the chilled out atmosphere and the hotel has a cool contemporary decor throughout. Good food and cocktails are served at the restaurant downstairs. And the whole downstairs area is a good place to hangout. The rooms are clean and a good size for Manhattan.

title: 素晴らしい
text:
エントランス…
ロビー…
ラウンジ
部屋…
景色…
サービス

全てが良かった
たった1日しか泊まってないけど…笑笑

部屋番号1804
また泊まりたい

title: Always a great experience.
text:
In my line of consumer experience consulting work, I do quite a bit of traveling to many major cities (e.g. NYC, LA, etc.) and usually end stay at a variety of nice boutique and higher end chain hotels.

I've stayed at the Ludlow numerous times.  In short, the Ludlow never disappoints. From the design, to the helpful front desk staff, to the quaint lower east side location...it's a fantastic place.

title: Fine coziness
text:
Great vibes, scent and people watching in the public areas. Fireplace was a nice touch in the cold winter nights. It would have have been nice if the roof was more inviting during this season too as the view is incredible.
I stayed in the mini studio for a couple nights. The room had just enough space for myself, not sure it would work for a couple.

title: Great old school hotel in a fantastic location for exploring on foot
text: This quaint hotel has NY-sized hotel rooms but they are nicely appointed and our room came with a large shower and a separate tub (which was bonus for my wife).   Room service is provided by the fantastic Dirty French restaurant that is on-site, and the first floor bar/lounge area is fantastic.  Front desk service was top-shelf -- friendly and very helpful.  The hotel location makes it easy to walk around the LES, East Village, Greenwich and West Village (also close to a B/D subway stop, which is great).  There are plenty of nearby options for eating, drinking and shopping.  As a bonus, we walked across the street at 930am on a Friday to eat at Katz's deli and there was no line -- at 945am, the line was building for the day.  We will stay at the Ludlow on our next NY visit.

title: Hip and expensive but a wonderful treat!
text:
Spent ages looking at hotels in New York before settling on this one... everything was so expensive in September and this was no exception but I wanted somewhere special rather than a normal chain. I made my choice and wasn’t disappointed!

Uber trendy venue with prices to match. The ground floor bar is always pumping in the evening. Felt a little awkward taking up space in it as a solo traveller but I did it anyway! Great drinks selection... if you don’t mind paying.

My room was on a high floor. I’d been worried it would be super pokey as I know how much you pay for space in NYC but it was a decent size, lovely big comfy bed, a couple of arm chairs and a fab balcony from which I could watch the bustling street below or look over to the Empire State. What a treat!

Wonderful bathroom. Lovely tiles. Great toiletries. Cozy robe, soft towels. 

I didn’t eat at the hotel at all... drew the line at the cost there! But the restaurant did look lovely. There are tonnes of choices on Ludlow Street and the surrounding roads though so no need to go far at all for breakfast, lunch or dinner. It’s such a buzzy, trendy area.

There is a small gym on the very top floor. Wonderful views over NYC while you are running!

Oh, and the building itself it beautiful. Love the windows! 

It’s a treat, but I’ll definitely come back!

title: Excellent !
text:
Je viens de passer 7 nuits au Ludlow Hôtel. Un studio queen au 16ème étage (1606), vue de folie sur le World one trade center d’un côté et l’empire state building de l’autre (en se penchant un peu). Emplacement idéal pour découvrir tout le sud de Manhattan à pieds, le métro n’est pas loin pour aller uptown. Chambre et salle de bain  très très très propres, un must mais pas toujours le cas et très bien insonorisée. Lit hyper confortable... 
Personnel très serviable et souriant, ils m’ont recommandé le meilleur endroit pour acheter des bagels que je voulais ramener en France. Bref, j’ai adoré et si je dois revenir à NYC je reviendrai au Ludlow Hôtel.

title: Ladies weekend in NYC
text:
My best friend and I met up in NYC and stayed at the Ludlow for one night. The hotel is beautiful from the moment you walk inside and see the cute bar and check in area. The hotel is right next to Katz deli, which looked pretty popular, and just far enough from all the NYC Times Square craziness that you really get to see a different side of the city. It was much quieter and less busy during  the day, and pretty popular at night with plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance too. 

The check in process was easy, and they were extremely friendly. The room (queen bed) was slightly larger than your typical NYC hotel, extremely clean, and a very cute set up. The elevator could get pretty busy in the evening, but otherwise all was nice. It was pretty windy the night we spent there, but we ventured onto the rooftop to see the gorgeous view on NY. 

We also checked out the bar? Which had tasty (and strong) cocktails, on the pricey side like most restaurants in the area. Great vibe in the evening. 

Overall, it was an excellent experience and I’m looking forward to going back!

title: Chic place for families as well
text:
Beautiful AND spacious room, large enough for a family. There where to bedrooms, so we can sleep separated from the kids. The location is good, merto line is a short walk away, and the neighborhood is fantastic too. 
I loved the stylish and chic interiors of the hotel.

title: Great for a long weekend
text: I stayed in the queen studio for three nights this month and had such a wonderful time! The ludlow was very clean and felt safe, and what I loved most about the room: windows! It was so bright and we had a fantastic view over the city. The room was small but it was just right for us once we stuffed our luggage under the bed. Location was great, close to Soho and walking distance to a few of our favorite restaurants and bars. Will return!

title: Return to The Ludlow
text:
We stayed at The Ludlow in mid 2017 and saw no reason to change when re revisited NYC in late 2017. And no regrets. Loved it.

In our earlier visit we had a room with a terrace which, at that time of year, was perfect but totally inappropriate for the freezing conditions in December! This time we opted for one of the King rooms with a giant bath tub - perfect after a day out in the snow and ice!

Add a roaring fire in the lounge, friendly and helpful staff, great bar and a great location for exploring the lower half of Manhattan and Brooklyn (even getting up to mid-town or upper-west/east side via FDR or West Side Highway was fine outside peak times).

title: The ideal Manhattan boutique hotel
text: I've stayed at the Ludlow numerous times since it opened and it never diasppoints. Lovely rooms with great showers and charming design. The restaurant and 24 hour room service are yummy. And the staff are attentive and helpful. The beautiful garden lounge is a great place to work during the day and in weekend evenings it's jumping with attractive people. Such a cool hotel.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We loved our recent stay at this hotel.  Decent-sized room (we stayed in a Studio King) and a good-sized bathroom (with a very deep bath tub and overhead shower.)  The design of the room was very characterful, and cozy.  We liked the large, comfortable bed, and nice bed-linen.

Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, although staff in the bar were a bit 'too cool for school.'

Excellent location - the hotel is situated near many great restaurants and bars, and is only a short walk from the subway.

title: A Decent Sized Room in New York that I Could Afford
text: Just stayed at The Ludlow for a couple nights while attending some meetings in NY.  Overall, it was a great stay.  Had a wonderful room on the 6th floor that had a king bed, decent bathroom, couch, two easy chairs, desk space, and a very nice large TV.  It was quiet, with neither outside noise or noise from other rooms or corridors being discernible. The front desk staff were extremely helpful on a couple occasions when I needed advice or some stuff printed.  The in-house restaurant had prices toward the low end of hotels in NY, and the food was way above average for the breakfast I had there.  The location also is quite convenient to a number of other places, from Katz's deli across the street to Lavagna, a great Italian restaurant about half a mile or less and an easy walk.

title: Great hotel, mediocre bar
text:
Firstly I wanted to start with the positives about this place. Location location location: slap bang in the lower east side just off East Houston you’re a walk away from some famous New York locations (Katz’s deli is 1 minute away, the Bowery and little Italy are nearby) and fabulous restaurants and bars. 

Rooms are on the cosy side but this is New York, but they’re comfy and well thought out. We were greeted by some of the best reception staff I’ve met. Truly brilliant and helpful, friendly and just awesome. Thank you for that. 

Now the one bad experience we had was at the attached bar. Total opposite to the rest of the hotel vibe - firstly cocktails are expensive and in a city renowned for its mixologists, just not very good. Sorry but they’re not! Also staff are appalling. I get that they’re prob doing this while they wait for their modelling career to take off, but seriously I’ve rarely not tipped before and this was one time where I just couldn’t. Arrogant is a good word for them. It ruined the whole “it’s cold let’s have a drink at ‘home’” ideal for us. 

Anyway yes I’d recommend this place for a stay but maybe dine and drink out instead.

title: Great Stylish Hotel in Great Location
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow on a business trip and loved the hotel. It has a great vibe to it with a cool and cosy bar space, large fire place great restaurant, friendly staff and amazing rooms. I was in a smallish room but it was still designed in a really inspiring way- the bathroom was amazing. Location was perfect - we walked and got the subway almost everywhere and theres loads of cool eateries around the hotel.
Would definetely return!

title: Instagram hotel :-)
text:
Very cool location in lower east side. There’s some great places to eat and drink around the hotel! Soho is nice 15m walk away... down side is... the whole area is a major party district... the hotel itself included...

The design of the hotel is nice, stylish, cozy and old school at the same time. Very cool bathrooms, nice wooden floors. 

Anything outside of suite is very small... count with that... (even for NYC, I would say). 

The hotel is full of beautiful fashion people and instagramers... count with that as well...

Dirty French (restaurant downstairs) is ok... but they’re better places around...

title: Cute, comfy hotel in great neighborhood!
text: Really cute and chic hotel in the East Village.  Was in town for a family gathering at Momofuku Ssam Bar which was a short cab ride away, but hotel was close to lots of other tasty, popular spots (Katz's Deli, Russ + Daughters)!  Was freezing cold, but the hotel was so warm, cozy and inviting with friendly staff and lovely rooms!

title: Okay...
text:
Upsetting that the rooms were small

We had a double suite and it was small and squishy 

Rooms were very dark which was annoying 

The staff were excellent in every aspect

The hotel is in a cool area but still far from the 'action'

I wouldn't stay here again

title: Fantastic hotel in the East Village
text: Excellent hotel. Great location in the east village. At a walking distance to Soho, TriBeCa, Nolita and the West village. Well connected to the rest of Manhattan by public transportation. Rooms are finely decorated and comfortable. Perfect beds. Large bathrooms. Cleaning service is really excellent. The lobby bar is cozy and the fireplace creates the inviting scene. All in all certainly very recommended.

title: Cozy boutique hotel
text: We had a loft king with an awesome view. Great part of town for relatively uncrowded and interesting eateries. Small fitness center with penthouse view. Restaurant was a bit too upscale for our family needs so didn’t try it. Friendly staff.

title: Stylish hotel in a great neighbourhood.
text:
This is a fantastic hotel located in the wonderful Lower East Side. Situated just a stones throw from the famous Katz Deli and across the road from a great burger joint (Black Tap), you are not short of places to find a decent bite to eat. We also tried Clinton Street Baking Company just 5 mins down the road which served a fab breakfast. 

The hotel itself has a really cool vibe. Reception staff were smiley and helpful, door staff were courteous and professional. They really helped us out when we needed a cab to JFK on our last day too. The downstairs bar was super cosy and served great cocktails. We didn’t try the restaurant but that looked excellent too. Our room, although quite small, was packed with all the amenities you need and the coffee machine was a godsend! The regular restocking of capsules was very welcome indeed. I loved the view of the city from the roof terrace and the gym looked good too. Would thoroughly recommend and I wouldn’t hesitate to visit again if I return to NYC in the future.

title: Lovely hotel
text: My daughter moved back to the lower east side last summer, and The Ludlow is now my “go to” place to stay when I visit her. It is really a little oasis in the city: quiet, comfortable,  very well maintained rooms and friendly, helpful staff. I had a nice view out my window but no intrusive street noise. The beds are all great, nice bath products and luxurious bathrooms, excellent restaurant. I look forward to coming back!!

title: Super Hotel, sehr freundlich
text:
Hotel mit Stil und Charme. 
Wir waren 5 Tage dort und hatten einige Anliegen, bei denen uns sofort und sehr freundlich und professionell geholfen wurde - Äußerst freundliche Mitarbeiter!  Wir wollten z.B. nach der ersten Nacht das Zimmer wechseln, da wir versehentlich  ein Queenbed statt Kingsizebett (ist breiter) gebucht hatten. In 5 Min war alles erledigt und bereits am Vormittag erfolgte der reibungslose Zimmerwechsel.
Vergessene Gegenstände aus dem ersten Zimmer wurden sofort nachgebracht. Das Personal an der Rezeption ist überaus zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit- egal ob es um ein Taxi oder das Versenden von Postkarten ging.
Die Zimmer sind unterschiedlich- das Skybox Loft hatte eine tolle Aussicht mit vielen Fenstern und eine Badewanne, ist jedoch so verwinkelt geschnitten, dass es für zwei Personen für 5 Tage eng wird. Das King Loft (in das wir dann wechselten) war viel besser geschnitten (Platz für Koffer etc. - obwohl es die selbe Grösse wie das Skybox Loft hat), Aussicht auch gut aber keine Badewanne. Kommt eben drauf an, was man will.
Das Wasser im Bad/Dusche hat einen guten Wasserdruck und ist sehr schnell heiss, ein Traum. Die Klimaanlage/Heizung funktioniert super, ist aber teilweise sehr laut- ist aber in vielen amerikanischen Hotels so.
Die Zimmer waren sehr sauber und nett eingerichtet. Tolle Minibar.
Der Zimmerservice war freundlich, schnell und große Portionen. Das Restaurant „dirty french“ bedient auch den Zimmerservice- daher darf man keie typischen amerikanischen Gerichte erwarten- es ist alles „französisch“ angehaucht. 
Die Subway ist zu Fuss in 5 Min zu erreichen, es fahren aber auch immer Taxis herum. 2 Min vom Hotel gibts einen Grocerystore, wo man alles bekommt (Getränke, Obst, Sandwiches, Schokolade, Chips etc.).
Die Gegend ist sicher und man kann problemlos herumlaufen.
Tipp: den Sonnenaufgang auf der Dachterrasse im 20. Stock genießen- tolle Aussicht!

title: Consistently Excellent
text: This was my second stay at the Ludlow and it felt like returning to a friend's home. My room was a bit larger during this stay, with a little sitting area which was convenient for working remotely. Plus, they kept the coffee maker stocked for me :) I also wanted to note that I accidentally left my noise cancelling headphones in the room upon checkout and didn't realize it until I reached the airport. I called the front desk in a panic, but the headphones were located promptly and shipped back to me within a few days. Great service!

title: Intimo
text: Este hermoso y exclusivo hotel también abre sus puertas a personas que no se alojan en él. Tiene una barra preciosa para tomar el trago que te imagines, y un restaurante con platos exquisitos. Te sentis en un ambiente exclusivo y privado. Ideal para una cita

title: Cool Hotel
text: We really loved to stay there. In the evenings hotel turns into a very popular place to hang out. It's very alive. And all the crew was amazing. The are very energetic and smiley. I would love to stay there again.

title: Great hotel
text: First time in New York, perfect location! We had a room with patio which was brilliant.Close to subway, bars + restaurants, Katz deli across the road, Russ + Daughters in the next street.Only complaint was the elevators...SOOO slow!! A bit noisy at night with sirens etc but it is NY.

title: Great hotel in an interesting area
text:
Had a great long weekend here really good for good bars, local specialist shops and close to little Italy and Chinatown. Really great stay in a Lovely room in this really stylish but friendly hotel. Couldn’t fault it and definitely will be back

Right near Katz deli and Russ and daughters bagel place.

title: Du style dans un quartier qui bouge, mais manque de place
text:
J'ai vécu quelques temps dans le Lower East Side, et pour ce voyage, j'avais choisi de séjourner au Ludlow. 
J'aime beaucoup le lobby, le bar et le restaurant : les portions y sont généreuses, et on y mange assez bien. 
C'est convivial et bruyant comme partout à NYC. 
Bémol 1 : seulement deux ascenseurs pour les 20 étages de l'hôtel, on perd parfois dix minutes à attendre un ascenseur.
Bémol 2 : la taille des chambres. Avec deux grosses valises, vous êtes très vite à l'étroit. 
Le point bonus : allez faire un tour à la salle de sport, située sur le toit. La vue est incroyable. 
Lever du soleil côté Brooklyn, profitez du jet-lag pour vous lever tôt :)

title: Trendy and cosy
text:
Me and my partner loved this trendy and cool hotel. The staff members were friendly and welcoming and the room was very cosy and comfortable.

The bar and restaurant are also very nice and the breakfast was great!

I will stay there again next time I go to NY!

title: Cool rooms, great service, perfect location
text: Room looked like something out of a West Elm/Anthropologie catalog - very hip, pretty, comfortable with huge windows/great light (rare for hotels in the Lower East Side, especially) and was on the roomier side (for NYC). Just steps away from all the major subway lines and hundreds of great restaurants/bars/things to do!

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text:
Great location and very swanky hotel but not stuffy. Yes the rooms are small but it's NY. The bar area is lovely and we also ate breakfast in the restaurant which was great. Very close to a metro station, lots of cool bars and restaurants in the area.
We had a room with the terrace and as it was April we really enjoyed sitting out then when we had returned from a day out.
Staff very nice in the hotel and check in very easy. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great intro to the Lower East Side
text:
We loved our stay in a Loft King room on the 16th floor. The corner setting offered great views south and west and there was even a small balcony. Floor-to-ceiling windows made the room seem bigger than it already was. There was an appealing seating area and the bed was very comfortable. Shower felt huge and had tremendous water pressure.

We'd stayed at the Ludlow's sister property, the Marlton in Greenwich Village, and were interested in trying things out here. I was a little concerned the Lower East Side location would feel out of the way, but Ludlow Street is lively and full of options for meals, drinks and coffee. Katz Deli is at the corner and the less-touristy but just as good Russ and Daughters Cafe is on the next street.

Like the Marlton, there's a lively scene on the ground floor with a pleasant living room-like lobby with fireplace and bar. Give the restaurant, Dirty French, a try if you have the time, even if only for breakfast.

title: Superbe hôtel au chic rétro au coeur du Lower East Side bouillonnant
text: Merveilleux hôtel, à l'ambiance à la fois délicieusement rétro et d'une coolitude très moderne, où tout est conçu pour se sentir bien. Dès le lobby, tout de boiseries sombres, fauteuils en cuir, carrelages en mosaïques et lustres aux lumières savamment tamisées, on pénètre dans un univers agréablement feutré où un feu brûle dans la belle cheminée. Les chambres sont dans la même tonalité: grands lits hauts et moelleux, parquets, poutres au plafond, salle de bain au chic rétro. Privilégier les chambres en angle et étages élevés, à la vue réellement fracassante sur le sud de Manhattan. Les chambres ont une surface tout à fait correcte pour NYC, où elles sont généralement petites. Service très sympathique et disponible, à l'écoute. Petit déjeuner très (trop?) copieux et délicieux mais un peu cher, servi dans la très belle salle du restaurant. Le quartier est formidable, à la fois très central pour rayonner à pied dans Manhattan et plein de superbes petites adresses à l'écart des sentiers battus, pour vivre à la New-yorkaise: délicieuse cuisine juive ashkénaze chez Russ and Daughters, sandwichs au pastrami servis chez Katz's, où fut tournée "la" scène d'anthologie de Quand Harry rencontre Sally, juste au coin de la rue; Momofuku noodle bar et ses ramen à tomber par terre; Clinton street bakery pour des petits déjeuners royaux; Pianos, "le" bar branché du coin et ses concerts en live tous les soirs; Lower east side, Bowery, Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Greenwich village, East Village, Brooklyn bridge, etc dans un rayon de moins de 30 mn à pieds. Bref, un rêve.

title: Amazing place
text:
Lovely welcome from hotel staff - they are very nice and helpful.
My room was quite largely sized for NYC standards. Decor of the room was tasteful and nice (soap, chairs etc...)
The view from the 20th floor is gorgeous - the general vibe is cool but laid back (not posh)
I'd definitely recommend the hotel

title: Fun hotel AND the best sleep ever in 2 bedroom suite
text: The hotel combines great customer service with a young trendy atmosphere. It is surrounded by an energized neighborhood including its own lobby bar. I had the best nights sleep in the smaller bedroom of their 2 bedroom suite which is set up "railroad" style. There was typical NYC street noise in the larger bedroom facing the street. We had a great stay for our "girls trip" but it would be just as nice for a romantic spot or even a family of 4.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I honestly cannot say enough nice things about this hotel! 
The position in Manhattan is just brilliant! The best district for bars and great restaurants. The hotel is modern and vibes are great. The Ludlow staff are always helpful and courteous and extremely switched on
Rooms and beds are top level with great decoration.  Bar area is trendy and breakfast and dinner is delicious. I am looking forward to staying again very soon for a well earned treat! 5⭐️

title: Great hotel with energized vibe
text: My husband and I stayed at the Ludlow for 2 nights.  The hotel is upscale cosmopolitan. The lobby has Keith Haring - type art work - black backgrounds with white image.  This is carried out throughout the hotel, which gives it an entirely artsy hip feel. The rooms are on the smallish size, but, hey, this is NYC.  The bathroom is a good size with upscale amenities.  We had a balcony, which was really nice. The lobby is warm and inviting with a fireplace. You can sit as long as you like. It's right across the street from Katz's deli, and close to other eateries.  You can get a bagel and coffee and bring it in and enjoy it in the lobby. We didn't got to Dirty French, located at the hotel - but you won't go hungry if you stay here.  The hotel is clean and you don't hear the street noise.  Staff was warm and friendly and the doormen cheerfully got us taxis. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Over Priced !!
text: I never wrote reviews, however, at what worked out at just shy of £400 a night during the labor day weekend I thought I must. The room was extreamly small and basic. Hardly enough room to manoeuvre round and I am by far not the biggest person around. I mainly chose the hotel for the view however my room was facing west and better yet, another hotel and construction site so it was such a waste of money choosing this hotel. The room was clean and beds were comfy but I would say not to advertise rooms with a good view of the city when you can't offer that especially when people travel from all over the world and pay a high price to stay here.

title: Cool and lovely
text: Great location, wonderful bar, exceptional service. Would stay here again, actually will plan to. Walking distance to a lot of great spots! Terrace room was worth it. Bar and restaurant are wonderful.

title: Everything about this places is so so cool..
text: Spent a few nights in a loft apartment in this place and loved every moment. The design and vibe is very very cool. Staff were amazing, at times I felt like I was in a movie.. the breakfast was also very good, I had the eggs benny 3 days straight!! Great location as it's in the heart of east village with good access to walking and the subway.. if I ever return to NYC I'm staying here!!

title: جدا جميل
text: الهدوء.. والإقامة في هذا الفندق جدا هادئة لا تكاد تسمع صوتا . النظافة .. الغرف نطيفة ودورات المياه نظيفة. موظفين الإستقبال محترمين يوجد خدمات اخرى تستحق الاقامه في هذا الفندق والتجربه مره اخرى اشكر لكم حسن الااقامه

title: Love, love, love
text: We stayed in this hotel for a few days before and after our city hall wedding just before Christmas this year. We booked the beautiful skybox loft and it worked out perfectly for us. The light that came from the skybox was beautiful and great for pictures. The downstairs bar was also a perfect place to sit and have drinks with friends in front of the cozy fireplace. We will be back for sure!

title: Very nice hotel, hip neighborhood
text:
We had a queen studio for me and my wife.  Not a big room but enough space for us.  Room was well appointed with nice furnishings and TV.  I really liked the shower too.  All staff was polite and helpful.  We really enjoyed getting bagels from nearby then eating them in the hotel garden for breakfast.  There is a very nice view of lower Manhattan from the roof.  We didn't eat at Dirty French (the hotel restaurant), but it must be good as it was slam full every night.

Only a couple things to nitpick - there could be a bit of a wait for the elevators.  Wifi signal wasn't great on the higher floors (we were on 13).  

Overall a great stay and would definitely stay again.

title: Lässig, aber nicht nachlässig!
text:
Ein cooles Hotel mitten in Lower East Side, das sich aber nicht in Coolness verliert, sondern einen Top-Service bietet. Hatten eine schöne Junior Suite mit zusätzlichem Bett, aber das Master Bett war so groß, da passten auch drei rein. Als meine Frau Schmerzen im Fuß hatte wurde ein Sektkübel voller Eis geliefert und dazu noch eine Rolle Nylontüten, sofort und ohne einmal nachfragen zu müssen, damit wir gute Kältewickel machen konnten.
Guter Fitness Club im oberstenStockwerk, von dem aus, man sich an Manhattan satt gucken kann, während man ein morgendliches Work-Out absolviert.
Auf der RoofTop Terrasse wird nicht serviert, Geheimtipp ist aber, sich was hoch zu bestellen oder mitzunehmen und die fantastische Aussicht zu genießen.
Bar und Innenhof sind sehr gemütlich, abends ein sehr gutes Publikum.
Lediglich das Frühstück im Restaurant muss man nicht jeden Tag haben, dafür gibt ein der Nachbarschaft besseres.

title: Fint och bra läge
text: Mycket trevligt hotell med bra service. Fantastisk roof top dit man kan ta med egen dryck och snacks. Lite små rum, men fint badrum. Jag blev lite besviken över utsikten från vårt rum som var över en byggarbetsplats.

title: Great loft and room; a bit pricy and restaurant a bit of an attitude
text: We spent 4 nights in a great room on the 16th floor. The restaurant seemed to have a a bit of of superiority complex and paid no difference to guests. The lounge was a great area but morning courtesy coffee was usually tepid or even cold and the open fire was only for looks. The hotel is interesting with good potential but needs to be priced 15% lower to make us return and the restaurant either enlarged to include a guest friendly, non haute cuisine area like a coffee shop or the menu/restaurant enlarged to accommodate all sets of clientele, guests need to be encouraged to eat in the hotel throughout their stay.

title: Hip 'hood, hip hotel
text: Have stayed at The Ludlow a few times while in New York for work. Hotel is hip from the lobby to the rooms - fun/busy area with great bars/restaurants and coffee shops in every direction. Lobby is an excellent place for a cocktail/people watching. Rooms are quite small, but the bathrooms are spacious. I recommend booking a room with a soak tub for an extra dose of luxury. Lovely staff - I left my iPad and hotel contacted me promptly.

title: Amazing five nights.
text:
My wife and I booked a five night stay for the two of us and our 8 + 4 year old daughters. What an amazing stay. This was perhaps one of the best boutique hotels we have stayed in and it was great experience having gone from chain hotels (e.g. Westin/SPG) to The Ludlow in the lower east side.

Positives:
1. The location is incredible. If you want to spend time in NYC away from the tourists and enjoy the East Village and LES, this is the place to be. It was great visiting the LES where we lived 20 years ago and have it right at our door step. Sure having turned 40, we felt old and unhip walking through the lobby and past the Dirty French but staying at the Ludlow made us feel young again. The hotel is surrounded by great bars and restaurants --- Across from Katz's, down the street from Russ & Daughters, and a 10 minute walk to the subway.
2. Our room was incredible --- the decor was unique and interesting and spacious. We had a two bedroom suite which allowed my wife and I to have privacy while our girls were able to do their own thing. The amenities were luxurious and everything was perfectly laid out.
3. The garden had tables reserved for hotel guests. It was gorgeous and a great place to lounge and have a drink. Our kids ordered dessert and the staff were incredibly kind and accommodating. For a hotel that doesn't resonate as being for families, it was perfect for us and frankly it was great that no one seemed mind that our children were around.

The value was incredible, the atmosphere was amazing and the staff were excellent. There is no doubt that we will be visiting again ... perhaps this time as a get-away without kids.

title: Hip hotel
text: Een zeer hip hotel enkel jammer van de trage WiFi connectie en de hoge prijzen in de bar van het hotel. Kamer is relatie klein te noemen maar alle voorzieningen zijn voor handen. Vriendelijk personeel

title: Wonderful hotel, great location and staff
text: The Ludlow is  a. We'll run hotel in a. Fun location in the lower east side.  the hotel is well designed and lovely. the staff is very professional and super nice.  front desk staff, Sophia,  Joe and others ( can't remember names) really aim to please. the doormen, Tristen and Irwin(spelling?) were all so welcoming.  Great location, great bar/lounge. the only complaint is That I did not like the restaurant which is a separate business.. Not impressed with the restaurant . they do not aim to please except for the bartenders.  I wish hotel would get another  restaurant . the ludlow is one of my favorite hotels in the city and I have stayed all over the big apple. I will be back!

title: Fantastic Anniversary @ The Ludlow
text:
My wife and I were celebrating our fifth wedding anniversary this past August and looking for a boutique hotel option in the Lower East Side/East Village/NoLita/SoHo when we happened across The Ludlow's website. We can't say enough about the quality of the room and service that we had the pleasure of experiencing at The Ludlow. For anybody looking to stay in a truly spectacular NYC hotel room with an unparallelled view of the Manhattan skyline from the Lower East Side, request room 1508... it doesn't hurt that there's a great little terrace from which to take in the view and a drink or two (or a great little Nespresso coffee, which is provided for in room!). 

I would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Seeing New York from the Lower East Side
text:
The hotel was really nice. The check in was quick when i eventually arrived from the J train. I was in a mini studio as I was on a solocation and was relieved when it was on the 19th floor. Amazing views to the East. But also a brilliant view of the Freedom Tower from the front. Head to the terrace for more of the same.
The room was small but plenty big enough for one person. And the bathroom was really big. Great view, great tub and shower and plenty of space for my toiletries.
I didn't eat at the hotel as there were great options very close by (hello SweetChick!!) but the restaurant did look nice as i passed by. The lobby area was never that busy whenever i passed but i was rarely in the hotel during the day.
I could hear some street noise from below but i actually don't mind that at all - you're in New York after all. It's a bustling interesting area so i love that vibe.

I have to say the air conditioning was VERY LOUD. So much so i had to go and buy ear plugs so that I could sleep. I don't know but even though i turned it off, there was still a noise. The pillows were also soft but not uncomfortable. 

Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Ludlow. Within walking distance of lost of areas and close to several subway stations if you want to venture further uptown.

title: Unique
text: Although we only stayed at The Ludlow one night it was a great place to stay. The neighborhood was bustling and ecclectic. The decor was creative. You knew you weren't staying at a chain hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The 20th floor has a fitness center and outdoor terrace with great views of the Freedom Tower. The room was clean and comfortable. Really couldn't ask for more.

title: Quite average
text:
As any good hotelier will tell you, it's the little things that matters. 

Stayed a week. The neighborhood is quite a circus. A really good one if you want to go out and stay up late. The hotel has charming rooms with spectacular views and a good patio for breakfast. 

But... it's the little things that can get a seasoned traveler to give an average rating for what could have been an otherwise good stay. 

I showed up at the front desk at 2pm after two long haul flights. My room wasn't ready. Check in is at 3pm. Fine... But it could have been said with a bit more kindness and a lot less attitude.

I ordered toast and jam for breakfast. I only got apricot jam. I asked whether they had any other jam (I just don't happen to like apricot). No was the answer. Not 'sorry', not 'let me check in the kitchen', not 'can I get you honey or maple syrup instead'... Just 'no'. 

May not seem like much. But it's the little things...

I usually stay at the Ace. I wanted to change neighborhoods. It was interesting. But I'll be back at the Ace next time.

title: Great vibe
text: A lovely relaxed place to stay.  Visiting manhattan with friends and decided on one week in the lower east side and one on the upper west. The Ludlow is in the Lower East Side (think Sydney's Surry Hills x5). My room was s queen loft and by New York standards plenty big enough. Separate bath and shower in the queen loft is a winner and enjoy the lower east side visit from the bath or shower through lovely large windows. Beds are very comfortable and the pillows are amazing. Helpful staff and well appointed common areas make this a great choice in my opinion. A huge array of bars, cafes, restaurants & delis are within a stones throw. Ludlow Coffee Supply, two doors down, has great coffee. I have really enjoyed my stay.

title: Ludlow Hotel is the perfect mix of old New York feel and an upscale boutique... amazing.
text: My wife and I stayed here for my 40th birthday, and from the time we walked in we were sold. The decor is perfect, the staff is outstanding and the rooms are perfect. Early 1900's styling with amazing views of the city from the room (1903) and the huge soaking tub.  Lots of great spots in the immediate are for food and drinks too. We will absolutely return here!  The bar downstairs has a super comfortable relaxed feel with lots of seating that makes you want to never get up, and the rooftop patio at night is even better. I can go on and on about this place. A+++++

title: Hôtel branché dans un quartier en transformation
text:
4 nuits passés ici pour le travail - bel hôtel avec beaucoup de caractère et une clientèle jeune et branchée.

Les chambres sont plutôt petites (comme d'hab à NYC) mais avec beaucoup de bon goût et caractère.

Seul gros bémol de l'hôtel ce sont les ascenseurs... il y en a que 2 pour tous les clients et les personnel de l'hôtel... donc il y a la queue pour pouvoir prendre l’ascenseur dans les horaires de point... juste pas possible!!!

La prochaine fois je ne pense pas y retourner... il y a mieux à choisir

title: Perfect location, very pretty and comfortable!
text:
Major pros: the decoration feels very cool and elegant, and all the staff members we talked to there were perfectly helpful and nice. The bathroom was the prettiest part of the room, and I loved the balcony with the view as well. 
Some cons to keep in mind: the air conditioning was one of the loudest I had ever heard, and it was so hard for us to sleep with it on. So we turned it off (with some help from Michael at 2:30am from the front desk, major thank you for that!) and slept wonderfully after that. The pillows were lacking in fluff, and the room is quite small. It was very quiet in the room, except from the fact that there's a major traffic street right below, but that's just NYC!

title: Stylish in a great location
text: Booked the Ludlow Loft, and while it wasn't a huge room, it was spacious enough for the family. It was also quite affordable for what you get! Great style throughout the place, rooms, "outdoor" terrace, lobby. Very friendly staff. In the heart of LES, can't be beat. Would highly recommend!

title: Our first time was excellent
text: This was our first time staying at the Ludlow and everything about it was perfect.  My first milestone for excellence is polite service...and we had lots of it.  Even when watching them handle an irate, unreasonable customer, they were cool and professional.  The place is clean and stylish, but busy.  Re: location, it could only be better if they moved the subway line closer :-)  Great neighbourhood...but be warned: it's busy on the weekend, so expect some action on the street.

title: Great location and very comfortable
text:
I chose this hotel as I wanted to see another area of New York, it was perfect. Quite close to the subway so easy to reach other areas, the hotel was fantastic, comfortable and offered a great breakfast.
Not a big hotel, it felt more intimate with wonderfully decorated rooms and a big bathroom.

title: The perfect hotel for your stay in LES
text:
ROOM: I stayed at The Ludlow New York City in the Sky Box room and could not have been happier. My room was on the 12th floor and had the most fantastic view from all 3 windows in the sitting area and the balcony located next to the bed. I was truly sad to leave upon checkout.
HOTEL: The hotel has a rooftop patio which is open 24 hours on the 20th floor and has a many patio furniture and beds with an exceptional view. Downstairs in the lobby, the hotel has a fantastic restaurant that I recommend even if you're not a guest at the hotel as well as a bar with many comfortable seats and a garden at the back of a hotel which was very relaxing. The garden can get busy but don't worry as a hotel guest you can reserve a table. 
LOCATION: The location of the hotel was definitely one of my favourites, there are many amazing restaurants and bars just a short walk away, and you can easily walk to lower manhattan, east village, greenwich village, flatiron district etc.
STAFF: The staff at The Ludlow Hotel were professional, nice and respectful. This is one of the few hotels in NYC where the staff genuinely cares about their gusts, and i've stayed in many hotels all over NYC (I only review the exceptional and the terrible and The Ludlow New York City was definitely exceptional).
WIFI: Free and very fast

I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking to have a great experience/trip at a wonderful hotel. I will definitely return myself!

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Quick one night stay while visiting family in the area in March. Late with this review!  Room was very nice, clean, cozy and comfortable (loft, one king).  Lovely small balcony to look around the area from.   A family member had a room directly across the hall from me and that was even nicer (loft skybox) with a great sitting area and also a small balcony. Bathrooms in both rooms were clean, nicely appointed with a retro vibe. Bar downstairs was quite busy with some terrific specialty cocktails.  Cool hotel in a neighborhood with lots of great restaurants, bars, things to do. Shout out to The Mercury Lounge on Houston. Love this area!  Will stay again on our next visit.

title: Cozy & Great Atmosphere!
text:
We stayed in a skybox loft room and it was so lovely having the extra sitting room with windows all around and great view. Clean rooms and very comfy bed. Lovely friendly and helpful staff. This hotel is trendy, cozy and has a great warm atmosphere.
There are lots of places to eat close by and the famous Katz restaurant is right across the street ( where Harry met Sally ~ Wink Wink! ) Absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone and if we are ever back in New York this is the place we will be staying!! You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

title: Beautiful, unique hotel.
text: Some hotels try too hard to be hip, but The Ludlow does it somewhat effortlessly.  Found the service to be extremely welcoming, and the overall design to be timeless and beautiful.  The room feels more like staying in a guest room in someone's well-loved home, avoiding a lot of the mundane looks that 99% of hotels all have these days.  Stunning wood floors, bespoke decor, and luxurious linens.  The room was small, but that could be overlooked once you saw the amazing marble bathroom and tub with vintage gold plates fixtures and a huge sunny window overlooking the bath.  Not cheap, but worth every penny.

title: Alles bestens, zur Zeit aber Baustelle gegenüber
text:
Wir hatten ein geräumiges Dreibettzimmer im dritten Stock, wurden freundlich empfangen und haben vor allem die hervorragende Lage genossen. Die Lobby ist einladend, und die kleine Dichterasse des Hotels ein besonderer Knüller.
Schade für uns war, dass direkt gegenüber zur Zeit eine Grossbaustelle läuft. In ein paar Monaten sollte das vorbei sein und dann ist das Ludlow klar die beste Wahl auf der Eastside bezogen auf  Lage, Service, Ausstattung.

title: Einfach nur wundervoll
text:
Wir blieben nur für zwei Nächte in diesem wunderbaren Hotel. Die Doppelzimmer sind nicht sehr gross, aber bieten jeglichen Komfort und einer fantastischen Aussicht. Wir sind Kaffeeliebhaber, daher war die Nespresso-Maschine auf dem Zimmer ein klasse Extra, Minibar ist gegen Bezahlung aber bietet einige nette und vor Allem ausgefallene Sachen an. Das Personal ist freundlich, wenn auch einige etwas mehr hervorstechen als andere. Besonders die Doormens und der Nachtportier (leider haben wir uns die Namen nicht gemerkt, aber an dieser Stelle noch einmal ein herzliches Danke für deren Hilfe, besonders der Rezeptionist, der Nachts gearbeitet hat und uns sehr geduldig mit unserem Groupon Gutschein geholfen hat!).
Es liegt etwas abseits der wichtigen Sehenswürdigkeiten, ich würde es jedoch jederzeit weiter empfehlen!

title: Must hotel
text: Going to new york three to four times a year and The Ludlow its always the best option in the lower east side. feeling the buzzing of the hotel and the area in the evening. breakfast eggs and sausage the greatest

title: Love this place
text: Perfectly situated on Lower East Side, great rooms, friendly staff and a wonderful Winter Garden to work in. In the neighbourhood there are great places like Katz, meatball place and others. Highly recommended!

title: The Ludlow cosy raffiné en plein Lower East Side
text:
Le Ludlow m'a séduit pas sa superbe décoration, son charme et la petite taille des chambres apporte même du charme par leur agencement et les vues dont vous pouvez bénéficier.
Le restaurant Dirty French est excellent,
je recommande cet hôtel surtout pour les couples

title: Flott hotell, super beliggenhet!
text: Ja, rommet var lite, og ja, heisen gikk litt tregt, men det gjorde ikke noe, dette er et kult sted! All betjening vi var i kontakt med var hyggelige og hjelpsomme. Hele hotellet var (etter min smak) stilfullt innredet, og det var rent og pent over alt. Vi spiste frokost på restauranten nede første dagen, litt dyrt men godt. Mange restauranter for alle typer måltider i nærheten. Ikke langt til flere forskjellige baner, men også greit å spasere flere steder herfra. Dette er et supert strøk for de som har vært i NY før, og som "føler seg ferdig" med Midtown. Jeg kommer nok til å bo her igjen!

title: LUDLOW LOVE
text: This is a great hotel with lots of personality in the Lower east Side. Amazing restaurants right outside the door, cool coffee shops etc. Not corporate like being mid town, much more interesting and great area to just wander around. And HELLO! Nespresso in the room! Also I had the restaurant to myself for early breakfast....it was great. Will definitely be back soon.

title: A fine choice on the LES
text: I've stayed at the Ludlow for my last three visits to NYC and it has consistently been a wonderful experience. The rooms are quiet, peaceful and comfortable, with luxury amenities and great service. Special thanks to one of the front-desk managers, Nickeesa, who helped me when I left a valuable personal item in my room. On my next visit it was waiting for me in a lovely gift bag with a personal note. That kind of service is rare, especially in NYC. Nickeesa is just one of the many reasons why the Ludlow is a special place. I'll be back...

title: 1603, a room with a wonderful view on the lower East side!
text: What a wonderful experience we had in our 10th Design hotel worldwide! Thank you for receiving  us with your nice NY welcoming, cool and friendly style. Staff at reception and bell men at the entrance all very nice and eager to help. The hotel has a tasteful design, wonderful lounge, even real sparkling and "cool" fireplace on in AC environment in spite of the 35 °C degrees... you gotta love this Ludlow. The bedroom was nice and spacious, with full ceiling-to -floor windows and magnificent views on the glittering lights of NY by night. Nespresso machine with double refill 24/7. Great shower and bath products. Nice robes and slippers. And got a wonderful sleep on the great mattress plunging my head in as soft as a cloud pillows. The roof terrace on 20th floor gave us the extra 360° view and light breeze to enjoy a moment of solitude from the hectic buzzy life of this more and more trendy  NYC neighbourhood.  This is the perfect location for a great gastronomic progressive meal as some of the best and historically renowned places to eat are just round the corner of the Ludlow hotel, ie Katz's, Yonah Schimmel, Russ & daughters... and some newly discovered ones such as The Clinton's baking Company. Another wonderful resource for food nearby the Ludlow is the fresh and wonderful Wholefoods. And in the hottest times of the day, how sweet to watch a movie in the nearby independent movie theatre "Sunshine". The Ludlow, a winner design hotel for our stay in the city! Thanks for making our stay such a pleasant, full round, "glocal" experience!

title: Nice family stay SoHo
text: Comfortable rooms (had two bedroom), helpful staff, good location. Restaurant is very good but service is mixed: waited 20 minutes for a menu and water at breakfast (food was great) even after asking twice. Some great local cafes (Caffe Vita) and restaurants (La Contenta) nearby. Exploring south Manhattan and Brooklyn from here is convenient. A little noisy with lots of construction right now.

title: Nice hotel in a great location but missed the wow factor for us!
text:
We stayed here over New Years and when we first arrived the staff weren't very welcoming which didn't change much throughout the rest of our stay. This in it self is one of the main reasons why I wouldn't return 

Rooms are very small and dark, we paid extra for a living area but the room still felt cramped. The hotel was clean enough though
