The food downstairs for breakfast was really nice but we didn't dine there of an evening but there always seemed to be a nice enough buzz in the restaurant 

Overall we felt that the Ludlow was very much on the expensive side and I don't think it was good value for money. I wouldn't stay here again that's for sure. They need to seriously look at their customer service and try and add a bit of personal touch to peoples stays!

title: Chilled Birthday Stay @ The Ludlow
text: After a weekend of "no's" at The Roxy- unfortunately one of our favorite hotels- we decided to change "hoods". After looking our options we chose The Ludlow, we wanted to leave the clubs behind once we left them yet have a lively lounge available as well. We were satisfied with our choice, stayed in a high floor king loft and found the space adequate for a weekend and yes, the beds are as comfortable as everyone mentioned. However for a longer stay our personal choice would be for a bigger room. One more plus.. our dogie was able to join us. Perfect!

title: Hotel Ludlow on Ludlow
text: A worthwhile experience on /Memorial Day week-end. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small but very acceptable. Free wifi. A mini balcony with a view of the Freedom Tower. I stayed here to explore the Lower East Side.......which didn't disappoint. Art galleries, great food, great bars.

title: A great stay
text:
We chose the Ludlow because it is literally a 2 minute walk to our son's apartment; we were staying for over a week so wanted somewhere comfortable. Booked one of the rooms with a terrace which was well worthwhile.

The rooms are lovely, beautifully decorated with good fit-out, including a Nespresso machine, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was the same and the shower great. My only negative was that the room was a little small, just a bit tight - fortunately we had the terrace, almost as big as the room, which was a great place to sit with a drink or even have a meal (we stocked up a couple of times from the very close by Katz's Deli and Russ & Daughters and grazed on a couple of perfect NYC evenings); the terrace also had great 180º views from the Empire State in the north to the Freedom Tower to the south.

The public spaces - reception, lobby, bar, restaurant (Dirty French) - were very buzzy; sometimes took a bit long to get a drink but nothing excessive.

Staff were friendly and helpful.

The Lower East Side is a fascinating warren of restaurants, bars, coffee spots, shops and so on and the Ludlow is perfectly situated to explore it.

Would certainly stay again.

title: Stylish hotspot, service a little disappointing
text: We were looking forward to our stay in the Ludlow, because we knew the hotel was a hotspot in an upcoming part of town, that had fantastic views on NYC from the room. I arrived several hours earlier than my boyfriend. Upon arrival i had a print of our booking, my passport and a few bags with me. When we made the booking, a reservation was made on my boyfriends creditcard to ensure our payment. But i was not let into the room, because i did not carry that creditcard with me that we used for the booking. I explained that i had travelled a full day and that we had limited time in NYC, which made it extra important to be able to enter the room, have a shower and be on my way. Even when i offered to do a cash withdrawal for the full price of the first night, they refused to let me in. Now this could have been a bad start of a great stay, but unfortunately that was not the case. In out opinion this place has become a little to popular and the staff know it, acting a little to comfortable. Never once did we feel that the staff tried to do that little extra that will make a average stay a memorable stay. One to many times we had to wait for 20 minutes or langer to have someone take our order in the bar and lobby. If you are interested in new parts of NYC and into esthetics this is a nice place to walk into and have a drink. But we didn't feel that staying in the hotel was worth the price.

title: Incredible Honeymoon Experience
text:
My husband and I visited in July on our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience! We arrived after a horribly delayed flight at around 3.30/4.00am and headed straight to our room... it was perfect! Floor to ceiling windows, large bathroom with walk in shower and bathtub big enough for two. We opted for the Queen with bathtub.
The bed was super comfortable and the views over the lower east side/ Brooklyn were wonderful to wake up too. There was also a bottle of red wine waiting in our room as a gesture for our honeymoon which I thought was lovely (my husband and I still have it at home as a keepsake!) The view from the rooftop terrace is INSANE. really takes your breath away. Everyone we came across in the hotel was very helpful and super friendly. It's got a very hip vibe to it! We had complimentary breakfast at their restaurant Dirty French (not sure if they still offer this) it was delicious and filled us up for our days of exploring the city. LES is such a wonderful area to stay with plenty of places to eat and drink, Sweet Chick next door and Russ and Sons were two of our favourites, not forgetting the incredible frozen margaritas happy hour at PIANOS bar. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!
text: Wow, the Lower East Side really cleaned up from when I was younger! Love the hotel itself, the room was small but very comfortable. The deep bathtub was so inviting and luxurious. The atrium downstairs was a nice spot in the early morning to sit in the peace and quiet sipping on my cappuccino purchased next door, and noshing on my bagel and lox purchased at a nearby Russ & Daughter's. Walking distance to the many restaurants and shops nearby. Loved it!

title: Great weekend stay
text:
We really enjoyed this hotel.  The room
Was small but very well designed and non standard- meaning it had visual interest.  The lobby is very charming and there are lots of places to discover near by.  We enjoyed the restaurant downstairs (just for cocktails and apps).  Overall it was a very fun weekend.

title: Perfect location and very good rooms!
text:
Vi bodde hör i en vecka. Var lite oroliga för att man läst om att det skulle vara högljutt och mycket ungt folk. När vi checkade in blev vi uppgraderade till våning 10 och här är är det knäpptyst hela natten. Rummen är mycket fräscha med fantastisk utsikt. Sköna sängar och ett stort och rent badrum. 

Utsikten i lobbyn och baren är över Manhattan. Det finns även en rooftop bar som är otroligt fin!

Vi kommer absolut att bo här nästa gång.

title: A very good hotel with only one slight problem
text: There are so many great things about the Ludlow it is hard to know where to start. The rooms are lovely, the beds insanely comfortable, the staff hardworking and professional, it is close to the F Train to get to either uptown or Brooklyn. Katz's Deli is right across the street and an amazing gelato shop is right on the corner. We ended up having to use their car service for a few emergencies and the drivers were pleasant and extremely knowledgeable about the city. However...if you are a light sleeper, you need to know that the hotel sits very close to the intersection of Ludlow and Houston Street and there is a LOT of traffic noise that goes on into the wee hours; and by wee hours, I mean it starts to quiet down around 2:30 to 3 in the morning (oddly enough, it is actually quieter in the neighborhood at 8 AM than at 3 AM) They will provide you earplugs free of charge at the front desk and you may very well need them.

title: Charming hideaway - I would return
text:
The Ludlow was recommended to me by a friend and lived up to expectations. I had the smallest room, which says on the website it is for single occupancy but actually had towels, pillows, etc set up for two. It was a small but comfortable and attractive room, nicely furnished with a safe, iron, well stocked mini bar. There was a large, light and airy bathroom with a full bath tub and shower (the shower was good but hard to figure out how it worked). There's also a comfy lounge and an attractive little courtyard garden - I wanted to spend time hanging out in the hotel not just out exploring New York.

The small roof terrace on the top floor has a good view across to the skyscrapers downtown, and there is also a good view from the gym.

Staff were friendly - although the service in the restaurant at breakfast was hardly attentive and there aren't really lighter options for breakfast, like toast or pastries. I ordered a granola, fruit and yoghurt bowl, and the bowl was so full to the brim it was hard to eat.

I would definitely go back.

title: Fantastiskt hotell
text:
Under våra nio dagar i New York testade vi tre olika hotell på tre olika ställen, The Ludlow, Morgans (i Midtown) och Wythe Hotel (i Brooklyn). Ludlow och Wythe var magiska och mycket beror på läget. 

Ludlow känns fräscht och soft. Läste kommentarer om att personalen skulle vara griniga och bara bry sig om de coola människorna. Jag tyckte tvärtom att det var skönt att den amerikanska trevligheten inte var så påtaglig. Vi sa hej i foajén och det räckte gott. Jag älskade rummet på 13:e våningen med en fantastisk utsikt. Baren och restaurangen var toppen men det blir snabbt fullt med folk. 

Jag kan varmt rekommendera Ludlow! Jag kommer bo där igen nästa New York-resa.

title: Great hotel in cool part of NYC
text:
We spent Easter weekend in NYC and stayed at the Ludlow. Would I choose it again? It wasn't perfect, but yes. A very cool hotel, we bumped into Noel Gallagher in the foyer and another guest said the last time he was there Lady Gaga was holding a party.  We had lunch on the day we left in Dirty French - great food at reasonable prices.

We had a standard room, which was on the small side, very little storage either in the bedroom or the bathroom, so next time I'd probably opt for something a little bigger.  Despite our room being on the 19th floor it was still pretty noisy at night with the window a little open, but that was marginally better than the noise from the air conditioning unit. 
The staff  - the front of house staff were fine, a little disinterested perhaps. The cleaning staff were incredible - I have NEVER stayed in a hotel with such friendly cleaning staff!

The bar area is very cool - both the indoor and outdoor space. All in all a very memorable hotel in a interesting neighbourhood

title: Cool & Chilled
text: You don't have to be a 30 something media exec to stay here. We have just returned from a fabulous week at The Ludlow Hotel. Firstly it's in a great area, Lower East Side, with loads of food and beverage outlets (of all price ranges) close by. The common areas are very informal and beautifully furnished with loads of comfy sofas. The room (we had a queen) was small but adequate. I would go for a bigger room if your budget will stretch. The bed was really comfy and the bathroom was really great - there just was much room. The service was second to none, the staff were relaxed but extremely efficient. I would certainly return if I went back to NYC.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
Great Hotel, everything was good. Clean, and quiet room with a nice view, we stayed at the 14th floor.

Nice bars and restaurants in the neighborhood, don't miss Hotel Indigos rooftop bar across the street, really good view of Manhattan.

title: Wonderful base to explore the city
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights as a base to explore the city and were absolutely thrilled we chose it. The hotel is really well situated as it's only a 5/10 min walk to Essex St station which is a great base to get uptown or downtown. Getting here from JFK was straightforward just take the Airtrain and then the J or Z line. 

The room is great, with an amazing view of the city. Staff were helpful and the hotel is situated in the fashionable lower east side area of the city. There is a restaurant downstairs but we didn't eat there as there was so much choice nearby. There is also a great coffee shop next door. The gym is well equipped and offers views over the city, there is also a roof terrace. 

I would stay here again in a heartbeat and really enjoyed our stay.

title: great place to be based for business
text: Cool hotel, but doesn't compromise comfort. Excellent room with excellent large bathroom (rare in NYC). Location superb, convenient for Manhattan and Brooklyn with subway two blocks away and the LES at your fingertips. Service efficient and friendly. Restaurant downstairs and bar scene lively and excellent food.

title: 4 Day NYC Trip
text: We've been to New York a few times but visited this time as our son was playing in Carnegie Hall. Having stayed in busy central Manhattan, we wanted to experience some other areas of New York. The Ludlow was an amazing choice! Absolutely lovely hotel - lots of really nice touches and attention to detail. Lounge areas really comfortable with attentive staff.  Bedrooms tastefully furnished with amazingly comfortable bed! Loved the bath tub in the window 😀. Great area with huge choice of restaurants and bars. Highly recommended - would certainly stay there again.

title: Fantastisk rom - Skybox
text:
Hotellet ligger sentralt til på Lower East med masse barer, restauranter, butikker og små gallerier.

Hotellet har flere typer rom, men anbefaler å booke en Skybox. Fantastisk med utsikt til 3 kanter samt en liten egen balkong.

Rommet er koselig og på badet kan du bade med utsikt til One World Trade center.

Hotellet har en takterrasse og treningsrom. I tillegg til en koselig bar og restaurant.

title: Great product
text: Absolutely everything worked during my last stay. Easy check-in, great room with wonderful view, excellent bed and mattress, fluffy towels, fabulous toiletries, real hangers, super clean, great housekeeping, good attitude, buzzy bar, good staff. In NYC, it is so rare to find something that works this well.

title: Stay away from this hotel.
text: In March of 2017 my husband and I stayed for 6 nights at the Ludlow Hotel in New York on Ludlow Street.  We were not only excited to visit my daughter and her boyfriend but also thrilled to visit New York City.  It was my husband’s first visit and my third after 35 years.  I’m sure you can imagine our anticipation to see my daughter as she has been living in New York for 3 years as well as all the “Big Apple” has to offer.  After 7 wonderful days with my daughter, we left the hotel along with my jewelry in the hotel room safe.  We called the hotel as soon as we realized.  The hotel said they had the safe opened and found nothing in it.  They can over-ride any combination.  We are outraged and terribly saddened. One of my losses was vintage gold earrings - a gift from my daughter - I can never replace them.  Is this the best of what can be expected from this establishment?   It has left a very bad taste for New York for us.   I would not recommend the Ludlow Hotel to anyone wishing to feel safe in a hotel in New York City.  Another much, much lesser issue we had is that when we ordered room service breakfast the attendant said that the hotel had run out of coffee and wouldn’t have any for 2 or 3 days.  We paid $250.00 a night for this!   Ronald Ullrich and Heather Anderson from Blaine WA.

title: Vaut le détour
text:
Hotel Tres bien placé au cœur d'un quartier trendy qui monte, qui monte... vues imprenables sur Manhattan avec la skybox room... demander étage élevé... restaurant et bar pris d'assault le soir. 
Personnel agréable sans plus

title: Good option
text: Ludlow hotel located near the F train which for me means good public transportation options.  Quaint hotel with modern attributes.  Staff unpretentiously friendly.  Great restaurant options at a walkable distance.  I took advantage of the hotel restaurant for breakfast and an evening cocktail.  Great night life atmosphere.

title: Rustic luxe meets French bistro
text: Loved this hotel in LES. Great decor. Great vibe. But more importantly, the most comfortable room we've had in NYC and a friendly helpful staff. Inviting and comfortable lounge for drinks. Did not try the restaurant. Variety of options within easy walking distance. Can't wait to go back!

title: Typical NYC hotel
text:
The rooms are very small ( just like most of NYC hotels), the food of the room service is not good at all ( I didn't like it ), you can hear your next room neighbor as if he was in your room ! 
The only good thing is the bar downstairs which is nice and cozy. 
Not coming back to stay in this hotel ... maybe to the bar

title: Hip, Fun Hotel
text: This is fun, hip hotel in a great part of NYC.  I recommend this hotel for guests looking to have a truer NYC experience than staying in the touristy areas of NYC.  The lobby and lounge area have a great vibe.  The front desk is very good but not the same level as a traditional five star hotel.  My biggest complaint is the noise at night is horrible, cars honking all night.  We were on a lower floor but even guests on the upper floors said the same thing.  I recommend this hotel but just know it is loud and not quite five stars but for the price, it is a great hotel!

title: L.E.S. GEM
text: Local NYer here, stayed at the Ludlow trying to "get away" in Manhattan and it superseded my expectations. Its a hidden gem in the LES and the studio rooms with the huge bathtubs are amazing. Abie from the front desk is the man! Thanks Ludlow!!

title: Super boutique hotel on LES
text: I love staying at The Ludlow. Even the smallest rooms feel cosy and the balcony feature in the larger rooms are a lovely touch. I would say that the front desk check in is always a little lacklustre in terms of energy and warmth no matter the time. However, the rooms, regardless of size, are always comfortable and well designed. The room is always well cleaned and presented. I love the beds, bedding and pillows there. They always feel fresh, soft and cocooning. The styling is beautiful and the lighting is well thought out. The sconces, overhead lighting and hallway lighting feel warm and boutique but it is convenient and designed so that you can switch them off at your bedside. The bathroom is well lit, beautifully designed with a well sized mirror and plenty of storage surface area. The showers are always hot with excellent water pressure. The small details in the bath mats and the Margiela robes are wonderful. I had water in my room on my first stay but not on the second but Housekeeping were quick to run some up to me. Housekeeping and Door staff at the entrance always seem friendly. Coffee is great in the room for a quick start to the day. The gym is small but has everything you need for a quick workout and the view is good. The roof terrace is a great feature.

title: Fabulous Stay
text: Stayed here for a business trip and was very impressed. The rooms were small on size (like most NYC hotels) but big on style and impeccably clean. Great service, the door guys and front desk were all friendly and helpful. Complimentary coffee in the lobby was a plus.

title: 4 nights in a very hip hotel
text:
We very much enjoyed our 4 nights at the Ludlow. My wife was in NY on business and the hotel's location in Lower East Side was ideal for her work. I'm not sure I'd recommend the LES for a "normal" holiday visit as it's certainly not a tourist area. But if you know London, think Shoreditch, Brick Lane and you'll get the idea. 

Our 7th floor room had a big terrace which would have  been even nicer if NY hadn't been snowbound at the time! The room was on the small side as all NY hotel rooms seem to be but it was very well appointed with a very comfortable bed. 

We only had breakfast in the hotel on our first morning - beware if you order "morning potatoes" and you're weight watching. My plate had no less than 12 roast potatoes!
Other mornings we went to the little coffee shop two doors down - excellent raspberry muffins! We had dinner one night in the hotel's Dirty French restaurant - we were seated in the Garden Room which was actually better as we could hear what we were saying to each other! The food was excellent but it is expensive. It comes as a shock when you're retired and have to pay for these things out of your own pocket! The rate of exchange at the moment isn't helping. 

The door staff, reception, room and waiting staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. If we had one gripe about the hotel it would be the bar and lounge service. The area is full of beautiful, trendy people (think fashion, social media types) all pretending to be really busy on their Mac books. Unless you fit into this category some of the bar waiting staff really give the impression they are doing you a favour by taking your order.  I see other reviewers have commented on this.

But that's a very minor complaint about an otherwise excellent hotel which I have no hesitation in recommending.

title: LOVED THE HIPSTER VIBE
text:
Stayed here at the end of January, and loved it from the moment I walked in.
The boys on the door, were cute and polite. The FOH staff efficient, knowledgeable and friendly. Everyone we encountered was so smiley and approachable. We ate breakfast here every day, delicious!
The room I had was spacious, clean and the bathroom beautiful.
I have never stayed in LES before, and I really enjoyed the area and all it has to offer in restaurants and bars.
Cant wait to go back.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow at the end of February and it was a real highlight of my trip to NY.   I had no idea when I was researching what was cool around the lower east side that this was THE place on the LES, so you didn't have to go far. 

I stayed on the 11th floor in a Skybox Loft room, which was great for 1 person.   An entrance hall led off to the bathroom on the right hand side, and then to the bedroom, and a sitting area with big windows on 3 sides.   The views are quite spectacular.  The bed was super comfortable, and it had a  Nespresso machine, and a well stocked mini bar. 

The Dirty French restaurant was fantastic, and the waiting staff were very friendly.  I ate there once in the evening and also had breakfast there.     All the food was amazing, plus there was Katz's diner over the road.    The area was great, didn't have enough time to explore it unfortunately. 

I will definitely be staying here again if I come back to NYC.

title: Outstanding Place
text:
My children chose this hotel for Dad's big birthday and we all loved it. Although it is very much on trend we 'oldies' did not feel out of place and the service from start to finish was impeccable. Our room on the 13th floor had two large windows giving fabulous views over the city. The bar area was great fun and we enjoyed the atmosphere and decor. Good local shops and restaurants in walking distance. 
Just go......it's superb.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
My wife and I celebrated her 50th birthday this weekend for a 4 day, 3 night stay at The Ludlow.  I have stayed on the lower east side before a few times in the past 10 years.  We are locals so to speak as we live on Long island and the city is a simple hour drive from home.  Simply stated, this was my absolute favorite stay in New York ever.

The hotel is simply wonderful in every way.  The rooms are immaculate and a normal size for a New York City hotel room.  We had a skybox loft on the 16th floor (goes up to 19).  It was slightly cramped but the view absolutely made up for that - GREAT views!  The bed was VERY comfortable and the roof was great to go up and chill and take in the views from the 20th floor.  The gym is located on this floor as well.  Our friends who booked one night to join us for a bit had a King loft and that room was a little larger and set up better.  It just didn't include a deep tub like our room.  I will book this room next time.

The lobby area is beautiful with tons of areas to relax, nice comfy couches and chairs and a crackling fire.  There is also a greenroom which probably has the roof open during the summer months.  Really pretty lobby.  At night, the lobby areas and restaurant get packed with a younger crowd into late night.  It is a happening place to be.  The neighborhood is one of my favorite parts of the city.  Anything you could want to eat or drink is in a two block radius.  The lower east side is jam packed with restaurants, bars and shops.  It is such a great area to just hang out and shop, etc.  

The hotel restaurant, Dirty French, was literally the finest meal I have EVER had ANYWHERE.  I do not say that lightly as I love to eat.  If you want to eat there you must make a reservation almost a month in advance as it is packed all the time.  The food was absolutely mind blowing and immediately became my new favorite restaurant in NYC.  I can't possibly recommend the restaurant more and I cannot wait to go back again - WOW!!!

The staff at The Ludlow were very nice and attentive to your every need - they do a great job and go out of their way to make sure you are happy.  Again, the rooms were really clean.  I'm sure it helps a little that the hotel is only 3 years old but..

We could not recommend this property more highly - it was SUCH a great weekend and I cannot wait to go back again.  Hopefully in the spring!!

title: Beautiful, chique hotel; awesome area, wonderful atmosphere!
text:
Absolutely fantastic hotel, full of character and charm. The first impression upon entering is of the lovely lounge/bar area with a fireplace and cosy greenhouse kind of garden in the back. We stayed in a studio queen room, which was just as shown on pictures, beautifully furnished and decorated; very chique. Bathroom and shower is gorgeous! Everything was immaculately clean and well thought through down to the smallest details. The room was equipped with a Nespresso coffee machine amongst other luxuries. 

The lounge/bar is cosy and calm during the day, and very lively and happening at night. The area around the hotel is great, lots of restaurants, cafes and bars you'll want to check out, and a very nice atmosphere in general. Venturing further afield, most of lower manhattan is easy to explore on foot from the hotel, with underground stations and cabs at the doorstep if preferred, offering easy access to midtown as well. 

We thoroughly recommend treating yourself to a stay at the Ludlow - we'll surely be back next time we're in New York.

title: Comfiest Bed award
text:
We stayed at The Ludlow NYC over New Years 17. 

The hotel was everything and more we expected. Situated in the Lower East Side of Manhattan the hotel is at the heart of an amazing neighbourhood with independent restaurants and bars. 

We didn't eat at the hotel but the food looked good. The staff were friendly and the rooms were just what you need.

Small well decorated rooms with Nespresso machines, a well stocked mini bar and a 50" TV with cable (perfect for watching the news/sports when getting ready).

The rooms were clean, and the bed was honestly one of the comfiest i have slept in. 

Look forward to staying here again.

title: Great hotel in excellent location
text: We really enjoyed this hotel - fun, young and funky in a great location a bit like Hoxton/Shoreditch in London.  View is great from the terrace.  Rooms are a decent size for NY (on our kind of budget anyway) with comfy beds and spacious bathrooms.  The bar has a roaring fire and massive sofas and was very busy with a young crowd in the evenings.  We didn't try the hotel restaurant or breakfast as there were so many super cafes and restaurants in the local area.  We walked miles and slept soundly, but there is some road noise that may bother lighter sleepers.

title: Check out this neighborhood!
text: The Ludlow Hotel is located in the heart of the Lower East Side which is a fun, young and hip neighborhood.  It is right across the street from Katz's Deli which is not to be missed if you have never been.  There are great shops and restaurants in the area.  The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff is very nice.  Our room was on the 18th floor and was very quiet.  It had a lovely view and a small balcony as well.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was perfect.  We also enjoyed a drink in the lobby bar.  And, it's relatively cheap for NYC! A real find!  Loved it!

title: Great Stay!! Super location! Loved it!
text: I really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Room is good size, bed extremely comfortable, linen is superb, felt like an angel on the clouds, love the bathroom! There is a roof terrace with great view and the gym is on the same level so you can work out while enjoying that view! Downstairs the lobby/reception is next to the modern bar which holds great nights with great crowd and great music. However, I wouldn't say it's family orientated hotel, it's more like young professionals, people enjoying cosmopolitan city environment.. There is a terrace on the ground floor too. All interior is modern and cosy, but at the same time looks luxury. The bar with fireplace, leather sofas and armchairs, and wooden floor - great spot to chill. There is as well restaurant. Breakfast is a la cart and you can pay straight after the meal or include in your final hotel bill. In the morning service is a bit slow at the restaurant as it's full of hotel residents, locals and business people, but food is yummy. Also, the famous Katz deli is just around the corner!! Great location! Definitely would stay there again! Btw, staff is very friendly and helpful too. I travel a lot and this stay definitely stay in my memories as one of the best stays in the city.

title: Excellant
text: This is one of the best hotels I have visited it doesn't sit in anyone era 1930's old New York YES 1970/80's Music era yes this hotel has everything love rooms fantastic conservatory and bar and the food is delicious

title: Fab experience...
text:
The Nomad Hotel was fully booked so I secured a reservation at The Ludlow based on the reviews that I had read here.I was incredibly happy with my choice. Like The Nomad the curators have done fabulous job giving the hotel a personality. The lobby and dining areas are beautifully realised as was my room. Oversized windows, four poster bed, cool light fittings etc.

I was offered an upgrade to the next category but wanted a room with a bath. And, what a bath it was. 

I received a welcome gift comprising a beautiful travel candle which is just one of the thoughtful touches I experienced. I also forgot my travel adaptor and one was provided for me gratis for my use throughout the stay.The reception staff were lovely to me and when you travel solo sometimes it really does make all the difference.

The surrounding area is 'interesting' but it is a shortish walk to Soho and I did not feel unsafe.

I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Wonderful Lower East Side hotel
text: The is a great place to base a New York Visit.  Close to the subway and walking distance to many neighbourhoods.  The "studio" rooms are small, but you expect that.  Great atmosphere.  Highly recommended.

title: LES hot spot
text: Beautiful lobby and adjacent restaurant, Dirty French. Very popular meeting spot after work and evening. Good food and shops everywhere nearby, as well as Tenement Museum; worth a visit for the history tours. The Ludlow's old structure has been carefully updated to squeeze in all you need in older small-space rooms. Fun gym at top of building and very able, friendly staff. Much more interesting than midtown.

title: Best Birthday Ever
text: I actually feel really bad because my stay was in July of 2016 and I never had time to write anything. I love the vibe and decor at the property. The room I had wasn't too big, but it had a huge terrace, so it was great to have people over and celebrate my birthday. The staff was attentive and super helpful. I did have a few drinks at Dirty French, but the best time was in my own private terrace hanging out on a warm Summer night. This place is a gem for people wanting to do a staycation (which is what I did) :-)

title: Service was excellent
text:
WE stayed at the Ludlow as part of a wedding.  My mother (grandmother of the bride) needs significant help getting around and they were incredibly helpful, storing a wheel chair, and her walker when needed. As she had never been to NYC and probably won't return, we asked them to arrange a cab to drive around Sunday afternoon. They allowed us to use one of their cars and drivers at the incredibly reasonable cost of $65/hour.  
The rooms are typical NYS rooms with minimal space, only 1 chair.  AS with all hotels, I thought the lighting was low.  Bed was very comfortable and they provided extra pillows for my mom.  Lobby was very nice for our group but was quite crowded on the weekend.

title: Sanctuary near the Bowery
text: Our stay was all too brief, but most enjoyable.  Staff were pleasant and responsive at all times.  The cleaning staff were especially courteous and quick, bringing extra foam pillows, removing excess minibar items, etc.  We stayed on the Fifth Floor and had a great balcony view over LES to the East River (lovely at sunrise).  Bed was warm and comfy.  Bathroom was spacious, and the toiletries from redflower dot com were sublime.  I loved the aesthetic of the bath -- mostly art deco with contemporary conveniences for today's travelers.  Yes, the rooms are small but not by NYC standards (or Paris, San Francisco, etc.).  Price is reasonable for the location and amenities, but the service and special touches make the Ludlow a great deal in lower Manhattan.  And the breakfast lounge/fireplace area is such a great place to hang out on a cold day while planning some city adventures!

title: A Cool Oasis
text: After staying in mid-town for the week a move to the cool oasis which is the Ludlow was the perfect way to enjoy Manhattan for the weekend. We had a king room with a terrace and although the weather was inclement it was great to be able to go outside to hear and the see the city breathe. We enjoyed the local bars and restaurants for Friday and Saturday and had a lovely dinner at Dirty French on our last night. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bathroom was a good size with classic 1950's style tiling. The lobby and bar area are very stylish in a sort of shabby subdued comfortable way. It all adds up to be a very enjoyable place to stay.

title: Ludlow Hotel
text:
The hotel was a joy!  Front desk - "3 Wise Monkeys" were helpful with all requests.  The small bar opening onto the main lounge & outdoor area is a treat. Best Pims ever to activate 6 pm refresh button prior to hitting streets again.  The hotel is well located to everything!   The surrounding streets provide a great choice of cuisines and all we sampled were very good.  The rooms,while not overly spacious worked surprising well given our 2 week stay.  Especially as we had considerable luggage which was rapidly expanding!  The Seperated bathroom worked well, despite the shower over the bath as it was not difficult to manage.   The King bed was super comfy.  This is a hip hotel beautifully styled with a comfortably cool atmosphere.
Room service was very accommodating.
I would heartily recommend this establishment if you love bespoke cool decor with helpful staff and excellent location to multiple service providers. It's like having your own little apartment but with necessary hotel services 24/7.  
Only regrets is that they could not provide a hot chocolate at the end of a long cold day!!  Ho Hum!

title: Charming Cozy Hip Hotel in LES
text: Lovely boutique hotel for the right person. Booked a 3 night stay in a King Loft. The room was well appointed but too dark and a bit depressing for my taste. My husband and I were in NY to visit our daughter who was staying with us for the long weekend. When I booked the room I was envisioning a living room with a sofa sleeper and a bedroom. Was very disappointed when I opened the door to our room and saw that the sofa sleeper was in the tiny foyer (very odd set up to me) then a long hallway to the bedroom. Thankfully I was able to cancel the remaining two nights to move to a hotel that better suited our needs. On a positive note the bed was amazing and the bathroom although small was very nice with luxurious amenities. The lobby area was wonderful and although we didn't get a chance to eat at the Dirty French it looked like a really cool restaurant I would love to try. The hotel is located in a very hip area with lots of restaurants, bars, shops etc. And the staff were extremely accommodating and very friendly.

title: Fashionable and cozy place in a very lively area
text:
If you don't want to spend a bomb in NYC and still stay in a lovely and fashionable hotel , look no further.

Excellent breakfast , lovely atmosphere , friemdly staff .A  Soho House feel , minus the price.

The rooms can be smallish so if you are a couple and have the budget opt for an upgrade, and you will end up in a small size apartment.

The hotel is in a very lively street full of quaint restaurants and bars, and the Gelato around the corner is something out of this world.

title: Warm, cozy and cool
text:
We visited in Dec 2016 as part of our annual nyc dinner with friends. We've stayed previously at another local lower east side hotel but wanted to change it up this year. Upon entering the hotel lobby , we were greeted very nicely by the staff and we're happy to see the fire place going on a chilly winter day. We Arrived late afternoon and the lobby bar was a buzz of people drinking and eating. There is a side garden room which is is a nice reprieve as its a bit quieter. The room was clean and a nice size for nyc with the ability to step out on a small balcony, a nice plus of fresh air. Our room was at the end of a long hall and was quiet . We did hang in the lounge after eating dinner nearby and enjoyed ourselves by the fireplace . The hotel was super busy and we were unable to get a table for brunch the next day but enjoyed ourselves at a local spot nearby . Note - housekeeping is prompt for check out was at noon which is nice but after a very late night we needed a few extra minutes . They come a knocking like 10 minutes after so be sure to get yourself out in time
. Glad we choose to switch up our hotel and would return again happily .

title: Drinks with friends!
text: We met friends for drinks late last night and all I can say is that this place rocks!!!  Great atmosphere, drinks are delicious and the music was perfect!  This chic style lounge is a must in NYC.   I love the large space and the different rooms... next time I'm in town I will book at this hotel as I hear it's just a cool as the rest of this hotel.

title: New Year's Eve in NYC
text: Das Hotel liegt in einer eher schmuddligen Umgebung in der Lower East Side, hebt sich aber wohltuend davon ab. Das Haus wirkt innen etwas düster, da alles in schwarzen und braunen Farben gehalten ist. Ich war über Silvester dort, als die Preise natürlich gepfeffert waren. Das Hotel hat 20 Etagen, einen großen Restaurant- und Barbereich sowie eine Dachterrasse mit Blick auf die Manhattan Skyline. Die Zimmer sind für U.S. Verhältnisse ziemlich klein. Die beiden Metrostationen der F -Line 2nd Ave und Delancey St liegen ca. 500 bis 800 m entfernt.

title: Fantastic view. Very good hotel.
text:
Sky loft room was fantastic if a little small for the price - but its NYC. The view was brilliant and the room very comfortable. Mean not to supply bottled was complimentary.

Bar is expensive but comfortable. Dirty French was decent for brunch but not the best - we didn't bother for dinner.

Service varied from very good to slightly too cool/ indifferent.

Overall highly recommend and would stay again.

title: Beautiful hotel in great location
text: We loved our stay at The Ludlow. The hotel is beautifully decorated from the lobby bar to the rooms, and the rooms themselves, while small, are cosy with very comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms. The location is fantastic, within walking distance of so many amazing restaurants and bars. The only disappointment for us was that while the check-in staff were friendly and helpful, the bar staff were aloof and at times rude.

title: Nicest hotel in NY?
text:
Trevligt hotell med bra läge. Lite hipp men ändå avslappnat och lugnt. 
Utmärkta rum, vi hade ett Double Room , två rum i fil med snyggt badrum. Perfekt för en familj med två tonåringar. Alltid fräscht och välstädat.
Fin takterrass med härlig utsikt över hela NY. Bra restaurang, inte direkt billigt men väldigt bra mat. För mera prisvärd frukost finns gott om billigare alternativ runt hörnet.
Ett stort tack till personalen som var mycket mån om allas trivsel och var till hjälp  med både taxi, tips och goda råd.
Vi vill gärna bo där igen när vi kommer till NY nästa gång.

title: Great decor and location
text:
Loved staying on the LES and with a great terrace bar and restaurant right downstairs. If you're looking to offset some of the debauchery of NYC the rooftop gym is a pretty special place to workout! 

The rooftop terrace was pretty deserted during my stay (during fashion week) and I was able to enjoy the views there in peace and quiet. The rooms are small in true New York style but the bathroom is luxurious - it was so amazing to bathe with views of the city each day. Loved the toiletries too! Its true, the service at the bar is pretty slow but you win some you lose some! 

At the Ludlow I say you also win due to close proximity to Russ and Daughters, next door to Sweet Chick and there's great coffee two doors down. Its a winner.

title: Great room
text: Beautiful hotel in a good location. Front desk staff are lovely and friendly, bar staff are slow and rude. We got a Studio King room, which was wonderfully spacious and extremely well decorated but it was at the front of the hotel so we could hear all the noises from the street below every night meaning we didn't sleep well at all (despite the wonderfully comfortable bed). Lovely bathroom and amenities too.

title: Okay
text: Yes the reviews are correct the hotel is for hipsters  but I have stayed all around the world which is probably why I feel slightly underwhelmed given the price I have paid. The rooms are small which is typical for New York but they are dark as is every other part of the hotel, but it's intentional I think. You would be hard pressed to read anything unless your in the bathroom lighting is good in there. Bed is comfy but the pillows are appalling they are so bad you need 4 just to sit up in bed then they fall through the bed head.

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
We adored the Ludlow. We traveled with our 8 and 12 yr old girls, and were a little wary reading all the reviews of the neighborhood being full of bars with loud nightlife. It was not over the top at all, and I never felt out of place with my kids. We had a Ludlow double and it was very nice sized on NYC scale (425 sq ft), 2 bedrooms and 4 people and didn't feel squished. Furnishing were super chic, and the bathroom was amazing. After walking the city all day for 3 days, we ate dinner near the hotel each night, Katz's is literally across the street and was a must, Sweet Chick next door awesome, and the Italian place across the street good as well. Dirty French was packed every night and we didn't get in there for dinner, unfortunately. 

Staff was super friendly, not at all snobby as some of the other reviews suggested. Very accommodating as well, we asked to be moved to a higher floor when we checked in and they automatically took care of it while we were out the next day. In hindsight, the noise level wasn't anything like I had imagined it would be and we would probably have been fine on the lower floor.

In short, I felt like I won the hotel/neighborhood lottery here. I travel a ton for business and I'm super picky about where I sleep. We'll be back to the Ludlow!

title: Very hip and special
text:
stayed three nights at hotel.
had a terrace room .
bed linen and mattress fantastic
staff very attentive and great attention to detail.
restaurant  wonderful chic french .
close to Katz before it shuts or go to Russ and Daughters . east subway access uptown and Brooklyn F line orcM line
Wonderful with a functonal rooftop gym

title: Great stay at The Ludlow
text:
Perfect hotel for our first visit to NYC. Our room was great, cleaned daily, not the biggest - but from what I can gather, it's difficult to find rooms with space generally in New York. 
Only small negative - (reason for not giving 5 stars) breakfast was not included in our room rate, which, for the price we paid for our stay, we feel should have been.

title: So cool!
text: Loved everything about this hotel. The location, the very hip style - hip but not overly - the bar and restaurant. The room felt "clubby" and cozy. The bathroom decor is unexpectedly awesome. Lots of old patina brass fittings. Black and white tile work and black hand soap. So so so so cool.

title: Excellent
text:
I like very much this hotel. The room is spacious with a nice view over. 
I have been staying In the corner room with a very nice and authentic decoration. The 3 windows is great to appreciate the view over NY. 
Very cozy lobby with fire place perfect for enjoying a drink.

title: Exceptional!
text:
We only decided to stay at the Ludlow last minute after being dissatisfied with another hotel. But we were so glad to have stayed here. It really topped off our New York experience. From the moment we arrived, the staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. We had the Ludlow Double Loft room which had a living area, king bedroom and queen bedroom. We enjoyed having lots of space. The room was very stylish but also comfortable, well equipped and well laid out. The bathroom in particular, was beautifully designed. The free wifi worked perfectly, 
We were initially unsure about the location, The Ludlow being situated in the Lower East Side, but we really enjoyed it. It's a gentrifying area so there are numerous trendy shops, cafes, restaurants and bars in close proximity. And Katz Delicatessen is right across the road. Aside from the Tenement Museum there aren't any tourist sights but we liked the local neighbourhood feel of the area. It's also not a long walk over to Nolita, Little Italy and Soho, our favourite areas of New York. And to the north is the East Village, another great area. There are also subway and bus stops close by.
The hotel's facilities were good. The gym was limited, with only basic cardio equipment and free weights. But it was on the top floor, so had a view of Lower Manhattan. The lobby area, with a fire and cosy chairs, was a great place to spend a cold afternoon. We didn't get to try the hotel's restaurant but heard good things about it.
Overall, an outstanding hotel experience and fantastic value for money. We would return!

title: great experience- highly recommend
text:
I must admit- I wasn't sure how I would feel about the Ludlow. The neighborhood is highly gentrified and not always quiet (especially on the weekends with loud obnoxious drunk college kids). 

The Ludlow is truly a gem. The staff are all kind and genuinely care about your stay. Their recommendations for neighborhood outings and places to eat were all impressive. I chatted with the hotel manager  a few times, and he was extremely friendly and accommodating. 

The rooms are small- but the beds, the bathroom and layout make up for that. I could sleep in without concern and safely leave my belongings. 

Dirty French and the adjoining hotel lobby have very thoughtful and well crafted dishes and drinks. They both offer very different atmospheres, which feels like you are at two different places. 

All in all, The Ludlow is definitely worth a stay and you won't be disappointed.

title: Wonderful time.
text: Stayed for 3 nights and felt very at home for being in NYC.  Food was great, room was sweet with oversized bath! And Joe in lobby helped us with EVERYTHING we wanted to do.  What a great representative for a little hotel gem.

title: A shoebox for $500/night
text: Went to our room. Booked a Studio Queen Terrace. Bed to wall 18" and bed to furniture on other side 12 ". No place to store our luggage so it'll be sleeping with us tonight. Room is so small that the paintings are hung 10" from the ceiling or you'd knock them over. Can't get to the Terrace unless you move the furniture. Its Lower East Side not Manhatten so no excuse. In our room even bottled water is not a perk. Can't wait to leave.

title: Microscopic room. Great location for exploring the Lower East Side
text: Public areas are very nice. The room was tiny - not even enough space to open a suitcase, much less sit comfortably. The front desk did not accommodate a reasonable late checkout request, offering only a half-hour extension past the unusually early Noon deadline.

title: Wonderful but a few areas lacking
text:
Beautiful building and great location near interesting restaurants, coffee places and an ice cream laboratory-parlour! We had wonderful views on 2 sides of our room through large warehouse style windows. Most comfy bed ever.

Whilst the meal we had in the adjoining restaurant was lovely, breakfast is way too expensive to even contemplate going - even trying once. Just a bit ridiculous.

Plus we were advised to use particular taxi company back to the airport, advised of the flat rate and used it for simplicity and ease. We were totally rinsed by the driver for at least £30 extra! Given the terrible exchange rate, this was an eye watering amount. Hotel need more control over things they are recommending.

title: excellent location -- beautiful hotel
text:
I had a single studio--super small, but ok for 1 person. Really comfy bed and beautiful bathroom. The room had a decent view as well which was a real bonus. The front desk service is fabulous. The service at breakfast in the dining room was god awful. I was alone, and was seated by the host, but waited an eternity to be noticed. The restaurant was not busy, not sure what the problem was. I was in DIRE need of coffee so I may have just been a tad impatient. In any case, the avocado toast was absolutely gorgeous and delicious once it came. 
The hotel is very stylish and glam. I would probably stay there again on my next trip.

the view from the roof top gym is amazing!

title: Charming Hotel
text: Stayed here for my 70th. Birthday.   Wow  Had a skybox suite.  Fantastic view, charming lounge with fireplace.  Great place to stop for a cocktail before heading to dinner.  Restaurant was great.  Great food.  Location was excellent.  Walked to everything.  Great area with lots of everything.   Cant wait to go back to the ludlow.

title: Stylish hotel with plush accommodations and outstanding service
text: I can't say enough about my outstanding experience at The Ludlow. It's a hip, stylish hotel with plush accommodations. On top of the standout design, it has a remarkable staff. In particular, I want to compliment Jason from the front desk. I made a special room request, and he went above and beyond to accommodate it. He was highly professional, responsive and accommodating. Thank you to Jason and the entire Ludlow staff!

title: Birthday trip to NYC
text: I visited New York to celebrate my 30th birthday during October and The Ludlow really helped make the trip special. Our Double room wasn't quite ready on arrival but we took advantage of the time to have a drink in the lounge by the fire (the whole downstairs space is amazing). When we were given our keys the Front Desk had written me a lovely "Happy Birthday" note and left us a complimentary bottle of wine - a great way to start the weekend! The space was excellent, as we had a Ludlow Double; I realised that the pillows and duvets were feather after my first night all of the bedding was changed immediately and it was still excellent quality. The staff were always super helpful, friendly and polite. Great location for exploring the Lower East Side, I loved having a coffee from next door's Ludlow Coffee Supply and then sitting reading one of the complementary New York Times in the garden room. Total bliss! Great Happy Hour at No Fun across the road too. Disappointingly we didn't have time to grab dinner in Dirty French - but there is always next time!

title: Heaven!!! 👌🏻
text: I love love love this hotel 💜. Friendly staff, beautiful decor & great location! Will be back in a heartbeat ✌🏼️. Katz diner is 2 seconds from the hotel, they have a really cool cocktail lounge on site and there are so many cool hip bars to visit 😎.

title: Fantastic Cozy Stay!
text:
Stayed at the Ludlow hotel this past Halloween and absolutely loved it.  It's charming with an authentic nyc feel and cozy atmosphere.  I loved the ambiance in the lounge area due to the restaurant Dirty French french downstairs as well.  Crowd was nice and felt like I was coming home every day. 

Rooms are quite on the small side so if you have a lot of luggage it might be tight but besides that no complaints!

title: Lower East Side Luxury
text: Though we live in the city, my fiance and I stayed at the Ludlow the night of our wedding. They were kind enough to let us check in early and we had some well needed rest and quiet time in the skybox suite. The room was absolutely beautiful, so much so that we had our photographer meet us there so we could get some earlier photos! The staff could not have been more kind or welcoming. The room service from the Dirty French was the best in room dining I've ever had. A great boutique place to stay, I would highly recommend to anyone coming to visit NYC!

title: Native NYCer giving this high praise
text:
I live in Manhattan but needed to stay in a hotel one night for business reasons.  I was impressed with the decor and service in this hotel.  The neighborhood is full of loud drunk hipsters (it was Saturday night), but there are some quaint stores and my room was quiet.

The only negative was that I booked Tablet because I am a Tablet Plus member and wanted the upgrade benefits, and my reservation was lost in Ludlow Hotels's system.  I had to wait 45 minutes until they solved the problem.

title: Lovely hotel in the lower east side
text:
For the first time we decided to stay in the lower east side in the lovely Ludlow hotel. We loved the hotel. Everyone was very nice to us, the hotel has a chic, the room is small but beautiful and we loved having a Nespresso machine in it. Bed was gorgeous. The bathroom was truly well designed and nicely decorated. 
The area of the hotel is very lively, restaurants, bars, shops,...

Great place to stay.

title: A gem on the Lower East Side
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow after a coworker recommended it. The hotel is gorgeous. The lounge is beautiful and has a small bar where I enjoyed a couple drinks. The character of this hotel is probably, to me, its biggest draw. Its sophisticated but not over the top. You feel very at ease here and wouldn't realize you are right in the middle of the Lower East Side.
The staff was wonder. My only complaint is the studio is very small. I know, its a studio, but they really can only get a bed in the room. There was a small table and chairs but this wasn't practical.  All that said, I wasnt there to sit in my room. I just needed a nice, comfortable place to stay for the evening and the Ludlow fulfilled that requirement. 
I will certainly stay here again. Its really very nice and I enjoyed my stay.

title: Hip staycation
text: My husband and I stayed here for a mini-staycation to celebrate a special occasion and enjoyed it very much. The location is fantastic -- close to the subway and some of the best restaurants (Sushi Dojo, Root & Bone, Ludlow Coffee Supply). Our Studio Queen room was pretty cramped (what you'd expect on Manhattan), but beautifully designed. I couldn't stop taking photos of the tasteful decor, very rustic chic. We used the rooftop fitness center (great view!) and hung out in the cozy lounge. The bathroom is gorgeous, with white marble and gold brass. I appreciated that the hotel left us a bottle of champagne (REAL champagne, not prosecco like most hotels). There were two minor issues: the person who checked us in was not very friendly, though everyone else at the hotel was wonderful. And it was extremely loud at night. This is saying a lot, as our room was up on the 12th floor and we're from Brooklyn and quite used to city noise. Either way, if you're staying here, you should probably be out late and enjoying the hip Lower East Side to the fullest.

title: Nice Lower East Side Weekend
text: This was our first time staying at a hotel on the Lower East Side, which we loved. The shops, galleries and restaurants are cool and there are very few tourists in this area--it's also more affordable than other areas of town. We've stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel before in Soho, and I would classify this as "Crosby Street Hotel, light." It has a similar industrial chic vibe, but is more intimate in scale and a much better value. Our Queen Loft room was a decent size for two people (about $500/night including taxes). I believe the smaller rooms are REALLY small. The closet is tight, but enough for about 10 hanging items. There is really no good place to put a rolling suitcase other than under the bed or in the middle of the floor. Perhaps some in room luggage racks could be added? The bed was SUPER comfortable, clean, white and fluffy. The ceilings seemed a little lower than most hotel rooms, but the big windows make up for it. Our view faced east and just above an outdoor parking lot/garage. We had no issue with noise on the 7th floor, other than the occasional siren. You will have a nice sunrise from this side. The real view is on the roof, which is incredible of downtown (and the sunset). The bathrooms are very nice--big for NY and had retro finishes and a soaking tub with a view. The toiletries were divine. We also loved the lobby area and small bar next to the fireplace. It's a cozy hangout on a cold day. The restaurant area of Dirty French was a little too chaotic for my taste and unfortunately the smell from the kitchen creeps over to the hotel elevators and reception area. It was a combo of stinky cheese and old mop at all times. For a first impression as you walk in the door, it's heavy. Fortunately, it's contained to this area. For the most part, we really liked this hotel. We planned our trip around being in this neighborhood and it felt like a different country compared to our usual Upper East Side stays.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: We enjoyed a five night stay at the Ludlow and cannot fault it at all. The lobby, bar and restaurant are stylish and distinctive with a very welcoming feel. It's neither big or small, just the right size in my opinion. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, including the lad on the door who wear great urban attire than the ridiculously "maroon" clad porters in top hats you see in the big swanky hotels. I'd choose this one any day of the week. Location wise, it's superb. Close to the subway and close if not in, a really gritty fun area of the city. If you're from London, I'd liken it to the up and coming areas like Shoreditch. It hasn't quite become completely gentrified but it's well on it's way and we didn't feel insecure once.

title: last minute weekend getaway
text: our first time staying in the lower east side was great, in no small part due to our hotel stay.  beautiful views, lots of space, tons of charm, and very chic.  the rooftop was a great surprise.  the only issue we had was with very loud plumbing noises, (brief, less than 2 minutes - in the middle of the night), it seemed to be resolved the next day after reporting it to the front desk.

title: tiny room, huge terrace
text: This is a slightly quirky boutiquey hotel  just across the street from Katz (the diner where Sally met Harry was made. but I guess they are sick of people reenacting that scene by now).  The rooms are small and if you get the one just above the door, absolutely tiny,  But we had one with a huge terrace with a table and chairs on it and spent most of the time out there and that was lovely.  It has a buzzy bar and a decent restaurant which you must book well in advance.  It was fun.

title: Central, small and expensive
text:
A hotel with patina! A rather old hotel with an acceptable restaurant in the high end of prices and the low end of quality! The rooms are clean but very small. The service is good.
The hotel is located within walking distance from "Ground Zero"
But very expensive.

title: Amazing boutique hotel in perfect spot
text: My favourite hotel in NYC! The best part is the amazing bathroom and great views. Service is impeccable and location is great. There's a whole foods down the road, lots of great cafes, shopping and thrift stores. I like this area as it's not a far walk to the Brooklyn Bridge which once you have walked over it you'll reach a lot of tourist attractions (911, Wall St, Staten Island Ferry). A great place to stay for first time travellers doing a lot of walking - it's a sanctuary to come back to!

title: Not if you're over 40
text:
If you enjoy a scene and enjoy being seen, this is for you. You also have to be able to see in the dark, as the designers were either saving on lightbulbs or it's really cool to be dark and moody. More likely the latter. 
The rooms are small. We stayed for four nights in a Loft King. Thank god for a high bed under which we could store our luggage, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to move. Closet space a joke for two people who would like to have a choice of clothes to wear. 
Bathroom descent and room very clean. 
Ludlow Street is narrow and chaotic and horribly noisy. Was woken by a truck loading stuff into the hotel at 4.30am. 
Staff pleasant enough. 
Breakfast very good.

title: Fair Value, Boutique.
text: Wife and I.  Fri night.  Exactly as expected.  A great boutique hotel.  Great east side location.  Surrounded by great night spots, although no need to leave the hotel given quality of bar and associated restaurant.  Room was better than hoped.  Only considerations: On 5th floor Fri night, there was a lot of outside noise and you need to stack the pillows for any kind of head elevation.  Would stay again!

title: Trendy hotel in a great location
text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Tastefully appointed room. The cocktails in the destination bar are brilliant. Although we didn't eat in the restaurant, apart from at breakfast, this was always fully booked. A celebrity spot. We saw Susan Sarandon and Stromae in the hotel during our stay. We've already recommended this hotel to all of our friends. The only slight negative is that, if you have the 'breakfast included' deal, the choice of breakfast items is very limited and becomes repetitive after a few days (N.B. you can pay extra to try the other items on the menu, but we felt that guests shouldn't have to do so if the breakfast is stated to be included in the room price). Location is amazing. Lots of restaurants, bars and cafes nearby. Subway around the corner.

title: Quality hotel in a great location
text: Traveled here recently for work, the room was nice, maybe on the small side when it comes to having to do work in, but when in NY when are you ever really in the room. Originally I was concerned about noise, due to the hip nature of the hotel, but was pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was for being in Manhattan. Service was great, the price was reasonable and again the location was fantastic, minus the concern of heart disease from eating at Katz's Deli too many times. I would recommend this for work or for pleasure, though I feel like I would be hesitant to recommend it for families.

title: An amazing hotel
text: An amazing hotel, in a great location. Young and vibrant area snd clientele. We had a pretty small room, No. 1402, but it was clean, had a very comfortable bed, a great shower and quality fluffy white towels! The breakfasts were fantastic and the staff throughout the hotel were very helpful and polite, nothing was too much trouble. Can't recommend highly enough. To top it all Gary Lineker stayed in the hotel at the same time as us!

title: Cool as a rockstar
text: Good food, nice service, nice vibe, and all around good place located in what is now a great spot in nyc. Very hip and worth the stay. We had the double room suite and it was a win. We were able to accommodate guests and use the grounds for meetings for business and pleasure.

title: Everything was even better in person!
text: We completely agree with an earlier review: this hotel made us feel cool! We're a couple in our early 50s and while yes, this place has a totally cool, hip vibe and is filled with gorgeous, fashionable people, what it lacks is attitude, making you feel completely comfortable regardless of your age. Best of all, it somehow manages to be far from 'trendy' which seems to be what makes it so timeless and comfortable... it's not trying to be cool, it just is, and you're not trying to be cool by staying there, you just are. The decor is stunning, the lighting is sexy and there's a definite buzz that fills the air. It's the kind of place you want to hang out in the lobby and have drinks (which we did). The restaurant, Dirty French, never stops, it is super popular with locals (according to one we know) and visitors alike. If you have any plans to eat there, make your resos now, they are booked about a month in advance. Ask to sit in the main room (they reserve the garden room to accommodate hotel guests which is incredibly generous - and very beautiful - but not quite the same).  The best we could manage in the main room was to eat there one night for dessert and after-dinner drinks which were all delicious. We were traveling with our two young teens and stayed in room 605 which was perfect - two bedrooms (one with a comfortable sitting area) separated by a hallway with the bathroom in the middle, two closets, two minibars, coffee machine, robes, slippers, everything you could need including the best stocked mini-bar we've ever seen full of unique surprises - I won't tell you because I don't want to spoil it but you MUST check it out! Definitely plenty of room for four and the bedding was exceptional. Windows opened for fresh air too which you don't usually find. We overlooked Ludlow Street and with the windows closed, couldn't hear a thing. We also didn't hear anything between the walls at any time. The sleek gym and open terrace on the 20th floor offered stunning views - we took our minibar Champagne and a couple of glasses up one night for a toast. The neighborhood, even though we were probably some of the oldest people around, was still the best place to stay. Walking around that area of the LES just south of Houston and then on the other side to East Village makes the trip in and of itself. So many small independent restaurants and shops, all buzzing, all hip, completely different day to night. One night we stopped for appetizers and drinks at as many places we could until we were stuffed, would recommend doing that too. Also, it's a great walk across Bleeker Street into West Chelsea and up onto the Hi-Line if that interests you. Consider taking their car to (and if they provide, from, we don't know but would inquire next time) the airport - it was about the same cost as a cab but 1000X more comfortable. Overall it was a 5-star experience and we would definitely stay there again. Highly, highly recommend.

title: Group holiday to New York
text:
Excellent hotel close to bars and restaurants..Great location staff fantastic.. Rooms bit small but were very clean we will definitely be back again.. 

Very hip and trendy. Breakfast was outstanding very filling x

title: First impressions...
text:
The hotel gives an exciting first impression - super buzzy ambiance, great furnishings.

I stayed in a suite, room was immaculate, bathroom excellent and overall very comfortable.

There is an issue with noise between rooms and I had the unfortunate experience of 
being woken at 3am one night by my drunk neighbours, one had passed out in the room, the other was locked out shouting, banging and kicking the door. Prompted me to call reception and assistance took a while to turn up.

Had breakfast in the hotel once. Wouldn't recommend and my food arrived stone cold.

Lastly, the staff on front desk that I encountered were unfriendly and gave a real don't care attitude which was a big let down.

title: This hotel made me feel cool
text:
As a couple in our 40's, I wanted us to stay in cool place when visiting New York.  This hotel more than accomplished that goal, plus I didn't fee out of place.  

I as worried that everybody would be in their 20's and very good looking. This was probably the case in the bar at night, but during the day there were all types.

Love everything about the hotel.  Room 809 has a juliet balcony with a great view - you can see the Freedom Tower on the left to the Empire State Bldg to the right.  The room wasn't that small, at least it was fine to me.  Plus, there is plenty of room under the bed for the luggage.  As the British say, Brilliant!

title: wonderful
text: I booked two rooms for a mother-daughter couple of nights in the area to celebrate my mothers birthday. We booked the King Loft Balcony and the Queen loft. Both rooms are as you see on the website; elegant, comfortable and both a good size for New York standards. The location is perfect, central to many of the great areas in new York. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel is hip without every feeling pretentious.  All in all a lovely stay for both my mother and myself. I would highly recommend to the many friends and family that visit us in New York

title: Second time was superb
text:
After a first so-so experience, I tried again this hotel and everything was absolutely  great and I enjoyed the great hotel facilities (superb gym room with a blasting view), the wonderfull room in all aspects with a superb view over NYC and Brooklyn, the technology available in the room together with the touch of classism makes the hotel unique. The service desk was extremely nice. I will.come back! 
Sometimes nice to try again before making a final call :-)

title: 40th birthday treat - well worth it
text: Love the Ludlow! Superb hotel. Room slightly on the small side but to be expected for New York. The hotel itself is super cool, book in advance for Dirty French - amazing, buzzy and super tasty restaurant downstairs. It's in such an amazing area too - lower east side surrounded by amazing restaurants and bars; Atta boy (speakeasy), Katz (old school deli for pastrami on rye), Russ & Daughters (Jewish deli for smoked salmon and cream cheese bagels). Friendly staff and amazing bar and reception area, very cool art. Will 100% be back.

title: SOLO BIEN UBICADO
text:
Estuvimos 8 días hospedados en éste hotel, a destacar la zona! El barrio es muy dinámico y buen situado.
El servicio del hotel bastante nefasto y escaso.
Recepciónistasque no hablan en Español y bastante pasotas...
Las habitaciónes son muy muy pequeñas.
Los albornoces de Margiela pero Rotos!!!!!!!!
Las sábanas con agujeros!! 

Los baños super bonitos eso si! 
Supongo que es demasiado caro para lo que encuentras.
Además cuenta con un ruidoso restaurante en el Hall del hotel y agobia pasar por medio del caos para acceder a los ascensores de las habitaciones.
Conclusión: No volvería.

title: Fabulous and perfect!
text:
Wonderful hotel. The Ludlow was recommended to us by a friend of my daughter's who frequently stays there for work. We took our adult son and daughter to celebrate my 60th birthday. It was just perfect! Isaiah in reservations was very helpful when I called to book the two rooms and he even emailed extra photos to help me decide on the booking. It all turned out perfectly. Our room was on 12th floor and was very quiet apart from the air con which is very noisy. We stayed in the skybox or loft box which had stunning views all round. Lovely bathroom with big window.  There is very little drawer space but there is plenty of hanger space and hotel was more than happy to provide extra hangers for the hooks that we used in addition to the wardrobe. These hooks were on the wall opposite bathroom and near the sofas. Bed very comfortable and large. My husband has a bad back and is very fussy about beds. He slept like a log! Our son and daughter were on 4th floor in a larger than expected room and they had no complaints about noise, but then they are in their 20's!
On arrival, there was a half bottle of champagne with a card wishing me Happy Birthday! A lovely surprise and a very welcome sight after a long journey! 
Lower East Side was perfect with great character, interesting bars, shops and restaurants. Away from the crowds but easy to get to all the sights. Katz Deli opposite was great for breakfast and around 8.30am very quiet. Russ&Daughters in orchard Street was also a fab cafe/restaurant. They also have a deli shop just around the corner from the Ludlow. Good place to stock up on pressies.
The young Staff on reception were always smiling, helpful and efficient. Reassuring too when my son went missing for a few hours after an all nighter enjoying NYC nightlife! "Saturday night is party till the morning in NY - he'll be back around 11am - he'll be fine!" they said. Sure enough he was.  "You'd better go,and see your Mum!" they advised when he walked into reception at 10.30am. 
We did not try the hotel restaurant as there are so many other places to try and that were recommended to us in the area. Would love to return to the Ludlow so maybe next time we will try Dirty French! Places we liked nearby were Ludlow House (newest addition to Soho House in NYC), Attaboy, a very small bar with great cocktails. No menu! Schillers Liquour around the corner from hotel. Thelma's on Clinton (great sound track all evening). 
It was a fabulous and very special week in New York. Perfect for birthday celebration!

title: 4 night stay for my Wife's 40th birthday.
text:
My wife and I have just arrived back to the UK after a 4 night stay at this hotel to celebrate my wife's 40 birthday and we both loved it. The hotel is trendy in a brilliant location with lots of restaurants and bars close by. Every single staff member we encountered were very friendly, polite and professional and made us feel very welcome. The rooms were a little on the small side but still very comfortable and as we were out all day and only in our room to sleep this did not bother us. The bathroom in the rooms was a very good size and well decorated and the bath tub was huge.
Before we arrived in New York I had arranged with the Hotel to have a birthday cake made for my wife, they did not disappoint and even supplied candles for the cake. If we ever come back to New York, The Ludlow will be the first Hotel I look for. Thank you all so much.

title: Lovely hotel but a bit noisy
text: This hotel is in a great, trendy location on the Lower East Side, staff are friendly, restaurant is very nice and we really liked it. Our room was a little small but hey, it's NYC, and the price was right. Linens are lovely, free wifi, a very pretty patio out back and a great coffee shop next door. BUT - it's in a trendy location and the halls are very noisy particularly with late night/early morning party goers. We stayed Wednesday to Sunday and while Wednesday and Thursday night were not problematic, Friday and Saturday nights were very noisy in the hallways. Would stay again though as overall, it's a great hotel.

title: Stylish and classy accommodation
text:
We loved this awesomely located hotel. We dined in the restaurant Dirty French on the first night (recommend the chicken and crepes) and would have been very happy to eat there again but with so many places to go to in NYC we just couldn't.
The room was pretty small but the bathroom is a generous size. We had a room facing out on to Ludlow street, it was quite noisy on the weekend.
I really like that the service was not over the top and my only gripe would be that you had to sign in to the wifi everytime and it was not very strong or reliable.
Ludlow is a one way street that is jammed up every night so catching a cab is best done on E Houston Street. But we walked a lot because it sometimes it was just faster on foot!
The covered atrium lounge has a very chilled vibe and great bar menu. 
The Ludlow has a rooftop seated area which was cool. We also went across the road on our last night to the rooftop bar at the Hotel Indigo, Mr Purple. Awesome view of the whole Manhattan skyline!
Awesome place to stay as a couple. We would love to come back.

title: So good they should name it twice
text:
Possibly best hotel I've ever stayed in , stylish but not pretentious , great rooms, staff, toiletries . For me location was brilliant too . So many good places to eat really close by. 
Was in heaven , can't wait to go back.
Lower east side still has spirit of old New York , plus across the road is Katz which is the best sandwich bar in the world bar none.

title: Unique hotel
text:
This place was excellent. We stayed for 2 nights. Staff was very nice and uniquely dressed-dressy pants with button down shirts with sneakers (not like street sneakers but fashionable ones) it was pretty awesome to see. Other hotel staff would wear the usual suit and tie, but here it's very hip. 

Hotel was very interesting, decor or the lobby and the room was awesome. View was nice. Although our room was pretty small, we managed around it and wow, the bathroom I loved! Bright lights, looked antique kid of style. Loved it. Loved the vibe. Would highly recommend this place to get away.

title: Sympa mais chambre toute petite. ..
text: Sympa et quartier très animée.  La  déco est très chouette, l hotel tres joli,  nous avions une chambre avec terrasse très bien par contre la chambre est minuscule , on a du mal à se déplacer. .. pas de rangement.. donc cher pour la prestation . On paye l' hôtel branchée.  Restaurant à la mode mais très bruyant.

title: Great recommendation
text: Great location and tidy / clean rooms.  The service you cannot fault, not over the top, just ready to help if you need it.  Ludlow Street is a great location for a hotel, with a great restaurant attached, and great coffee next door.

title: 1 night ...... Views were incredible
text:
We were upgraded from the room we booked and it was amazing!

Lay in the bathtub and look out over the One World Trade Center .....wow!

Super large windows and a lovely terrace! You could see the Brooklyn Bridge and lights forever! 

A rooftop terrace you could relax on too .....lovely!

A great location for bars and places to eat!

Phoebes ... In Bowery was brilliant! Great food, friendly staff, very lively! Fab!

title: Lovely brief stay at the Ludlow!
text: In town for less than 24 hours for a show and the Ludlow was perfectly convenient and nicely appointed. The staff members were kind and easy to work with. I loved the style of the whole hotel (entry and common areas, corridors, rooms, and restaurant). The room design of the Studio Queen was well-executed, making great use of the relatively small space. Comfort was not sacrificed. The shower was excellent. I would certainly stay here in the future, especially if it meant I could eat again at the Dirty French downstairs.

title: A comfy first night stay with an amazing view
text:
