It was extremely expensive but a great comfortable room - we had a terrace which was great for checking out the amazing view! To the right Empire State over towards left one world skyline! 

Comfy bed - amazing shower - stylish bathroom - with the usual complimentary soaps - sofa area - big windows all round - nice lighting - we didn't eat here - we ate breakfast about a block away in a small cafe with tables on street - we walked a short walk to Essex St subway and it was about 4 stops to battery park! 

Oh ! Right opposite Katzs deli! 

Neighbourhood is busy! 
 
Around neighbourhood we found a subway for a nice steak & cheese sandwich ! An Irish bar for a reasonably priced beer! 

The drinks in hotel were expensive!  But also on a Saturday night it was packed, low lighting, noisy!  Not that that affected our stay! 

$16 for a cocktail ! 

On checkout we sat outside in a covered courtyard that was nicely enclosed & felt like being in a garden on a sunny day! 

Staff were all very pleasant and doorman quickly found us a taxi on our departure!

title: Great place, small room, wonderful terrace
text: Love the hotel, comfortable rooms and I booked a room with a terrace. Although the room was small it had all you need. Comfortable bed. Airconditioning was a bit too loud. Good location if you need to be downtown.

title: Not Right
text: This place doesn't even try to get it right. Lots of design but short on detailed attention and service. Fist what I liked...old school design and the outdoor courtyard downstairs. Bathroom is large and fixtures very nice (almost - see note below). What didn't work: rooms tiny, furniture selected huge (bad combo). Room door not insulated so I could hear all my neighbors comings and goings. Hallway a/c was set on freezing (why). Room a/c unit loud. Bathroom had dual spray jangle and shower but shower is rainwater so you are all in or all out yet the spray handle had no place to hang so you could be under the spray. Who missed that detail (how simple would have that been)?  Towels were worn and had holes (see pic). At $525 per night you think they could inspect and use newer towels. Lobby is dark. No room security (rfid key not needed to get up to floor in elevator - another missed detail). Plenty of other hotels in 1 mile radius. I won't be staying here again.

title: Beautiful and Truly Special
text:
We stayed for 5 nights in the Ludlow, and it was perfect, as my first time in New York, it was stunning to wake up to the views of New York sprawling beneath us (to the extent that my boyfriend insisted on sleeping with the curtains open, so that sunrise could wake us up each morning, which was stunning) and I can say, the Skybox Loft is worth it.

The first morning, we went downstairs to Dirty French for breakfast, and that was delicious. We tried nearby places on subsequent mornings, and I can highly recommend the Clinton Street Baking Company nearby, (we went twice, and both times were gorgeous, the wait is worth it, and you can sit at the counter if you don't want to wait for a table), as well as Balthazar, which is a tiny bit further away but near some great shops. 

As for dinners, we brought some food back to the hotel as we were jetlagged and exhausted after a day walking around- the Meatball shop around the corner was delicious and friendly, as well as Stanton Street Pizza for some truly local NY slices. Katz's is not for the faint of heart, but staff are friendly and the Pastrami is great. 

All staff we encountered were professional and friendly, and we were given space to explore and were never bothered by anyone at the hotel, but always returned to a pristine room. (as we are trained architecturally, someone was disappointed to find that the mullions on the windows were stuck on, but really? It doesn't affect the grandeur of the view at all). 

We loved the robes and the toiletries, and everything was appointed beautifully. Will return!

title: Special treat
text: Special trip to celebrate hubbie's 50th. Great location, defo recommend the area, easy to get everywhere we wanted to go throughout the week on Manhattan Island and also to Brooklyn, Coney Island etc...but away from the mentalness of the real tourisity areas. Felt safe walkingnaround even late at night. Loads of independent eateries in the area. Hotel was chic and trendy, felt like we were with all the beautiful people, quite hip! Room was comfortable, clean and practicle, bed comfy, not massive area but adequate for a weeks stay, bathroom was great! Had breakfast everyday which was good, service varied every day depending on how busy it was, but always got a table and always got at least two cups of coffee, although I usually need about four! Would recommend hotel, don't forget to visit the roof, take a bottle of wine and listen to the buzz of the city!

title: Magnifique Hotel bien placé
text:
Bel Hotel comme j'aime . Dans le quartier en bas de Manhattan. 
Proche des petits commerce Arty et indépendant . Les chambres et salle de bain sont sublime au détail près .
Ambiance chaleureuse avec un lobby/bar/terrasse couverte trendy & relax. Visiblement à la mode 
Les New-yorkais se donne rdv au bar. 
Le restaurant du Ludlow : "French Dirty " est vraiment excellent. Mais les vins sont Hors de prix pour un européen. Succulent dessert. 

Seul Hic : la clim est glacial !

title: What a view
text: Myself & my newly husband stayed at this hotel for three nights in the skybox loft. The views were spectacular the room was beautiful and even views from the bathtub. We stayed for our wedding night which the hotel kindly sent up two bottles of champagne one the night before and on the day, lovely touch! We liked the area and found it easy to get around. The only one negative was we decided to have a drink in the bar one afternoon & we had an extremely rude barman, he was overly rude and made us feel very uncomfortable which isn't great  customer service, so perhaps some staff training needed. Other than that a perfect stay.

title: Tasteful bite of NYC
text: Smack in the middle of everything with tasteful interior and helpful staff this is a keeper! Hipp crowd, happening restaurant and nice views from the top rooms ( ask for a room on the upper floors) Don't miss the gym located on the roof with spectacular views. Could need another elevator, but hey, who's in a hurry?!

title: Loved the Ludlow, Love to Go Back
text: Took a cab from mid town to LES it was raining and windy there were road works on Houston St, and the bellboys had disappeared from the front of the hotel as we fought our way inside against the wind. Was our room ready 'no,' not a good start said the ladies of a certain age from Australia as we settled in the lounge near the fire while ordering drinks and a late lunch. But this was the only glitch in an otherwise fabulous stay at this hotel. The interiors were dark, the staff apart from the bar staff who appeared too busy to serve you were helpful. Our room a Loft Queen had a great bathroom with a bath and shower and  the room had a view of the alleyways and graffiti common in this part of NYC. The room was an average size for NYC but had some groovy touches like lambskin or alpaca rugs over chairs and bedside tables seemingly made of pieces of polished wood. We had continental breakfast included which was a perfect start to the day. We found delicious food at our finger tips particularly the Italian restaurant Tre which was directly across from the hotel. We found good coffee at the El Rey around the corner which was frequented by a cool young crowd who I guess were locals. We felt as though we had found a place where real New Yorkers lived and we were thrilled we got to share it with them. I could go on but I won't you should just book this place and get out onto the streets.

title: Just what we wanted!
text: Moved here from another hotel we were unhappy with and it was the best decision of our whole trip! It's a little more expensive then other options but so worth it. A lovely sized room, very clean and just wonderful bathroom! Our room looked out on to the road but this wasn't a problem and it wasn't too loud for us! Lots of nice bars and eateries around and easy transport links to sightseeing! A trendy hotel with equally trendy people gracing the bar downstairs. Staying here was a lovely addition to our trip! Would def stay again and recommend to everyone!

title: Bumped!
text: I don't like writing bad reviews which is why it has taken me so long to write this one. We had booked a Skybox room at the The Ludlow 5 months prior to celebrate the end of our round the world trip and my 50th birthday.  On arrival we were shown to a room that wasn't the one we had booked (it was tiny!) After I questioned the room change they initially told me the mistake was mine.  After producing my email confirmation they said there must have been a mix up and (of course) no Skybox rooms were available.  They gave us another room and as compensation gave us a free glass of wine in the bar and a lower rate on the alternative room.  At the end of the day we didn't want a lower rate we wanted the room we had booked and were willing to pay for as the most expensive rooms in the hotel.  I travel to New York often as I used to live there and still have many friends there.  I will never stay at this hotel again or recommend it to my numerous friends that travel there.

title: Отличный выбор для семьи
text:
Красивый и стильный отель. Очень удобное расположение. Минибар разумно наполнен. Дизайнерский интерьер. Теплая и просторная ванная. Отличные кровати.
При гостинице есть ресторан на удивление популярный. За неделю, что жили в гостинице, видел 100% заполняемость и ресторана, и бара.

title: Just lovely...
text:
I run an inn for a living needless
to say I'm beyond picky when I travel.  Recently I stayed in one of the top hotels in the world and to be honest the Ludlow beats that hotel hands down!  Staff is friendly, gracious, helpful and down to earth.  Room(s) were beautiful, spotless, and very comfortable.  My first night I had unexpected guests who needed to stay with me...the staff held both the larger room and my original room for me to decide upon my arrival.  I experienced both the two bed suite (first night) and a loft queen on my second night.  I just loved the loft queen on the higher floor..sunshine, windows that opened and an amazing view!  I will  never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Lower East Side boutique jewel
text:
Lower East Side can be a loud affair these days but The Ludlow is a peaceful retreat from the streets hustle & bustle, with the kind of style that those familiar with Soho House type of properties would appreciate. Modern but homey, attention to detail is the word with a friendly, non fussy service. Guestrooms bathrooms are an absolute beauty but, as with most NYC properties, if you want to move around a bit, best to book Studio Queen upwards. I didn't have a problem with the size of my Studio Mini but something one could do with is tea/coffee facilities.
The hotel features Dirty French, a great bistro that fits the LES rock feel like a glove. Guests can take breakfast here which is a tasty/stylish way to kick off the day. 
Nice touch: reservations manager e-mailed me 10 mins after I booked online to discuss further my requirements and everything was provided for upon check-in.
Looking forward to my next visit!

title: Tiny Room done right!
text:
In NYC its hard to find a large room, we stayed at the Ludlow in a small room, it was a sold out night. They have large rooms we just didn't have the luxury. That being said out of all the small rooms to stay in, in NYC this was by far the best we have found.
My husband and I didn't feel overly crowed and the rooms character was amazing. The bathrooms are oversized, I could take a bath, and I made sure I did!

If you need to stay in this area this hotel will not let you down!

title: Almost too cool for school
text: ...but don't let that put you off. This is the third of Sean MacPherson's hotels we've stayed in and possibly the best. I love the original - the Bowery - and liked the Marlton too but felt most at home here. Having lived in NYC when this area wasn't quite as salubrious as it is now, it's a tad strange to think you're paying top dollar for a hotel across the street from Katz's bins, but times have changed. It's a superb location, the decor is as spot-on (as usual) and staff just the right side of edgy (very occasionally they're a bit too busy posing and chatting at the Bowery to notice you're there). It certainly doesn't feel 50% bigger than the Bowery. The bar is shockingly loud (but does bloody good cocktails - who needs to talk?), as is the restaurant, Dirty French, (which seemed eye-wateringly expensive to us, so we eschewed) but the vibe is consistently 'up', friendly and 'happening' without veering into pretentious waters. Added bonus - I bumped into the Arctic Monkey's Alex Turner in the lift. Swoon.

title: Gem In The LES With An Incredible Team!
text: My husband and I discovered this hotel on Tablets a couple of years ago and it's been our 'go to' hotel ever since.  Not only is it a great location, wonderful ambiance and beautifully curated, but the entire staff is top flight!  From being greeted with a smile by Scarlett at the front desk (love her!!) to the wonderful gentlemen who help with baggage, the experience from start to finish makes for a great stay!  It's always a good sign when you go back several times and the staff is the same.  It makes one's stay feel like a 'home away from home'.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: great boutique hotel in the middle of it all in lower east side
text: We stayed in a quiet king room on 3rd floor which was great because I don´t like to stay on floors very high up. (not fond of heights) A well designed room and lobby area and restaurant looked cool to, we never ate there though. Staff was nice and polite. Super comfy bed and well stocked mini bar. After a few beers we went up to top floor out door space one evening and it was an amazing view of the city. Over all very stylish and posh urban feel.

title: Relaxing Weekend in the LES
text: My wife and I stayed at the Ludlow this weekend in a Studio King.  Our room was well apportioned with an incredibly comfortable bed.  The LES offers great bars and music so we stayed out late and the room/hotel was so quiet and comfortable that we slept in late too!  The Ludlow is well situated to great restaurants too.  Of course, Dirty French in the lobby is hard to resist, so we enjoyed a late brunch there too.  Looking forward to another visit in the future.

title: Enjoyable trip
text:
Great hotel, Nice vibe.
Professional staff and impeccable rooms.
I particularly liked the shower which was very powerful and hot. 
Downsides? Well it is NYC so it's pretty noisy so if you want it quiet then book a room high as possible.

Lots of great places to eat and drink around this location and if you are only a 6min walk from 2ndAve/Houston st MTA Subway station.

Would stay here again just for the atmosphere in the bar.

title: Wonderful stay at the Ludlow LES
text: We are just wrapping up another wonderful stay at the Ludlow on the Lower East Side. The hotel is a perfect blend of old world and contemporary.  Our special staff member Scarlett always goes out of her way to make our experience extra special. She is the best!

title: My new favourite hotel
text: I loved this place, had already stayed a week at The NoMad and had two extra nights that i thought i'd try another hotel.  Similar in style to The NoMad, with it's extravagant, European styled interiors.  A gorgeous indoor courtyard , excellent restaurant Dirty French and solid service, with really excellent value for money.

title: Charming, cozy, trendy
text:
I booked this hotel because I had a delayed flight and wanted a hotel that had 24-hr room service. I wasn't aware of how trendy and upmarket the Lower East Side had become.  We wished we'd arrived earlier (2am) and had a look around.
But despite the late hour, the desk manager was very charming and helpful. He got our rooms sorted out and gave us information on the hotel. 
The rooms were a good size for NYC, and had quite a distinctive decor.  The windows were real and opened. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. 
The choice of food on the room service menu was a bit disappointing, and a couple of items were not available. I also was told I couldn't have ice cream because it wasn't on the late night menu (really?) The mini-bar, however, was very well stocked.
Other than that, it was a good stay and the bar/restaurant looked to be wonderful! 
I'd go back to get the full experience.

title: Très bon hotel pour touristes avisés
text:
Hotel récent situé en plein LES. Les chambres sont raffinés et décorés avec gout. Une machine nespresso est à disposition ce qui est rare et fort appréciable.
Le lobby est magnifique avec une ambiance très new york voire underground. 
Le personnel est très "new york" c'est à dire pas toujours très avenant.

title: 綺麗でオシャレで素敵なホテル
text:
マンハッタンから少し離れているローワーイーストサイド。
おしゃれなバー、レストランなどがたくさんあり夜まで眠らない街。そんな中にあるこちらのホテルはホテル界の巨匠によるデザインだけありおしゃれ。ニューヨークだからこそこんなアンティークな家具たちが華やぐのかなとおもうほど。

一階のバーも最高で、のんびりお茶するのもあり。一人でワインを飲むのもあり。

値段もお手頃で、おすすめのホテルです。

title: Hotel staff terrific but.......skip the lounge!
text:
I frequently travel to NYC and absolutely love this neighborhood.  My mother grew up around the corner from this hotel in the 40's and we came to NYC often growing up so I always come to this neighborhood when I am in town and have frequented numerous restaurants and bars in the area.  I had never stayed at The Ludlow and the rates were reasonable so I booked a room for the weekend.

First....any of the staff that had anything to do with my room were friendly, courteous and just great overall (front desk, bellman, room service, etc.) I have never received a pot of coffee faster at any hotel....and two days in a row! 

After dinner (Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya...would highly recommend) we decided to have cocktails in the lounge of the hotel which is part of Dirty French, the restaurant in this hotel. Now there are a plethora of choices in this part of town for really awesome, creative cocktails and were hoping this experience would be the same. 

We found a comfy couch and waited about 10 minutes until I had to ask the bartender if someone could come and take our drink order.  We ordered the same drink but since I don't care for tequila which was the main component of the drink I asked if I could have vodka instead.  We waited minimally 20 minutes (this is generous) for our drinks to arrive. 

When we tasted the cocktails mine tasted like tequila so I tried my friends and they tasted the same.  I immediately told the waitress and after more extended waiting two men came over to the table from the bar/restaurant with my cocktail, a bottle of Ketel One (the brand of vodka I ordered) and incredible rudeness.  They asked who the person was who liked Ketel (with sarcasm), proceeded to measure out the vodka which they added to the rest of the ingredients in my drink, all the while with the most obnoxious attitude and sarcasm.  I honestly have never been treated so rudely in any establishment EVER.  I waited tables when I was younger and am currently a successful business woman with a career in sales and finance. I travel and dine out regularly. My friend and I were truly shocked and insulted.  I did reiterate this sentiment to the waitress who told me that she would "let them know".  So much for that.  A word to the bar.....the customer is always right and kindness goes a very long way. 

I give the staff of the hotel related to my room 5 stars and 1 for the Dirty French lounge. Unfortunately, because of the awful bar experience I would be very reluctant to stay here again.

title: Small but Charming
text: We had the Skybox Loft at the Ludlow Hotel, which was delightful but still quite small. No drawers to put things away and the closet wasn't designed to fit much. However, the room was beautiful and clean (and Nespresso in the room and free wifi is always a plus). The location can't be beat for going out at night. The lobby looked lovely and if there hadn't been so many choices for great bars in the neighborhood, we would have had a drink there. The rooftop deck is nice and the fitness room is great for when it's too hot/too cold to run outside. The Loft room has a deep tub with a view of downtown. Would stay here again.

title: Could be so much better if staff lost the attitude
text:
So just finishing up our stay at the Ludlow. Some background - we live in NYC and every few months stay somewhere for a night or weekend to get away from our hectic life of school and kids activities. So not new to NYC or hotels in NYC. We debated between this hotel and the Highline Hotel. Chose this one for the neighborhood as we already spend a lot of time on the west side. 

The rooms themselves (we had a skybox loft) are nice. Small but we knew that coming in but we were here mainly for neighborhood and views. Bathrooms are nice but not spacious. But overall no complaints about the room except the AC. It is very noisy. It will wake you up throughout the night. 

The biggest issue, which seems to be fairly common for hotels down here (like Sixty LES, but surprisingly not Standard East Village or Bowery Hotel) is the attitude of the people working the front desk. I don't know why it is so hard for the hotel to hire and train personable people to work the front desk. Instead they act as though they are working the line at s club and treat you like some rube tourist that is too much trouble to be nice to. I have never experienced this at hotels like the Mandarin, NY Palace, etc. Case in point. We asked for a late checkout. Lots of rooms available tonight, including our room class so not likely to be an issue of them being fully booked. We were told than anything after 12:30 incurs a half day charge. We pointed out that the book in the room stated that anything after 2:00 would be a half day charge. She responded as though we did not know what we were talking about and looked at us again like rubes from out of town. I then indicated I would be happy to go and get a copy of the house rules in the room to show her and then she said well it's 12:30 for your class of room. Clearly making it up as she was going along. Didn't care to argue the point so we will check out early. 

Of course the management is reading trip advisor and they know this is a common complaint. It has not changed so clearly this is either intended or unimportant. 

Overall fine but could be so much better if the staff at the front dropped the attitude. Probably will not be back.

title: Vintage Chic in a Neighborhood
text:
Staying here now for an anniversary weekend getaway. The place is fabulous. 

let's get the "negatives" out of the way. The room is small, BUT that is the case for almost all NYC standard rooms. We're in a Standard Queen Studio. Hallways are tight and narrow, but I believe it's original to the building as this looks like it was an older property that has been meticulously and lovingly updated.

For the good stuff. 

Location: it's in in the Lower East Side. We purposely wanted to stay in a neighborhood and a non-big commercial chain property. It's walkable to just about everything you need and truly get to experience what it's like for a New Yorker who lives in this area. I'm from Chicago, so appreciate the true neighborhood feel this provides. It's a relatively safe area, lots of people and businesses around so we felt safe walking around even in the evenings.

SO MANY RESTAURANTS!!! And good ones. There's a fair combo of old school joints and newer concepts. The famous Katz Deli is at the end of the block, so we had to have it even if we said we weren't going to the typical NYC touristy spots on this visit. A good gelato place Il Laboratorio Gelato adjacent to Katz. Walked to Union Square Market for some in-hotel goodies like water, fruit and snacks.

There's also a small gym on the top floor, which was a bonus to us so we didn't have to pay for a daily pass at a gym in the area. On the same floor a great rooftop to bring a drink up and just get a great view of the city.

Property: Just so  nicely done! the exterior, the lobby, the restaurants. I can go on! The attention to detail is spot. My favorite has to be the sun room toward the end of the main floor. Nice little respite from the hustle & bustle. 

Room: As I said, small (235 sq ft). They did however really use the space wisely with bed frames that are elevated so you can put your suitcase under. Closets/Shelves with storage. Our room has a Juliet-ish balcony...we can step out and get fresh air, but only one person can fit there. The bathroom is nice. Standup shower only, no tub for those who need/want that. Great lighting for make-up. The finishes/design is what I'd call updated vintage. Tree stumps for nigh stands, nice dark wood bed frame. The room also comes with a Nespresso Machine. Score! 

Staff/Service: so nice and helpful. Opened doors, held elevators, greeted us each time. I noted on my booking it's our anniversary and they dropped off a nice bottle of sparking wine. A small touch that really made us feel special.

title: Awesome room and atmosphere
text: Was pleasantly surprised at how nice our room was and how friendly the staff was.  It was in a great location and amazing Sweet Chick diner next door.  Hotel was cool, and smelled amazing.  Slept very comfortable.  Would absolutely recommend staying here to anyone traveling to New York!  Also, we drove and there was a parking garage right across street that was great.

title: charming boutique hotel
text: though room is quite small, it has all what you need. considering the old interior setting which i find very charming, it has a modern coffee machine. i like especially the rainshower in the bathroom. i wish there is a suitcase stand in the room for convenience.  the view from the room is very nice. oh and very honest staff, they returned my daughter's wallet she lost in the hotel's premises.

title: Fabby hotel
text: Comfortable, stylish hotel. The layout of the Ludlow Double room was good with two bedrooms (one without a window), each with a door for privacy, sharing a vintage-style bathroom. Perfect for families and friends. A friend booked the loft room, with three walls of windows around the small living area, which was gorgeous. Loved the free breakfast; we didn't eat dinner here but the restaurant was buzzing every night. Great area packed with interesting boutique businesses, wonderful Katz's deli right across the road and pizza slices just around the corner for midnight munchies. Walking distance to Little Italy.

title: Skybox Haven
text:
We stayed 2 nights at the Ludlow. The location could not be better for exploring the Lower East Side. Check in was smooth. We literally put our bags down & walked across the road to Katz for their famous pastrami sandwich even though it was 1:00am! Lots of great cafes, restaurants & galleries all within walking distance. It's a hip & trendy area but streets are smelly & dirty especially after Friday/Saturday night. An authentic old New York vibe.

The room was beautiful, especially the bathroom. The bath tub was massive, one of the best we've experienced! We also loved the touch of gold in all the fittings. Our only complaint is the size of the room. It was really really really small, we already had a skybox room so we can't imagine how tiny a standard room would be. We couldn't fully open our suitcases anywhere. Had to leave them in the narrow corridor to access them & zip them back up each time we headed out or wanted to close the bathroom door. We didn't bother unpacking or hanging any clothes up as there was literally no space.

Aside from that everything was fine. We enjoyed having breakfast in our skybox lounge every morning. Even managed to catch a glorious sunrise. They provided coffee but no water or tea. The gym on the top floor is small but adequate. Even if you don't want to use the gym, go up there for the rooftop view!

We had lunch at their restaurant Dirty French. Both food & service was incredible! They serve these complimentary flatbreads there that are highly addictive as warned by our waiter - he was not joking!

Overall we were happy with our stay at the Ludlow for its location. It's suited more to a younger crowd, especially for those who want to party till late & to see & be seen. If you want a more spacious, quiet & comfortable stay then the Ludlow is not it.

title: Great hotel!!!!
text: Fabulous quaint hotel! We stayed there and we're very happy we chose this spot. I booked through booking.com, double check your dates! Mine were changed on the site, I wasn't aware. But the hotel was very accommodating and I appreciate that!

title: Small Rooms, Great Location
text: The lobby is warm and welcoming with that woodsy vibe in the big city.  The outdoor patio by the lobby bar is a relaxing place to start the night.  Once you ascend to your room, don't be surprised by the small size--though that is pretty typical of NYC.  The water pressure is poor, but the room makes up for it in character.  A small workout room is on the top floor, but it leaves much to be desired. Spectacular rooftop views

title: Excellent hotel, always worth!
text:
A great hotel, well positioned at 10' walk from SOHO, very good facilities, high standard.
Breakfast is also quality and the staff is very prompt.
Many restaurants and shops nearby, is an all too appropriate location for both tourism and business.
I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Small but perfectly packaged
text:
I checked in for a one night stay on a fleeting trip.
the reception staff were lovely and I was soon in my Skybox Loft room.    The area is great for those looking for hectic nightlife, but it also wasn't a problem noise wise with the windows closed on a high floor.

The pluses:
The mini bar is amazing.  The first hotel I have ever stayed in where they don't try to take advantage of the guest and in this case they charged reasonable prices.  The variation of products also top notch.  Just brilliant so thank you.

The bathroom also well stocked and I loved that there was a window in the bathroom which can be rare!

The views and layout of the room made the best use of the limited space available.

The cons:
None really.
As a note the rooms ARE small even top of the range ones, but for me that wasn't a problem as it was one night.  There was little hanging space so could be a problem for a longer stay (e.g. not really anywhere to store a larger suitcase - perhaps under the bed could work).

Daytime service in the lobby bar area was a bit slow during the day (it's fantastic at night).   Food options a little limited - however it was pretty empty in the day so probably doesn't make sense to overstaff for it.      I enjoyed spending the day working on my laptop in there with the comfortable sofas.   Food was good quality from the menu.

title: NYC Pure!
text:
This is an amazing hotel! The service is top, architecture phenomenal, interior design and lighting design in public spaces genius. 

NYC was the meeting point for our group of friends to meet being that we are scattered from Long Beach, Californai to Berlin Germany and a few places in between. Being that 3 of us work in hospitality management our expectations were high of a hotel charging what the Ludow charges - needless to say- we were impressed and want to meet again at the Ludlow next year!

As a former Food and Beverage Director I believe it is the details that set apart just a good F&B Outlet from a great one. The Dirty Frenchman (in house restaurant) is exceptional! We had a nice breakfast, and being that we all lived very long in Europe or are European, it is nice when being served a dish from the proper side and having the correct cutlerty set up for corresponding courses. The Servers were always authenticly friendly, prompt, competent, and non-intrusive.

The front desk team were equally well trained and helpful. Should you be in need of a taxi ask the front desk as the compant which they work together with  is much more comfortable than the regular city taxis. 

The only qualm I have is paying $15 for a bagel with cream cheese on a room service order. Calculating from an industry norm Cost of Goods Sold at 25-30% the bagel would have to cost the hotel about $4 to produce or purchase, I can assure this was not the case. The F&B director should reconsider the food costing on room service items. A room service charge was also added to the bill which I can completely understand. Good personnel are expensive and should be paid well for working late nights, that said I think all together I forked out about $45 for a bagel (partially my fault as I am a generouse tipper).

I look forward to my next stay at the Ludlow! We will be back! :-D

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel!
text: Just loved our stay at the Ludlow! Fantastic location and charming hotel.  The design of the rooms and attention to detail make this a plus for the great location. Near fantastic restaurants, unique shops and not far from Brooklyn. Dirty French is the hotels restaurant and the food, music and environment are wonderful. The only issue we had at our stay was one of the elevators was out so at first it was a little bit of a wait, but took the stairs most of the time it was backed up. The bathrooms in the room are beautiful and toiletries top notch. We will return!

title: Ottima atmosfera e interior design
text:
La location è molto bella sopratutto la parte Lounge in vero stile nyc...oggetti e design ricercato. Le camere.sono piccole ma molto carine ,molto bella la vista sulla città dalla vasca se prendete una queen de chiedete un piano dal quindicesimo. Al 20 c è un piccolo rooftop ma accogliente con tanto di palestra,avrebbero potuto ampliarlo e farci un cocktail bar come in tanti altri. Al momento unica pecca il ristorante...camerieri incompetenti , fatto già 4 colazioni e in tutte e 4 nonostante il.locale fosse praticamente vuoto ,si sono dimenticati almeno 1 o 2 cose dell'ordine fatto...da sottolineare che ho ordinato 4 cose in tutto.
BELL HOTEL , PARTICOLARE BELLA VISTA DAI PIANI ALTI ,RISTORANTE DA EVITARE

title: nice hotel
text: The Ludlow is a stately hotel.  The service is excellent.  There are a few different bars downstairs, and nice outdoor spaces, including a relaxing Moroccan inspired space.  I only had breakfast at the restaurant, which was very good (although there is a Katz' Deli across the street).  The rooms were quite small, but I booked one with a private balcony terrace that was quite spacious, with room for a table and 4 chairs, and 2 chaise lounges.

title: Prétentieux pour un hôtel très moyen
text:
Nous étions au Ludlow hotel en juillet, il est très excentré. La ligne de métro la plus proche n est pas forcément la plus utile.
Le quartier se veut branché.
Le personnel est assez méprisant. Il vous regarde de haut.
La chambre est assez petite, la salle de bain avec baignoire est belle et fonctionnelle.
Le lit n est pas suffisamment confortable et trop petit.
La vue est magnifique.
Nous n'avons pas pris le petit déjeuner à l Hotel au regard des prix exorbitants pratiqués.
Le bilan parait donc bien mitigé.

title: Top hotel and awesome staff
text: Was in NYC in April for the weekend on my own and stayed in the Ludlow for the 1st time. I try and visit NYC twice a year and I can safely say this is the best hotel I have stayed in. The hotel is beautifully designed with really cool rooms and social areas. Fantastic lobby bar with really cool friendly staff. The food in Dirty French was excellent too and the hotel is perfectly located in the heart of downtown. I'll definitely be back. Thanks. Ben

title: A perfect spot for spending your time in the city!
text:
We arrived very early in the morning following a red eye flight and the Ludlow staff were able to give us access to our room upon arrival. This started our trip off perfectly as we were able to have a shower and rest before heading out for the day! 

Even though the rooms are small as other reviews have said, it is New York and they were definitely easy for us to function in with there being enough room for our bags to fit under the bed. The rooms are beautifully designed for a boutique hotel with lovely views of the city/sunset. 
Depending on where you plan to spend most of your time, it is a very convenient location and close to the subway. We found it very easy to get around once we got the hang of it.

Most of the staff were lovely, particularly the evening/overnight front desk staff and the cleaners - very helpful when I hurt my wrist and they were able to bring ice up for it and checking in to make sure I was ok. 

As a side note, the ludlow is also very close to Russ and Daughters, a delicious Jewish deli that we frequented often on our stay! And also a gelato place called il laboratorio del gelato!

title: Great hotel, really helpful staff!
text: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Ludlow. Beautiful room, great neighborhood- best of all, when we got back home, I realized I'd left a new shirt in the room- I was sure it would be gone, but I reached out to the hotel just in case. Amazingly enough, they had it at the front desk and arranged to have it sent to me. Service really above and beyond, 5 stars all around!

title: Lower east side
text: This is a gem of a hotel!!  Loved the little patio outside of our room.  Rooms are small, but finished beautifully.  The service was impeccable.  This will be our new go to hotel in NYC.  It was like they anticipated our needs every step of the way.  As we were leaving and getting ready to hail a cab to the airport, the doorman suggested an Uber that was WAY more comfortable and less expensive. Thank you Ludlow!

title: snazzy gastro-hotel in a buzzing neighbourhood
text:
In British-speaking terms, the Ludlow is best described as a busy gastro-pub with an eleven-storey hotel built above it, in a bouncy neighbourhood in the Lower East Side.   The restaurant/pub on the ground floor is very good - upmarket steak and fish dishes etc - and is both an in-door dining room plus a glassed-in atrium area out the back (particularly pleasant).    You need to book, but they do give priority to in-house guests.  

The rooms are not huge, but they're very nicely decked out - shiny black-and-white tiled bathrooms, comfortable beds, a very comprehensive mini bar (which includes amongst other things, a Lovers' Intimacy Kit, the contents of which I will allow readers to imagine for themselves).    The neighbourhood itself buzzes all day and night, full of restaurants and bars and convenience stores and ice-cream parlours.  The subway is about two blocks away at Delancey and Essex, and covers two different lines, crosstown and uptown.   

It's about five minutes walk to Bleecker Street and from there into either the East Village or Greenwich Village, and you can spend a couple of days just exploring that area.     Or the whole of Manhattan stretches uptown from you.

I was delighted with the Ludlow.   The staff were friendly, the rooms were good (it might be worth asking for one that doesn't face the street - there's a constant stream of cab drivers outside, which means a lot of horns), the meals and drinks were good, and we wandered around the Lower East Side very happily, if a bit footsore after a week.   Highly recommended, and I hope to return...

title: Great stay! AMAZING desgin...
text: Room design one of the best - if not THE best - I have ever experienced.  Sooooo lovely! Rest of hotel design spot on, too.  Fun, quirky part of NYC with lots of hidden gems for dining.  If you are lucky enough to stay here be sure and visit 20th floor roof top. Will definitely be back. Thanks, NicholasM and staff...!

title: Love this place!
text: Terrific hotel located in a bustling neighborhood with loads of cafes and restaurants.  We love the whole vibe of this place.  The staff is incredibly friendly.  The lobby/bar area is very cool, and comfortable to hang out in.  The lox and bagel at the restaurant, Dirty French was top notch delicious.  And don't neglect to check out the view of the city from the top floor deck.  This is now my go to place.  Can't wait to go back!

title: 80's rock-n-roll casual chic
text:
Great service throughout. Super stylish with zero attitude. Beautiful, comfortable, evident attention to detail.  This is my new go-to NY hotel. 

While I was there for biz this time and it totally fit the bill, I'd love to return for a romantic getaway as well... it's a very sexy place. 

Note: Was a bit concerned I'd made a style-over-substance choice when I booked a Lower East Side hotel for a midtown biz trip. But it was so convenient! Just a few blocks from the F train, which goes right to the center of midtown. And I've long been a fan of the area for the mix of great restaurants (both hip, foodie variety and old NYC classics) and the European, downtown vibe of Soho and the Village.

title: Lower East Side
text:
Great location for exploring the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Walking distance to Tenement Museum, excellent cafes and restaurants, close to New York University.
Pulsing city life. Hotel has a wonderful restaurant -- Dirty French -- and Sweey Chick next door. Don't miss Russ and Daughters on Orchard Street.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The Ludlow exceeded our expectations. The rooms are well appointed and the furnishings are beautiful. The location is sensational and is walking distance to amazing bars and restaurants. The staff are very friendly and helpful. This hotel added to our NYC experience and highly recommend the Ludlow to anyone.

title: Great staff, great neighborhood, great hotel
text:
My teenage son and I had a great stay at the Ludlow.

Strengths: 1) fun, modern vibe without any attitude or self-consciousness, 2) great value (THANK YOU to this hotel group for your efforts to keep prices reasonable!), 3) the rooms are spacious, light-filled, and extremely well-appointed, 4) the neighborhood is fantastic, 5) rooftop deck is accessible and gorgeous.

Practical note: I love the wide selection of rooms here. My son and I stayed in the Ludlow Loft, and it was perfect for us.  The room has a sitting room with a couch that can be used as a bed.  The extra space offers a lot of flexibility for those traveling with friends or family.

One caveat: light sleepers may want to request a higher floor.  Even for a high-energy neighborhood in NYC, I found the street noise exceptional.

Thank you to the management and staff at the Ludlow for a great stay, and I can't wait to return with family and friends for a future visit!

title: Gorgeous Hotel - Perfect Neighbourhood
text: I stayed here for a long-weekend with my boyfriend, and we both loved the hotel. The design is incredible, and the staff members were all so friendly & helpful. I couldn't recommend this place enough! We stayed in the Queen Studio - it's a bit small, but perfectly comfortable. We had breakfast at Dirty French (the restaurant in the hotel) and really enjoyed it (they even have gluten-free bread!). The bar area gets really busy at night and has a nice vibe to it, so it's great for evening-starter or end-of-the-night drinks. The best part is the proximity to cool cafes, shops, restaurants and bars. The hotel's website will even recommend some great nearby places! I loved our stay here so much and would 100% go back.

title: Could be super!!
text:
Spent a few days in NY with family.
Lower East side is a fabulous area- cafe culture & good vibe.
The Ludlow is a quirky hotel- could be even better! The staff are young and helpful and for that I thank them. We booked a sky loft box room on 19th floor. The views of the New York sky line were fabulous . Coffee facilities in the room, great ensuite with loads of hot water. Big negative- not much room to hang your gear. I would get rid of a couch and put in a set of drawers. 
Great area to walk round and not far from all the usual attractions.

title: やっぱりNYのホテルは狭いですね
text:
すごいボリュームのパストラミサンドイッチで有名なKatz' Delicatessenの近くにあるブティックホテル。素敵なアートで溢れているロビーエリアは夕方から夜にかけてはファッション関係などのお洒落な人が集まって会話や音楽を楽しんでいていつも賑やかです。
部屋はというと清潔でシャワールーム、ベッドルームのデザインが落ち着きつつも適当にお洒落でNYの滞在をわくわくさせてくれます。しかし、やっぱりニューヨーク、部屋が狭いです。スーツケースはベッドの上でダーンと開けなきゃいけないし。長期滞在者にとっては洋服の置き場にも困るでしょう。ビジネスで行きましたが、部屋の中でメールなどのやりとりをする気にはなれません。が、午前中はロビーで無料のコーヒーを飲みながらゆったりとした雰囲気の中お仕事できると思います。歩ける距離にいっぱいレストランもあります。
スタッフも丁寧でフレンドリーなサービス。また今度も泊まってみたいですね。

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The hotel was beautiful. We did get upgraded the firs night due to our room being unavailable. So if you can get the penthouse its pretty awesome! Is a pain to pack up and relocate when you are there for work and have to get moving but was a nice upgrade. They could use a little training for the management or more experienced managers.  Just a bit awkward and uncomfortable when there is a problem. Check your bill if you book through a third party. Great doormen and lower level staff. Great decor. Great location.

title: Brilliant hotel, great location
text:
We came here with our two young children and stayed in a Ludlow double, which was incredibly comfortable and spacious (considering NYC).  Staff were very responsive whenever we made any requests.  We didn't eat in the hotel but Dirty French seemed v popular, there is a Sweet Chick (chicken & waffles) right next door and of course Katz's across the street.

While I appreciate this is not a family focussed hotel (I had no expectations for it to be as such, although we were very comfortable and happy here), I would suggest management consider installing some kind of baby change facility in the toilets by the lobby.  A small pull down table wouldn't take much space and would significantly improve the experience of visiting parents (I'm sure we won't be the last!).

title: Charming Boutique Hotel
text: I recently spent one week at the Ludlow Hotel and really enjoyed it!  LES -  nice location. Friendly staff. Great room and bathroom - very clean and comfortable.  Good attention to details.  Red Flower aromatherapy bath products, Mavis toothpaste, FRED spring water…  Eclectic, cool, comfortable lobby - could spend hours sitting there.  Dirty French Restaurant - had a wonderful dinner there!  Loved the atmosphere.  Porc aux Moutards spare ribs, Beignets with chicory caramel sauce, Tatin with pineapple, banana & rum raisin ice cream - terrific!  Still thinking about them.  Lovely planters outside.  Want to return!

title: Enjoyed it
text: I'm not going to lie, I'm a boutique hotel snob and I've stayed in the best NYC has to offer time and time again.  I decided to try The Ludlow - liked what I read online (reviews), the neighbourhood and the fact that it was designed by the same people who did The Bowery Hotel (I've probably stayed there 100 times).  I had a king loft with small terrace and loved the room.  People - don't complain about the size of the room when you haven't done your research - their website clearly states the size and the studios are small (190 sq feet) so if you can't handle that don't book or or complain about it!!  The elevators move quickly most of the time but I found when it was backed up it was often staff using them (housekeeping mostly) and I think it would have been wise to have a separate elevator for service vs. guests.  Thought Dirty French was good and loved the neighborhood in general, so many great restaurants and shops.  Easy walk to the east and west village & soho, whole foods close by, subways etc.  My only wish would be to provide complimentary water at turn down service - Bowery does it as well as provide a little snack, I always thought that was a nice touch.  I think the front desk could be a little friendlier but the doormen were very good.  Nice gym, nice views of the city from the room and rooftop terrace; gorgeous property - bar/lounge and covered outdoor area lovely.  Reminds me of the Bowery Hotel a lot, but the rooms at Ludlow are nicer ;).  Enjoyed the red earth bath products.  The hotel is a winner, perhaps a little refinement in order but I'll definitely be back :)

title: Great Stay
text: This is one of the best hotels that we have stayed at in NYC. It is not your typical hotel, it had an eclectic look and feel. Although it was on the high end of our budget, it was well worth the extra $. We booked a loft which was a 2 room suite and it was perfect. The room was clean, included free wifi, an honor bar and an expresso maker. There was plenty of closet space (2 closets in the room). The bathroom was large and clean. 24 hour room service was available. The only negative was that, except for breakfast, there wasn't much on the menu that we were interested in ordering. But there were plenty of places to eat in the area. Taverna Di Bacco was our favorite across the street. Parking was across the street and cost $50 per day. Bottom line, I would stay there again.

title: Very small but comfortable rooms, and the whole vibe is very sophisticated and trendy.
text: physically quite small rooms, but the appointments are beautifully done, and the lobby and public spaces have a modern feel while still paying carefull attention to maintaining the beauty of the original architecture. Well sound-proofed rooms provide a quiet space despite the high energy in the lobby and lounge as the evening progresses. Best part of the hotel is the roof top sunset views! Take your Champagne up to the 20th floor and get a breath-taking view of the sun going down over Manhattan. Leave the kiddies at home this trip, and enjoy this very romantic hotel with someone special!

title: Greta buzz and great staff
text:
The Lower East Side is the real NYC if you like tose narrow streets, fire escape tenement buildings and really lively atmosphere.  It's a million miles away from those refined and boring 5th Avenue and midtown "classy" joints.  Flew this time on a BA package and chose the Ludlow  on a personal recommendation; so glad we did.  it's surrounded by lively food joints, including Sweet Chick next door, Katzs deli on the corner and a huge number of bars within walking distance.  you must visit Laboratorio del Gelato round the corner on E Houston for fantastic ice creams too.  Friday night and the hotel turns into this fantastic meeting place for young and not so young, the buzz is fantastic.
The facilities and staff are just what you'd expect from a four star hotel, comfortable and reliable with nice touches of class.  can't recommend this highly enough if you're after a real NYCity break.  Don't miss the Tenement Museum tours highlighting what the area was like in the 19th Century for the immigrants who used to populate this now trendy area,  i think you can get a discount on the admission at the front desk, though we didn't find that out until afterwards!  It's just round the corner on Orchard St.
We'll go back in a shot

title: Not at all a 4* hotel. Non può esser definito un hotel a 4*
text:
It's not at all a 4*hotel. Not clean: I found a cockroack in my room!!!! The staff was not very pleasant, and the lobby's waitress a jerk! Not to mention the breakfast, the worst I have never eaten. A really shame for a "4stars" hotel. Nice the interior design and the bar/lobby that during the night turns into a pub with music, a lot of people and fun. Moreover I have to admit that bed and pillows were veeeryyyy comfortable! Just this save the hotel.

Non è neanche lontanamente un 4*. Non è pulito, io ci sono stata 5 notti e mi sono ritrovata uno scarafaggio in camera. Quando sono andata a protestare (mostrandogli le foto) si sono scusati con una bottiglia di vino...cioè, come minimo mi dovevano cambiare stanza. Ad ogni modo, il personale è davvero scortese, e la ragazza che serve ai tavoli nel salone è insopportabile. Per non parlare della colazione, davvero pessima! Buono l'arredamento e l'atmosfera che si crea la sera nel salone, con musica e tanta gente. Ma l'unica cosa che davvero salva questo hotel sono i letti e i cuscini, davvero molto molto confortevoli!

title: Swanky, friendly & upscale
text: Great Lower East Side hotel. Lobby well appointed with comfy seating and nice bar - nicely eclectic. Favorite ground level room is greenhouse-like garden room with couches and chairs/4-top tables. On two recent stays, we stayed in 7th floor rooms with a very nice terrace. The terrace was almost as big as the small but comfy and well appointed room. Good bathroom. Good bed and linens. Breakfast in 'Dirty French' restaurant was superb.

title: Great place in a exciting area
text:
Sky box loft on floor 15th offered a splendid view! Small bedroom but the living room more than well makes up for that. Really nice bathroom with large tub with plenty of room for two!
Wonderful athmosphere, just hanging in the bar, restaurant or the lobby is fine as well.

title: Nice hotel but TOO LOUD
text: Hotel is very nice and trendy but best for someone who wants nightlife and no sleep. Outside noise from bars, fighting, and cars honking from construction traffic backup was nonstop. Our room was a loft king and was comfortable but small.

title: We'll never stay anywhere else in NYC
text: This is by far the best hotel we've ever stayed in. The room was amazing - so peaceful and luxurious. We were on the 13th floor and had a queen loft room. There were two windows overlooking LES and the view was great. We slept with the curtains open while we were there and woke up to amazing sunrises. The bath was probably my favourite thing about the room, as well as the comfortable bed. We booked on the Ludlow website and got free breakfast and cocktail vouchers. The breakfast was lovely, although it would have been great to have a little bit of each of the continental breakfast options instead of a huge basket of pastries as one option! The bar was really cool. Location was perfect - lots to do nearby (Katz's Deli definitely worth a visit for the experience) but not too far to walk to Midtown (about half an hour). We found an amazing speakeasy Mexican restaurant/bar nearby. The Ludlow is an amazing hotel in New York and we'll never stay anywhere else.

title: Definitely a treat
text:
Pros:
- Skybox loft gave incredible 180 degree views downtown and of One World Trade.
- Bed was super comfortable.
- Bathroom was amazing.  I would stay here again and again just because of that bathtub.
- Free Nespresso pods and wifi in the rooms.
- The room was quiet.  We stayed on the 11th floor and, apart from the odd siren from the street, it was very quiet.
- Bar and restaurant downstairs were lively. We didn't visit them, but wish we had!
- Front desk were very helpful at all times.  We were able to check in early at 12pm.
- Great location.  Heaps of bars and restaurants around and right over the street from Katz.

Cons:
- Rooms are not huge (but it's NYC, go figure). We stayed in the Skybox Loft for two nights, so there was room for a suitcase on the floor and to move around it.
- AC. It's not unbearably loud, but if you're a light sleeper...  Either it's on all the time, or on 'auto' where it will kick in every so often to cool down the room - and frighten the life out of you.  On the plus side, room was always a good temp.

I would love to stay again (if I could afford it), the room was great and I loved the area.

title: Trendy and Fun Boutique Hotel with Best Downtown Location
text:
The Ludlow Hotel is easy to adore.  Yes, the standard rooms are boutique-sized, (recommend upgrade to loft rooms if you can afford it), but the appointments in the room are superb, the location is to die-for and the staff is wonderfully helpful.
Dozens of amazing LES galleries are blocks from the hotel.  The Whitney and all of the high brow Chelsea galleries are an easy Citibike ride across town (make sure you get a Citibike pass!).
In my book, The Ludlow is the ultimate in living like a New Yorker for a short stay, (says this former New Yorker who visits the Ludlow a few times per year).

title: Girls weekend
text: Couldn't be happier with the weekend I had at the ludlow. A friend of mine booked it and I'm so happy with her choice. We stayed here for a fun girls getaway. The rooms were beautiful and the cocktails in the lounge were amazing. Everyone was super friendly especially the two ladies at the front desk (bridey and scarlet) who were really helpful and gave great suggestions for places to eat and go dance. Can't wait for my next stay!

title: Birthday/Anniversary Trip
text: Exceptional boutique hotel and within walking distance to some great restaurants and shops, as well as the subway. We stayed at the Ludlow for our 10th anniversary. The staff left a handwritten note congratulating us with a bottle of wine upon arrival to our beautifully appointed corner room. We took full advantage of everything the hotel had to offer; including, the rooftop gym with gorgeous views, the sky lighted cafe/rest area, the bar with FANTASTIC drinks (quiet during the day, fun and full on a weekend night), and, of course, the acclaimed restaurant, Dirty French (we ate there and had room service: both fantastic. Loved the lamb burger for room service). My favorite experience within the hotel, however, was the interaction with the staff. All were fun, friendly, and helpful.

title: Great property, not impressed by their restaurant
text: Put the restaurant aside, the location of the hotel is great - right in middle of great bars, restaurants and shopping - everything is walking distance. the rooms and property were super nice - well appointed, well taken care, and well worth the price. And everyone was super nice and helpful. Just didn't like the restaurant (attitudes and drinks) and when i e-mailed the hotel about it, they never responded. Disappointing, Would def go back to the hotel, just would avoid the restaurant.

title: Nice area but the rooms are too small!
text: We spent two nights in Ludlow hotel, we paid for night around 370usd, included tax and all resort fee Ect Ect as usual you book for a rate and then at the end you pay three times more in USA. Tricky. We had a studio room. Small is not even the right words. For two people it was almost impossible to stand together in the room. Nice design but you need also to open the suitcase in certain case) minimal type of amenities, if you know what I mean. Great area, indeed. I wouldn't return.

title: Disappointed
text:
We were really looking forward to our first stay at the Ludlow, and although we travel extensively, we have never before written a review.  The series of mishaps were as follows:  We checked in at 3:30 p.m., and the process was much longer than it should have been as were told that "I have to move some things around."  That was a strange thing to hear during check in, but it was repeated twice.  "I am sorry; I have to move some things around."  We finally proceeded to our room only to find that the temp in the room was 78 degrees, and the AC would not work.  I called the front desk and they told me to wait 10 minutes for it to "kick in."  I nicely assured the front desk staff that I am very good with hotel AC units and am quite sure that it is not working, but he asked me to please try waiting.  After 10 min, I called back and told them the AC wasn't working.  A second gentlemen asked me to flip the fan switch from "auto" to "on," and that should fix the problem.  I assured him that I really don't think the AC is working, but he asked to try this and please wait another ten minutes. He was sure that would fix the problem.  Ten minutes later I called back to tell them the AC wasn't working.  "Oh," I was told..."Did we send up a mechanic?"  "No," I said, you told me twice to wait 10 minutes."  So they sent up a mechanic, who told us that yes, they have had several units that day that have needed to be "reset."    He proceeded to do what he had to do, and 45 minutes after we got to our room, we were finally able to leave the room, comfortable that the AC was fixed.  It is very puzzling why the folks at the front desk did not seem to know what the mechanic told us, and why they did not send him up right away.  
   The following morning, a strange and unpleasant sulfur smell came from AC vent.  This lasted about an hour, then gradually faded, but it was enough to wake us and make us a bit nauseated.  
   Then we went out for breakfast and returned to check out.  We got back to the room at 11:53 a.m., and although we were assured that check out time was indeed noon time, our room key no longer worked.  So we had to go back down to the desk, and they had to send someone up with us to unlock the room.  We were told that the key might stop working after check out time.  I told him that, no, I got back to the room at 11:53 a.m., and he told me "yes, the keys sometimes stop working around that time."  That made absolutely no sense to us, and was the final of the comedy of errors that we experienced.  It seems that the Ludlow has some very serious kinks to work out.

title: Nearly 'Good'; Service Lets It Down
text:
So much going for this place, including good-value rooms in the crazy scheme of New York hotel prices. But I would not go back.
The location is good if you are going to hang out downtown and there is plenty to walk to visit. 
Charming doormen greet you and help you in. Good first impression. If only the receptionists could bother to look you in the eye! Cold and cursory at best. 
A chic reception space gives on to a warm and buzzy bar. Quite a small space for the number of guests, but comfortable and good to meet people.
The elevator must be one of the slowest on the lower East Side. You think twice about dashing back to the room. The stairs are quicker.
The room was good. Stylishly fitted out, truly comfortable bed and a chic bathroom. Could do with some more drawers or shelves to store clothes, but good and welcoming space. 
We checked in late and wanted to eat in the hotel. The restaurant was fully booked. We were met again by the cold and unapologetic staff, advised to 'try down the street'. Of course, we should have booked ahead, but just some charm would have worked.
Breakfast is brisk and slight; just some self-service coffee and buffet items in the bar area. It's fine if a little functional. I would recommend finding a diner round the block.
So - stay here if you want a good room but you don't need to hang around. If you want to relax and enjoy the space, if you wanna eat in and expect a welcome on the desk - I would look elsewhere.

title: Long weekend in the City
text: This hotel is very clean and modern. The staff is very accommodating and friendly.  I would definitely (and have) recommended this hotel to others.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  I have stayed here once before and had a great experience and will stay here again in the future.  I have traveled to the city many times and this is by far my favorite hotel.

title: Fun in NYC!
text: We have stayed at the Ludlow a couple of times and enjoy it very much!  The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and accommodating, and we love the atmosphere of this boutique hotel.  The decor is unique and beautiful. We will definitely go back!

title: Great place to stay!!
text: This is our second time staying at The Ludlow! The staff is excellent and very accommodating. Kenny at the front desk was very attentive to our needs... We loved our room ... There are robes in the bathroom and a lovely tub and shower combination. The lobby bar was a great place to have a drink ...Thank you!!!!

title: Quality, Attention to Detail, and the Scene!
text:
I have stayed at the Ludlow four times in the past year - a couple trips for biz and one for pleasure. The place has an insane attention to detail, and obsesses about creating a great customer experience. I can't really explain it, but whenever I stay I feel like I'm a member of some private club, granted lock and key access to one of the hottest spots in the city. I like it because my local friends always come to me at this hotel, rather than meet up at some overcrowded bar in the LES or Soho. The lounge downstairs feels private, but is overflowing with creative types and models. 

The beds, rooms, and mini-bar (yes!) are one of my favorite parts of the experience. Massive, super comfortable beds and furnishings/decor seem straight out of a Restoration Hardware catalog. The rose-scented bodywash and the pretzels/gummy bears from the mini bar are unreal. 

Honestly, I never write reviews about hotels but felt compelled to do so here. Ludlow is unlike any other.

title: Great experience
text: Great hotel at a convenient location. Lots of restaurants and bars around and a quick walk to the tourist spots. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Room was clean and quiet and had everything I needed. Only complaints are the size of the room (a little small) and the slow elevators. Would definitely stay here again though. I highly recommend this hotel to singles and couples.

title: Awesome Hotel!
text: I've stayed in NYC many times, usually at chain hotels. This time we decided to give the Ludlow a try.  Our room had a small sitting area - it was on the 16th floor.  The room was awesome - great bed, wonderfully furnished, very comfortable but also just well done.  Unlike some reviews, we found the service was terrific at the front desk - very friendly.  This will be our new go-to hotel when we come to NYC.  By the way, the location is great - walking distance to SOHO and great restaurants all around it.

title: Above and beyond
text:
I've stayed here multiple times while visiting New York for both business and pleasure. And it gets better each time. 

The rooms are well-designed, the service is sharp and personable, the views are amazing, and the food/bar scene is top notch. 

From late check-outs to special room requests, the front desk has always been accommodating. 

I also love grabbing drinks in the covered area, and then following that up with a delicious meal at their restaurant Dirty French. Speaking of which, for breakfast, the scrambled eggs are cooked with perfection and the roasted potatoes are next level. It's sometimes the small things that make your stay extra memorable.

title: Great hotel but really horrible service
text:
My room was nice, great view, and with high tech equipement and superb bed. Great gym room and roof top is wonderfull. The doormen are really helpfull and welcoming.
But the service is not friendly at all (check in desk) :  she did not welcomed me, she did not look at a second while doing the check-in, and even worse:  I told her that the arline had lost my luggage and that it will be delivered to the hotel the day after, she did not care at all and did not show a inch of empathy...just horrible for such a hotel of this level. Finally, I paid for a high floor room and I had a 8th floor out of 20 (i dont call it high) ! 
I will not come back. For this price other hotels in NYC are better.

title: Overrated
text:
We stayed here as a couple in May. We booked a queen loft as it was a special occasion and we wanted to splash out.

I have to say we didn't enjoy our experience. We found the vast majority of the front office staff to be surly. There wasn't much of a welcome and given how tucked out the way they are it seems they're kept away from guests.

Our rate included breakfast at the equally disappointing dirty French. Given the room rate we were expecting more than granola or pastries, we were even charged for a slice of toast to replace these items which I couldn't eat - which seemed mean.

Indeed most of our stay felt about what wasn't available or included versus 'welcome thank you for staying'. The tone in the welcome manuals, signs and staff is all a bit too cool for school and here we found the famous American hospitality utterly lacking.

The location was quite convenient and there's some nice spots around. The bar is very expensive and with a fire in 25 degree heat was a bit strange.

Overall I've stayed in some lovely trendy places where I've felt really welcome and left with great memories. Unfortunately this isn't one of them. We won't be returning to the Ludlow - which is a real shame

title: Quirky, great location, amazing food
text:
Overall score 9/10

Views 10/10 amazing overview of the city we stayed on the 13th floor 
Staff 8/10
Design 10/10 very nice marble simplistically decor 
Rooms 8/10 could be a bit bigger but it is New York
Food 11/10 it has a busy restaurant on the ground floor but not affected by the noise at the rooms are much higher the food is is just fabulous
Location 11/10 full of coffee shops bars and quirky shopping 

Please see the view from the living room area

title: Definitely Worth Trying
text:
I booked two rooms at The Ludlow for a recent family trip to NYC for an extra-long weekend. 

In general, we liked the hotel very much, would return and would recommend it to others. Front desk people are helpful and responsive. The public spaces are quite to my liking -- Lower East Side vibe with a cutting edge, but still comfortable. The courtyard garden sitting area is particularly cool and restful.

The connection to the excellent Dirty French restaurant is a huge plus.

Be careful when choosing a room. Go big or go home. I had a King Loft with Terrace and it was not huge but the outdoor access made it feel more spacious. The clothes hanging space in the wardrobe was inadequate and the bathroom was small. The robes and bath towels are skimpy. These are little things that the hotel could improve very easily.

Although I had requested more than once that the second room, occupied by my (grown) children, be located near mine. They were placed in a room a dozen floors below and had a view of cars in a stacked parking garage. A polite request resulted in a room switch the next day. Unless you are getting a super-great rate, avoid room on the east lower floors.

The roof terrace could be spruced up and serviced. At the moment, it seems like a wasted asset. On the other hand, the lobby and courtyard areas are good choices for a post-shopping drink.

Anyone who is a little tired of the more touristy areas will love the history and authenticity of this neighbourhood. Katz's is a 5-second walk away! The Ludlow's rates are reasonable when compared to other choices in LES and Soho. With bigger towels and space for a few more hangers, it would easily get 5 stars from me!

title: EXCELLENT BOUTIQUE
text: This hotel is just beyond cool. The bar/lounge is hopping and  has a great vibe. The rooms are neat and the bath robe is Maison Margiela and available to purchase! Super convenient location by Katz's Deli (yummy ) and Russ' Daughter's Deli.

title: I fell a little bit inhe  love...
text: I am already looking forward to coming back to the Ludlow  hotel. I enjoyed the design and for once I even enjoyed the scent and the shower cream. lotion etc., which is not normally the case as I am sensitive to perfumes. The beds are to die for and you do not want to get up: If you get up there is a restaurant, the Dirty French in the hotel with fab food and a cool bar where you can sip your drink and enjoy the crowd. And when venturing outside you are in the a very interesting neighbourhood with lots of interesting things to discover. For once the gym is not hidden in the basement, but at the top so I got a nice view every morning. What really stod out was the staff. Very nice and service-minded and the Ludlow seems to hire not based on a fancy training in hospitality, but rather personality. They way beyond what is "normal service" to make our stay as great as possible.

title: fabulous hotel
text: We stayed at the Ludlow in may, we were really impressed with this hotel, spotless and the decor was amazing. Beautiful roof top terrace great for viewing the New York sky line, there's also an indoor covered area which is nice for a chilling drink. The staff were very helpful and friendly and very willing to offer advice and help. My only thing to watch would be if you want to eat in the fashionable restaurant you need to book in advance, this restaurant and bar is popular with the New York erst so enquire before you travel. I would love to go back to this stunning hotel.

title: An Oasis in SoHo
text:
Love the location, top notch staff, and great hang out area. Felt like I was in Europe . Dirty French resturant worth the visit alone. Detail and appointments genuine. Ludlow Street is a nightly scene in itself, but with Wholefoods up the street, it's really a great hub for visiting NYC

Reason I really love it , Katz's Deli 50 feet way!

title: Loved it!
text: I stayed here for four nights with my boyfriend in December 2015.  We both absolutely loved it.  A new, modern and cool hotel.  We had packed for a cold winter break with huge jackets etc but were surprised as it turned out to be about 20°C most days, which is a Scottish summer!  The air con worked perfectly for this!  The bathroom was by far my favourite part, went for a bath everyday!  The bed was also one of the comfiest I have slept in.  The room was small but that's what we expected.  The way the hotel was decorated and furnished was really to my style.  The rooftop gym and seating area was good for views of the city.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and we can't wait to stay again!

title: Good hotel in LES
text:
Love the decor and details of this hotel. Rooms are tiny, but typical in NYC.  There's complimentary coffee (nespresso) in the rooms but also good Coffee shop two doors down, and another one a block over, and several cute boutiques in the area. Also close to train stn and main road to catch a taxi.

There's a restaurant, Dirty French, in the hotel that was always bustling day or night, and the hotel lounge is always busy in the evenings so didn't even get a chance to have drinks.   Popular place so can only assume that its worth checking out!

Service was only okay compared to other hotels I've stayed in NYC, nothing spectacular.  Would recommend for short stays and if you don't require much service from the hotel.

title: Great visit!
text: We visit NYC each year to visit our daughter in the East Village. This year we chose to stay at the Ludlow. A great decision.  The location is right in the middle of great restaurants, especially Katz right across the street. Room was good, comfy bed, nice size bathroom and great view. Ray at the front desk was exceptionally accommodating during our visit and will definitely stay here again.

title: The Ludlow makes NY even cooler.
text:
I stayed here for two nights with some friends for our 40th birthday and what a perfect place to spend it! 

The lounge and bar area are simply stunning. Leather furnishings, a multitude of textures of Browns and oranges, warmly lit and a beautiful fire place. 

The lounge area is transforms in to hive of social activity and the vibe is amazing. It is populated with the beautiful people of NYC but that's by no means a bad thing you can't help but admire the elegance.

The rooms are a little cosy but beautifully decorated. The super king size beds just swallow you up. The bathroom is a masterclass in 19th century British design; gold ornate fittings, white tiles, big shower. 

The staff were great and always helpful and polite. 

New York hotels are expensive full stop and I wrangled about paying another £35 a night extra for the Ludlow but it was well worth it. It's a great hotel in a great location surrounded by great places to eat and drink. Next time I'm in NY it will definitely be on my place of choice.

title: Tiny rooms, no storage
text: Clean nice hotel, but the rooms are to small with virtually no storage for clothes, we had to leave most our clothes in our suitcase, they then only provide you with a hopeless travel ironing board so get used to wearing creased clothes 😬👎🏿

title: Intenso, charming e qualche pecca
text: L'hotel si trova in un'area rivitalizzata di gallerie d'arte e di vita notturna. L'ambiente è originale, di mattone rosso a vista, con stile e calore. Perfetto per un soggiorno a due. La camera calda, accogliente e con stile. Il personale è giovane e cortese. Una pecca: la colazione di qualità modesta e di modesta quantità

title: didnt work for me
text: Rooms are small. I had to store my suitcase under the bed.  Bar area is nice but the drinks are very overpriced. I liked the throw over the bed, the rugs were beautiful, the area is wayyy too loud (think sirens alllll the time) and has little character.  Front desk is so unhelpful.  I travel a lot.  I stay in NYC a couple of times a year...I wanted to try out the location and was taking my Mom, I wanted her to have a balcony and she did.  It was very good sized, so we did enjoy that.  Called ahead to get rooms close and was told it would be no problem.  We ended up on two different floors.  Needless to say, I won't be back.  If you want to stay lower, I think tribeca, soho, and greenwich village offer much better surroundings.

title: Beautiful cozy rooms
text:
What a great job with the design of this hotel. The rooms are just lovely, some with some great views over the city. The bar and lounge area are the perfect place to relax with friends or alone. The restaurant was very good and with a pleasant atmosphere. 
Love the location in the Lower East Side, right next to famous Katz deli and plenty of other great places.

title: bell'albergo, ottima posizione, peccato per il pessimo servizio
text:
è la dimostrazione che non basta avere un ambiente "cool" per avere un hotel di successo. l'attenzione agli ospiti dovrebbe essere la priorità di un hotel.
mi hanno smarrito una borsa a mano che avevo affidato alla reception durante il mio check out. E' già abbastanza grave che sparisca qualcosa dal guardaroba custodito dal personale dell'hotel. E' scandaloso che al ritrovamento della borsa questa venga affidata ad un spedizioniere che ci mette 15 giorni per consegnare in Italia e mi addebita 37 euro di spese di spedizione.

title: Great Hotel/Great location
text: This is a fun 'hip' hotel in the Lower East Side. There are great restaurants, bars and boutiques nearby. The bar is buzzy and fun - the restaurant good - not amazing. My room was wonderful - cozy but with a huge terrace. It is great value for the price. My one complaint would be that they don't have a service elevator. At certain times of the day you wait ages for the elevator and then you cram in with service carts and staff.

title: Long weekend NYC break
text:
Overall this hotel is in a great location and the hotel itself is very quiet at night, bathrooms are clean and a good size.
We choose this hotel as it's owner is also the owner of the Bowery Hotel were we have always stayed and loved. On arrival check in was very quick, however I would say a little impersonal. We had a queen terrace and I have to be honest the room is TINY, thank god for the outside space or it would have felt very cramped and boxed in.

If your choosing a queen terrace, Don't travel with a lot of luggage, the room can not accommodate storage for them, thankfully we only had hand luggage bags or we would have run out of space to move around in the room.
Don't bother brining a lot of clothes either as there is hardly any space to put them. One small rail in a small wardrobe with one shelve, no drawers. My husband and I are savvy packers but found it difficult to store the few clothes we did have.
