The bathroom is a very nice size, showers are excellent however the towels were frayed on the edges, something I think shouldn't happen in a $400 per night hotel, and there was also a very noticeable hole in the bathmat.

The saving grace of this particular hotel room was the terrace.

We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning, and were asked if we were guests of the hotel, keep in mind it was not super busy we were still asked to wait and then watched how another couple was seated before us even though they arrived later than we did. The waiter then claimed that he didn't speak to us initially and only after approaching him then proceeded to seat us.

The boys at the front door where always very helpful and friendly, hotel also offers to store your bags on check out until you need to come back for them to continue your trip.

title: NYC to paint son's apartment
text: We visited NYC for a long weekend to paint son's new apartment on the Lower East Side. He recommended the Ludlow which was near his place. We arrived Friday and registration, reception and parking was easy. We went to the lounge off of the lobby and it was excellent. A fun place full of travelers and locals having a drink and conversation. We had dinner at NAVY and it was very good. We ate breakfast at the Ludlow and it was very good. We had lunch on Saturday at L.E.S burger and it was excellent (cash only btw); dinner was at Rin Tin Tin and it was excellent, food, service etc were all above par. Breakfast Mother's Day was at the Ludlow and we had the Crepe American (pancakes) and they were fantastic. All in all a great trip.

title: Very stylish but didn't work for us .
text:
We booked 2 rooms as part of an 'easter special' deal with this hotel for a family of 4. I had been clear when I booked that one room needed to have twin beds but on arrival this was not the case ( not entirely saying fault of the hotel ) The problems arose when we tried to resolve the issue - the reception staff did not appear to be interested and we felt demonstrated a poor attitude for a hotel of this calibre. We managed the first night by requesting a bed be made up in the sitting area. 
The hotel is very stylish and the decor is great , it no doubt attracts a very trendy clientele and anyone wishing to experience the buzz  of New York would enjoy the hotel but it is very noisy, street noise until well into the early hours but also lots of noise of people chatting in the corridors after 2am. The final straw for us came when we tried the 'complimentary ' breakfast  which was supposed to be part of the Easter promotion - this was 1 item only from a choice of 3 - fruit , yoghurt or pastries and a drink . ( even a different milk had to be paid for ) . None of this had been made clear when the booking was made and we have never before experienced such limitations on a complimentary breakfast.
We ate in the onsite restaurant for dinner on arrival and the food was fabulous - very highly recommended.
We checked out after the first night and the Manager was apologetic but on this occasion the hotel just did not work for us.

title: Ridiculously cool hotel
text:
Had a great three night stay at the Ludlow over the bank holiday weekend. We treated outselves and splashed out on the 'Skybox loft' room which I cannot recommend enough - it really was so special having amazing views over downtown new york and sitting in the bath looking out over the bustling city in the evening. Plus, waking up horribly early due to jet lag we threw open the curtains and watched the sun rise every morning from our many windows which was amazing. 

We arrived late on friday night with no dinner reservations and the lovely girl at reception sent us in the direction of Lucien on 1st Av. A delicious little french restaurant full of very cool people - highly reccomend! 

Only thing that wasn't ideal is that there wasnt much storage space in the room, just a small wardrobe. Luckily, we didnt mind but if you want to hung up all your clothes, you may find it tricky. 

We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant however it was quite expensive. On other mornings we ate at 'Egg Shop' and 'Jack's Wife Freda' which aren't far and much better value. 

All in all, it was an amazing amazing trip and the Ludlow made it. We look forward to visiting again soon!

title: Perfect hotel for our trip to NYC!
text: When you walk in the lobby you cant help but feel like you are in a 5 star hotel. Room although really small didn't bother us at all. We weren't in NY to do cartwheels in our room and quite frankly I think its silly that people even complain about the room size. The location is great, right next to a subway station. It was the best hotel for the price we were willing to pay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC.

title: Trendy Lower East Side Hotel
text: Wanted to try this hotel as we have stayed in their other The Bowery several times. Same hip vibe, crowded bar and lobby space that gets louder and fun at night. Great part of town for lower Manhattan visiting which was our goal.  Rooms are on the small side, but booked the studio King which added a bit more space.  Great bed and noise was not a problem from 5th floor. Enjoyed the common rooms in the am and early afternoon for drinking and work as not crowded yet. Need to go with the flow here and enjoy old buildings as elevator slow and also has to cover as service elevator.   Dirty French is their restaurant. Had good dinner with a gang of people but their breakfast service (and I mean the service) was so bad we walked out twice during out stay.  Also had to go to the neighborhood cafes for coffee as the house blend was flat.  Maybe that's what New Yorkers do.

title: Uber cool and trendy hotel.
text:
We stayed at The Ludlow for 4 nights back in Feb and I'm so glad we picked this fabulous hotel for our trip to NY.  It was our first time staying in the Lower East Side and I was a bit apprehensive about this location but as soon as we stepped through the door of the Ludlow, I knew we'd made a great choice.  The vibe is incredibly cool and trendy with seriously funky decor.  
We stayed in a Sky Box Loft and, although it is much smaller than the photos, we loved it.  The seating area and the huge windows make for some pretty amazing views of the south/west side, especially in the winter sun.  The only negative I have about the room is the lack of closet space.  
We spent some time at the hotel bar, which was always buzzing and great for people watching.  Most evenings when we came back to the hotel, the bar was incredibly busy and made us stop for some nightcaps.  
The hotel has some great bars, coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance (and Soho is a 10 min walk).  I have definitely changed my mind about the Lower East Side and cannot wait to come back to The Ludlow.

title: Great stay!
text: We stayed for two nights at The Ludlow and really didn't want to leave. The queen room was a little snug, but lovely and cosy, and the terrace more than made up for any space issues inside! We had a great view of the Lower East Side and it was lovely to be able to relax outside after a day of shopping & wandering. It's a shame that terrace rooms don't have bathtubs - that would have made the stay truly perfect. It's pretty expensive, but lovely as a treat! I would happily stay again.

title: Great hotel  with nice views
text: We stayed for a night and liked the hotel very much. The studio mini was indeed a little small but the nice bathroom with bathtub made up for it. The bed was queen-sized and very comfortable. Best thing was the view (we were on the 17th floor) which was not on the Manhattan skyline but looking south. The staff was polite and helpful and the breakfast in the french restaurant was good too.

title: Amazing hotel- would visit again.
text:
Stunning modern boutique hotel. Friendly staff- especially the doorman ( always polite and friendly). Excellent location- walkable distance from subway. Great view from hotel - could see the Empire State Building. Helpful list of local restaurants- all the ones we tried were very tasty! Complimentary breakfast was delicious- especially the almond croissants!
Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Looks great but has some issues
text: I was really excited about our stay at the Ludlow as I had heard great things but I must say it didn't live up to my expectations. We booked through Booking.com and the room we were given didn't match the Queen Room we had booked or the one advertised on the Ludlow website as it didn't have a sitting area. They apologised and 'upgraded' us to a King Room but we went from the 9th floor with a city view to the 5th floor at the back of the hotel with a view of a car park. We ordered room service one night and the food was really average. However it is in a good location with lots of fun boutiques, restaurant options and the subway is close. The food at Dirty French was great but be prepared it is pretty expensive.

title: Great birthday treat
text: Stayed at this hotel for six nights with my husband as a birthday treat for him,we had a queen studio which is on the small side but as its only for sleeping in we thought it was perfect ,the bath was huge and was lovely to sit in and watch the world go by and as we were on the 16th floor and no building overlooking us it was very relaxing.we were about 2 miles south of time square and we just walked to all the attractions as we were able to see many sights en-route,the hotel restaurant was busy at night as was the whole area as so many bars with live music.The staff were very pleasant always ready to help in any way as was the housekeeping staff bed linen changed every other day ,we found a nice pub to eat and drink called The Grayson 16 first avenue staff very helpful.All things considered it may not be the cheapest place but we will definitely be back.

title: Great stay in a fun neighborhood
text: The room was beautifully appointed, though tiny (welcome to New York). The bed was comfortable and the shower was perfect. The staff was attentive and helpful. The lobby is definitely a scene at night. I didn't mind because the room was still nice and quiet. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but the bar is quite good (Dirty French). The room service was prompt and friendly. The neighborhood itself is lively with lots of bars, restaurants and shopping.

title: Week in NYC in spring time
text:
Just arrived back from 6 days in New York staying at the Ludlow Hotel. Stayed on the 16th floor brilliant view, woke up each morning to a beautiful sunrise through the large paned window. This hotel is boutique style it ha very laid back atmosphere, staff very attentive and helpful. Had to wait an hour until our room was ready but sitting in the covered seating area having coffee made it very pleasant.
The room we had was one of the smaller types but comfortable and had a huge bath that filled in minutes with a big picture window look out off. Maid service excellent everything changed each day, could not fault that side. 
Hotel has a restaurant on site but we didn't use as quite noisy one of the places to be in the lower east side. The whole area within the Lower East Side is very vibrant, numerous restaurants and bars all busy most days of week, all types of cuisine. If your coming to New York to see the sites this area is the place to be you can see all sites through the day and party the nights away as a lot of bars have live music covering all types of genres.
If you like your sport several darts showing all main sports throughout the day.
If it's your first time in NY and you like good food and nightlife the Ludlow is a good place to stay.

title: Edgy
text: Great hotel. Our room was ' cosy'/ small but the views more than made up for it. Great bathroom with a big window. Breakfast was good in front of blazing fire. Good downtown location -and parking very nearby. Close to Katz's famous deli ( When Harry met Sally). Funky restaurant ( Dirty French ) in hotel. What are you waiting for??

title: Lovely
text: We had a wonderful week in New York and the ackommodation couldn't have been better. The Ludlow Hotel has a warm and cosy atmosphere. The staff was professional and friendly. We loved the "Are you coffee or tea people" guy at breakfast. The bed was awesome and rain shower refreshing 😊. Service was top since they took care of things directly. When we return to New York we will definitly choose the Ludlow Hotel.

title: Everything you would expect from a Lower East Side hotel
text: I stayed here two nights for work. It is a super hip hotel in one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods -- great ambiance for an NYC vacation.  They have a nice roof deck, a better-than-average gym and a fun restaurant. The staff is very pleasant and professional.I got an "upgrade" to a room that was still tiny, but that is not that surprising in light of the location. If you want the most bang for your buck I am sure there are better deals (probably in Queens or Brooklyn), but this hotel is definitely on par with the other small hotels in which I have stayed in Lower Manhattan.

title: Trendy. gritty. quality
text:
We wanted away to stay from Mid-Town tedium when we booked a five-night stay for my wife's birthday and the Lower East Side ticked every box in terms of something completely different.
For English visitors, think Hoxton or Shoreditch - definitely slightly edgy but dip below first impressions and there is so much to be said for an area which has vibrancy, energy and life. Just in Ludlow Street where (predictably!) the hotel is situated there were a dozen great bars and four of five top class restaurants. Thai, Japanese, French, Italian - and that's before you add Dirty French in The Ludlow to the list.
After The Ludlow organised a car from JFK, we arrived at the hotel and were greeted impeccably. Already the lobby bar was buzzing and our reservation at Dirty French was waiting. Even if you're a resident, don't chance your arm that you'll get a table, book at least two weeks in advance, it's that popular.
Great decor in the lobby, bar and restaurant, totally in keeping with the hotel's cutting edge reputation and our room matched perfectly. Let's be fair, NYC rooms are infamously small but our 7th floor dwelling definitely didn't come in the 'shoebox' category and with a big terrace overlooking the street which had a table and chairs and two loungers, we weren't complaining.
Dirty French was excellent although fatigue kicked in and we swerved the bar afterwards in favour of the biggest bed I've ever slept in.
The next morning we ventured out and with the subway at Delancey Street/Essex Street just five minutes stroll, we began the most memorable week's trip in what is fast becoming my third favourite city (behind London and Rome).
Not much else to add except every member of staff at The Ludlow was enthusiastic, warm, friendly and welcoming - there wasn't a single thing that was too much trouble. They gave New Yorkers a great name with none of the infamous attitude you sometimes find further Uptown.
We could walk comfortably to Greenwich Village, Soho and Tribeca and thanks to a recommendation from the hotel, we mooched up and down Bleecker St a couple of times and got a real feel for that part of the city.
Three restaurant recommendations if you're going. Try Catch opposite the Gansevoort Hotel near Chelsea Market for outstanding seafood and sushi. If it's decent weather, try and get a table on the roof terrace.
Mezzaluna on the Upper East Side is the best traditional Italian I've had anywhere for a long, long time and, finally, Via Carota in Grove Street off Bleecker in the West Village for lunch takes some beating.

title: Stanze piccole, parti comuni molto godibili
text: Le stanze sono veramente di dimensioni ridotte, in compenso la lounge è un posto gradevole, pieno di elementi di design, complessivamente molto curato. Eccellente la zona, piena di vita senza essere invivibile.

title: Super hôtel
text:
On a aimé : l emplacement, service, la deco, l ambiance du soir au bar, la propreté, la vue ( chambre skybox ), la qualité du petit déjeuner , l accueil bref tout!
L'organisation du desk était parfaite depuis la réservation que l'on a faite depuis la France.
Opter pour une chambre le plus haut possible afin d'avoir la meilleure vue sur Manhattan. À couper le souffle

title: Muy buena opción para vivir como un neoyorquino.
text: Muy buen hotel en una de las zonas punteras de Nueva York en la actualidad. Muy bien ubicado en una zona con muchos restaurantes y marcha y de difícil acceso a las diferentes líneas de metro. Un plus es que la zona, a pesar de ser puntera, es más barata que el resto de Manhattan. Chinatown y Little Italy están también a unas calles de allí. Lo único que no nos gustó fue el desayuno. Va incluido y sólo puedes elegir entre tres cosas. Si además quieres un café de cafetera (es decir, un café a la europea) tienes que pagar, por ejemplo. No sé si el restaurante que está allí (que por cierto tiene mucha clientela) y el hotel son una misma cosa. En el caso de serlo falta comunicación entre ellos. Una de las mañanas que desayunamos allí tuvimos un percance con uno de los camareros de allí (el único maleducado, el resto eran muy amables y serviciales) porque no nos habían explicado bien lo de los cupones que dan en recepción para el desayuno. En lugar de ayudar se puso muy grosero acusándonos de no querer pagar y de que nos pusiéramos nosotros en contacto con recepción para solucionar el problema. Para darle la mayor puntuación al hotel, deberían de cuidar las formas así como la comunicación y el servicio entre el hotel y el restaurante. Por lo demás, todo el personal del hotel, desde recepción a los porteros, pasando por el servicio de limpieza, fenomenales.

title: Fabulous
text: Beautiful common areas, beautiful room, beautiful views from the top floor terrace; somehow, they've even managed to attract a big crowd of beautiful people too (including a famous musician who got in our lift)!  This is a fantastic hotel though, I would not look anywhere else when I am back in the city.

title: Loving the Ludlow
text:
This was actually my 2nd stay at the Ludlow. I stayed last year during their "soft open" (hey the rate was awesome) and that stay was cool, but proving that the second time is the charm, I really enjoyed my stay this time.

GOOD
I love the look, feel and vibe of the place. It's location in the heart of the LES is the selling feature, however the retro yet warm design notes here are really the winner here. A lot of the rooms are pretty tiny, NYC standard they are outfitted with supremely comfy beds (slept like a baby, even with all the lower Manhattan noise, of which there is a LOT. and the bathrooms? Yum.
I went with the Skybox loft this time and sure glad I did, what it lacks in square footage it gains in wonderful wrap around views and a comfy and fun seating area (with a view to the shower btw - for all you kinksters, and yes I did flash the family jewels, couldn't help it). 
Bathrooms are stocked with nice local toiletries and water pressure and temperature was awesome. Lighting, unlike a lot of hotel bathrooms, was great.

BAD
The staff. Most of them I would say were ok but with the exception of 1 young man and 1 young lady, most of them I would describe as "meh" not rude or anything, just not friendly either. The Ludlow is such a nice boutique hotel with a great vibe, the lame staff is a sad state of affairs.

I didn't have time to sample the restaurant in the hotel, but it sure did look like a hoping place, popular with locals. Next time.
I rarely stay in the same place twice in NYC, the hotel snob that I am, but the Ludlow has won my repeat business. Cannot wait to return.

title: Beautiful design, great room service!
text: I had the smallest room of the hotel, and I'm sure my bathroom - which was so beautiful - was almost the same size, but it was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Amazing city views, clean - and then I mean REALLY clean - all amenities in the room you need, and the best room service ever. If you want to stay at the Lower East Side, I can really recommend it!

title: muito bom
text: O hotel é  muito bonito, tudo bem decorado, aconchegante  e o atendimento muito bom. O quarto era calmo com uma vista muito bonita e alem de tudo era muito lindo. adorei o hotel e em breve voltarei novamente.

title: Wonderful anniversary weekend getaway!
text:
I don't even know where to begin. First things first, Miss Kourtney at the front desk was WONDERFUL! Don't get me wrong, the entire staff were fabulous as well  but I spoke with Kourtney the most during my visit and because of her customer service, I will most definitely be back again soon. 

My BF and I decided to spend Easter weekend in NYC to celebrate by 10 year work anniversary, our one year dating anniversary, and my 41st Birthday. After lots and lots of research, I chose The Ludlow based on location, reviews and the cost during the Easter weekend as most hotels had upped their price significantly for the holiday. The Ludow prices were also a bit higher than usual during this holiday weekend (as expected), but with some added perks such as free continental breakfast during our stay as well as a free drink for each of us. Score! I had reserved a King Studio and requested a higher room just so that I would possibly be able to see the skyline at night. It was a long shot but I figured I would ask. Man on man did they deliver. I should have taken a picture of the room I stayed in (which was room 1506) as the view was wonderful.  We had a small balcony with a table and two chairs in which we were able to sit out and have a cocktail. (Yes it was a little cold but we sucked it up and because the view was really nice). The room itself was small but still very quaint and the both of us were able to move around the room just fine. The bed was huge and so comfortable, with the TV situated on the wall at the foot of bed so that on our lazy Saturday evening, after much debate as to whether or not to brave the cold weather at night once more and after walking all over NYC both Friday and all day Saturday, we decided to stay in, watch TV, drink some more cocktails, eat pizza, and just relax in our comfy bed which is something we rarely do seeing as we both live thousands of miles apart.  (We also underestimated just how cold it was going to be and did not bring heavy coats with us just jackets and sweaters). The bathroom was small but quite beautiful. I loved that it had a rain shower fixture and that the bathroom was nice and bright. It made putting on what little makeup I wear so much easier and I looked fabulous, or maybe it was just really good lighting.

All in all, the hotel has great character. Small but quaint with very friendly staff.  The top floor of the hotel had an amazing view of the NYC and had a nice little sitting area The hotel is located in the Lower East side which is close to tons of restaurants, shops, etc. You seriously cannot go wrong with this hotel and its location and I definitely look forward to visiting again soon

title: Good location but hotel starting to age and feling impersonal
text: We stayed 2 nights in the Ludlow after staying at the Standard High Line. We asked for a high floor room and 'only' got a 9th floor with a very average view. The room was VERY small and we could not even open the luggage (we had to slide the 2 medium suitcases under the bed...) The room was clean and tidy though and the bathroom was cute. We got waken up by the cleaners at 9.00 though... We asked for an upgrade to get a bigger room, but were not offered one. The place was buzzing on the ground floor with the buzzy bar and restaurant but the place was so packed that you do not want to stay and we had all breakfast and food outside as we love the area. The place also felt tired and used already especially where there was carpets. It felt like a 'Nomad want-to-be' but already older. It was a bit disappointing vs. our expectations and previous experiences in similar hotels in NYC.

title: 2nd honeymoon
text:
Loved this hotel ... Fabulous area, amazing chic eclectic interior, (Jesus the lighting is amazing ! ) lovely vibe and great cosy room. I know the rooms aren't huge .... However it just added to the boutique style which this hotel offers. 
Is this hotel for children ? Probably not ... But is great for time away if you have children and want the whole package of great music ( loved the 80s play list ! ) and feeling young ! 
Dirty French next to hotel is amazing food ! 
Loved loved the hotel ...
We will definitely return .... Soon hopefully... Thanks again for a memorable time. 
Paula X

title: Hip fun hotel
text: We strayed away from our usual midtown location- we were with friends who like to stay downtown. We had a great time- it's a great walking neighborhood. Right across the street is Katz's deli if you feel like waiting in a long line. There are lots of other new hotels springing up in a neighborhood so it's fun to pop in and out for a look at their decor, and drinks. My favorite things about the hotel: the fireplace in the bar area with great art around it, the cozy little garden area out back, and our breakfasts in the restaurant with the friendly (and funny) waitstaff. The service in the bar left us cold, though. We spent a bit of time there all three nights of our stay, whether meeting our friends before a night out, or concluding the evening with a nightcap. We found that whether they were busy or not, the female server we had didn't seem to love her job much. The bar manager (?) was great though and fun to see in his creative outfits. The room is on the small side for sure, but comfortable. We were initially told we could have a late check-out and then told we couldn't, which was disappointing.

title: A Vibrant and Lively Downtown Hotel
text:
The Ludlow, located in the lower East Side, is a perfect location for those planning a visit to the party central area of NYC.  The hotel features a very popular late night bar with great cocktails and service, a restaurant (Dirty French) which unfortunately we didn’t get to try and a small, but adequate rooftop gym for those that need to run off those late night excesses.  The surrounding area offers a host of bars and restaurants to try whilst still in walking distance to the East Village, Chinatown or Soho.  Try Iggys just up the street for a local feel.

The Loft room we stayed in is strangely laid out for a hotel but very much matches the apartments and spaces of Downtown Manhattan.  Wonderful high beamed ceilings are a feature with a separate sitting room consisting of day bed and flat screen TV to greet you on entrance.  This is followed by a 12-15 foot hallway and offset bathroom.  The hallway leads to the King-sized bedroom with additional seating facilities (2 chairs and a lounge with coffee table) - again with a flat screen TV.  The bed was large but uncomfortably soft for my taste; as I’ve said in other reviews I prefer a firm mattress and pillows.  This bed and pillows were seriously soft.  

Other than the bed, the room was a great size with mini-bar and a good room service menu from the restaurant downstairs.  The separate sitting room offered options to those seeking some quiet TV whilst your partner sleeps.

The bathroom was spacious with a combined deep bath and shower.  I wouldn’t recommend this for older or less mobile guests as it was a struggle to get into and out of though the bath was great for soaking. 

WiFi was free and laundry service available but we chose to use the next day Laundromat on the next corner.  $10 for a 10lb load.

Negatives, the staff were friendly but there were some problems.  Check-in was a hassle but some responsibility rests on my shoulders as my name wasn’t on the reservation, I was given a key and sent to an already occupied room (not good, this should never ever happen as it breaches security - thank God for the separate sitting room, I once did walk in on a couple when the same thing happened elsewhere) and whilst this is a good hotel you need to be aware that it is also a very, very popular night spot.  My recommendation, this is an hotel for the young visiting NYC to party but still wanting exceptional rooms and quality of service.

title: Wonderful Hotel - can't wait to return
text: We stayed here for a week and had a fantastic time. The Hotel's location is great, just a quick walk to the subway which is super convenient for getting around Manhattan and inexpensive with a weekly travel-card. The Hotel itself was brilliant, the room so pleasant and cosy with stunning views of the city, which you can see from the comfort of the four poster bed or bubble bath ! Decor was also on point, the dark wooden features of the room, and the white marble bathroom were perfect. The lounge area downstairs was also great and the rooftop seating area. The breakfast basket was really yummy too ! Staff were friendly, friendlier than we'd been led to believe with New York. Honestly, so looking forward to going back !

title: Nice hotel
text: I really do like this hotel. This hotel is in a convenient location. Their food is great, the staff in the restaurant is super friendly, feel welcomed there. The room itself is nice with enough sunlight. They managed to switch our room since the original one we booked is a little small. Housekeeping did a good job. Normally I do not prefer a hotel around soho or in the trendy category, but this hotel changed my mind. Definitely will visit again.

title: Spotless, trendy, and friendly!
text: Born and raised NY'er who recently moved to FL back to visit friends & family.  Having lived on the UES for 15 years I'm well aware of the various nightmares that one can incur at even the nicest best known hotels.  The Ludlow was spotless.  The staff was very friendly & helpful.  The decor was adorably trendy.  The room was a bit small, but to be expected.  My only complaint was that I didn't spend enough time sitting in the gorgeous garden in the back.

title: Приятный лобби бар
text: Мы не останавливались в этом отеле, а лишь по совету друзей, жителей Нью-Йорка, посетили лобби-бар после ужина. Поистине романтичное место, вкусные коктейли, интимная обстановка! Всё очень стильно и красиво! В следующий раз обязательно попробуем и сам отель

title: THE MOST PERFECT HOTEL
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow from the 25th of Feb to the 2nd of March both business and pleasure. I have to say that it is one of the most accommodating hotels I have stayed in in NYC, others have been great but I felt at ease from the Moment I walked in. From the door staff to the reception, bar, and concierge everyone was so truly helpful and kind. The decor of the hotel Is beautiful just up my st! I can't recommend it more. ~#LES is one of my fave areas to stay in with great friendly atmosphere quirky shops and bars . Cool clubs and easy to get anywhere else in the city from
Ludlow st. I ate at dirty French and it was not hard to get a table for me , everyone was kind. I was also able to accommodate 
My friends at the hotel bar they found me a table no problem. Only one downside the wardrobe is tiny, working in fashion I brought a lot of clothes 🙈 which I couldn't fit in the closet only my shoes :)
I will definitely stay here again on my next visit and when my flight was changed the staff accommodated me last minute with another room with no problem at all.
Luca at the front desk was particularly helpful throughout my stay- i would give The Ludlow hotel full marks for making my stay in NY even more enjoyable. 
Thankyou 
Francesca X

title: Nice place in a great neighborhood
text: Nice hotel and friendly staff! Rooms are smaller than you see online but comfortable. Worth the money to get the Skybox room. Incredible views! Best tub and shower. But, ask for extra towels! Only two small ones available in he room. The restaurant Dirtys is delicious but they do play loud music. Hard for larger tables of 6 that want to visit. That said the food was amazing. Fun bar scene! we all enjoyed it and would stay again.

title: Beautiful, modern, boutique hotel, nestled in the Lower East Village...
text:
The Ludlow is a beautiful, modern, boutique hotel nestled in the Lower East Village. I was in town for a quick business trip, and booked this place for a decent rate last minute... I'm glad I did.

The first floor contains two classy bars, full of comfortable couches and seating areas, along with a nice French restaurant. The whole time I was there, the bars/restaurants were full with people, both those staying in the hotel and folks who just wanted to be somewhere "cool."

My room at the Ludlow was well-done and lovely. The bedroom, though smaller, was comfortable and just classy. The bathroom was even more beautiful, and quite spacious. My only complaint was they put me low in the building on the third floor, and my view was directly into a parking structure. Note to self: ask for a much higher place next time.

The staff was extremely responsive and very friendly. I asked the front desk on two separate occasions for various items, and they responded within minutes each time. I was very impressed. The valets and other service people were eager to please, and very helpful.

The gym on the top floor is small, but did the job. It's fun to run on the treadmill and have a cool 180-degree view of the NYC skyline. I wished I used it more.

Would definitely return to The Ludlow. Great stay, and I'm glad I opted for the bigger suite (though next time, I'll certainly ask for higher placement).

title: Awesome Hotel/Awesome Staff
text:
Stayed at the Ludlow for a long weekend last August with my wife and three kids. Not sure what took so long for me to write review, but here goes. When we have gone to NYC in the past with the kids we have always stayed Midtown/Times Square area. 

We decided this trip to stay in the Lower East Side at the Ludlow.This Hotel has a great New York City look/feel to it and is only made better by the good people that work there.

From the minute we arrived we felt most welcomed at the Ludlow. I literally think we were the only guests in the hotel with kids. At no time during our stay did we receive a single complaint,or a nasty look regarding the kids from the Ludlow staff or guests.

The Hotel has a great modern industrial chic look to it.The rooms are beautifully done and make for a very comfortable reprise from the bustle of the city.

The staff for me is what makes this place great. Every time we came and went we were greeted with warm hellos and goodnights from staff. We were always asked by the front desk and valets where we where going and if we needed any help.They often added their own suggestions to our plans which always made our plans that much better.

The bartenders in the lobby lounge kept the easy flow going at the bar with great drinks for mom and dad, complete with handmade sodas for the kids.

Mark (from Brooklyn) at the front door was especially helpful to us. One morning my wife wasnt feeling well. Mark grabbed a yogurt for my wife out of his own lunch bag.sat her down on the bench out front and wouldnt let her leave until she was feeling better.

I am neither wealthy or famous. Somehow the Ludlow made me feel like i was last summer

Don't ever change

title: Fantastic!
text: After previously staying at The Bowery - one of my favourite NYC hotels we decided to check out The Ludlow - and we weren't disappointed. Loved everything about it. The rooms were gorgeous - casement windows, comfortable turned wood framed beds and lovely detailed bathrooms. My only disappointment was that we book a 'loft' room which I though would mean be high up with a view, yet our only view was of a stacking carpark - so make sure you ask for a higher room. The bar was fabulous and the fire a prefect foil from the col weather outside. Dirty French was wonderful, albeit pricey. Overall a wonderful stay in a great part of Manhattan.

title: Fabulous!!
text:
Absolutely loved this hotel.

Chic boutique hotel in the lower east side. Decor is great, from lobby, bar, rooms and gym.

Service was friendly and professional from check in to check out.

Room had a great view, we had freedom tower & Empire State Building they are a good size and have a gorgeous bathroom.

The hotel is surrounded by trendy bars and restaurants.

Subway nearby, china town & little Italy within walking distance. 

All in all I would stay at this hotel again.

title: The Perfect East Village Hotel
text: I loved everything about this hotel. The decor, the amazing staff, the cocktails, the Dirty French breakfast and dinner, the buzzing bar, and finally, the stunning Skybox room! Couldn't have wished for a better 5 days in New York.

title: Amazing
text:
My new go-to hotel in NYC. The Ludlow is the personification of what a boutique hotel should be. It's hip, even slightly edgy but in a positive way. The staff are all wonderful and eager to please, the rooms are beautiful, and the bar is great.

The restaurant and bar are top notch. I had dinner at the bar and the sea bass was nothing short of amazing which explains why the restaurant has a 4.5 star Yelp rating, I don't know too many hotel restaurants that I'd recommend but this is one of them. 

 The lobby bar with a functional fireplace and lots of sofa seating is just the place to relax after a day of business or the perfect setting to start the evening with a few drinks. 

I upgraded to the King Loft with a terrace and was not disappointed. Very nicely decorated with a poster bed and modern bath. The view was fantastic and the terrace was the ideal place to enjoy a drink as the sun set. 

Location. The lower east side is ideal for downtown or Soho and you're an easy taxi ride anywhere else you want to go. You'll find Katz's deli on the corner and if you want a hip place for dinner and dancing, check out Beauty and Essex which is a block away. The entire area is filled with great places to eat, the small cozy type with outstanding food in a comfortable atmosphere, for example The Meat Ball shop also a block away and very much worth checking out. 

The net/net.  The Ludlow in my opinion offers it all and I've stayed at more NYC hotels than I can count. If you're in town for a romantic get away, business or a weekend adventure, this is where you want to stay. 

You can thank me later

I travel extensively both domestically and internationally and have high standards for where I stay.

title: Chic hotel
text: Stayed here for one night for a quick getaway. Our Loft Queen room was cozy but really nicely decorated with a couple of funky chairs and a small table as well. Huge casement windows let in light and gave us a pretty decent view of the neighborhood. The bathroom was pretty luxurious. We loved the huge tub and the high-end bathroom products. The rain shower was a nice touch too. Only complaint was no full-length mirror. Our favorite part of the hotel was the lobby bar and the gorgeous enclosed garden. So great to have a few drinks out there and even enjoyed a morning coffee as well. Great vibe, excellent 80's soundtrack. Service was friendly and efficient. And love the LES neighborhood- still some independent shops and great food options.

title: Очень милый отель
text:
Хороший не большой отель, рядом с Сохо, номера чистые и уютные. Больше всего понравился бар, вот только коридор на этажах  мне показался странно узким и вечно холодным в летнее время.
 В номере как то заклинило замок от двери, сервиса долго ждать не пришлось, все сделали сразу. Обязательно остановлюсь там еще раз !!

title: Loved the hotel. Great concierge service.
text: Beautiful hotel. Rooms a tad small but still quite wonderful. Great view from the room and especially from the roof where you can go and take a look. Nice at night. Had a lovely cappuccino in the room off the lobby while waiting to head out on the town. What made the stay especially great was the concierge - Luka. He helped us navigate our way around the city. Answered any questions we had. Even helped with a small emergency. He took control of the situation, remained calm and everything resulted in a happy ending.  Luka is everything you would want a concierge to be. This was my wife's and mine first visit to NYC together. (We both went several times as kids before we knew each other).  Would definitely stay at the Ludlow again.

title: Perfect
text: Very cool, clean and large rooms, great lounge, convenient location to downtown and Soho and overall very nice hotel.  I would not hesitate to return here.  Not sure if it is great for kids, but they were very nice to our kids and I am sure they are nice to everyone.

title: Chic & Trendy
text:
I stayed for one week at The Ludlow and i had an amazing time. The hotel is off Houston in lower east, very hip, staff is super friendly. The restaurant "Dirty French " is amazing, breakfast options are not many but delicious. 
The view from the gym in the top floor is amazing :)

title: Hip hotel, great location, excellent service
text:
I stayed with my 3 siblings for a reunion long weekend in a Ludlow Double room. Would absolutely stay again, with friends or for romantic weekend. The rooms and the common areas feel like you are in a very warm, welcoming home, and not in a sterile hotel. For very detailed review, keep reading.

LOCATION
This is an excellent location if you want to experience the city life (and still feel safe), and not just the typical tourist sites. I highly recommend it. There are countless tempting restaurants and cafes and bars to suit every taste and budget. The famous Katz deli is right across the street. A few streets away is East Village with loads of vintage shopping and local artisans. You could spend days walking around the neighborhood and not get bored.

CHECK-IN
Check-in was quick and friendly. 

ROOM LAYOUT - LUDLOW DOUBLE on 4th floor (405)
The entrance opens into the first bedroom with double bed, closet with room to hang long garments, shelves, safe, mini-bar snacks & water. There are small bedside tables without drawers and a long narrow table against the wall with 3 small drawers (big enough for accessories, papers, not clothes). There is also a floor lamp and a TV in this room.

From the first bedroom you pass through into a short narrow hallway with a wall-mounted coat rack and door to the bathroom.

Thru the hallway you come to the larger bedroom with queen bed, slightly larger closet than the 1st bedroom, which has mini fridge and safe in it. There is a wall-mounted TV facing the bed, long narrow wall table with small capsule coffee maker, sitting area with sofa, 2 chairs & coffee table next to a window overlooking Ludlow Street. 

Overall the rooms feel comfortable, welcoming, like you are in a home and not a hotel, but they are “cozy”. Not a lot of space to move around in between the furniture. At least the beds are high enough that you can store your suitcases under them.

SLEEP QUALITY/BEDS
The beds and bedding themselves were very comfortable, with soft sheets, and I think pillow-top mattresses. However the pillows were all very thin and soft. We asked for extra and had to pile them up. All four of us would have preferred firmer pillows.

The interior room by the door is obviously the more quiet and darker one. The larger room facing the street was also quiet with good blackout curtains. None of us had a complaint about light or noise.

BATHROOM
The bathroom is beautifully decorated with brass fixtures, a deep bathtub and a large very well lit mirror above the single sink. There is a magnifying mirror hinged to the wall, hairdryer, good quality shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, hand soap and toothpaste. Towels were clean and soft. There are plenty of hooks for towels, and 2 bathrobes. There is a full-length mirror on the inside of bathroom door. DRAWBACKS: There is limited space to store toiletries. There is just a small sink surround and a small sill under the mirror. No shelves or drawers. We were 3 women getting ready each day, so that was challenging. The vanity lights all around the mirror are beautiful but really heat up the bathroom quickly. If you have a shower the glass partition mounted on the tub is not enough to stop the water from flowing onto the floor. We had to use the bathmat and several hand towels to absorb the water from each shower.

HEATING/AIR CON
It was very very cold in NYC during our stay. There is 1 thermostat in the suite, which was easy to use and quickly adjusted. Note that the larger room with window is always going to be a different temperature than the interior room by the door.

FITNESS ROOM
This is a small room with 2 treadmills, a reclining bike, 2 cross-trainers, mirrors and free-weights. Awesome views over Manhattan. There is a water dispenser and cups, complimentary apples, and paper-towels dispenser. Not a lot of floor space.

WIFI
Free wifi with good speed throughout the hotel rooms and common areas. No need to enter a code.

CLEANLINESS
We found all areas, the rooms, bathroom, linens, hallways, dining areas and fitness center immaculate. Everything was very clean and in good condition.

SERVICE
The service was very friendly but casual. Not cloying or pretentious. The wait staff, doormen and housekeeping staff all were very friendly but not tip mongering, which is refreshing in NYC. Several times we asked at the front desk for suggestions of the best pizza, best Mexican in the neighborhood and they definitely came through! 

BAR/LOUNGE
This area on the ground floor is decorated very hip, but cozy. Deep leather sofas, low lighting, a fireplace, a garden terrace area that is heated. Drinks are pricey but expertly mixed and you are paying for the atmosphere. It is a very popular lounge in the area, attracting older couples, business people, but mostly 20/30-something very trendy people. The music is loud and, I’m not sure if it is ironic, but when we were there it was mostly 80s rock ballads. Trip down memory lane…

DIRTY FRENCH RESTAURANT
We had breakfast one morning in the Dirty French, which is also very popular with locals. There are comfy leather booths and eclectic kitsch décor. The food was amazing. Everything. Our table had the eggs benedict, French toast and the duck hash. They bring you complimentary homemade pastries before your food arrives. The coffee was very good and free refills. I had a Bloody Mary, which was one of the best I’ve had. Our waiter Kenyon was very friendly and knowledgeable. We just loved him. He made a small mistake with our order but it was quickly rectified and he brought complimentary sparkling wine as an apology before we even noticed the mistake. Totally unnecessary, but much appreciated!

TO IMPROVE
A few things that would have improved our stay:
-Better selection of pillows
-More space to store toiletries in the bathroom
-Better partition to keep shower water from running onto floor
-A mirror in each bedroom to allow for grooming outside of the crowded bathroom. Even just a mirror mounted on the inside of the closet doors would do.

CONCLUSION
All in my party would definitely stay again. The price point matches the location, amenities and overall feel of the hotel.

title: Top 10 hotels I've stayed at
text:
Okay finally! This is what a New York hotel should be: easy, modern and sexy even in the edgy Lower East Side.

From the seemingly artfully curated design aesthetic to amazing dining, a neat bar, and an even better night’s sleep, it couldn't be more the perfect.

Dramatic lighting, well-appointed mini-bar and usb charging station is appreciated.

title: Superlative hotel
text:
Not often I can't think of anything negative to say but had heard so much about the overpriced tiny roomed New York hotels that my expectations weren't high.

Utterly wrong. Queen loft room was gorgeous, plenty big enough with lovely comfy bed, huge deep bathtub in a large hammam style bathroom. Heating and aircon worked very well.  Bar was cool downstairs, location phenomenal in a very trendy part of NY, even roof terrace was a nice surprise with spectacular views.

Price very good value for the quality.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: I stayed for two nights for a business trip and found it quite lovely. The rooms were clean and well decorated. A bit small but what you'd expect at a boutique hotel in NYC. The subway is a short distance away. Great lounge area to have a drink and people watch.

title: Wow. Absolutely fabulous
text:
We stayed for a week at the end of January.  

It was a wonderful stay. From the minute you entered you felt welcome. 

The doormen were superb. Always polite and friendly.  The reception staff were great.  Helpful and friendly again. 

At breakfast we have to give a special shout out to Kenyan  (hope I spelt his name right) what an absolute star he is. You should be able to replicate him and have him all over the hotel!

We adored the room.  For a city centre I thought a very decent size.  Wish we could have used the balcony more but with the snowstorm it made a great wine cooler. 

We found the drinks at the bar to be reasonably priced. 

There were a few downsides :

Service in the bar was hit and miss.  It was more of a point if you could get service. Waiting staff sometimes seen it as an after thought.  And it closed early especially for a city centre hotel bar. 

At breakfast (when kenyan wasn't on shift) service again could be hit and miss.  I know small things but having to ask for milk three times for your coffee or if you want a coffee having to go up and ask as staff were talking.  I'd expect better service than that. 

The towels were to small .

Worse of all was the mirror on the back of the toilet door.  If I looked like a supermodel I could handle sat on the toilet  staring at my naked self. Unfortunately I'm not  so put the mirror in the main room. 

Putting those tiny bits aside it's not enough to make me drop it to a 4 star rating.  

Absolutely loved it.

title: Good boutique hotel for holiday - not for work
text:
Very stylish design hotel with beautiful rooms. Great view and friendly staff. This is place to go if you are on vacation for a few days in New York. Comfortable bed, new flat screen and free fast WIFI. Nice bar and ok restaurant (very varying quality and high prices).

However, this is not a good hotel for business. No desks in the room and no real work area down stairs made us work in the bed which is not very practical. No real meeting room - made this not the right hotel for business people.

title: A design hotel right in the middle of the buzz
text:
Absolutely loved it! 

Beautifully styled rooms, friendly staff, amazing view from the roof, fun hotel.

Would stay over and over again.

Fantastic location. 

If there could be any criticism... The housekeeping did come into the room twice when we first checked in 
Without knocking.

title: Fantastic and cosy hotel in a great atmospheric neighborhood
text: We loved the Ludlow hotel for many reasons: Great atmospheric neighborhood with lots of lovely and good restaurants, cafes and shops, our cosy sky box loft with fantastic views on 3 sides, great décor of our loft including very nice brass fittings in the bathroom. Very comfortable bed, little balcony, very clean and a big plus in New York: very quiet at night and day. The complimentary breakfast in the Dirty French Restaurant (great cosy décor as well) was delicious especially the Granola. Throughout the hotel including breakfast service very friendly, professional and charming staff. We stayed 4 nights and will certainly be back again because it was such an exceptional experience. I forgot to mentioned the very nice and cosy bar near the lobby with an open fire place which is perfect for having a drink after a long day in the city.

title: What's not to love??
text:
Loved The Ludlow! Big thanks to a great little hotel and it's amazing staff! I never write reviews, but we were so impressed with the decor, location, hip vibe and especially, the staff; I felt compelled to write one up. 
  We stayed in a Loft King, and loved it. Didn't even mind the blizzard. Big windows, nice amenities, super clean, and bohemian chic. The bed was crazy comfortable. The views from the room were amazing. Even the shower had a fantastic view. Great location! Lower east side. Close to the subway. Lots of great places to eat and shop in the neighborhood. Katz's Deli is right across the street; so be warned...
  Big thanks to the entire staff, especially Scarlet, Mark and Michael for making us feel so welcomed! You really brought our stay to the next level, so thank you for that! We will definitely be staying at The Ludlow when in NYC. Maybe, even making a special trip just to stay there. Thanks again Ludlow.

title: Teeny but great
text: Great boutique hotel with rocker, indy, feel.  Service is top-notch.  Would rate higher but the room is so teeny I couldn't.  No desk, lighting a little dim but room has large, loft-like window and bathroom was roomy and well equipped.  Room sparkling clean and quiet even tho I was near the elevator.  Bed very comfy.  Great lobby bar with roaring fire.

title: ニューヨークの下町風情がすぐそこに
text: 部屋は狭い。ベッドも狭目。この辺はマンハッタンなら仕方ないので文句いうのは野暮とあきらめて、スタッフの優しい笑顔にいやされました。イーストビレッジのほぼ真ん中でイケイケの地区なので、どこにも行きやすいです。

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: A nice stay at the Ludlow. Walking distance from the best deli in NYC, Katz. The front desk staff were not very professional nor trained in customer service. The elevators were extremely slow. Parking across the stgreet for $50 per day. Overall a nice experience.

title: Almost there...
text: A quirky little hotel in the east side. Close to the subway, Katz's Deli and an array of restaurants, bars and speakeasies. We stayed for 4 nights over New Year's EVe and there seemed to be different breakfast staff each day. The breakfast included was not of the best standard and the upgrade wasn't the cheapest. Gym on the roof, as well as a roof terrace. Reception weren't the friendliest, but some were very helpful. The rooms are also not the biggest but adequate and a good range of amenities offered within the room.

title: A Touch of class
text: Just returned from 5 nights stay at the Ludlow a great experience.Just as all the reviews promised the Ludlow is a trendy boutique style hotel.It also oozes luxury and excellent service .It was a great base for our visit to NYC and a ideal place to return to every day after our sightseeing and shopping trips.We would like to thank the staff in the DIrty French breakfast was great every morning steaming hot coffe flowed .A special thanks to the team on the door their knowledge and input was excellent and very much appreciated .We stayed in room 1002 a small problem with noise from the elevator was sorted out promptly .We would book a return visit without hesitation the Ludlow delivers excellent service in a very chic urban hotel that's exciting whilst offering a high standard of comfort .

title: The Ludlow, a beautiful hotel with helpful concierge service
text: Four of us visited NYC this past weekend & stayed at the Ludlow, a small but well appointed hotel on the lower east side. Great experience with the knowlegeable and gracious concierge, Luca T.  Had a crisis involving a lost article & Luca helped to resolve. Thank you, Luca!

title: An excellent hotel in the Lower East side
text:
This hotel is a great place to base yourself whilst you explore all that NYC has to offer
The staff are extremely courteous, professional and friendly. Our room was very nicely decorated with a beautifully tiled bathroom. It was large enough for our needs and very comfortable. 

The breakfast is good

The bar area is a very nice place to unwind although the drinks were a little expensive
The restaurant dirty French is a great place to spend an evening

This hotel is located very close to the famous Katz Deli with other  bars and restaurants within very close proximity. 

Easy access to the Subway. China town and little Italyabout a 15 minute stroll away

Highly recommend this hotel. We will return

title: Bar None Experience - Made Extraordinary by the Staff
text: It doesn't matter the season - The Ludlow continues to bring it. The awesome vibe is set by the staff, particularly Luca, the loveliest concierge who delivers every request on a silver platter. A professional to the core, he makes the Ludlow experience a unique one to return to time after time. The library, with its warm fire burning and music playing, is always entertaining. The rooms are super comfortable with spacious bathrooms and stunning views. Dirty French for dinner is an absolute must. The bonus is the rooftop gym - a view extraordinaire.

title: Weekend Get-A-Away
text: The studio queen bed room was on the small side however the location of the hotel, the cleanliness and amenities were fabulous! Luca a gentlemen at the front desk went out of his way to make sure our stay was beyond enjoyable. Luca assisted us in making reservations for the Broadway show Chicago and reservations for dinner at night. The service clearly made the difference and we will definitely return again. We will also be sure to tell all of our friends to stay at the Ludlow when visiting New York City.

title: Christmas new york
text: First impressions of the Ludlow where a little disappointing , our room was very comfortable , the shower access wouldn't be great for an older person , Christmas Day was very low key but maybe that's an American thing , I would have thought a little more fuss could have been made for a special Occassion , we ate in the dirty French which was very enjoyable and the service that night was much better than the breakfast service and the bar which was non excistent , maybe we where not hip enough , for the Ludlow , a couple of individuals stood out on reception , the surrounding area was great and we really enjoyed exploring it ,

title: Cosy chic warehouse style.
text:
Always a welcoming fire to sit beside with coffee or drinks.Staff very attentive but not intrusive.
Fabulous breakfast included .coffee topped up constantly.
The gym on the roof top had the most delicious apples we have ever tasted.A real bonus after an exhausting workout !!!

title: Rockstar chic
text: The lobby has the very best retro design with a shabby sort of hung over sensation around the edges. That is meant as a high compliment. Small well designed rooms with an excellent bed. Fascinating neighborhood. Perfectly located for a restaurant & bar crawl.

title: Lovely hotel, great rooms, friendly staff but overcharged
text:
My Partner and I stayed at The Ludlow in December 2015. First impressions were great, the room was a good size (Skybox Loft) with great views and a lovely bathroom. 

The staff on reception were friendly throughout the stay and the location was perfect for us. You can take a leisurely walk anywhere throughout the City, get a cab to central NYC for about $10 or get on the Subway which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

We had a few problems with our stay. The first issue was a security guard banging on our door at 2am when we were asleep. He thought that we’d phoned reception to say that somebody was running around, knocking on doors in the middle of the night. We had been asleep for 3 hours and no idea what was going on. It was a little disconcerting but the manager was brilliant the next day, offered us a bottle of wine and apologised profusely. This was absolutely fine as it was obviously an honest, unfortunate mistake.

The second problem was slightly more annoying. At 5am the fire alarm started going off and didn’t stop for almost 2 hours. There was no fire and there was a constant voice telling us that it was a test. At about 6am I went to reception to enquire and there were quite a few unhappy customers there. It turns out that there was a problem in a kitchen which was causing the alarm. The hotel, once again, dealt with this very well, refunded our evening’s stay and apologised for the mishap. 

The reception staff were great throughout and dealt with all problems swiftly. The final problem has come since we’ve returned to the UK. The bill that they served us when we were leaving had charged us for room service that another room had ordered. We realised this in the taxi on the way to the airport so messaged the Ludlow upon out return to the UK. We didn’t receive a response for a week so sent a chase email which they then followed up, informing us that they had made a mistake and that the money would be refunded. This then didn’t appear in our account for a further 5 days, which would have been fine. They then took the money back out of the account, put it back in again and finally, after a further week, removed the money from the account again. We’ve had to instruct our bank to not accept any more withdrawals from the Ludlow as it appears they are taking money which is rightfully ours. 

So after a great hotel stay, in what is a lovely hotel with amazing bedrooms, views and bathrooms, we now have an incredibly sour taste in our mouths as the hotel has essentially stolen money from our bank account. The rating that I've given is based on the hotel overall and not the terrible post stay service that we have received.

title: Buzz, great location
text:
Love, love, love this place.

Nothing too much trouble. I appreciated the fast service to have an electric kettle put in my room. Friendly service. Great neighbourhood.

I deducted a star for the car service. The driver tried to charge me more than the quoted fare. Dampened my otherwise brilliant stay

title: Amazing place!
text: Staying at The Ludlow, in the heart of trendy and charmy Manhatthan's Lower East Side was a very pleasant experience, which I'd love to repeat asap. Our Room was comfortable and cosy. The staff is truly professional and friendly. The included breakfast is pretty good. We had a good dinner at their beautiful restaurant "Dirty French" (maybe just a bit overpriced) and had some very good time chilling in the bar among the coolest people you can spot in NYC. Warmly suggested!

title: Hipste hotel Lower East Side
text: Sfeervol, trendy hotel in leuke wijk. Kamers niet erg groot, maar met prima bed en goede service. Het inclusief ontbijt was wat beperkt qua keuze maar kwalitatief oké. De lounge annex bar is ook populair bij niet hotel-gasten en heeft heerlijke cocktails. Het restaurant 'Dirty French' erg populair en reserveren is dus vaak handig, maar in de straten om de Ludlow zijn ook veel leuke(te) alternatieven. Subway (2th av.) op loopafstand. Al met al een geweldig hotel voor een verblijf in NY.

title: Brilliant Hotel - so glad we chose to stay here.
text:
As soon as we saw The Ludlow we wanted to stay there - away from the usual tourist trap hotels and in a fantastic and cool part of town. 
All of the staff were super friendly and efficient. They gave us plenty of tips ie walk the Brooklyn bridge from the Brooklyn side rather than the Manhattan end to take full advantage of the NY skyline (in our excitement we would have done the opposite!).
We were celebrating our recent wedding and my 50th birthday and were delighted to find a bottle of champagne waiting for us on arrival. 
We booked a Skybox Loft as we wanted the great views. A smidgeonly gripe was we would have preferred to have been higher up (we were on Floor 8 of 20). Also the room does not have much in the way of storage space - but we were aware of this prior to booking. Otherwise the room was amazing and the bed super comfy. Top quality furnishings and fixtures. A well stocked minibar for those who wish to indulge but we managed to abstain. Great and roomy bathroom - robes and hairdryer provided. The room was scrupulously clean. The wifi worked perfectly every time. The air con was quite noisy. 
We ate the complimentary breakfast each day - my husband plumbed for the delicious granola and I had fresh fruit. On New Years Day it was a free service affair which we felt worked better than the waiter service of the other mornings. 
On our day of departure the hotel arranged us a private transfer to the airport - we were so tired we had no energy to battle on the subway. The car was more like a limousine for the same price as a local cab - we were so grateful for this service. 
On return we found we had been overcharged by mistake - however this was sorted out quickly when we contacted the hotel. 
We would like to extend our thanks to all at The Ludlow - as cool a hotel as it is we older guests never felt out of place. We loved the character and the vibrancy.
If we return to New York we would love to stay here again.

title: Great hotel made better by the staff.
text:
Had a great stay here for 4 nights.
Great room best hotel bed ever!!!
Great location, just hop on the subway.
Great breakfast, but at night the restaurant is very noisy,not my thing, but we are all different.
The staff were very helpful.
And I would go back again.

title: Great hotel in a lively neighborhood
text: If you want to explore the Lower East Side and the East Village the Ludlow is a perfect home base. Just walk out the door and you'll have a great choice of trendy bars and restaurants as well as shops and some galleries, which we enjoyed very much. The hotel itself is well-done in a cross-over style of what I would call cozy "modern chalet" with some faux antique elements such as brass furnishings in the bathroom. We had a Skybox Room on the 11th floor which had a small living room section with windows on three sides and nice views over Downtown Manhattan. The bar downstairs is lively and quite nice for an aperitif, though the cocktails are ok but not outstanding. Be prepared to listen to an 80's music soundtrack there, which seems to be a hipster thing in that area of town but which is quite funny when you actually lived through that time in your own youth ... It is also a rather short walk to the more upscale shopping areas of Nolita and SoHo so overall a very good choice for a nice long weekend in the City.

title: Hidden gem in fantastic location
text:
Fantastic views from the room, we visited on our honeymoon and were given a high floor double which had a brilliant view across the city and downtown. 
The rooms were small but very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. 
The bottle of wine with our booking was a nice touch and we went up on the roof to enjoy it. Amazing views right over the city. Would recommend. 
This hotel is in the LES, so quite a distance away from the usual Manhattan tourist attractions. If you're looking for somewhere off the beaten track, with lots of good bars and restaurants this won't disappoint. 
The hotels bar and restaurant is definitely worth a visit, make sure you book in advance! The food is fantastic. The famous Katz's deli is also just around the corner.

title: Love This Hotel
text:
Picking a hotel for a trip to NY can be overwhelming.  I looked through tons of reviews as well as recommendations from friends.  The Ludlow was a recommendation and was also listed on Tablet.  I was traveling with my husband and my two teens and we were all so thrilled with this hotel.  The public spaces are exactly as they appear in their website plus beautiful holiday decor.  The rooms looked great on the website and I felt they actually were better in person.  We had the Ludlow double which had a queen bed in the first room as you entered and then a king size bed along with a sitting area in the second room as you move towards the window.  In this set up the bathroom separates the two rooms.  The bathroom was very spacious.
The staff was friendly and professional and I particularly appreciated our fellow Floridian who checked us in.  We took advantage of the breakfast which is included in the room rate at their restaurant Dirty French.  The staff and service at the restaurant is also top notch.

title: Hidden little gem in a great neighborhood
text:
My wife loves unique experiences that are off the beaten path. I will admit to being slightly hesitant given the decor, reminiscent of early 20th century converted building. Imagine my surprise when learning the place is two years old. The intimacy of the design and execution of details are convincing. The experience however, is very modern. 

Priced very favorably compared to the five star hotels in midtown, with the only slight negative being super limited late night room service options. Not really a problem because there are a ton of late night options near by. 

Stayed in a sky loft which offered excellent views of downtown and a mini balcony to catch some air. Clearly not a five star in terms of in house amenities, but with out question I've enjoyed a five star plus experience. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great locatiob
text: We had a 6 night stay in this trendy hotel in December. We thought the location was great. The hotel was comfortable with good beds. Our queen terrace was on the small side at about 400 dollars a night but was sufficient to our needs. The staff were great, nothing was too much trouble.overall had a great stay.please try the TRE restraunt opposite that has the best Italian food that we have tried , and we have had many trips to Italy. The staff there also were very friendly

title: Classic Style - Great Stay
text:
The Ludlow is wonderfully classy and perfect for a long weekend in New York.

My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights and found it a really pleasant stay. We opted for the bed and breakfast option - although there are hundreds of places to eat, the breakfast at the Ludlow was very nice (and filling) but not much choice. 

The rooms are finished to a high spec and the style is very classic. This was a refreshing change from the standard hotel decor. The rooms are a little small but it is expected and it does has everything you should need for a short stay. 

The hotel is a short 5 minute walk from the nearest subway station. So the rest of the city is easily accessible!

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed at the Ludlow during a conference. The hotel staff was very friendly and sharp. The rooms were nicely appointed and very comfortable. Very clean and excellent public spaces. The drinks at the bar were amazing. I will definitely stay here next time I am in town. Also, located in a very centric area with lots of things to do nearby.

title: First time in New york
text:
We spent 5 days in New York recently and stayed at the Ludlow hotel. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Room / facilities - we had a fifth floor room and a view of Ludlow street. Other reviewers have commented in the past about traffic noise being excessive but we didn't find this at all. Our bed was large and comfortable. The pillows were slightly too soft for me but this is a minor problem. The bedside tables are big enough only for a telephone. The bathroom was fantastic. The room was cleaned daily and spotless when we returned, the cleaning staff deserve compliments. The minibar is very extensive, it is however expensive but no more so than other large hotels I've stayed at in other cities.

Wifi - the hotel wifi is free, and seems to run prefect.y well. I was able to stream television programmes without any significant delay. 

Breakfast - we arrived for breakfast between 7 and 9 every day and were always welcomed by very friendly staff and were seated within a minute of getting there. The menu is good and the complimentary / free items were always pointed out by e waiting staff. We had the eggs, French toast and some of the other items. Can honestly say the food was great and the chef should be praised. The service from the waiting staff was extremely good, the only issue I had was that 1 or two items which we ordered didn't arrive with the main breakfast. The layout of the restaurant means that it can be difficult for the waiting staff to see if you need a refill of your coffee, this happens if you are sat behind a post. We were given a free breakfast on one morning because of a delay in it arriving, the restaurant did this without any prompting or complaints from us. The only slight issue we had with the restaurant / kitchen was with room service, when the food arrived it was lukewarm.

Other - to get to the upper floors the only way seems to be by the elevator. It doesn't take very long for them to arrive but they are shared by the hole staff so can be crowded. We wanted to use the stairs to get a bit of exercise but couldn't find the ground floor exit. I'm not sure if the hotel has a policy on guests using the stairs but I'm sure we're not the only people who'd like the option of doing so. The hotel staff are all very friendly and accommodating and I found them uniformly excellent. 

We were very happy with the hotel and aside from a couple of minor issues would quite happily stay here again. Happy to recommend it to anyone.

title: Located in a great district... But not convince that this is the best place
text: The room are either nice (if you are lucky) or extremely bad. When experience the hotel I would say that the restaurant is really disapointed for both, diner and breakfast. When I visited the first time the bar was quiet and nice, then it became a very crowded place, almost disgusting to be back from a nice day in New York and have the feeling to arrive in a terrible club. I'm a real fan of the East Village therefore these disapointed problems became ok.

title: Unique boutique hotel
text: My husband and I were looking for a pet friendly hotel on the lower east side and came across this little gem!! Such a cozy, funky space on a lively street. Everyone working at the hotel was super friendly and they even offered to walk our dog when we were out on the town! We loved everything about The Ludlow from the classy bathroom to our sweet little terrace. Do yourself a favor and check yourself in!

title: A great place to stay
text:
I've stayed at the Ludlow a number of times now and have never been disappointed, some of the rooms are small yet cozy,cool interior design, bathrooms are spacious. I've always found the staff to be very helpful and accommodating. A few times have even had my room upgraded at no cost.
 It's in a nice area with plenty of good restaurants, stores and shops,easy to get a taxi or to just walk around. 
I would highly recommend to anyone who wants to explore the lower east side of NYC.

title: A unique experience!
text: I absolutely love this hotel. This is the sort of hotel you remember staying in forever because of how especial it is. The rooms might be small but my room on the 17th floor had the most fantastic view- I woke up to the sun rising over Brooklyn. The decor is spectacular, and the bathroom one of a kind. It has all the desired utilities of a hotel room, and has heightened the experience of my trip.

title: Fab little gem
text: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it, the only disappointment...having to come home! My husband and I loved the area and found some great places to eat, try sweet chick next door...waffles and fried chicken sounds strange but it was great! We read reviews that the rooms were really small and yes that's true but we never found it a problem, we didn't spend too much time in there anyway. A lot of people have moaned about the complimentary breakfast in past reviews but I loved it...I am really missing the yoghurt! My husband ordered extra breakfast from the menu and said it was good. I also read some reviews saying the staff were moody and unhelpful...total rubbish! They helped me with some minor issues and were always friendly! Yes we were there when the fire alarm went off Very early in the morning,  it was annoying and left us very tired that day but hey these things happen. Also I have read reviews about waiting ages for the elevator...we never experienced this problem at all. Great stay and we will definitely be back!

title: Hip little boutique hotel in Lower East Side
text: We stayed at the Ludlow the first weekend in December this year. It had a very cool vibe and was just off Houston. It's right down the street from the infamous Katz's deli (think Harry met Sally scene). Some good shopping was close by (Rag and Bone, fun Tom's store) and a pretty quick walk (say 10-15 minutes) to the great shopping of SoHo. It's definitely a haul to Flatiron and Midtown, but I think that's part of the fun of NY is walking everywhere. So...back to the Ludlow. Its definitely very hip and cool. They have a great little bar that is also a celebrity hangout...we had a great encounter with a celeb....all I gotta say is #ointb! Dirty French is also located within the hotel. Breakfast was included with our room which we ate once. The hotel was always bustling and fun. We stayed on the 14th floor in a skybox loft. I would definitely recommend that room. It had a queen bed (we usually sleep in a king but whatevs) but the best part was a 270 degree view from a cute little sitting area. The LES doesn't have super tall buildings so you could really see a lot of the city. The bathroom is pretty small but has super trendy brass fixtures which were cool. There was one small (tiny) closet and no dresser space so my husband had to keep most of his stuff in his suitcase on the floor. We stayed in the heart of it all in midtown in January at a fabulous luxury hotel but was glad for the neighborhood feel of the Ludlow during the insanely busy Christmas season. It was nice to be able to walk up to midtown, experience the madness, and then retreat to your nice little neighborhood hotel. All in all if you're looking for a trendy, nice fun place to stay that's off the beaten path (is there such a thing in NYC?) then I highly recommend the Ludlow.

title: Lower East Side Vibe
text: If, like me, you tend to avoid mid-town hotels like the plague, then I highly recommend the Ludlow. Rooms are small, but cosy, staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast restaurant had a nice vibe to it too. It's also just around the corner from Katz's deli which never hurts....

title: LSE Cool
text:
Could not really fault this place was expecting a tiny room after all the reviews but it was large enough for two. We did store our cases under the bed. By the end of the week we were struggling with the amount of shopping we had done with where to put it but that was our fault! My wife loved the large bathroom and the complimentary toiletries. Free breakfast was fine and good coffee. Didn't eat here so can't comment on the restaurant but was always busy. Elevators not a problem, best subway is up the road at 2nd Street. Plenty of places to eat we went to a cheap diner called Remedy. 

Everyone was polite and helpful throughout our stay. 

Sadly no apology was given to us about the fire alarm waking us on our last day when we could have done with a lie in before travelling home.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
Stayed for 4 nights, very warm welcome on arrival and fast efficient check in, our room was the studio full and while small it was very well equipped and ample for the two of us, bathroom was lovely with a huge bath and fantastic shower over. We booked via British airways who obviously used Mr and Mrs Smith so the complimentary bottle of wine was welcome plus.
Robes, slippers, wifi and an in room safe all included.
Breakfast in dirty French was lovely, the service good, friendly and a choice of three options. Bar area was busy, shame there was never any draft beer and the wines were on the pricey side. Service was ok.
As a previous reviewer mentioned we awoke with a jump to the fire alarm at 0530 in the morning and this went on and off for over an hour, but no problems after that.
