Over all a very comfy and pleasurable stay and would return to the Ludlow again and highly recommend.
For great burgers, pizza and a huge selection of craft beers I would highly recommend benson NYC which is just round the corner.

title: Very nice boutique hotel with a great personality...
text: The Ludlow is a very nice Boutique Hotel in New York that has a very nice New York feeling .Its very cosy and have a nice vibe.The location is very nice and quiet and the restaurant and bar is very nice in the evening.

title: Great atmosphere
text:
We arrived on Saturday night after a long journey. We had a warm welcome and staff were attentive, helpful and friendly.
The bar and lounge were packed and the vibe was great. People were partying and it felt like a big house party atmosphere! Nowhere for us to sit for a drink though, so we ended up going next door to sweet chick. I had contacted the hotel prior to our arrival to ask if they could try and acknowledge my daughters 21st birthday in some way when we arrived in our room. This was the purpose of our trip. They said they would have a "birthday amenity" package sent over. We were also meant to have a free bottle of red wine with our booking. On arrival to our room, there was no wine or birthday welcome, which I was disappointed about. When I mentioned it to reception, they offered to go out and buy a cake which I'd have to pay minimum $35 dollars for, plus a $10 runners fee! In the end, they sent up a bottle of champagne and a note, which was nice, but a bit late.
Bed was amazing. So comfy and wonderful, soft sheets.
Views were amazing. We left our curtains open all the time!
Room was small, which we were aware of prior to arrival, but ok for 2 of us. Bathroom was a good size and lovely. Bath was great....hot water, filled quickly and nice toiletries.
We had slippers, bathrobes and hairdryer.
We were always warm in the room and air con was good when needed.
Free wifi was brilliant and not expected.
Breakfast was a joy. We expected a little continental buffet, but were pleasantly surprised to eat in Dirty French with waiter service. Guests could have a choice of 3 things, pastries, fresh fruit or parfait ( yoghurt, fruit and homemade granola...amazing!).
Tea or coffee. Service was ok. Some staff were not very cheerful or efficient. Others were more welcoming and on the ball. The breakfast was lovely. I could have had it for every meal!
The guys on the door were great....helpful, friendly and welcoming. 
Reception staff also good.
Our last night was spoiled by fire alarms going off several times in the night, but a $42 transaction was knocked off our bill to compensate. That was fair.
Bar drinks were pricey and service there not great. No bar snacks available to nibble on ie. Nuts or pretzels.
We ate at sweet chick, and  Schillers liquor bar which were both great.
Clinton St bakery was busy but good food.
Freschco's Deli had lovely sandwiches and snacks.
Loved the area, loved the hotel and would highly recommend the Ludlow. It's cosy, comfortable and a home from home. Glad we chose this hotel. Thank you to all the staff for our stay with you!

title: I love this place!
text:
I spent a long weekend at The Ludlow with my sister for our annual NYC Thanksgiving get together.  We have always stayed in Soho or thereabouts and decided to give The Ludlow a try.  It was worth every penny!
The hotel and surrounding area were so calm and serene after the madness of Soho and the Village.  The room (king) was very stylish and comfortable -- nice wooden floors with a sofa and two armchairs, a massive bathroom and the most comfortable four-poster bed I've ever slept in!  
We loved the complimentary breakfast (the fruit, yogurt and granola were amazing!) and thought that it was well above what we have had at other similarly-priced hotels.  
The gorgeous fireplace was a welcome haven after a day pounding the pavements, hitting the shops!
All in all, a really great place -- very chilled vibe, lovely staff.  I look forward to sitting in front of that fireplace next Thanksgiving!

title: Funky hotel
text:
I stayed for nearly a week in this hotel.  Love the vibe of the hotel but the slow elevators do bother me when I wanted to rush to work. 

Room: I had a Studio with a king bed.  There are plenty of sitting area but hard to work on your computer and really not enough space to open your luggage (Rimowa in this case). The only place I could place the luggage is under the bed, thank god the bed is very high.  The bed is VERY comfortable and amazing sheets they have, same as all the towels and bathroom amenities.  Windows are not 100% soundproof, but it does give you the vibe of lower east side!

F&B: I had a few drinks in the lounge and one dinner and almost breakfast daily.  Service at breakfast could be a hit or miss, they dont always come with everything you need... such as forgot milk for coffee or forgot your forks for eggs.  But overall people are very friendly and they do make great cocktails. 

Location: This is really a LES hotel.  So make sure you like this area!

title: Lo mejor en el nuevo New York
text:
El Ludlow es una gran opción en el Lower East Side, el barrio más auténtico, joven, creativo y descontracturado en New York hoy. De estilo informal creativo y estimulante supera el minimalismo ya agotado con una propuesta de apariencia clásica con fuertísima presencia joven y dinámica, ruidoso en las areas públicas y silencioso en las habitaciones. El clima del Dirty French desayunados de día y bullicioso y siempre lleno bar/restaurante de noche es inmejorable. El front desk es muy atento y simpático. 
Si sos joven es lo tuyo, si sis mayor ( nuestro caso ) es ideal para recargar baterías!!
Emilio

title: Another Great Stay!
text: I love this location - though know not everyone would. I feel cozy and well cared for by the staff. Not crazy polished service but it fits the place - cool and comfortable. Breakfast service options included in the rate from Dirty French is a nice touch.

title: All together fabulous
text: Loved the location, knowledgeable and helpful staff, and incredible views. The lobby lounge is worthy of a long stay in itself, excellent Bloody Mary and lots of stylish, comfortable seating in which to gather with friends or read the paper. Excellent room furnishings, well lit with natural light and unobstructed views. We had a room on the 19th floor with three walls of windows, a deep bathtub flanked by windows-- highly recommend rm 1905.

title: Fantastic boutique hotel, in great location
text: Amazing boutique hotel, staff were great, friendly and helpful. We had four fab days in NYC and coming back to the hotel every night made the trip all the more special. Bar and restaurant has great atmosphere of a night, especially Thursday, Friday and Saturdays. Room was clean and very comfortable, especially the bed, go for a larger room as even these are on the small size (many thanks for the upgrade!). Finding out the connection to King Tuts Wah Wah club from the 90s made it all the more special. Will definitely be back!

title: Beautiful but below average service
text:
We stayed in a corner king room. Stunning view (we were on a high floor), very comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom with shower. The hotel is stunning and very trendy -- this is obvious from the moment you enter. 
Breakfast was included in the nightly rate but we were soon disappointed when we found out that what was included wasn't even a continental breakfast. We had to choose between bread or fruit or cereal. Never hear of such a thing in such a high priced hotel! Not only that, but service at breakfast was very slow both mornings. We needed to be out the door by a certain time, but when we informed the host he didn't bother get our waiter so we had to wait ten minutes just to get a glass of water. If they can't afford to have enough waiters, they should just offer a buffet breakfast. 
On the third morning, we arrived just before the end of the breakfast service but they refused to let us in. I've never had that happen to me before. So I complained and they made up for it by bringing us coffee and pastries. But that still left a sour taste in our mouth. Not to mention that, by the time they did get around to finally offering us something to eat, we had wasted thirty minutes discussing with the personnel. 
They need to solve the breakfast issue. After that, yes we would recommend staying at the ludlow.

title: Hotel pour profiter to Lower East Side. Branché, Bobo, Artiste, Mode
text: Pour changer de quartier et profitez du bas de la ville, une adresse 100% sympa. Uns style décontracté, chambre petite mais bien décorée, stylé. Beaucoup de charme, belle vue sur la ville dans les étages elevés. PdJ un peu cher, mais très bon. Le restaurant est une table à découvrir. Patio sympa pour boire un verre, et bar clientèle new yorkaise

title: L.E.S Hot Spot
text:
If you are looking for hipsters, cross dressers, and loud music you've come to the right hotel. 

I stayed here for 4 days and every day the open spaces are filled with people working, snipping coffe and chatting away on their Macs and iPads. Later in the day this gives way to music, AC/DC's Back in Black was a surprise, to cocktails and good food. 

We stayed in 505, which is a great deal if you are traveling with another couple, but don't want to share the same room, like I did with my snoring parents. The railroad room has two separate bedrooms split by the rather large bathroom.

Rooms are nicely designed and good sizes, with comfy beds. The 5th floor does get some street noise, but my dad's fixed that with ear plugs. Good closet space in each room with nicely a stacked mini bar.

A limited breakfast selection is included, but its plenty, I would recommend the cocoanut yogurt parfait. 

My only quips, after servicing the rook the maid left without replacing the TP and they would have used another elevator, but I am being picky -- this was a 4.5 star experience. 

Wifi is fast and free and a parking garage, not affiliated with the hotel is across the street. 

Be sure to visit Katz's on the corner before checking out.

title: Downtown Chic on a Great Block
text: If you want to explore downtown and the youthful energy of the Lower East Side and East Village in style, this is your spot. Nightlife, hip boutiques, restaurants galore (Sweet Chick next door has great fried chicken), the best gelato (Laboratorio del Gelato), chocolate babka (Russ + Daughters), and candy from your childhood (Economy Candy) are all around the corner. So is Katz Deli for those who need their "When Harry Met Sally" Big O fix. Oh, and Dirty Laundry, one of the trendiest French bistros in town, is in the hotel. The hotel itself is just fun and stylish. Rooms are warm and inviting, tastefully decorated. The beds are super comfy and my bathroom was very sexy. Highly recommend for a Lower East Side stay.

title: Felt like we hadn't paid enough!
text:
Got on a mr & Mrs smith package deal with BA and from walking through the door our stay was fantastic. Welcome wine in our room, gorgeously decorated room and one of my favourite bathrooms in a hotel thanks not only to the feeling it was a dressing room but the awesome shower with lots of power! 

Breakfast was in the dirty French restaurant downstairs and had 1 choice from parfait, fruits or basket of pastries but each one was far too much for one person and they would constantly top up your coffee and juice.

As you'd imagine, we went all over the city on our trip but often found ourselves coming back to this area and road in particular as it just seemed to have the best bars and funky little restaurants, really felt like we'd unexpectedly stumbled on the coolest part of town! The famous Katz deli is opposite and you're only a minute or two walk from the subway.

The lounge was gorgeous and nearly every night was full which told you it was popular with more than just the tourists, plus the rooftop gives you an incredible view of the city - I recommend taking a bottle up there to watch the sun go down!

Absolutely loved our stay here and have been telling everyone about it, one of my favourite hotels!

title: East Village wonder
text: This hotel is great! Decorated in a charming steam-punk industrial chic combo, the rooms are small but functional. We had a terrace, possibly larger than the room, which was a real advantage in the warm fall weather. There is a continental breakfast included with your room. It is a bit confusing. Choose one of the first three items on the menu, plus coffee, tea or juice for the free breakfast. There is also a workout space on the 20th floor. Only complaints are the very slow elevators and room service doesn't always answer the phone but the front desk can help. Seems a slight disconnect exists between the restaurant and the hotel.

title: Mis-leading and style over substance
text: Very cool hotel in the heart of New Yorks alternative bar district. The only problem is the designers of this cool new hangout have spent far too much on the design and not enough on the the little things which actually count. When we booked the room we booked it with breakfast included but to our surprise at breakfast on day 1, hotel guests are limited to 3 small choices! In all honesty I would rather have not had the breakfast included at all but my feedback would be to review this policy. It just leaves a sour taste in the mouth. The rooms are very nice and well designed but small. Remember in NYC rooms with size are rare and come with a hefty price tag. Having stayed at several of manhattans hotels, from Times Square to the upper west side I have to say location wise this is great. I would recommend this hotel for a weekend stay but no longer.

title: Lovely hotel attentive staff
text:
Really nice hotel within trendy part of NY. Rooms are small but nicely appointed. Excellent bathroom. 
Has a very good restaurant which is hard to get into but they save some places for guests. Only things that could be better is service at breakfast. It's chaotic. Lifts are slow.

title: Trendy Boutique Hotel
text: What a great hotel.  And no surprise, considering these hoteliers brought us The Bowery Hotel.  First of all, when booking the reservation I mentioned that we were traveling for a birthday and they had a bottle of wine and handwritten note waiting for us in our room.  Needless to say, the service was exceptional.  It's a brand new hotel, so obviously clean and fresh.  The decor is contemporary hipster, tastefully done with faux fur throws on the luxe purple chairs and beautiful hardwood furniture.  The bathroom is very cool with a Keith McNally restaurant feel.  We had a virtually unobstructed city view and we could even see the Williamsburg Bridge and did not experience any street noise.  The rooftop offers a fantastic 360 view of downtown.  The complimentary continental breakfast offers a nice spread, and you can even enjoy it in their garden courtyard.  Located in the very hip, Lower East Side, this place is close to some of the best restaurants and night life in NYC.  It's not the cheapest but well worth the money.

title: Trendy Foyer, Rubbish Hotel: Little space - Little internet - Little breakfast - Little Value
text:
Classic case of a hotel with an above average foyer for the public but which misses the mark as a place to stay: if you chose your hotel for the foyer, this is an option (although by far and away you will find better foyer scenes elsewhere in NYC) but if like us you chose a hotel for the rooms and its delivery, as a hotel, give The Ludlow a miss. 

The Ludlow is trying to appeal to those looking for something of a boutique experience in New York, lower East Side. Beyond what is a pretty funky space in the foyer (which is not without charm and ambience) the hotel itself is what lets it down.

Little Space: The smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in - in my life. Barely able to walk around the bed. We booked one of the higher categories of rooms described as a "Queen Suite" higher up with views. The room was NOT a suite. It was a bed and a very narrow space for walking around it. Cramped and no where to even leave your bags. The absence of space is so bad it shows in things like: in the bathroom the toilet paper dispenser is hidden underneath the sink; the ironing board is more an ironing plate (being one of those tiny dinky jobs that you set up on a table top except there was no table surface in the room large enough to put it on so you have to balance the little board - with hot iron - on the uneven surface of the bed).

Little Breakfast - a pet hate of mine this is one of those hotels that forces you to pay for the "breakfast included" option - but then when you turn up you discover that you have paid for breakfast but are only allowed two or three very limited options and that for all the normal breakfast goodies you need to pay up like everyone else. So unless filter coffee, orange juice and some fruit are what you want when travelling on holiday or business - assume the already inflated room price is exclusive of breakfast. 

Little internet - wifi is patchy to non existent in the rooms - again all effort is spent on the lobby where internet is normal. 

Little Value - in a city renown for overpriced hotels - and one I have travelled to on dozens of occasions in recent years - The LudLow Hotel stands out as a prime example of an overpriced hotel, with some cool public facing bits but which misses the mark as a place to stay. The breakfast restrictions make you feel cheap and nasty. There are no features to justify the price you pay, not location, not view (very uninspiring in a  city with plenty to inspire), no add ons to make the place feel special.

If you want my advice - maybe go to The Ludlow for a drink in the bar one night (quiet but happening crowd) or maybe a brunch and stay somewhere else in the area (there are plenty of options that may not be cheaper but give you much more bang for your buck).

title: terrific trip to New York
text: Warm and welcoming trendy hotel in a great area of downtown Manhattan New York. Lots of character and great views of city from the rooms and roof top.  Very friendly and helpful staff. Fabulous food in the restaurant which is very popular but tables always available for guests

title: (-)Single room size for 2 people (-)Only 2 elevators for 20 floors and NO service elevator (+)Bathroom very good.
text:
We paid 300$ night (taxes included) per night. The room was suposed to be double, it is what we booked via booking.com. The reality was a room with a 131cm bed !! We saw (late) that in the reservation it was written that the bed could be from 131-150 cm... but frankly, I have been in several hotels of this category and  in my experience, this kind of bed and room size is for a single room, never for a double room. 
However, the bathroom was big and as we had no space for the 2 suitcases, we used it to place one of them. The bath was wonderful, its size was for 2 people, and we had views of the city from the window next to it. The bath with a glass of red wine made our day happy.

Other weird point for a hotel of this category was the elevators... Only 2 elevators for a 20 floors hotel is not enough. And to make it worst they had NO service elevator. This was anoying for us the customers but overall for the service people who (very kindly) let the customers use the elevator before them. This made service staff wait and wait until the elevator was empty. This also made us stop in almost every floor. Result: 10 minuts from the lobby to the room in the worst scenario. 
The good points are: the location (great), the hotel design (very elegant and cool), the breakfast (tasty) and the staff (very nice)

title: Cool & relaxed, perfect location in LES.
text: Realtiv neues Designhotel. Grosse Gastronomie im Erdgeschoss. Perfekte Lokation an der Lower Eastside - der Ort, wo im Moment alles passiert. Zu Fuss nach Soho und zum East River oder mit dem Fahrrad in kurzer Zeit nach Williamsburg. Einfach Super. Die Hotelzimmer sind recht klein, aber NY Standard halt.

title: Great Stay
text:
We stayed 9 nights at the Ludlow while in the city for our wedding and could not have loved it more.

We were in a studio queen on the 12th floor, and while the room was small, if you are neat and tidy it was just the right amount of space. The small balcony was a nice touch, it was great to be able to open up the door and step outside every now and again. 

The hotel is insanely gorgeous, with the beautiful design extending to the smallest of details. We loved the incredibly comfortable bed, the rain shower, the over sized bathroom mirror, the robes, the ample number of power outlets and the easy to use television.

The lobby, too, is a gorgeous and a great quiet place to hang out / rest during the day before it turns into a super swanky bar by night. 

The staff is overall great, we had a bit of a hiccup with a car order but nothing that wasn't overcome. 

I can't speak on breakfast because we chose to eat out every day, my husband used the gym a couple of times and was really happy with the availability of free weights to pull together a holiday workout. The wifi worked seamlessly and the laundry service was fast and efficient. 

The location was one of the main reasons we booked The Ludlow, it's such a great, happening neighborhood and a really quick walk to the East Village and Soho/Nolita  with the F train just 3 blocks away.

I would highly recommend the hotel and would happily book again.

title: Love this gem!
text: The Ludlow Hotel is my go to place to stay in NYC! I stay in many NYC hotels and this is by far the best! Why???? Well to start with the staff is beyond accommodating! The Rooms are always fresh and clean! The views are spectacular! The bathrooms are amazing with a vintage feel! It's the quintessential boutique hotel! And it's on Manhattans trendy Lower East Side so you reap the benefits of less crowds and great restaurants! And if you're a runner like me the Williamsburg bridge is steps away! If you need to wind down or relax(which, who doesn't?!) there's a fab bar downstairs with a cozy fireplace! And in the am a complimentary yummy breakfast in there restaurant Dirty(which is amazing at night but very hard to get a rez) Don't forget to visit there neighbor restaurant next door "Sweet Chick" for the best chicken fried or grilled you've ever tasted!!!!!!!

title: Nice hotel and super location
text:
I stayed at the Ludlow with my boyfriend for my birthday weekend.

It was our first time to NYC and so pleased we chose the Ludlow as the location is brilliant.
Great shops around in little Italy and soho.
We had breakfast in the Dirty French (part of the hotel) but that was the only time we ate but the restaurant was always packed so obviously good!

Rooms were a good size with a balcony.
The BEST bed ever, beautiful linen and huge!!! 

The only thing we would have liked is a bath but I think they are with the more expensive rooms.

Would recommend to anyone as its unique with cool decor and would certainly stay again.

title: Funky location of NYC
text:
This was a rare hotel in NYC with 2 bedrooms and therefore 4 people could stay together. It is a Gem in this regard for our friends + baby.

I cannot get over how much i loved the location of this place in NYC.. its next door multiple fantastic restaurants & cheap eats (kats, gelatostore, meatball shop, claw daddy) multiple boutique shops & sneakers stores and pubs/bars.. it is also walking distance to the metro and best of all.. in lower east side manhattan

it is situated above dirty French restaurant (wasnt a huge fan for food).. which is a great bar at night 

service by all staff was fantastic and we had absolutely nothing to complain about during our 10 day stay at this place... 

would highly recommend if you are looking for a 2bd place OR if looking to stay in lower east side.

title: Trendy but friendly.
text:
So pleased I chose this hotel, we loved the decor, the friendly staff, the liveliness of the restaurant and bar at night, and the interesting neighbourhood.
 I wasn't sure if we would feel out of place being that it mostly has a young, hip clientele, but there were others our age and the staff members were welcoming to everyone.

Our room, 712, was tiny, probably the most tiny room we have had anywhere, but it had what we needed and the bed was seriously the most comfortable bed we have had in a hotel and we had a difficult time getting out of it each morning. The bathroom had a very large shower, toiletries were nice. One minus is that the door to the bathroom didn't open all the way as it hit the toilet, so that took a bit of maneuvering.  

The breakfast included in our rate was great and we could add on and pay a supplement if we wanted to. Staff at breakfast were unfailingly cheerful and pleasant.

There was a subway stop two blocks away and we used the subway to go everywhere from Brooklyn to the Upper East side with no problems.  Across the street is Katz's famous deli, on the corner is a gelato "laboratory" - delicious!  Nearby is Drexler's a new bar/restaurant where we had some very delicious cocktails one night.

I would stay at the Ludlow again and this time make more time to explore the neighbourhood more thoroughly.

title: amazing restaurant, small room
text: Stayed here for the night after my wife and my marriage ceremony. The restaurant absolutely took care of us giving us so much delicious food and we were stuffed beyond our limits. Breakfast the next day was also delicious! The lobby, restaurant and cafe area are all beautiful and the roof access is also a plus. Maybe we cheaped out by getting the cheapest room because is was really small, the smallest hotel room i've ever been in and the view of a parking lot to the East wasn't the most romantic. The bathroom was almost bigger than the bedroom with really nice decor and a huge tub. Would definitely love to come back but stay in a bigger room.

title: great hotel in great location!
text:
comfortable rooms, great details like lots of outlets, friendly and capable staff. could become my regular place to stay in NYC. 

elevators seems to work well, despite other reviews. wifi good, and easy to connect notebook to room TV. (Yes, I'm an old-school nerd)

I'll be back!

title: A fantastic getaway to a fantastic city
text: This hotel made our trip to New York truly unforgettable. Everything, from the ambience of the lounge to the staff, from the cocktails to the amazing rooms, was top notch. When we checked in the reception promised us that they will take a good care of us but they exceeded their promise. We can't wait to book with them again next time!

title: Great design, cool NYC vibes
text:
Very stylish, design-oriented hotel at a convenient location on the lower east side, close to the subway and in very trendy surroundings.
Staff was friendly, and everything is in a great condition. Things look old, but that's part of the design. Maintenance and cleanliness standards are extremely high.
The restaurant was great too, crowded every night. A breakfast appetizer is included in the room rate, and it's delicious, albeit a bit small to be a full breakfast.
The only not so great point: our room (standard queen studio) was tiny. Really tiny. Difficult to store two suitcases during our stay let alone unpack. But I suppose that's just Manhattan...

title: Beyond wonderful
text: I booked this hotel for a one-night stay after some time in the Hudson Valley for a close friend's wedding. Having lived in New York for almost 7 years, I knew this area and was really excited to stay at the Ludlow given everything I had heard. Suffice it to say, from the instant we pulled up, I was sold. A very friendly bellhop named Chris quickly assisted me and my partner (we were parked in front of a fire hydrant across the street) in gathering our bags and getting us checked in. I returned the car to the rental depot while my partner was kindly escorted to the room by Chris. It was relayed to me that Chris was full of information about the hotel, area, amenities, and even told my partner when the sun would be setting! On arrival from dropping off the vehicle, the desk staff welcomed me with a friendly smile and hearty greeting. A staff member was getting onto the elevator with me and he was very friendly. He asked me about how my stay was going and I told him I was just arriving. He said, "You're gonna love the bed!" He wasn't kidding.  I still rave about how comfortable the bed was. The bathroom products were amazing (and I don't use hotel bathroom products!) and everything was well-appointed. Even though - as I said before - I know New York like the back of my hand, I won't be staying at another hotel. Ludlow all the way!

title: Great NYC vibes
text:
As the first stop on our 3 week honeymoon this hotel was the perfect beginning. Well appointed rooms with a nice comfy bed and a very cool restaurant Dirty French down stairs. Details in the bathroom were stunning brass finishes mixed with marble! The wifi was super fast so made researching our stay in NYC a breeze. Good selection of Channels on the TV for when you get back from a days shopping and need some downtime before dinner.
Also a really great rooftop we bought drinks and sat up the there a few times. Gym is also on the roof level so make for a great workout space.

Eating at dirty French for dinner is a must. 

Location is perfect, nice local feel about the area but still easy to walk to most areas.

Only issue we found was charging guests for a international adapter these should be available to loan.

Thanks for a great stay! 

Megan and Rob

title: High energy Hotel In New York
text:
Brand new, 1 year old hotel, part of the Design Collection Hotels. We started following this hotels last year, and they haven't disappoint.
The Ludlow is in the "Meat market district", is trendy, industrial looking, they have preserved the original elements of the factory it used to be, brick wood tiles.
the Bar (with a nice fire place and adjacent patio) is right next to reception is high energy, great martinis and simple food menu. The checking is professional and quick.
the rooms are decent size, we stayed at the loft with terrace, we had 2 rooms (2 short stays) #1502 is next to the elevator and have a very tiny wardrobe... can barely get 2 suits in...#1508 is a corner unit lay out is much nicer same space, (about 35 sqm) huge king size bed, sofa area and a great decent size terrace with table and 2 chairs.
Breakfast is included (3 choices fruit/ cereal and bake goods) if you want something extra is 'a  la carte' try the eggs Benedict with serrano ham, AMAZING!
Food is good..the service it's ok... not fast not too slow, the only thing i should point is that in the restaurant it seems there is no one in charge.. we have to constantly repeat our order... reception concierge is forgetful, so if you like a dinner reservation check it has being done..or they will forget...(it happened to us) I would say the stuff is young and they are working out the snagging of just being new.
All in all our stay was great.
Good restaurants, pubs and bars ALL ARROUND (Beauty and Essex, Stanton social...etc)
Great access...we had to travel to Brooklyn for meetings you are at 15 min drive max in Brooklyn on the other side of the bridge, and 5min from the highway to drive to upstate NY, also if you are going to Broadway or the center of Manhattan, the taxi's take the highway which is much faster than bumper to bumper traffic.

title: My new favourite in NYC
text:
I found the Ludlow when looking for somewhere to stay with a colleague when we visited the city for a concert. I'd recently stayed at the Marlton, which was fully booked, so we headed here instead and am so pleased we did. We booked a double loft which meant we got a room each with a shared bath. I had the larger room which had a great king bed, sofa area and a view over the LES. I felt somewhat guilty that my friend's room while equally nicely decorated had no window, so was in complete black out at night. It's also worth noting access is via this room, so if you come back later you have to go through this room to acces the master bedroom. Aside from this quirk the room was great, and the bathrooms are stunning, with mirrors surrounded by bulbs and Maison Martin Margiela bath robes and bath mat. 
Downstairs the breakfast in Dirty French (included in the rate) is stylish and uncomplicated (worth adding the bacon for $5!) and the staff throughout the hotel were friendly, helpful and not too cool as can sometimes be the case in trendier hotels. We had a packed itinerary so didn't get a chance to checkout the bar, but whatever time we got in, there seemed to be a great scene (but not so much we heard it from the room!) 
I will definitely be back here!

title: Great hotel and location
text: We were at this hotel over a weekend, visiting family in NYC.  Great location if you want to be on the lower east side.  Rooms small (as is typical in NYC) but well-appointed and clean.  Bathroom very nicely sized.  Restaurant in hotel is excellent.  Staff professional and helpful (even when one of the elevators was out of service).  The only complaint is that, even though we were on the 13th floor, there is an incredible amount of street noise coming from Ludlow Street.  Next time, we'll ask for a room not facing Ludlow or one even higher.

title: Nao e tudo isso!
text:
O hotel e localizado num bairro alternativo porem muito charmoso, cheio de restaurantes e bares interessantes, com fácil acesso ao metro e oportunidade de conhecer a verdadeira cidade de Nova York.

Pontos Fortes:
-Localizacao
-Limpeza

Pontos Fracos:
- Cafe da manha no restaurante anexado ao hotel com somente 3 opções ( as demais são cobrados a parte), inaceitável num hotel que custa 350$ por noite e 4 estrelas
-Os funcionários da limpeza são  muito educados porem não repõe os produtos do banheiro diariamente provavelmente por distração ou talvez política do hotel de economizar ???
-Dava pra sentir o cheiro de cigarro nos banheiro (por sinal muito pequenos), vindo de outras áreas do hotel 
-O funcionario da recepcao no check out nao quis nos dar o recibo, entregou somente uma folha impressa com o orçamento, foi grosseiro e indiferente, quando questionado sobre os detalhes do pagamento respondeu fazendo a gente se sentir envergonhado de perguntar, no check in foi solicitado o cartão de credito e cobrado um deposito diário de 50$ ( que no check out foi restituido) porem sem previamente informar sobre o fato. Os recepcionistas usam o cartão de credito como se fosse agua e não dinheiro.
O recibo ia ser enviado por email e não foi. Atendimento relaxado demais.

-O ar condicionado faz muito barulho e não mantém a temperatura fixa no quarto, tem que se ligado e desligado o tempo todo

-A noite tem muito barulho vindo das ruas principalmente as sirenas porem as janelas, quando estão fechadas isolam o ruído.

title: Highest level customer service with a rock'n'roll vibe that keeps you young
text: Great hotel and a great value. Rooms are exquisitely furnished with the most comfertable beds ever. I loved the front desk the most. Very professional yet cool and warm at the same time. The concierge Luca was beyond awesome. He made us feel welcomed and always had a smile on his face to start our day off right. Mark at the door was always there to great us as well. I usually dont believe in writting reviews online but i had to this time because the hotel and its staff went above and beyond my normal expectations. The view from the roof is perfect. I must say that if you want a hip, chic, and cool rock 'n' roll hotel, then stay at The Ludlow when you go to New York City. I've stayed at other NYC hotels such as the Crosby and the Peninsula and I have to say The Ludlow is far more fun. Its the real deal

title: Fantastic NYC hotel
text:
I booked this for my husbands 30th birthday having trawled the net looking for a hotel with a bit of character, it did not disappoint! Really well located, nicely appointed room & busy bar. It might have the potential to be a bit pretentious on approach (especially at night) but it's really not, most staff at the front desk / bar were very friendly & helpful. 

They offer a complimentary breakfast which is really unusual for NYC so were we grateful of this, it's a choice of 3 dishes plus juice & coffee & it's really tasty. We usually shared 2 between us. Despite being absolutely buzzing at night, the restaurant service is very slow in the morning, but we were on holiday & so didn't mind the casual pace. 

I would recommend asking for a higher room, that was my only disappointment, that the view wasn't better, but it's hardly a complaint! 

We had a problem with my credit card provider whilst there which was a bit of a hassle, but Julianna & the accounts team delivered a bottle of wine to our room later that day which was a nice touch.

We enjoyed our stay greatly, we only wish it had been warmer so I think we'll just have to come back to see The Ludlow & LES in the sun!! 

We also enjoyed happy hour at Sweet Chick next door a few afternoons whilst there, really nice little bar offering fried chicken dishes & a great cocktail menu, with all wine & beer included in happy hour prices :)

title: The attitude
text: Traveling is about making compromises. If you are a professional traveler you admit that things go wrong and you admire staff handling this professionally. The Ludlow is professional. Yes, there were a few things going wrong. But what I liked about The Ludlow - they were adequatley addressed. I admire the staff for this professionalism and also for the outstaning great bed. I will be returing.

title: Best of the east side!
text:
Absolutely loved staying at the Ludlow. Front of house staff from doormen to concierge are super helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. Great rooms with great lighting - and plenty of dimmers, groovy chaises and couches, lambskin rugs and contemporary art. We stayed in a loft room (great square footage for NYC) that had a great second space with a bed/couch area. Bathrooms are large and some of the nicest in NYC - deep baths, great water pressure with Marvis toothpaste and a gorgeous Moroccan rose body wash. Beds and pillows ensure a great night's sleep and the location is not noisy. 

Hotel is BRILLIANTLY located near the subway, the divine il laboratorio del gelato and a range of great bars and restaurants including pizza, tapas, tacos. The hotel's famed Dirty French restaurant is buzzing at night (and you get a table if you are staying in house) and the bar area is also a great bar with a relaxed energy. I loved the rooftop gym that is well equipped and the wifi works a treat.

We had a slight problem with our A/C when we were there and a maintenance man was at our door in a matter of minutes. All room service and inquiries were answered super promptly.

My only gripe was that the continental breakfast was very light on and morning service can be slow (but very very friendly). I'd opt for the more expensive larger breakfasts - crepes, eggs etc. The Ludlow is a real East side gem. A round of applause!!!

title: A Slice of Old School NY
text: Great neighborhood on the LES that still has a sense of history - looking down Ludlow at the buildings you can imagine how the neighborhood could haven been when the tenements were filled immigrants building a new life in America. the hotel is convenient to the subway (two blocks to the F) and easy to walk to Nolita, the Village, Chinatown. the rooms are small, but very well appointed. comfy bed, excellent HVAC, exposed beams and very steampunk-ish fixtures in the bathroom, which was quite large compared with other NY bathrooms. the staff was very friendly during my stay. highly recommended for its location and design.

title: Loved this place
text:
Took this trip to celebrate our daughter's 21st. Couple of contacts made with the hotel prior to arrival - prompt and efficient responses.  On arrival, supremely efficient; checked in and sat in our rooms admiring the views of both the Empire State Building and One World Trade Centre within 10 minutes. Beautifully furnished rooms. No issue with size of our 2 queen studio rooms -they were more than adequate for our needs. 

Birthday cake discussions prior to arrival with hotel worked like a dream; Charles - you and your team at Dirty French made it a night to remember.  The care and attention we received at dinner was wonderful. Thank you so much. 

Location is fantastic.  So many bars and restaurants - too many to take advantage of so lots of enticement to return.

Checkout was swift. Calm and efficient process.

Many people raise issues with the lifts.  We had no issues at all.

Really was a fabulous break and the the entire team from front of house,catering to housekeeping helped make our first time in New York just that little bit more special.

Thank you The Ludlow hotel.

title: Enchanting
text: The staff at The Ludlow were beyond expectation. They gave me a run down of everything while helping me to my room (what direction my room was facing, what time sunset would be and where the best view was). The room was tiny but was comfortable and luxurious. The bath and products were fantastic. The most  minor complaint would be the doors slam shut so all afternoon and evening you get this SLAM as everyone is entering and exiting their room. Can't wait to come back to NYC to stay here again.

title: What a great Hotel. Book it before it sells out!!
text:
Room was fairly small (701) but was really nice and as we weren't here to spend much time in the room it wasn't a problem. The bed is really comfy though, more like home than a hotel. All the staff we came across were very nice and helpful. The bar area is really a nice space and the restaurant, Dirty French, does a really good breakfast. Didn't have time for dinner but it was rammed on both the Sunday and Monday nights of our stay.
Would definitely stay here again. Book it!!

title: Ultra cool, achingly hip
text:
Just off the main drag of Houston, very dark lobby and bar. At least in daytime. The cheery man at the desk said we will have a balcony! Happy days. On reaching the room, I thought they were having a laugh. The room was so small, we had to keep our suitcases under the bed. The balcony was there, but my wife and I could only be on there at the same time if we cuddled each other. Disappointing. The bathroom was good. Again, as a previous review said, we paid on exit, and we're shocked to have fifty dollars a day taxes. Approx $350 per night plus taxes. Quite a bit for perhaps the smallest room we have ever stayed in.
The mini bar etc was also so extensive, (and expensive), it took up most of the bedside table. 
The iron and ironing board were in the tiny wardrobe. The ironing board was approximately three feet long in total, which I suppose was just as well because there was nowhere to erect a full size one.
Would I recommend it, not really.

title: Style and Substance
text: Here's what sets the Ludlow apart:  the neighborhood, original windows/great light and a kicking lobby that attracts a cross section of NYers and guests, working and playing. Add complimentary breakfast at Dirty French and the reasonable rates, and the out-of-the way-for-most location just doesn't matter. The only negative is SLOW elevators. Perfect for NYU parents - and anyone, really.

title: Very disappointed
text:
I booked the Ludlow having fallen in love with the pictures of the room and the area in which it is located.  It was a birthday trip for my boyfriend so I wanted the hotel to be excellent which is what I thought we would get at a five star boutique hotel. Unfortunately, the hotel did not meet our expectations. 

I will begin with the positive points. The decor of the hotel is excellent and our room was clean (but small) with an excellent view. The food (breakfast) in the hotel was very good. The area is great for bars and restaurants.

The main negative point of our experience concerned check-in/payment. I had booked on booking.com and had selected a "pay later" option i.e. pay on check out. When we arrived to check-in, they asked for a bank card. I explained that we would be paying in cash - we had changed money in the UK to obtain the best exchange rate and avoid paying the fees associated with using our cards in the US. I was told that this was fine but that they still needed a card for us to be able to check in. What was not explained to me was that the hotel would be freezing the full booking amount plus incidentals from that card - near $2000. We did not expect this to be the case as no hotel has done this to either of us before. We are frequent travellers (although primarily in Europe) and are familiar with having to provide a card and even pay a deposit - but never the full amount. We were told this was to protect the hotel in case guests left without paying - which was a bit surprising Do people do this? Are hotels not insured against that? After some difficulty with the payment, we settled the bill on day 3 in full in cash. However, after doing so the hotel continued to extract smaller amounts from my account - near $200 - apparently this was automated and I will receive these amounts back but it could take "up to 30 days". Not ideal. 

As a goodwill gesture, the hotel then offered us a complimentary breakfast (meaning items other than the 3 items the hotel offers as part of the rate). When we came to check-out this complimentary breakfast had not been communicated in our guest history. This led to a very awkward conversation where we (a) had to convince the front desk staff we weren't trying to skip paying the $42 bill and (b) the person who offered us the complimentary breakfast didn't have the authority to do so. Eventually the hotel agreed to remove the cost of the breakfast from our bill. To be honest, it was extremely embarrassing to have to "fight" over such a small amount and what should have been a nice gesture turned into another difficult experience.

Other, more general negative points were:

(a) staff attitudes at the front desk and at the hotel bar/restaurant were poor and inattentive. As a general rule it would take 10 minutes after being seated to be served and when we were often served the wrong items or items were not brought out at all (not a huge issue when it's part of the complimentary breakfast but still not great). We felt the attitude of the staff was deliberate as the hotel strives for a "cool" and "laid back" image. 

(b) staff use of the hotel elevators. It seems that the hotel does not have a service elevator, so cleaners and other staff would use the same elevators as we did. Our room was on the 11th floor and it was a little annoying to get into an empty elevator and then have it stop multiple times on the way to the ground floor for staff to get in and out.

For guests who just want to get out and see New York these things were just annoying and frustrating.

In summary - this hotel has the potential to be incredible (great location, great views, good food) but the service does not fit with the standard that the hotel is trying to attain. Based on our experiences on this trip, we would not be able to recommend this hotel to others.

title: Buena localización - excelente hotel
text:
Me quede aprox una semana
Habitación : su tamaño es razonable pero esta muy buen decorada , el baño está muy bien equipado y su decoración es increíble 
Atención : personalizada, su personal es bastante educado y cordial 
Restaurante : tienen un restaurante muy bueno justo abajo, lo recomiendo 
Desayuno: es complementario, está bien pero creo que podrían mejorar, especialmente con los utensilios de plástico y cartón ( poco ecológico) 
Ubicación: tiene el metro a dos calles, está en una zona bastante hip llena de restaurantes y bares

title: Trendy Hotel
text: Rooms were wonderful amd architecturally beautifu and well decorated.  Lobby/bar area was fun and a perfect spot to wait and have a cocktail if you were having dinner at Dirty French.  Would suggest they have a better experience when leaving...we wanted a taxi and they told us to use Uber...which we would have done but frankly the rates were a bit much.  Just seems to me for a hotel which is high end, you could call/hail a taxi for the guests. True, not a high traffic area but taxis but they are around.  We ended up heading over the 2nd ave and hailing one ourselves...didn't make for the best experience.

title: Very groovy - totally loved it
text: Really nice hotel.  Hip and trendy in the lower east side.  Very trendy area, cool clientele, great staff, fantastic bar area, food excellent.  There's even a guitar shop two doors down - HEAVEN!!!!  Very highly recommended, close to subway to get up to Central Park and all over NYC.  Fantastic - can't wait to go again.

title: Loved it!
text: This wasn't my first visit to NYC but it was my first time staying in the Lower Eastside and at The Ludlow. I loved both!  The Ludlow has the most comfortable beds ever. Really. Seriously! In fact we loved the hotel - liked its style, found the staff friendly and the breakfasts great (although worth noting that the inclusive options are very limited and hot breakfasts are charged for). Still, it wasn't a big issue. Occasionally the breakfast service was a bit erratic but always with a smile! We stayed in a King Studio which was absolutely fine (the bed, the bed!) and with a very nice bathroom but I'd have loved to have stayed in one of the loft suites not least because they're higher up the building. One small gripe - if you're staying there for a few nights, you'll probably struggle with the rather inadequate wardrobe space. It's worth requesting, as in any hotel, a room away from the lift. The streets of NYC aren't exactly quiet so if you need absolute silence, pack earplugs but, from my previous experience, that applies to pretty much any city hotel!  The views from the roof top are amazing. There's no bar up there but there is furniture and we simply took our drinks up there one early evening as the sun was setting. The hotel's bar is buzzing but has a really cool, relaxed, vibe.  So, there maybe a few minor niggles but I'd return to the Ludlow in a heartbeat. I thought it was much better value than any other Manhattan hotel that I've stayed in previously.  There are loads of restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood and it's a very easy walk to Soho etc.

title: Great fun and good value
text: We'd never stayed on the Lower East Side, but found the Ludlow by accident and decided to take a chance.  It was a great fun experience, good location to explore from, interesting surrounding area, nice hotel and we had a much bigger room than we normally get in NY.  The staff were efficient without making any effort to go out of their way, but that seems pretty normal at most NY hotels we've stayed at.  The bar is a lot of fun in the evening, but we could still escape to peace and quiet with a good view of the NY skyline.  Good value and good fun.

title: Beautiful chic hotel
text:
Myself and my partner stayed here for 6 nights on our visit to New York. It was my first time in the city but my partners 3rd visit so he recommended we stay in lower east side. This hotel was the best value and the nicest in the area and the pictures whilst booking were not deceptive at all! The hotel hosts a beautiful lobby, all tiled floors and french chic- looking! The staff on reception were very helpful and always very attentive, welcoming you every time you entered the hotel. The rooms were absolutely stunning, we were on the 16th floor so had excellent views towards the Williamsburg ridge. The rooms are a touch on the small side but you get this in any big city like New York- where space is a premium. The bathrooms, however, where huge with a beautiful deep sunken bath and gorgeous shower! There was a mini bar and complimentary toiletries including the use of a hairdryer and toweling robes.

I would give the hotel 5/5 but for me the location was not the best- still good though! For first time visitors I would recommend staying in Midtown, where everything is as you are pretty central to everything. However around the Ludlow there was loads of lovely bars and restaurants- including Dirty French downstairs! I encourage you to try their eggs benedict! It was amazing! The waiters and waitresses really look after you and make sure your coffee cup is always full!

All in all I would completely recommend this hotel- it was fantastic! I would have preferred a better location but thoroughly enjoyed my stay!

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Stayed in one of their sky box loft rooms, with amazing views.  Great gym on 20th floor with a terrace for relaxing.  Nice restaurant and funky bar on ground floor.  Only irritation was the 2 lifts, the cleaning staff utilise them to move between 1 or 2 floors resulting in long waits in the lobby.

title: You get just on the border of reasonable service
text: Skyloft room was nice. Hotel was nice. Everything was nice but not amazing. Staff were adequate. Not rude not impolite but did the minimum required. Example: Arrived NYC from UK at 11am 4 hours early. Called them prior to arrival at the hotel and asked if the room was ready. Was advised no it wasn't but they would prioritise it and have it ready asap. Dropped off our luggage and went for a wander. Hotel called us at 3:15pm that room was now ready. Checking in time is 3pm anyway ...lucky we were "prioritised". They should have just advised us no it wont be ready till 3pm and left it at that instead of implying they would go out of their way to accommodate us.

title: Just book it!
text: Had an absolutely amazing experience at The Ludlow.  Everyone was lovely, front desk especially great.  Breakfast is beautiful, the bar is great, the whole place is gorgeous, and the beds....Well, you just need to lie on one of the beds and you won't want to get up! Heaven!! Great location and will definitely be back!

title: Branché !
text:
Hotel que je qualifierai de : branché moderne , tout à fait dans le style NewYorkais underground , dans un quartier populaire . Bref , on vit le cœur de NewYork même ! 
Propre , deco industrielle/rock/pop décalée , patio intérieur hyper sympas , cosy . 
Chambre avec vue sur downtown superbe et terrasse au 20ème étage avec vue splendide sur Manhattan ! 
Seul petit bémol s'il en faut : le petit déjeuner est à la carte et pas beaucoup de choix ( café The jus viennoiserie (très bonnes) granola fruits  compris ,  les autres choses en supplément payant ...

title: The best!
text: For my first time in New York this couldn't have been a more perfect stay! The best was literally the best bed I've ever slept it, the decor was perfect, luxurious whilst matching my own personal taste, perfect location for my partners birthday! We requested a balcony, and we got it for no extra charge! Staff are relaxed and quirky. Great unique, unusual place. Very clean, friendly with excellent products. Bed, duvet and cushions, heaven! Would love to go back and highly recommend it to anyone.  If all the rooms were as good as ours, there is no reason why you would not enjoy your stay here. A*******

title: Hipster hotspot
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ludlow. The hotel and rooms really have a lot of character and have been furbished with great attention to detail. We had the full studio room. The room had everything you need and the lay-out was as good as possible given the size of the room. However, if you can, I would advise to upgrade to another room type, especially if you like some more space. The design of the bathroom especially was jaw-dropping and the products smelled great. For breakfast there was a wide range of dishes, three of which were complimentary. There is also a rooftop terrace where you can go chill with a bottle of wine or a beer. All in all, we had a great experience here. You really get your money's worth at the Ludlow!

title: Top five favorite hotels!
text:
I just came back from a three night stay at the Ludlow and it was better than I expected.  We stayed in the Skybox Loft, which I would recommend to anyone who wants killer views.  Our room was located on the 18th floor and we had the best views of the city.  As a bonus, they have a 20th floor patio area with tables and lounge chairs and indoor gym as well. 

The vibe of the hotel is also a selling point.  It's cool, but not too cool where you feel like you don't belong.  The decor was 1920s speakeasy.  A lot of tile, wood, leather and brass.  The staff was really friendly and it felt more like staying in an apartment than a hotel, complete with a doorman and restaurant downstairs.

The location is the best in my opinion.  Lower East Side has turned into such cool neighborhood and is walking distance (15 minutes) to Soho.  On Friday and Saturday nights, Ludlow street is packed!  There are a ton of bars/lounges/restaurants around so be prepared for a lot of people on the streets.  That's what makes New York...New York!  Once you step into the hotel you can get away from all of the street noise and chaos.  We heard zero street noise in our room...maybe because we were on the 18th floor. Actually we never heard doors slamming or other guests on our floor which is unusual in a hotel.

The room itself was great!  The Skybox Loft has a separate seating area with two chairs and a small couch.  The bathroom was large for a hotel room, especially in New York .  The whole room was large by New York standards!

I'm already thinking about planning my next trip to New York which will include a stay at The Ludlow!

title: First rate
text: The property and staff are incredible.  The gm Marcus and host of Dirty French Royce are first rate.   The entire staff was helpful and made us want to come back...and we will.  You just need some minor patience with the elevators.  That would be the only negative and it's very minor.

title: A Stellar Stay
text:
My husband and I have stayed in many high end hotels on the Lower East Side and The Ludow is by far the best.  We had an wonderful 5 night stay, with incredibly comfortable beds, a spacious room (by LES standards), and each morning, a delicious complementary breakfast.
The staff was always friendly and gracious, ready to help at a moment's notice and every request was filled immediately. The bathtub was fantastic and the shower, just as good. Truly, a superior experience. We will definitely be back and already are looking forward to it.

The location was perfect--what's not to love about being next to Katz's Deli and Russ & Daughters!  It's an easy walk to Soho and the East Village, but there are wonderful restaurants (including the hotel's Dirty French) and stores in the neighborhood, and a terrific movie theater only 3 blocks away.

title: Nice hotel....
text:
First time staying at the Ludlow, staff were friendly, helpful and nice. We booked a studio room which was small, we decided to move to a slightly bigger room and the staff at the front desk were very helpful.
We have visited NYC a number of times before. Ludlow St is a good location for getting about town.

title: Love the Ludlow!
text: Beautiful hotel, stylish interiors, lovely room with a balcony, powerful shower, good breakfast, great location in lower east side (subway within a couple minutes walk) with bars, shops and Brooklyn not far away. The staff and the wifi were great too. A perfect experience overall, and would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent affordable boutique hotel near SOHO
text: I enjoyed staying here for a wedding.  The rooms were reasonably priced, albeit small.  The hotel was clean, staff was helpful, and the French restaurant down stairs was good.  It is right across the street from Katz's deli.  I would recommend staying here again.

title: Beautiful gem of a hotel in a great area
text:
We visited this hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel is really beautiful. Bar area is very welcoming, staff friendly our room on the 13th floor was lovely with a fantastic view of the city. 
The subway is not far at all, and East Side area is absolutely buzzing. It's a great place to stay without being amongst the total "touristy" area of NYC.
Definitely want to go back to NYC and would stay at this hotel again without question!
Well done The Ludlow!

title: Great hotel
text:
Stayed for three nights late August, early September 2015.
The hotel is hip, trendy and spotless. Such a pleasure to be in and around the great decor. The staff were nice and the rooms were very nice too. Yes small-ish, just like most large cities, but not an issue. The roof top terrace was a nice surprise with great views. The LES area is great too, buzzing with life, great bars and restaurants. The subway was close and very easy to get around Manhattan from here.
I would like to return to New York and wouldn't hesitate coming back to the Ludlow.
I can only imagine those that have given negative reviews are professional complainers and will never be happy in life.

title: WONDERFUL HOTEL AND STAFF
text:
Our first visit to New York, and this hotel appeared on the British airways site.  New, luxurious and Cool.  It has that fantastic old school New York charm, non of the over commercial times square rubbish here.

The staff are fantastic, especially on reception and the room was wonderful.  We were floor 16 in a standard studio.....a little small, but spotlessly clean.  

It has its own resteraunt called Dirty French and a good Bar.  Over the road is a very nice Italian eating house, on the corner the famous Katz Deli, and some unusual bars and etc up Ludlow street.

Please consider lower east side for a base, its a short walk from China Town, and Little Italy, and about half an ours walk form the 911 memorial and the financial district.  In our view its an area that shows a traditional face for NYC.

title: The best
text:
I spent two nights in this amazing hotel last June. I spotted it on nightnight.co, a website that curates the coolest affordable hotels in selected cities. 

Everything was perfect, from the atmosphere inside the hotel, to the room itself. Loved also the incredible attention to details. 
> at the heart of the Lower East Side, one of the coolest part of Manhattan 
> in front of the legendary Katz Deli, perfect for grabbing a BLT on the back to the hotel  
> the super comfy bed and retro interior designs of the room
> the bathtub with a view!!
> Maison Martin Margiela robes (!) and luxury bathroom accessories 
> the retro lobby lounge and the garden in the back
> super friendly staff

Can't wait to come back. Would definitely recommend!

title: Une adresse vraiment "cool"
text: Si les tarifs de l'hôtel Ludlow sont dans votre budget, c'est un bon choix.  Quartier est super, à la fois "new yorkais" et sympathiquement  "alternatif", bien animé le soir. Un choix des restaurants, des bars, etc (même au-delà de la rue Ludlow, n'hésitez pas à explorer). Hôtel est très bien desservi grâce à des transports en commun (plusieurs lignes de métro et des bus à proximité) donc aucun problème pour faire du tourisme. Quant à la prestation hôtelière proprement dite, on regrette (plus que la taille de la chambre) l'absence d'armoire dans certaines chambres (sic!) ou des porte-manteaux. Service est bien, le personnel de la réception très serviable. Le petit déjeuner est bon, quantitativement peut être satisfaisant, mais au bout de 5 jours, on en a un peu marre si on ne veut pas/ne peut pas faire autrement.

title: Great Hotel on Lower East Side
text: I recently stayed at The Ludow for 7 Nights whilst on a business trip. The Hotel was great and my room was very comfortable and extremely clean. It is situated In a really nice part of town that has a cool collection of restaurants & bars near by giving it a real neighbourhood vibe. The complimentary breakfast in the Hotel Bar/ Restaurant Dirty French was good and the service was great. There is even a small roof terrace that gives a fantastic view of Lower Manhattan I would definitely recommend a stay here!

title: Attraversando gli Stati Uniti
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 3 giorni in questo Hotel al limite del quartiere italiano e quello Cinese è un Hotel frequentato da molti giovani abbastanza vivo in un quartiere con locali notturni. Con questa è la terza volta che visito New york e facendo il raffronto con le altre volte devo dire che l' Hotel è un po sotto la media le camere sono piccole per lo standard americano  tipo quelle Giapponesi ed è un pò lontano dalle maggiori attrazioni. Direi che non lo consiglierei ad uno che è la prima volta che visita la città.
Mauro e Michela

title: Quirky, comfy hotel - the perfect city vibe stay.
text:
Having been to NYC before and stayed in Time Square, I wanted to local experience rather than the tourist one. The Ludlow is such a unique and stylish hotel. The bed in the hotel room was nick named 'the cloud' because it was so insanely comfortable! The hotel is near to lots of quirky restaurants, buzzing bars and pretty little shops. It is situated between the famous Clinton Street Bakery and Katz deli. It is sometimes a little loud at night but this didn't bother me in the slightest as you'll hear car horns and voices in most parts of the city late night/early morning.

All tourist landmarks are a taxi ride away but you can walk it too. My mum and I got a taxi to the Highline (would definitely recommend this) and walked most of the way towards manhattan, we walked all the way up to central park - easily done but if you're short on time I'd recommend taking a cab. 

The hotel was brilliant service wise. Breakfast had only three complimentary options but all were delicious, especially the coconut parfait with fresh granola which was ideal for me as I'm gluten intolerant. The concierge was wonderful at organising black cabs, booking restaurants, printing boarding passes and providing information about anything we needed. 

I would definitely stay here again, it was so lovely to feel like part of NYC rather than just a visiting tourist.

title: Worst experience
text:
In a few words, they are a team a arrogant hipsters. The worst was when calling and asking for a room service sandwich at 3am  and they couldn't tell me how long it will take, then calling me half an hour later to say they don't have any bread - really?  breakfast might be included but black american will be charged - the air con makes a very loud noise and when called to help turn it off, they never got back to me and I waited an hour at midnight for the engineer to come who obvisouly never showed up 

The rooms are very dark, some like it, it has its charm. The location is great

title: Fantástico
text:
Estupenda experiencia, hotel encantador con una cuidada rehabilitación. Personal muy amable, preocupado en todo momento por el cliente.

Habitación amplia y confortable (fantásticas las camas King size) cuidada decoración, luminosa y bastante aislada a pesar de que el hotel está en una zona bulliciosa.

Muy muy recomendable!

title: Great place to stay, nice breakfast included
text:
The attention at the front desk is superb, they take great care of details regarding their guests
Rooms are a bit small, but the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was due to challenges with their elevators

title: Wonderful stay in a great neighborhood!
text: My husband an I just returned from an amazing trip to New York, where we stayed at the Ludlow for 4 nights. This hotel exceeded all of our expectations, especially for NYC. We paid $328/night for a skybox loft. The bathroom had a huge soaking tub and rain shower, the bed was gorgeous and super comfortable, and we loved the glass-enclosed sitting room with great views of the city. The rooms, and the whole hotel, had a very modern, luxurious vibe. We never heard any hotel or outside noise while in our room, though because the skybox rooms are at the end of the hall there likely was more privacy. The bar was great and had a hip, fun, but not-too-packed ambiance, even on a Friday night. We only went to the restaurant for the breakfast included in the room. It was pretty basic (croissants, fruit, and yogurt parfait, plus juice and coffee), but it was a sit-down affair, and did the trick. The staff was always very friendly and accommodating, and we especially were impressed that they didn't bat an eye when we asked to check in 3 hours early. The neighborhood was super fun--tons of cute bars, restaurants, coffee shops, pizza joints, delis, you name it, and close to several subway stations. It's funny, usually on a trip I don't really look forward to going back to my hotel room at night, but here I couldn't wait to get back to the neighborhood to get a drink and then retreat to my cozy, chic, clean room in the sky. We are in our early 30s, and this hotel seemed well-suited to young professionals and couples. We loved the Ludlow, and were sad to leave!

title: One of my new favorites in NYC.
text: The Ludlow was a very pleasant surprise. Located perfectly in a very lively area and walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do - it also was a fabulous place to stay! The room was well appointed and comfortable - and quiet! Even though the area is busy, the room was an oasis. Everyone was very, very nice and helpful. I can't expound enough on how pleasant it was. Definitely worth the choice.

title: Funky Hotel in a vibrant location.
text: I had concerns about booking this hotel as it seemed cheap compared to other similar standard hotels.  However, I am really pleased I took the risk and went ahead with the booking.  The room was beautifully decorated with dual aspect windows.  Light and airy and spacious for a New York Hotel room - even a small balcony from which you could glimpse a view of the Empire State Building.  Shower room was small but had a great view towards the Brooklyn Bridge.  We ate breakfast in Dirty French which was OK but there are some great places very close by that are worth checking out.

title: Terrific Hotel in an Amazing Neighborhood
text:
I switched hotels and came to The Ludlow upon the recommendation of a New York local. Let me tell you, The Ludlow did not disappoint! Everything about my experience was superb from check in to check out. My room (Studio Full) was small but beautifully appointed - with a remarkably comfortable bed. To top it all off, I was given a room up on the 19th floor where I had expansive views of the city right from my bathtub!

Then, as if the fabulous room wasn't enough, the staff was among the most fun and helpful I've ever come across. I particularly want to mention the Bellmen Archer and Shawn - who helped me lug my bags around and generally provided a great first impression of the hotel. Additionally, Bridget and Ben from the front desk were both absolute pros! Let them know if you ever need any concierge help - you won't be disappointed!

I really can't say enough about this hotel - I'll definitely be back. Just terrific.

title: First Time In NY
text: This was our first trip to New York, the occasion being my wifes 50th birthday. The Ludlow was absolutely fantastic, everything we had hoped for....the rooms were fabulous, the style and decor were spot on and the location was just where we wanted to be. We didn't want to be in the typical tourist district, instead preferring to experience more of the real New York.....well we certainly got that...what an amazing cultural experience. Will definately go back.

title: Service, please, service!
text:
This is the second time I staid at this hotel, looking for an alternative to Mondrian, Mercer, Rivington and Co. First the good things. Beautiful hotel, great location, nice views, cosy bar and outdoor space. Dirty French is a very interesting place, both for people watching and good food. It seems to be a real hotspot right now.

Now to the negative point: service! It is very good at the restaurant and housekeeping/room service, but 90% absent at the front door and mainly at the reception desk. Having thought during my first stay this was an exception, it has been confirmed almost as a motto during the 8 nights I just spent there. No "Hello", "Good morning", "Welcome back", "Have a nice day", "Could I help you?", "No problem, let me see..."... Even a basic smile to give you the feeling you are welcome. If it was just one person you would see it as an exception and an error of youth, but the feeling of arrogance and complete lack of interest in who you are, each time you pass the door, can be sensed across the board with everybody there. Every day. Which is a real pity and should clearly been taken care of. It is the only reason why I would NOT consider going back to this hotel. And why I am already looking for an alternative.

title: Il top del top!
text:
Veramente eccellente questo hotel situato in Ludlow street nella zona Sud della penisola di Manhattan.
Lo staff sempre gentile, accogliente e disponibile, giovane e attivo, camere semplicemente perfette, arredate in modo semi lussuoso m pieno di dettagli che ne fanno un posto unico. Il bagno è bellissimo con le tubazioni della doccia a vista di un color giallo oro, gli asciugamani accogliente, di buon materiale, Made in France e con la cucitura dell'hotel sulle maniche. Mai visto niente di tutto ciò negli altri classici hotel. 
Importante: Wi-Fi free!

title: Excellent hotel
text: As a former New Yorker, I visit the city several times a year for work and pleasure. Out of all of the hotels that I have stayed in, the Ludlow has been the best, by far. I am currently in the hotel (2 nights- Friday through Sunday) and this establishment far exceeded my expectations in just the first night. Check in was fast and efficient, the staff responded to every request in a prompt and friendly manner, and the all amenities that the hotel has to offer make it a wonderful place to stay. My room (404) is large and spacious - much better than NYC standards. There is a rooftop terrace as well as a fabulous bar and restaurant downstairs. Highly recommend this establishment.

title: LOVED IT!
text: What a wonderful place to stay in the East Village! Excellent location. Really happening bar at night. Beautiful, well appointed and decorated room. Doormen & room service people were so welcoming. Front desk staff not so much. Had trouble w/ the door lock & the pillows are too soft.

title: Great neighbourhood to discover
text:
What a great hotel. Beautifully styled. Young, cool staff. Great location.
The rooms are well appointed with an interesting un-hotelish decor. They are in the small side, but that's New York real estate for you!
The biggest negative by far, and the constant conversation with other guests was the slowness of the elevators. With 2 elevators servicing all the guests and the staff it was way too slow. On several occasions the doors opened and there was no room to get in, as they were full with both guests and maid service trolleys. Other times guests just pushed on in, as they knew the wait for the next elevator would take some time. 
Breakfast was included, which was great. There seemed to be some confusion each morning over what exactly was included. The first morning we were offered all 3 items, the second morning we were "guided" to order 1 item and no juice was offered. The third morning the waitress took charge and decided what would be best for the table.  What we didn't understand was why there were only certain things available, when the prices shown reflected more options would be covered within the price range of the included breakfast. By day three the options feel limited.
Dinner at the restaurant was fantastic. Great menu, great food, great service. 
If your familiar with New York, but not this part of town, it's an opportunity to explore a new neighbourhood. 
Reading back, it sounds more negative than it really was. Yes there were issues, but would definitely stay there again.

title: Luxurious night in NYC
text: Beautiful hotel and Gorgeous views! Stayed July 17th in the Skybox Loft, stylishly decorated small sitting room with amazing 180 degree views of NYC and the LES, a balcony overlooking E Houston St. and Essex St, superbly comfortable Queen size bed and incredible shower/tub/towels/bathrobes. Very clean, staff was awesome! Hotel is located in the middle of one of my favorite parts of the city with music, food and culture all around. Definitely recommend!

title: Repeat customer, generally very pleasing
text:
This was my 3rd time at the Ludlow. I am generally a very satisfied guest.

Location is great, and there is always a nice buzz in the bar area off the lobby. One nice change on this trip was that breakfast is now served in Dirty French. It's a smart move, as there are quite limited options offered complimentary, so I also ended up purchasing items - but no compliants. It was a great breakfast.

The one major downsize is that the rooms are so small. This was a solo trip so it was fine, but for a couple or 2people it would be a very cramped trip. 

And another issue is with only two elevators, it can be a long wait to go up and down. 

Did however really enjoy this stay again and would return.

title: loved, loved The Ludlow will definitely be returning
text:
Just returned with my partner from 4 days at The Ludlow, loved it! Very stylish, great decor, amazingly friendly team everywhere from Dirty French, to Luca and Sarah on the front desk plus the housekeepers (not sure what happened with other travellers who expressed different?). Ate in Dirty French twice - lovely food, amazing atmosphere (only tip would be to expand the options that do not include meat and fish as I do not eat either and twice was enough only due to my limited options). 
We stayed in a loft king with a terrace - sooooooo comfy bed, great to have a terrace and a seating area with table inside, inventive mini bar ;) and completely adequate shower room and wardrobe space. No issues whatsoever with the lifts and the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, delicious - the granola and fruit enabled us to walk for 31 kms on day 1 alone. Walked what felt like the entire city from this location, didn't venture in to the Katz deli but would next time. Could not recommend highly enough.

title: Très bon hôtel dans le Lower East Side
text: Un séjour impeccable. Hôtel design du Lower East Side, tout près de quelques adresses agréables comme Russ and Daugthers (pour ses bagels et poissons) ou le Musée du Lower East Side (passionnant pour comprendre l'histoire des migrations dans ce quartier en cours de gentrification mais encore proche de ce que fut Manhattan). Nous avions une chambre Skybox au 15ème étage, certes exiguë (problématique lorsque l'on a de gros bagages) mais avec une vue magnifique sur Washington Bridge. Très bon et copieux petit-déjeuner compris (contrairement à ce que nous avons pu lire dans d'autres avis). Wifi gratuit et qui fonctionne. Service parfois un peu dilettante mais qui s'améliore si l'on insiste un peu.

title: Delightful Lower Eastside Hotel
text:
Charming. arty and airy with a European ambience.  Conveniently located near night life and off Broadway theatre.  This is a delightful weekend get away hotel for a couple.

The only reason for giving it 4 stars is because the service is gastly:  slow and rude in the bar and restaurant.  

While the service was poor, it was reasonably priced for NYC and we love the location. The best restaurant nearby is right across the street, Taverna Di Bacca.  The Sicilian dinner is worth the trip here alone and the owners made the meal!!
