title: Couldn't ask for more from a LES hotel, good free breakfast!
text:
Friendly, attentive staff in a beautifully designed hotel in the heart of NYC. Loved it!

Location: This was our first time staying in the Lower East Side and I don't think we'll ever go back to Midtown or Upper Manhattan. It's just so convenient if you're visiting NYC for the best restaurants, cocktail bars and shopping—even trips out to Brooklyn were easy. If you're sensitive to noise, you will probably notice street noise no matter what time of day, so bring earplugs or ask for a room on the other side of the building. It is LES so it's not quiet, like ever. If you want a peaceful stay, I would consider a different neighbourhood like the Upper West Side or get a room on a high floor in one of those huge hotels Midtown.

Breakfast: Included in our stay was breakfast as Dirty French, the popular and hard-to-book restaurant in the lobby. Though guests are restricted to a few items, it is still an exceptional value-add to your stay. There is decent coffee, fresh squeezed OJ and good quality carbs/fruit to get your day started. Easily worth $10-15/pp per day.

Room: We were pleased to be upgraded to a King Studio which had a great amount of space by NYC standards. Very comfortable for two of us. My one complaint is that the air conditioner is loud and can start abruptly in the middle of the night. I also noticed that it drains through the same plumbing system in the shower and the dripping woke me up in the night. That was quickly resolved by tightening the faucet.

Overall: We would definitely return for our next visit to NYC if we find reasonable rates. It's still a relatively new hotel so I suspect the prices will go up once people catch on. I just hope they keep up the breakfast perk and friendly service.

title: Design-centric hotel with great view, big bathroom and friendly staff
text:
There are so many things I liked about this hotel! 

It's well-designed - contemporary, not overly trendy and with colors in earth tones, which is in tune with the LES location - hip and happening, with a downtown edge (also close to Nolita, SoHo and Meatpacking District - all the places I had planned to go). The lobby and entryway are spacious. 

The room is stylish and functional. I stayed at a "studio" - its standard room, and was pleasantly surprised by the big bathroom and a deep tub. The floor tiles and vanity mirror in the bathroom are beautiful. 

The front door and concierge staff was very helpful. Sarah at the concierge checked me in and she gave me the perfect room when I asked for a higher floor, with a nice city view. You can also go up to the rooftop to get a really good view, thankfully there aren't many skyscrapers in LES to block the view. 

The food at the hotel restaurant, Dirty French, is excellent! I had breakfast and dinner there. There are floor windows on the street-side of the restaurant and they're open when it's cool and breezy outside, which is simply delightful. 

Last but not least, WiFi is free and was extremely reliable during my stay.

title: 4 night great stay
text: Concierge was delightful. (Mark) he was a great help.  Desk staff were ok.  Wanted to take over $1000 on our debit card on arrival but told them that wasn't going to happen so amazingly they said it would only be $50 per day.  Our room was lovely didn't have a great view but in all honestly we were only in room first thing in morning and late at night but the bathroom was outstanding. Biggest shower ever. (Room 706).  We had breakfast included and the staff in Dirty French were lovely. Breakfast was healthy which was a lovely change.  The hotel gets noisy at night but we expected that but we didn't hear anything in our room.  We had brunch on our last day and it was outstanding.  We stayed in Lower East Side because our daughter lives there and so happy that we did rather than stay up in mid-town or upper.  You see real NY.  Would stay again if opportunity arose.

title: Great hotel, great downtown location
text:
We spent a weekend at the Ludlow after reading good reviews on TripAdvisor and also recently in the New York Times.
The downtown location is great, in the Lower East Side, close to SoHo and the East Village , with many restaurants and shops within easy walking distance, and with subway stops nearby.
Our upper-floor king room was spacious with large windows and great city views. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was fairly spacious with a large rain shower. There was good (free) WiFi.  The air conditioning was loud and seemed to cycle between "High" and "Off," and the sound woke us up a couple times during the night.
The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was not ready by 3:00 check-in time, so they gave us a voucher for a drink at the bar, a nice compensation. Of note, there is no valet parking, but it is not a problem since there are garages a few steps away.
Breakfast, as noted in other reviews, is included with the room charge, served in the hot-ticket restaurant "Dirty French." There are three choices (plus coffee), but you can have all three if you want.
The Ludlow is a great hotel with a hipster vibe for a downtown New York stay. It has comfortable rooms and amenities such as breakfast and WiFi included that make it stand out from the crowd and add to the value quotient of its moderate rates. We would be happy to return.

title: fun funky hotel
text:
Very unusual rooms.
Especially nice if you have a high level room with a balcony.  Rooms are small but well designed to use all space well.
Nice, happy employees make it all good.
Restaurant is good but evolving -- especially nice in the garden area reserved for hotel guests.

title: Small rooms, but everything else is great!
text:
Typically, I try to stay out of the touristy areas when I go to NYC.  Saw this hotel online and it looked pretty cool, so I decided to book it even though all the reviews I read said the rooms are small.  Booked a queen room with a terrace, which turned out to be a great choice since the weather was so nice while we were there.  Rooms are small, but definitely not the smallest I ever stayed in while in NYC.  The bedroom was large enough for a queen size bed (very comfortable), two small chairs, and a side table and two small petrified wood-looking night stands.  Lighting is very cleverly mounted to the walls or pendants on the ceiling so it doesn't take up any more space on the floors or tables.  Not of ton of shelf or closet space. Bathroom was small, but had a good sized standing shower with good water pressure.  Rooms are pretty quiet and the door and windows to the terrace were double paned so you couldn't hear any street noise at all (we were on the 7th floor).  The terrace was the highlight, though - literally about as big as the bedroom with two low lounge chairs and dining room sized table with two chairs.  Great views and just an awesome place to hangout and have some wine (get some from September Wines down the block!).  I even took a nap on the terrace one afternoon.  

Some other great things:
- 20th floor is another great place to hang out - there is a fitness room up there, and a lovely area with lounge chairs with great views
- Dirty French, the restaurant in the hotel, has great breakfast (that was included in our rate) and solid cocktails
- Wi-fi is fast, which is great since it's free
- Location is great - so close to many awesome places to eat (Katz's, Russ & Daughters, Mission Cantina, Beauty & Essex, etc.) and very close to a pretty convenient subway line
- Super nice staff

Overall, I highly recommend especially if you don't mind smaller than average rooms.

title: Incredible Service!!!
text: I have never met such a more attentive, friendly and laid back front desk staff as the one at The Ludlow. My wife and I were treated like VIPs all three days we were there. Thanks to Luca and the rest of the gang for making our stay so memorable. Will definitely return.

title: Trendy
text: This Hotel is amazing, located in the LES! The staff here bend over backwards for you. The Garden is Beautiful, The Dirty French is amazing and the rooms gorgeous. There is a fitness center and roof acess, this place can't be beat.

title: Skybox Loft, plus Dirty French! Say no more!
text:
A really great boutique hotel with a number of truly unique things going for it:
1. The neighborhood - one of NYC's most diverse, interesting and fun
2. Dirty French - one of NYC's best restaurants, and hotel guests get priority (otherwise you need to reserve weeks in advance). I got a reservation for the very night I checked in!
3. The rooms - at least mine. I chose the "Skybox Loft" and it could not have been better-named. A little gem of a room with a living area surrounded on three sides by windows, with views east, south and west. Utterly without compare in my experience in NYC. Perfectly decorated, with every detail thought-out. The curtains alone are with the room price!  And my bathroom is one of the very few I've had in NYC with a view as well!! The shower had a huge window facing south, and it's possible to shower with a view while not getting arrested because the curtains can be arrange just so...!!

Do not hesitate to stay here!

title: BOOK IT NOW NO HESITATION
text:
I normally do an extensive research prior to hotel reservations and I am very glad I found this gem and went ahead with the booking! Location is adequate, complimentary breakfast works just fine, the parfait was yummm! The staff were very cool and helpful. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel as everything worked, although a bit of problem with the AC. 
OH the bed was super comfy, soft pillows, I could go on... Definitely staying here again and the rooms were not as small as some reviews made it seem. A lot bigger when comparing to hotels in Paris!

Thank you Ludlow and Management, I will be back.

title: Great location; TINY rooms
text: Loved the feel of the hotel; it's lobby space and attached restaurant is great in an awesome neighborhood (Katz is right around the corner!). However, the room was absolutely tiny. I have stayed a many boutique hotels in NY around SoHo and this was by far the smallest room I've stayed at. Bed was comfortable, however. Stay for the location and if you don't plan on being in the room that much, then a good choice.

title: Charming Hotel with lots of night life around!
text:
I decided to book a stay at the Ludlow because I knew I was going to be partying in the LES and East Village are because of a bachelorette party.

The hotel is located right off of Houston street and a stone's throw away from the iconic Katz's Deli. When you enter the hotel, you'll get the feeling that you're stepping into another era.  It's kind of dark, with leather couches and chairs in shades of brown. Behind the check-in desk you'll see shelving with "keys" for each room. Keys are actually magnetic key fobs that will let you open the door to your room.

I didn't want to spend too much money, and knew that I just needed a bed to sleep in, so I got a Studio Full room...their smallest room. I would say that this room is good for one person.  I had one bag, which fit in the closet just fine, but if I had had suitcases the room would have felt even smaller.  AND if I had been traveling with someone, it would have been way too tight.  The decor of the room was charming, similar to what you would find in someone's guest room...a guest room of someone who has expensive and eclectic tastes with an interior designer's eye. The star of the room is the bathroom, which is bright white with old fashioned fixtures and tiled floors.  

Just a quick note on service and amenities...bathrobe and slippers are provided.  There is a mini-bar, safe, free wifi in the room.  I forgot a shower cap and the front desk provided me with one.  I also let them know that a light in my room wasn't working. An engineer came up, changed the bulb and got it working probably about 10 minutes after my request.  I thought that response time was pretty good.  I was annoyed that the housekeeper knocked on my door the morning of my check out.  I'm pretty sure the housekeeping staff gets a list of who's checking out, so that they know the rooms they have to clean.  I don't think it's appropriate to knock on the doors of those guests due to leave, 2+ hours before check out time.  I was asleep when she knocked and could have stayed that way for a few more minutes.  Also, once I finally was up and leaving my room for breakfast around 10:45, I saw the housekeeper in the hall.  I had put the "do not disturb/ no" sign on my door.  She looked at my door and gave an exasperated sigh...I guess she was bothered that she couldn't get in to my room and clean it. I did have breakfast in the restaurant, Dirty French.  The top portion of the breakfast menu is complimentary for hotel guests, as is coffee, tea or juice. I don't think this was mentioned anywhere when I booked the room, but I was told about it by the check-in desk and once again in the restaurant.

Anyway, I think it was a really pleasant stay and I would return.

title: perfect!
text: We had 2 wonderful nights at this perfect hotel and would always come back - Thank you Sarah for being patient with us and making that stay unforgetable! The entire staff is nice and friendly, the included breakfast a nice treat and I loved the decor of the rooms!

title: I will definitely stay here again!
text: Enjoyed a wonderful night in the beautiful and cool Ludlow in NYC. The room was gorgeous - average views but absolutely stunning and lovely furnishings, great bathroom (a big test for me), comfy bed, lovely linens, and a fab restaurant and bar downstairs. Service was just right - a little bit of attitude on arrival (just the right amount - I was in NYC, so it felt ok ;) ) but above and beyond service the next day in dealing with transport arrangements, attractions, luggage storage and more. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing!
text:
Ludlow is the best hotel I have ever stayed at! Everything from the rooms to service is top-notch! 

My room was serviced everyday and housekeeping did a fabulous job of making sure all my amenities were fully stocked and my bed made. I loved the decor of the hotel, especially the little yellow pillows on my bed. 

I never experienced such professional front office assistance, and I'm very picky about my requests. Each time I called down my calls were answered after the 2-3 ring and the person on the other side of the line were always super nice and helpful. Check in and check out was a breeze! 

I read couple of the reviews about loud AC but I personally didn't experience any problems. Yes, of course I could hear it, but I also hear my own air conditioner at home. 

Thank you so much Ludlow Team for a perfect stay! I will definitely come back!

title: Cool and recommended
text: In a city where it's very hard to find average priced hotels, the Ludlow does the trick. The location is not ideal if you're looking to do the touristy things but the subway isn't too far away. The rooms are as expected, clean and cool. The staff are very friendly, the breakfast is great and the gym has a fabulous view overlooking New York.

title: As New York as it gets. The cool, the crazy, is all here to be experienced.
text:
This neighborhood is as New York as it gets! trendy, cool and vibrant. The cool, the crazy, is all here to be experienced.

The room had one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on, my wife is actually making me buy a similar bed... More than the comfortable bed, you can see that there was thought put into the decoration, you can see that there is an artistic-look to it that matches the feel of the rest of the hotel. Really good views as well, I would recommend requesting high floors. This is my wife's and I second stay and she can't wait to go back.

Roof: several lounges where you can hangout and enjoy the view. HINT -  take a bottle of wine.

As far as the service, which is usually paramount to everything else. Great service, the staff are really helpful and friendly from the housekeepers to the bellman everyone seemed really friendly.

Dirty French Restaurant and Bar - Really cool place the drinks are good and the food was excellent, and the vibe just syncs in with the hotel's. I liked that you can request to eat at the courtyard.

If you want to experience the real New York... this is the place - Ludlow Hotel @ Lower Eastside.

title: Lovely place on the LES
text:
I spent two nights at the Ludlow with a friend whose "important" birthday we were celebrating.  We had a double room-- actually two rooms, each with a queen bed, connected by a super bathroom with giant tub/shower with brass fittings.  Everything was immaculate; the minibar is very imaginative!

We were a little afraid of noise, either from the corridor or the street (4th floor), but it was not a problem.  The service, both housekeeping and front desk, was very nice.

The location was perfect; easy to get uptown, plenty of transit options.

We also loved the complimentary breakfast (we had the patisserie), which we ate far too much of.  Can't wait to come back.

title: Disappointing - avoid
text:
Sad to say that after looking forward to our visit to this hotel for months we are pleased to be checking out tomorrow and would never stay here again. 

The positives. 

- Good location, previously stayed at the Smyth in TriBeCa (fab service) so this made a change and it was nice to explore the LES, Nolita and SoHo etc. 

- Breakfast was nice if somewhat limited. We enjoyed the complimentary parfait and fruit each morning given that breakfast often isn't included in NY. 

- The maintenance team are very helpful - we unfortunately became well acquainted with them throughout our stay

Now the negatives  

The rooms are small but that is a given with NYC although they are well laid out and nicely decorated. 

Front desk and management staff need to learn some customer service skills. 

The basic utilities are poor and need immediate attention. The water in both the sink and bath are very slow draining to he point where a pool forms and the water takes ages to drain away. They were also dirty and never looked as though they had been cleaned properly. 

Our a/c never worked properly - our room stayed a relatively constant 79 degrees although it did creep to 81 degrees on several occasions. Through this we became well acquainted with the maintenance team and their efforts to fix the problem. On one occasion the room was cool for two hours then heated up again making it pretty unbearable to sleep in. Each time we reported the problem to the front desk and were met with apathy at best. At no point did anyone follow up on the engineer's many visits. A call or email would have been expected at a minimum given that we had to call the engineer for three nights of our six night stay. The other three nights we didn't bother as it was clear that the issue was not being resolved. I also found that going to the frontdesk got a quicker response than calling them which was an even more fruitless experience. 

It is our final night and another visit from maintenance has left us with a very noisy portable a/c machine in the corner of our room - really not ideal as we now have the noise of that and the street. 

We enquired about moving at 10:30 this evening having waited since 9pm for the a/c to be looked at so we could actually get some sleep on our final night and this was met with hesitation and indifference. We were eventually and somewhat grudgingly told we could move rooms if we packed all of our things. I couldn't see the point of this as I am sure no one else would be prepared to stay in the room we are stuck in especially between now and tomorrow when we leave. 

To sum it up, unfortunately disappointing on many levels. I would urge people to avoid, wishing we had sought alternative accommodation on night one. Will also be feeding back to Mr and Mrs Smith who we booked through - really not what I would expect from one of their hotels.

title: Super-cool Lower East Side Hip Hotel
text:
The Ludlow is located in the hip, youthful and trendy Lower East Side - the best part of NYC if you ask me. The vibe is super-cool and Ludlow Street itself is filled with countless bars, boutiques, restaurants and is very lively at night. If that sounds like your kind of place, then the Ludlow is likely to be your kind of hotel. 

I think some reviews here are misleading partially because the Ludlow might not have been what the visitors were looking for in the first place. However, the hotel's website is a true reflection of the aesthetic of the hotel, and if you don't like it from the website you're not likely to like it in person. We LOVED it. 

The style of the rooms, the lobby, the covered patio and the Dirty French restaurant were very much our cup of tea. The styling of the room we stayed in (a Skybox Loft - it's worth the extra if you can afford it) was gorgeous - exquisite throws, sofas, chairs and rugs. The views of Manhattan were astounding and the hotel gets serious brownie points from me for enabling guests to open the windows in their rooms. There have been some complaints here about the air con and the wifi in the rooms. Re: the air con, we never slept with it on at night anyway as the room had stayed cool during the day so it wasn't needed and re: the wifi issues, we had perfect access throughout our stay so maybe some teething problems have been fixed. 

It's both unusual and fantastic to have breakfast included in the room rate and was definitely a selling point for me when we booked. Dirty French is a gorgeous place to eat breakfast (tiled floor, banquette seating, fluorescent pink cockerel statues (!!)) and start your day and the waiting staff were consistently brilliant - sweet, attentive and very hard working. Some reviewers have seemed disappointed by the range of items on offer but they were perfect for our tastes: a choice from granola, delicious pastries, fresh fruit, orange/grapefruit juice and tea or coffee. If you do want to eat eggs/pancakes etc these can be purchased at a supplementary cost. Seems fair enough to me. 

I have a top tip for future travellers, though. We found out on our last day that there was a roof terrace on the 20th floor! Unfortunately, no-one had told us about this when we checked in which was a shame as the views were great and the place was completely empty despite there being several sun loungers. There's no bar up there but we would've hung out there more had we known about it. 

Above all, though, the Ludlow is the perfect place from which to explore the LES, Greenwich, the West Village and (crucially for us) it is super-near the Williamsburg Bridge which means you can walk into Brooklyn within forty minutes or take the F train and be there in ten. I think if you're exploring Manhattan as a family and want to see all the 'sights' then this is not the place for you, but if you're on a city break and want to pretend you actually live in NYC then it's ideal. 

So be prepared for the hotel actually to be like the hotel it appears to be and you'll be happy. But if you're looking for a stuffier / more formal vibe, you're not going to get it at the Ludlow because that doesn't seem to be what it's trying to be about. 

PS - if you're still reading this long review, well done... but I have to write about the lift situation as so many people have written about it in their reviews. You DO have to wait for the lifts in this hotel. That is an indisputable fact, BUT the people you meet in that lift make it worth the wait! We waited with anticipation to see who would appear in the lift next: once again, if waiting for lifts annoys you then don't book into this hotel, but you'll miss out on meeting the most amazing range of diverse people.

title: Great relaxed tone
text: My stay here was an Xtra cool experience on a very hot day with a warm welcoming atmosphere. This hotel near cafes, clubs, all types of ethnic NY eateries including Katzs delicatessen. Hotel has an acclaimed restaurant also

title: A wonderful stacation!
text: My husband and my friends surprised me with a stay at the Ludlow Hotel for my birthday. What a lovely surprise that was! Lower Eastside is a gem that I must discover more. The front desk associates were very knowledgeable. I recommend stopping by if you are not familiar with the LES. The staff is very cool and hip. They go so well with the LES vibe!!  We had a king room with a terrace. Oh how I wish I had that terrace at my place. We dined there. Ordered room service from Dirty French. Delicious. My friends were quite pleased with the food. Room was clean and some unique decorations. I will be back for sure. Lower Eastside + Ludlow Hotel+ Dirty French = a wonderful staycation!!!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Welcoming crew, beautifuly designed rooms (loved the bathroom!!), well located and affordable rates. Although not ideally located vis-à-vis my workplace - Midtown- I'll definitely go back to the Ludlow on my next trip to NYC!

title: All aesthetics, zero substance.
text: Cool neighbourhood and cool interiors but that is really all I the positives I can squeeze out of this hyperventilated establishment. The "buffet" breakfast was a joke. I mean, after staying in one of their cupboard sized rooms, battling with a "free wi-fi connection" (only available in the lobby) surely you'd be gantin for more than a few crumbs of bagel with a plastic knife and a cup of orange juice.

title: Silly management, Nice hotel
text: You  will enjoy the fact that the hotel is clean and new and the bathtubs with the windows are wonderful especially after a long day of walking. To bad that the staff is silly and ineffectual. There is no security in this hotel, so you must be vigilant about your well being and your belongings. The bellmen dropped our luggage in the room and left, no showing us about the thermostat or setting up our bags on luggage racks which you must ask for since they are not in the room. Just wanted his tip and walked out. It is a place where you are on your own in terms of any kind of service. Their restaurant, Dirty French, lives up to it's name. All the dishes we had put in front of us were filthy and the service is brutally slow and rude. Go across the street if you want great food and a lovely place to eat. Again, if there was any kind of service, security and a clean and gracious place to eat this would be an outstanding hotel. Right now, it's a great location with a good room.

title: Cool hotel,great location
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights.
The hotel was perfectly located for us.
Heaps of cool resturants and bars right on the door step.
Subway a 5 min walk.
Staff very friendly, and helpful.
It was a bit loud on street noise and th AC took some getting used to.
To be picky - lifts were super slow and breakfast wasn't very good.
Small selection included in room rate (3options )

title: Che delusione
text:
So che NYC è una megalopoli ed è ovvio che l'offerta ma anche le fregature sono innumerevoli.
Abbiamo scelto questo hotel per la posizione più comoda rispetto alle più blasonate zone centrali di Manhattan 
Ebbene la via dell'hotel è molto rumorosa e la puzza che sale dalla strada non è piacevole.

Le camere sono a dire poco minuscole ed anche il servizio lascia desiderare: su 4 notti di soggiorno per due volte non ci hanno portato gli asciugamani per la doccia 

L'aria condizionata è impossibile da tenere accesa di notte: non per il freddo eccessivo ma per il rumore, sembra di avere un vecchio pinguino piuttosto che un impianto centralizzato

se avrete la fortuna di avere le camere ai piani più alti , preparatevi ad attendere l'ascensore per molti minuti. Al mattino infatti le inservienti usano i due piccoli ascensori come montacarichi 

Loro ovviamente non hanno alcuna colpa, ma questo si riflette nell'attenzione verso gli ospiti.

Se volete andarci, fate pure. Per quanto mi riguarda quando mi capiterà di tornare aNYC la scelta sarà differente

title: My first negative Trip advisor reveiew
text:
The Ludlow New York was a hotel I had previously read about , I heard only good things . Great location , décor etc . Having previously eat at the restaurant and enjoyed it so much I figured this would be an ideal location for my  mid yearly family holiday to New York . This was not the case . 

As I frequent New York at least 2 to 3 times a year from Scotland I have stayed in my fair share of hotels , from the palace to the Hudson but never have I ever experienced service as terrible as the Ludlow New York . 

I would bore you with all the things that had went wrong with my stay :

couldn't find my luggage initially 
Cigarette buds on terrace 
lack of Roll down bed
Light switched broken 
Bathroom door Broken 
Un clean room

I could go on and on . 
However had these problems been met with friendly and apologetic staff I would not have minded , the service and reception I got when entering the hotel was disgraceful. I had no report with the receptionist I was given no eye contact , no small talk I felt as though I was not  "cool " enough to be spoken to . 
This trickled down to the door staff who where more busy chatting to others and smoking cigarettes  than helping me and my daughters open a door with a arm full of bags , This happened every single time I entered or existed the building.

I did speak to the assistant manager James about this problem , he said he would deal with it , however his idea of dealing with it was unloading a cheap bottle of wine and poorly written sorry letter but implemented no changes as the service was exactly the same as before, my lights in my bedroom hadn't even been fixed and there was still match sticks lying on the terrace two days later .

 My husband went to the desk on the 4th of July , he was given no smile , no happy independence day nothing and when he asked for an extra key she simply said "name" without even looking up at him .
 My husband said "would that be what is your name please, although I guess that is a choice " 
She answered blanked face " yes it is a choice " 
That was the straw that broke the camels back , so with that we decided to check out.

This in my eyes is unacceptable especially with the price I was paying for 2 rooms, one with a terrace . 

We checked out 4 days early as we felt uncomfortable staying in the hotel any longer and we weren't even asked why .I feel as though they didn't even care .

I will never be returning to the Ludlow again and instead will be staying the hotel round the corner SIXTY LES where the staff where super friendly and who managed to fix the holiday that the Ludlow where ruining .

title: Everything was done right!!!
text:
This hotel had everything...The room was beautiful anything you could have possible needed was there.The hotel was stylish, comfortable a great restaurant and a beautiful bar!!! 
The hotel is in a great location always things going on!
I have to say though the thing that made everything even better was the staff..
They were all so friendly and helpful!!!

title: Groupies' Trip
text: Trip to NYC to see a band and stayed at The Ludlow.  I was a little leery to stay in that location, but we wanted to be within walking distance to where the band was playing so went against advice to stay in midtown.  So glad we did because there was such a laid back atmosphere every where. We got in before our room was ready but the wait time was not too long.  The staff was very friendly and our room was very nicely decorated.  It was very clean and the shower was heavenly and the bed super comfy!! Although we did not indulge in the box of treats, we were pleasantly surprised by the selection of snacks, chocolates, wines, liquors and champagne.  The view from our balcony - yes, you could access - was pretty nice.  The lobby, dining area were very chic but my favorite was the glassed-in garden area. Every staff person we saw was very warm and friendly and inquired about any needs or concerns.  These were the same types of interactions I saw with any other guest while we were there.  I will certainly go back.

title: Sexy in the summer
text:
I loved this hotel. It has a real 'noir' feeling to it - dark lobby with an old-fashioned front desk. My Queen loft was fine - on the small side but fine for one person. Bathroom was great - also old-fashioned but luxurious and with all the modernity you could wish for.
The hotel is located in the Lower East side - a funky and increasingly gentrified area of the city that has few sky scrapers. Lots of bar and restaurants around, including some really good ones with superstar chef owners (Mission Cantina is literally round the corner - and very good). The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown and SoHo and NoLita. Good shopping too - not chains but independent small stores with cutting edge designer clothes.
I would stay here again in a heart beat - but it's a little off the path if you have business in midtown or beyond.

title: Business Trip
text:
Usually in New York, we opt to stay at the Smyth TriBeCa due to their impeccable service, but thought we'd try something else this time based on positive reviews. 

On the positive side of things, the hotel is beautiful and conveniently located, the rooms spacious and well appointed.

However, I wanted to point out a few areas that need work. When we arrived, the front desk staff were slouched at the desk, playing on their phones. Checking us in seemed to be a burden. The front door staff opened the door for us only sporadically. The service in the bar/lounge was slow and sullen for the most part, with one exception being a lovely gentleman who helped us pick a great wine. Sadly he left for the day and was replaced by a young woman who seemed uninterested in taking orders or issuing a bill. 

At no time during our stay did anyone greet us as we entered, or even smile at us, wish us a good day etc. Having become accustomed to the amazing service and friendliness of the Smyth, this was a bit of a shock to our system. We hope the hotel works to ensure the quality of service eventually matches the quality of the physical environment.

title: Settimana a New York
text: Con un'amica ho trascorso la settimana di Pasqua a New York alloggiando al Ludlow e ci siamo trovate molto bene. Va segnalata la massima disponibilità del personale che ci hanno sempre aiutato, soprattutto in occasione di un malore che ha richiesto un intervento medico. Sono stati disponibilissimi e ci hanno aiutato tanto!!!

title: Better than expected
text:
My fiancee and I visited in June and loved it.  The location was fantastic,  right in the middle of soho close to China Town with lots of hip, trendy restaurants and bars around.

The room itself was stunning.  The bathroom had an industrial glamour look and the bed was unbelievably comfy.  There has been lots of reviews where space has been an issue, but from what I have researched - most rooms in NYC are like this unless you are prepared to pay over the odds.  We were there only to sleep as we were busy site seeing, so for what we wanted it for the room size was fine.  Plenty of room under the bed for cases and a wardrobe for clothes.

WIFI came free.  Sounds bizarre to mention it, but there were a few hotels I researched which didn't include this..

Biggest let down was the breakfast... considering it is the US I would have expected a much better selection than a pastry or some yogurt and fruit.  Thankfully, the fact you are in soho there is plenty to choose from.  So I would suggest you head out to eat.

Staff were very friendly and accommodating to all your needs.  I know it comes as standard but even the small details like offering an umbrella when it was torrential rain made a difference.

I would 100% come back here again if I came to NYC.  It made the trip staying in soho.  A lot more to see than your standard 5th Avenue.

title: Hip Hotel with excellent staff
text: The Ludlow from the street view does not do it justice -- interior is trendy and hip and the  room we stayed in (suite) was lovely - with a large fantastic shower, great bed(and bedding!) with a balcony view of the eclectic neighborhood.  More importantly, the staff was excellent - generous with their attention and very helpful with information for travelers.  I loved the front desk staff!   High volume of international guests from around the world make for interesting and fun conversations in the hip lounge area.  We went on July 4th weekend - and found it a great place to celebrate! Although I went with just my husband, as a mother of seven - my kids would have loved this place!

title: Cool place to stay in Lower East Side
text: Lovely smaller boutique style hotel, with cool atmosphere in lobby and lounge areas. The room was quite nice and comfortable, with no complaints or issues. Not a lot of space, ok for 1 person but could be a little cramped for a couple. Quiet and good bed so a comfortable sleep. Gymnasium on the top floor was ok but could benefit from some additional kit. Overall would recommend and return again.

title: Buen ambiente...
text: Hotel muy bonito, con buena hubicación, una zona con muchos retaurantes y bares. Enfrente de Katz,s famoso por los sándwiches de pastrami. Muy buen restaurante muy concurrido todas las noches con buen ambiente. Solo una pega, habitación pequeña pero aún así recomendable.

title: Hip hotel in a fantastic location
text:
My Girlfriend and I stayed for four nights , and we both loved our stay. Although we spent most of our time out exploring, the hotel definitely helped make the trip.

The furnishings are to a very high standard and our room had an excellent partial view of the city. 

Breakfast was included in our rate and was served in the Dirty French restaurant. Granola and yoghourt, pastries and fresh fruit with tea coffee and juice were the options, which we couldn't fault.

The location is brilliant, a short 5 minute stroll from the subway , and then around 15 minutes on the train if your heading towards Times Square. We loved the fact it was away from the touristy areas, the bars and restraints around the hotel were all fantastic.

The room we first were shown was too small even by new york standards, but the helpful staff changed us no problem!

In short, stay! Your won't be disappointed.....Just make sure you visit the top floor gym, and venture outside to the balcony the views of the city are unreal.

title: Elegant hotel in a good location
text:
We stayed here for a couple of nights at the end of June. The whole hotel is very elegantly decorated with lovely lounge and bar areas. Our room was close to the lift but not too noisy.. the lift however was a bone of contention. There are no service elevators so we were constantly waiting for the lift to arrive and when it did there was a cleaner with laundry trolley so you had to squeeze in (if you could). The staff were a little standoffish and didn't seem too worried about customer service. We waited ages for drinks to arrive after ordering at the bar with no apology.
The room was small (we are in New York so you have to expect that) however the bathroom was large (so we had suitcase in there). It also had a great bath, large enough for 2, next to a window with a view of the city. Bonus.

title: Design hotel dans East Village
text:
Bel hôtel design fréqunté par les hipsters situé dans un quartier pas trop posh idéal pour ses bars et restaurants.
Belle chambre dotée de parquet, lit en bois massif, beaux tapis en soie et  lampes marocaines.
Le restaurant le Dirty French m’a moins convaincu. La nourriture était certes correcte mais le service quelque peu négligé.

title: Clean and cool.
text: I love this hotel, it was clean and pretty . The only negative thing I could say is that I booked it months ahead directly through them and I requested if at all possible to have a decent view. My view was to the stackable parking of the hotel . Other than that it's a very hip hotel and in a very cool neighborhood .

title: Smart friendly hotel, great neighbourhood
text:
We stayed at The Ludlow for 4 nights at the end of May and really enjoyed our stay. We had not stayed in the lower East Village before and would definitely go back. 

The hotel is a good mix of smart and trendy. The rooms are small, we had a loft Queen, not the smallest of rooms on offer, but still very small, however, everything we needed was there and very nicely styled, comfy beds, wall mounted TV, lovely bathroom with good toiletries. Beware, the air conditioning in some rooms is very noisy, we actually moved from our first room because of this. However, the hotel were very accommodation and moved us to another room without fuss. 

The hotel has a great lounge bar and restaurant, both are very popular with trendy locals as well as hotel guest in the weekend evenings.  The food is very good in the restaurant and the drinks very tasty in the bar.  The lounge bar is a great place to sit and relax, night or day. 

The Ludlow is in a great location with many bars and restaurants on the same street all at reasonable prices.  The short subway or a taxi ride will take you to all other areas of Manhattan.

We had a great stay at The Ludlow and would recommend it.

title: Awesomeness!
text:
Stayed here when it was just opening and loved it!

It is unique and very design-forward in every detail. Rooms are small, as is expected in New York, but they use the space well. The location is fine, close to the subway. The restaurant was not yet open so I can't say how it was but do look forward to coming back to stay so I'll review it then.

Loved the bathroom, the bed was extremely comfortable and as has been mentioned, absolutely loved the design from lobby to room.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service!
text: I just stayed here for the 4th of July weekend, I loved the hotel, the decor is really cool, the staff is friendly. The rooms are a good size and the bathroom is awesome! A block from the hotel you have Russ & Daughters where you will have the best salmon beagles ever, and I am not kidding!!! Momofuku noodle bar is a 5 min walk from the hotel, 15 min walk you are in Soho. Great location, 100% recommended.

title: Great location
text: We enjoyed staying at The Ludlow as the location was pretty great. The hotel is close to many great clubs, restaurants and shops and East Village is a really hip area. The staff were really friendly and the breakfast is served at the Dirty French restaurant below. The food is delicious but the service needs work. The wifi connection (free) is slow and in many places I had no working wifi. Our bathroom door kept jamming but they very quickly sent someone up to fix it. I would stay again!

title: Fantastic hotel and service!
text:
We loved loved loved The Ludlow:
- fantastic reception staff who came to the rescue of the poor jetlagged tourists with all their bags
- small rooms indeed but with style and bed so comfortable that we dream to have the same ones at home (what is the brand of these pillows ???)
- best pastries ever for breakfast (almond croissants ....mmmmm) and good coffee for NYC. Quick, friendly & efficient service 
- great bar and patio and friendly staff who managed to get us food 5 minutes before the kitchen closed (fabulous crostinis!!!!)

Could be better with lounge chairs on the terrasse, more shelves for clothes & toiletries and more elevators but it wouldn't prevent us to come back. We had a lovely lovely stay!

title: Nice hotel
text: Recently stayed at the Ludlow in June and found it a very nice hotel for the price.excellent staff.located in the lower east side away from a bit of the hustle and bustle but close to subway and Katzs deli!!best hot pastrami sandwich ever

title: disappointing to say the least
text: I have to say that I feel that the ludlow is a fairly good hotel. Stylish clean services needs to be up to British standard's with the services . I did feel the breakfast was slow I have to say they could have less staff if they worked together and communicated. The room was small no room for clothing in the what they call a closet ,just to small for a couple fro a weeks holiday. The bar was very expensive but was very well styled.  We did have a problem at the end of our holiday that is so disapointing for a 4 star hotel I have to say cast a shadow on the holiday. This is are 5th time in nyc we will be back but unfortunately  it will not be in this hotel. Positive the door men are the best thing about the ludlow .

title: Good value, fantastic location
text:
I booked this room back in January and got a great rate for a studio double.  Overall I was happy with our experience and I would stay here again for the right rate.

Pros
The location was excellent, the décor was lovely, the bed was very comfortable, beautiful bathroom (especially shower), nice robes/slippers and I loved that there was free WIFI and breakfast and a newspaper included.  

The breakfast parfait and grapefruit juice were delicious.

Good value for money.

Cons
I expected the room to be small and it was.  I can cope with a small room but the thing I found difficult was that there was literally nowhere to put your clothes.  There is a wardrobe for things that you hang up but only one small drawer and one small high shelf for the rest of your clothing.  We were staying for one week and found it difficult to store two people’s clothing.  

While the breakfast was great to have, I never really understood how many items we were entitled to.  They were a bit vague.  There are three options; parfait (beautiful, though better on some days than others), pastries (we don’t eat pastries) and fruit.  On the first day the girl told us to get all three between us to see what we liked.  From then on we ordered two parfaits and one fruit because we thought that was the three items we were allowed.  One day we were given a parfait each and a fruit each which was fantastic, while another day they brought our usual plus a basket of pastries…I’m still not sure what exactly the allowance is.  Also, the cups of coffee are tiny and I found it difficult to get a top up.  

I had a parcel delivered to the hotel.  When I went to collect it I was informed that nothing had arrived for me.  I was told that if my name had been on it and it had been signed for then there would be a record which there wasn’t.  I followed up on my side and got the name of the receptionist that signed for it.  They still couldn’t find my parcel but eventually found it later that day.

I’d read in other reviews about the slow lifts and I have to agree.  One morning, one of the two lifts was broken and it was extremely slow.  There doesn’t seem to be a service elevator so staff add to the elevator traffic.

Finally, I have a major phobia of dogs.  One morning when I got into the lift a dog came running in jumping about.  I hadn’t realised it was a pet friendly hotel and I was petrified.  In fairness, one of the doormen was there and apologised to me but surely dogs should be kept on a lead while in the hotel corridors etc.?

title: Poor experience
text:
Best service in this hotel is from the guys at the front door, they were really friendly and helpful. Reception staff tried hard to be cool but did not really succeed with that. The hotel has only 2 elevators which are used by both guests, housekeeping staff and workers, so you nalways have to wait, never knowing for how long. Room was average size, some would rate it small. A good deal of traffic noise even if the room was in the 13th floor, but not so that night sleep was disturbed. Water in the sink took a looong time to run down, it was obstructed and has obviously been this for a long time. A hairpin was lying on the bottom of the toilet. It was still lying there when we left.

Breakfast was disappointing. When we reserved the room, breakfast was included in room rate. However, when we sat down for breakfast we were told that this applied only for the top 3 items on the breakfast menu card. We ordered the top 3 items and an omelette each (not included, so you have to pay extra). Small fruit bowl, a small yoghurt bowl with granola and some pastries came immediately, and then the waiting began. After 20 minutes, still no omelette. Evententualy the waiter came and informed us that the omelettes will come "momentarily". Well, after8 or 9 minutes, still no omelettes. We then just raised and left the restaurant.

The bar has only french beers. They do have a really impressing selection of single malt whiskies, but 28 bucks for a standard Lagavulin 16 is massively overprized, especially when you get it measured by the milliliter, and it is served in a standard american tumbler glass, and you do not even get some water to dilute it with. Sorry, but if you try to appeal to whisky connaisseurs, you have to do better than that.

title: Fab hotel on the Lower East Side
text:
Fab hotel with a great location on the Lower East Side, down the street from Katz's deli and more importantly surrounded by a ton of great restaurants and bars.

The decor is very stylish and the rooms well appointed. They are small but very comfortable. We also thought the hotel good value for money.

Our only slight quibble was with the loud air con unit. Ironically our air con broke in the middle of the night in 30 degree heat - not anyone's fault and the hotel moved us to another room and gave us 50% off which was very fair.

We'd definitely choose the Ludlow again on a trip to NYC

title: Honeymoon City-Break
text:
I visited this hotel with my husband for a couple of nights to tag on to the end of our honeymoon. Beautifully decorated throughout - we stayed in a Queen Studio, which had generous space considering this is an NYC hotel room. The attached restaurant 'Dirty French' gets mixed reviews online and from guests. We only attended for the included breakfast and it was generous for a continental but service was slow as very busy. We would both recommend this hotel - excellent situation on the Lower East Side, trendy part of town and not too noisy overnight with incredibly comfortable and luxurious beds. Staff were very helpful/friendly and we arrived early for check-in and they were able to switch our room around to accommodate us. 

This was a truly lovely hotel to stay in - safe, trendy, comfortable and delicious cocktails too! It should also be noted that this hotel offers free wifi in the rooms, which actually seemed quite unusual when we were looking for hotels to stay in. If you book through Mr and Mrs Smith you get a free bottle of red wine on arrival too!

title: Awesome Boutique Hotel!!!
text: If you want a great hotel on the L.E.S., this is it! Rooms are great, staff is wonderful, Bar and Restaurant are fabulous.  The price is very good for what you get, too.  Would Highly recommend!  We had a room with outdoor terrace which was very nice for having breakfast or a glass of wine! Will return for sure!!!

title: Bravo ! Parfait
text:
Depuis votre pick up a l aeroport jusqu au premiers bagagistes et a la reception, tout fut parfait des l arrivee et encourageant !

Le personnel est jeune, looke mais choc, attentif.

Arrive en chambre, 18 eme etage, mon courier et colis deja installes, tres belles salle de bains, finitions en chambre parfaite. Peut manquerait il juste un service de couverture le soir pour mettre la cerise sur la gateau.

Le bar est vivant avec une equipes de barmen vraiement pro, un carte courte mais tres technique et bonne.

Le restaurant bonde midi et soir dans une formule francaise revisiter, bonne.

Que ce soit en mode business ou day off, ils pnt rempli toutes mes attentes !

Un remerciement special au public relation du bar et au housekeeping, very good job.

title: Loved our stay at the Ludlow
text:
Recently spent one week at the Ludlow with my 8yr old daughter and we had a ball.

Best bits:
Check-in quick, polite and friendly after a 24hr flight
Decor beautiful & stylish 
Downstairs bar wonderful (try one of their inventive cocktails - delicious after a long day pounding NYC's pavements)
Yummy simply continental breakfast
The bath in the skybox loft room -  An evening bath became our ritual.
The bed is so very very comfortable - we called it our fluffy white cloud! 
Happily stored our bags for 1week while we travelled elsewhere.

Not so great bits:
The lifts are a tad slow
air-con can be noisy but we were able to turn it off (which suited us fine)
Rooms are a little small but the skybox loft has a separate sitting/lounge area with fabulous views

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Very helpful and friendly staff. Check-in was swift. Room on the small side but space in Manhattan comes at a premium. Decent continental breakfast included (pastries, parfait, fruit) but the eggs Benedict is worth the upgrade. Didn't get a chance to try Dirty French for dinner, but the bar area is lovely and buzzing in the evening. 

Location wise this hotel is fantastic. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby on Ludlow Street, Bowery, Prince Street, 2nd Ave. Metro 2 minutes away. Broadway 10 minute walk. 

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel decisamente cool, il personale però non è all'altezza.
text:
l'albergo si trova in una zona piena di locali modaioli ed è molto comodo alla stazione della metro.
I due bar dell'hotel sono decisamente di fascino, spaziosi e ben arredati.
La stanza è piccola ma curata nei dettagli e decisamente silenziosa.
Il prezzo è elevato, di talché non si comprende la ragione per la quale sono stati posti limiti alla scelta dei piatti serviti per colazione.
Peraltro, nel menù non sono indicati i piatti compresi nella tariffa ed il personale o decisamente non spiega cosa si può ordinare ovvero lo spiega in modo del tutto laconico. Pare che nemmeno tra i camerieri vi sia chiarezza sul punto.
Il servizio durante la colazione è particolarmente lento e l'organizzazione lascia a desiderare.
Peccato un albergo così meriterebbe altra cura

title: Very chic hotel at a good price
text: The Ludlow is quite a new hotel and so the decor is fresh (and stylish).  Rooms are on the small side (as usual in NYC) but bathrooms are surprisingly spacious.  A good breakfast is included (pastries, yoghurt and granola parfait and/or fresh fruit plus coffee and juice) and the restaurant and bar are both good (and seem destinations for non-guests too).  The area is great - lots of restaurants and bars, and pretty central.  Only complaint would be that they need more lifts!

title: Very cool & chic NYC hotel!
text: Great place to stay while your in NYC. Location was perfect. Shopping, restaurants, etc. The rooms were comfortable & staff was welcoming!    Breakfast included.. Delicious !  Will stay again. I really loved the area!

title: Maybe trying too hard
text: Recommended by friends, but in reality it's aiming to be too trendy/hip for its own good. Very welcoming staff, and equally helpful. Room was small (think nowhere to place a pair of carry-on bags). Location - fine for a night, but not more. Good dining in the area, but you have to hunt for it. So a mixture of good and bad - one night stay + lunch, and $600 later....not sure it's worth it. Especially as the lunch was so so.

title: Gorgeous hotel
text:
My friend and I shared the queen size room and it was just perfect. Beautiful bedrooms and gorgeous bathrooms. 

I've read reviews regarding lack of space but this room was fine and had good views through large windows. 

All the staff were very friendly and helpful. There are also great views from the gym of the city. One minor point is the slowness of the lifts. You can be waiting ages. 

I'd definitely stay here again.

title: very nice stay
text:
the ludlow is a fairly new hotel in NY, well located more in the East near Nolita .The hotel has the typical modern look which you see a lot in NY : classical, vintage, warm, hipster.
Rooms are perfect as you have a balcony , so you can actually open the window... a big plus !
very friendly staff and great lobby to hang out.

title: Wonderful experience - can't wait to return!
text:
I travel to New York for business between 8-10 times a year and have stayed in hotels across Soho, the Lower East Side, Midtown and Williamsburg for the past 12 years. I'm a loyal creature of habit and stay at the same place most of the time, but was curious about the hotel after a lunch at Dirty French. So glad that I broke out of my rut and gave the hotel a try last week.

My time at the Ludlow Hotel was perfect. From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff was quick, efficient and incredibly kind. I'd received some bad news minutes before my arrival and was visibly shaken. A few minutes after getting into my room, the front desk sent a very thoughtful bottle of wine. A nice touch, especially for a staff with a busy, lively lobby/bar/restaurant area. This gesture set the tone for the next three days of my stay. Room service, housekeeping and the entire staff were friendly and excellent at their jobs. 

The room (upgraded to a loft king on the 14th floor) had beautiful views and was such a welcome place to return after work and city humidity. It was quite tastefully decorated, with the most comfortable bed EVER...and quiet. The wardrobe was spacious, bathroom had good counter space, nice shower and great lighting.

Bottom line--great staff, very tasteful and comfortable rooms, gorgeous views, fun restaurant and bar. Excited to return next month!

title: Incredible Experience in New York at The Ludlow Hotel
text:
The Ludlow Hotel:
- Incredible location, you really can't beat it
- this hotel is located in the heart of true New York, right next to the best restaurants and bars
- Nick, Luke & Scarleth (hotel managers) are willing to help you out with anything you need
- The actual hotel room is so beautiful and clean
- The bathroom is spectacular
- The restaurant in the hotel is actually stellar

I stayed over the weekend of June 12 - 14, I will be back

title: Fantastic hotel with large and unique room
text: We booked a couples overnight stay for my husband's birthday. The hotel atmosphere is chic, comfortable luxury. We loved having an "outdoor" drink in the grenhouse. we had originally booked a king room but were torn between the king loft and the sky box. The hotel rep at the front desk was so helpful. He gave us great descriptions of the room and also had a bellman show us the available rooms. We are so glad he did. We switched to the skybox. The bathroom had a nice soaking tub. Even though the room is a little small and with a queen bed the "skybox" view and openness was magical. We loved the hotel and would stay here again! The Conceirge also gave us great recommendations for "grown up" but still cool bars.

title: All that glitters isn't gold
text:
My husband and I recently stayed here for 3 nights as the first stop of our honeymoon, traveling across the U.S. 
We chose The Ludlow because it was recommended by Mr & Mrs Smith and we have enjoyed their boutique hotels in the past. Also, the area had been recommended as a great place to stay by a friend that lives locally. 
The area of the hotel is indeed great - very close to many hipster bars and great little restaurants. As for the hotel itself, however, it quickly became apparent that what it offered in style, it lacked in service and facilities. 
The rooms were trendy, impeccably clean and the bed was very comfortable. However, the rooms were TINY (even though we selected a superior room). There was no place to store our luggage except under the bed (which, was fortunately quite high), the AC was very noisy (apparently the same in all rooms, as advised by the building engineer) and the showers were not especially hot. 
Moreover, while the hotel offered a fun and bustling restaurant and bar scene, the service was very slow on all occasions - meals were served without cutlery, toast without butter and on our last day, the restaurant simply ran out of pastries - one of only two options on the continental breakfast menu. Paid breakfasts were overpriced and underwhelming ($5.99 for a cafe latte). 
Unfortunately, it seems the Ludlow has been overwhelmed by its success and has been unable to keep pace.

title: Qualche pecca.....
text:
Il Ludlow fa parte degli hotel di tendenza con hall e ristorante animati ma qualche carenza dal punto dal punto di vista dell'ospitalità. 
Non è un caso che anche noi, come altri, abbiamo avuto il problema dell'importo bloccato al momento del ceck in; il problema non è stato risolto fino alla fine della vacanza, quando si è scoperto che avevano erroneamente calcolato un importo di 1000 dollari in più rispetto al prezzo della prenotazione. La stanza è molto piccola e arredata con mobili carini ma di dimensioni enormi, così che l'armadio è praticamente inesistente. Il bagno è molto piccolo ma la doccia è grande e comoda.
La colazione, è vero che è compresa, cosa rarissima a NY, ma è scadente e poco varia, un buona fetta di pane fresco con del burro e della marmellata sarebbe stato preferibile.
Le stanze hanno delle bellissime finestre enormi che riempiono la stanza di luce.
La zona è molto carina e animata; unica pecca è che i negozi della zona aprono alle 11 e le strade sono molto sporche.
Il personale è gentile e disponibile.
Non so se tornerei al Ludlow, ma tutto sommato sono stata bene.

title: Joli, bien situé, du charme
text:
J'ai essayé le ludlow en alternative au standard (east village ou high line). Quartier du lower east qui est une super alternative. Orchard st. déborde de tout ce qu'il faut.

Chambre : skybox loft. Petit salon avec vue à 200 degrés vraiment top. Mais chambre quand même petite, peu de place autour du lit, on ne sait où poser sa valise, et il n'y a qu'un placard penderie. 

Salle de bains géniale. Baignoire ample depuis laquelle on voit tout downtown, et un vrai charme.

Bref : un soupçon moins bien fini que le bowery hotel, mais moins cher, et beaucoup d'ernergie.

Je reviendrai !

PS : aucun problème d'ascenseur. Et service : pas eu l'occasion de tester. J'ai Check un & out, c'est tout. Ménage très bien.

title: Fabulous place
text:
I stayed at The Ludlow for 4 nights in June. I'd booked a queen studio but on the first night the air conditioning didn't work. It was 30 degrees outside so no joke! I spoke to the people at the front desk and they immediately upgraded me to a top floor suite. Which was absolutely amazing and had far reaching views of Manhattan from it's full width roof terrace. 

The staff were friendly and relaxed. The area was great with loads of stuff going on in the super cool lower east side. There was no shortage of great bars and restaurants nearby, although I found it really hard to tear myself away from Dirty French. The food here was delicious and it had a great atmosphere. The bar was also really lovely. Very cool but also a really comfortable place to relax and hang out. 

All in all a really nice stay. I'd definitely come back to the Ludlow.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for a few nights and really enjoyed it! Cool music and the hotel bar made you want to hang around for a drink. There was also a good buzz from Dirty French next door. Breakfast too was enjoyable - just enough!

title: Something else
text:
This hotel is simply excellent. It is located in the Lower East side, a lively neighbourhood full of bars, restaurants etc. and no sky scrapers. A tube station is located nearby.
It is totally refurbished in a kind of "retro" style giving an overall good feel.
The room was clean, spatious and provided with everything one can expect and the staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Un hôtel a taille humaine
text: Quand on arrive à l'hôtel on apprécie le cadre la décoration et justement le fait que ce n'est pas une chaîne où tout se ressemble. Les chambres sont insonorisees ( penser à demander à étage élevé. Le quartiers est sympa, la bouche de métro est toute proche. Après oui on attend un peu l'ascenseur et oui le petit déjeuner nest pas fameux mais nous avons demandé du pain grillė confiture que nous avons eu. L'hôtel est bien tenu les chambres propres.

title: Great hotel in the LES
text: Excellent location just between the Lower East Side and East Village--super easy to walk to awesome restaurants and shops close by.  We had a King Loft with Terrace and the terrace was huge and great view.  Room is decent-sized for NY and had a very comfortable bed and sitting area.  I did not try the bar or restaurant although they looked crowded and fun every time we walked by.  Staff was also extremely friendly.  I would make this my home base in NYC again.

title: Stylish, relaxed, perfect
text: Just loved this lower east hotel. Rooms are beautifully decorated with lots of little details that excude that homely feeling so rare in hotels. The lounge, adjacent to the semi-outdoor garden, was a great place to hang out with a drink. The restaurant "Dirty French" is apparently very popular, swarming with locals, so one must book quite a bit in advance. The included breakfast options were delicious. All members of staff were extremely nice. i had this place recommended by friends and do not regret choosing it.

title: TRES BEL HOTEL
text:
Hôtel très bien placé dans le Lower East qui est très branché...Une multitude de bar et restaurants aux alentours...Le restaurant de l'hôtel et son bar pleins tous les soirs...Très bonne ambiance, branchée et conviviale...
Le personnel de l'accueil  très pro et très efficace..
Un petit bémol pour le personnel du petit déjeuner qui semblaient dépassé et désorganisé mais cela ne nous a pas empêché de passer un super séjour!
Le rooftop exceptionnel

title: Could not be more helpful and friendly
text:
The first impression is how friendly and helpful the door man and front desk personnel are! We arrived shortly after noon on a Saturday, fully expecting to store our luggage until check in time 3:00. Much to our surprise our room was ready for occupancy.

The hotel is beautiful, the lobby warm, modern and inviting. The   Dirty French lounge has relaxing spaces and comfortable seating. The garden room adds a touch of quiet in a busy part of the city.  

Our room, though not large, was beautifully appointed, excellent bed and linens, great shower and all the extras one would expect in a fine hotel, robes, slippers, etc.  Breakfast in the Dirty French Bistro was included, coffee, juice, huge fruit and yogurt parfaits and croissant basket. Wait staff friendly, happy and attentive.

Would stay again, and again!

Great hotel in a hipster area! Lots of night life!

title: Ci manca il Ludlow!
text:
Io e la mia compagna abbiamo trascorso 4 notti trovandoci benissimo.
E' un hotel che, dal nostro punto di vista, ha tanti punti a favore.
La posizione: siamo in pratica sul confine tra East Village e Lower East Side, fuori quindi dai contesti più turistici di Manhattan, ma è una zona che pulsa di vitalità con un'umanità composita, alternativa, di tendenza (ma non fighetta/snob). Caratteristiche che si riflettono in pieno sull'hotel.
Non è un hotel di lusso o chic ma è ben frequentato e benissimo gestito. 
La nostra camera era al 12° piano con una buona vista verso il Financial District e discreta verso Midtown (ma basta andare presso la sala fitness all'ultimo piano per poter godere di un panorama più "pieno"). Certamente non grande ma sufficientemente comoda (specie il bagno). Pulizia ok.
La colazione a noi andava benissimo nella sua semplicità: caffè, brioche, muesli e succhi. Se si vuole di più lo si deve pagare (e temo anche caro).
Una nota di merito allo staff: tutti gentili, sorridenti e professionali. Abbiamo avuto qualche disguido sugli importi bloccati sulla carta di credito (ben più alti del previsto): hanno immediatamente rilevato il problema (probabilmente con il gestore della prenotazione) risolvendolo e porgendo le proprie scuse per quanto avvenuto.
Lo consiglio a coloro che decidono di stare fuori da Midtown (ossia dalla zona più turistica) preferendo altri quartieri. Il Lower East Side è very cool!

title: So Comfortable Amidst the Hustle and Bustle!!
text:
We had a really wonderful stay at the Ludlow! So many things made this the perfect place to stay- the location, the comfort, and the staff.  

We loved that a train was only a couple blocks away, and that we were surrounded by delicious food, adorable shops, and aside from that- our room had a KILLER VIEW of both the Freedom tower *and* the Empire State Building! We could get to Brooklyn or midtown in one fell swoop.  Our bed- even though it was just a queen sized bed- felt enormous and incredibly comfortable.  The shower was so spacious (and the overhead spout- so posh!) as was the bathroom itself - and the studio was all we needed for the two of us to come home to after busy days enjoying the city.  The rug, the throw on the bed, and the chairs all had added softness to them which made us feel at home.  Also- aside from other reviews, we found the elevator to be perfectly quick- and heard no noise from our neighbors! 

But the best part was the staff.  Everyone was willing to help out- and the hostess at Dirty French- Sid- even totally hooked us up with some to-go-coffees before we jaunted out for our busy day.  We got stuck having to stay an extra night and they got us into a room no problem, handled our bags with ease and brought them to our room... And all with a smile.  Just a really great place to stay, hang, call home -everything.  

Huge props to the owners and the staff- we will stay here every time we come to the city!!

title: Hip and Comfortable
text: I loved the Ludlow.  The room was spacious, inviting, and did not have the typical cookie-cutter hotel room feel.  I, personally, love the neighborhood, as there are so many great restaurants in the Lower East Side.  If you're looking to be in the middle of Times Square, this clearly would not be the best fit for you. The complimentary continental breakfast was delicious. I will definitely be back!

title: Great NYC base
text: I had a fabulous five nights here in a room with a terrace. The room was immaculate and fantastically cleaned everyday, full marks to the maids, truly. The terrace was a little drab and might have been more useable with different furniture, there was a dining table with six bistro chairs. A recliner of some sort would have been more useable, to enjoy the outside. Also, the three planters were bare and filled with just earth, no flowers/plants. The bar is very cool and a nice place to be. The restaurant is also loud, noisy and cool and the food is delicious. I had two different salads, fabulous, but what was amazing was the bread you are given, a hot, oily, salty flatbread served with a smear of goats cheese. Heaven! I didn't quite understand which items were complementary at breakfast the first day but after that just stuck with the granola/yogurt which was nice but repetitive. I think they could expand the complimentary breakfast idea. Good location for the subway. Sometimes there was a very strong smell of roasting meat in the hotel which I didn't like, was that from Katz's next door? Another negative were the lifts, sometimes you can be waiting ages, up to 10minutes, for a lift to stop. All in all, recommend, and sad to leave

title: Amazing hotel!
text: One of my fave hotels! The room is well-appointed, classy with a very lovely interior. Around 5-min walk to the subway and almost next to a public parking(50USD per day). The breakfast was nice, comprised of bagels, croissants, few choices of spread, fruits, brewed coffee and several kinds of juices. A lot of restaurants are nearby, our favorite is The New Roma, a pizza parlor which serves super delicious italian food. Staffs were very helpful and always have beautiful smiles on their faces. Will choose the same hotel on our next NY trip!

title: Number1 Son Still In NewYork
text:
I think this has been the best location yet.  Our son lives in East Village. What a great location. The hotel is so close to Katz Deli location for were Harry met Sally.

The hotel is very trendy we stayed in a suite. With great bed and good bathroom. You get a separate lounge also.

One drawback with the room, no draws to put clothes in just 3 very slip draws and nightstand a very chic but too small. Can only hold phone. 

The bar area is great and really cool.  I would say the bar staff are too cool they seem to spend a lot of time strutting around. however overall the level of service in hotel very 

good. Just can you pay more attention to customers than yourself bar staff.

Breakfast fantastic and service amazing.  If you stay at this hotel do not I repeat do not miss out on eating in Dirty French as a guest you will get a table. other wise as my son 
informed us impossible.  The food is Fantastic. 

All in all a wonderful trip great location and everything within walking distance. The options of restaurants are such high quality.

title: Very nice
text:
My stay was when the hotel was fairly new and the restaurant was not yet open. The taxi accidentally dropped me at the high rise next door, also named Ludlow. If you're forcing your roller bag through a rotating door you're at the wrong place. 

The Studio Queen is small but styled beautifully and great fixtures but it would have been nice to have some sort of nook to manage my bag. The minibar next to the bed was well stocked with many local items. Economy Candy is around the corner so I just went there instead for my candy fix but did go for Uncle Jerry's pretzels. The XL sized Maison Martin Margiela bath robe was too small so maybe I shouldn't have. 

At the time I stayed, the elevators were shared by the cleaning staff. It's entirely possible service elevators were yet to be put into commission. But I spent many waits chatting with friendly guests through our shared elevator experiences. 

The air conditioning was state of the art but very loud and I wound up turning it off to have uninterrupted sleep. I could sleep wonderfully with it on or off, just not when it came on abruptly startling me awake each time. 

For the Lower East Side, noise at night was not so bad. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. I didn't go to the hotel bar at night but it was where they had the continental breakfast set up with pastries, bagels, fruit, juice, coffee, etc. There is a nice courtyard if the weather is nice. 

The F Train is nearby and many places nearby to grab a bite including The Lobster Joint (casual), Whole Foods, Il Laboratorio del Gelato (I recommend scoops of Armagnac and amaretto crunch), and many other places. I did not find many cute shops anywhere in the area, though. The Tenement Museum is close by. 

All in all, a very nice hotel in an area very accessible and with many things to do in walking distance.

title: Très bien placé et très propre !
text:
L'essentiel dans un hôtel : la propreté et l'emplacement
tout est bon pour le Ludlow qui est dans le quartier le plus sympa de NY ; lower east side
on peut faire une bonne partie des restaus / bars sympa à pied !
la chambre est spacieuse, propre, rien à redire
le wifi est gratuit
le bemol : une clim trop forte dans les couloirs et dans le lobby ainsi que des odeurs de nourriture trop fortes dans les couloirs menant aux chambres
le personnel est acceuillant et très sympa
ah, un dernier bemol : petit dejeuner compris dans la formule est limité, pas trop, à ne pas prendre donc, il y a les meilleurs pancakes de NY pas loin au Clinton Bakery

un très bon 4 étoiles !

title: Great hotel with a lovely bar and restaurant!
text:
Really great hotel in a really good area of NYC! Lots of bars/restaurants at your doorstep. 

The rooms were a nice size for NYC with a nice balcony and the beds were super comfy. 

Hotel bar is fantastic with really good, comfortable seating and a nice outdoor area. 

The restaurant is also a city hotspot, and for a good reason.. It rocks! 

Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Fantastic service - cool hotel
text:
First time on TA and moved to review The Ludlow having flown back to the uk today. The feel of the place is what makes it so special along with the excellent service from genuinely helpful staff. If you don't like the style shown in the photos - don't go as they are a true representation of the place (moody lighting and interesting details). Furnishings are retro styled and look very sexy but comfortable too. 

The location is more edgy than the refined Greenwich or Chelsea but there is loads going on nearby and the Ludlow style fits in perfectly. 

Our room was at the lower price end and whilst NY proportioned, it was beautifully presented and the bathroom was perfect. Very well stocked mini bar and a great tv. 

We didn't eat in the restaurant (Dirty French) but will next time. It was packed every night and the menu looked excellent (if a bit pricey). Breakfast (included) was restricted to certain items but they were ideal for a short trip. The remaining breakfast items were reasonably priced and were / looked good. The bar oozes cool and the staff look the part too. 

A fantastic hotel that we will visit again. If you visit, please don't change the feel of the place as we thought it was perfect. 

Stephen & Esther

title: Affordable  hotel in the Lower East Side
text: The Ludlow is well located in New York's LES. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a friendly staff. Dirty French Restaurant on the premises is great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Nice menu with well prepared food but slow serice. Room prices are fairly reasonable for NYC.
